I35sMsLBFete4snjH0aHAA.text: A hangover's best friend can be found inside these four trendy walls. The first thing that brought me here was the fact that they carried Heart Roasters beans from Portland. Once they whipped out some coffee I knew I was in the perfect location for the area. While sipping on some delicious coffee they brought around free dessert samples (FREE!) to everyone. How they possibly stay in business giving away free dessert is none of my business but I will ride that gravy train until the closed sign shows up out front.   The terrible crowd when I was there does stop me from dolling out a 5 star rating... which I get is a GOOD thing that people want to be here but they just don't seem to have any intention of learning how to handle a mass crowd. When you are popular, you need to figure out ways to turn tables better, faster, make room, be faster on your service feet. They also seem to him and cry too much about substitutions which always makes me roll my eyes as I walk away. I wish with my 2.5 years in the service industry I could of told people they couldn't of done that! A dream of mine at night I tell you. With all that said, the place has some room for improvement on the management/business run side but the dessert I sampled and some I stole from my friend were dynamite.   Most of the food I understand is local grown and the presentation is top notch. Their is for sure a reason this place has been very busy every time I step inside the door. Give it a visit but plan plan plan to be there longer than you think. This most likely won't be a hop on, eat, out the door unless you are visiting at some odd hours or are the big asshole sliding in five minutes before close.

pAIrCb5Yot9bOjzhT226QQ.text: Love it went here for my birthday breakfast! Long wait time but so worth it! Delicious!

VnRHQ31nKitTrjpzh3eIlw.text: Awesome...I can't speak highly enough of this place. I drove 30 minutes to get to it and it was well worth it. Not only is the food outstanding but the staff is so incredibly attentive, warm and welcoming. The restaurant is tiny and they also have an espresso bar with delicious coffee. I had the crepe burrito which was to die for and my friend had the chicken pesto crepe.   For dessert, we share the "first time" which is a crepe filled with sliced bananas and Nutella...I don't need to say any more.

nNq59owj-072jJEFUJUuHQ.text: I found this place while in search of coffee, food, and wifi as I was going out alone.  They offered a free coffee with check in on Yelp, so I decided to give it a try.  It's really, really good.  The place was pretty busy for a Friday morning, but I had no trouble finding a table.  The staff were super helpful and friendly and the atmosphere is casual and comfortable and not over the top trendy.  I ordered the breakfast burro crepe and it was even better than I thought it would be.  While waiting for my meal they brought out sample size portions of fresh granola, salad, thick toast with nutella and fresh strawberry jam (which was incredibly good), and a cookie slice at the end.  I only spent $7 and felt like I was eating at a place much fancier and more expensive.  I will definitely go back and have already been telling friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burro

atBey5pcGOk4VOdlLRbcUg.text: This place has a death grip on me, but in the best possible way.   Locally sourced stores aid and support the creative and tasty crepes here in Tempe. Portion control is only limited to how many times and plates of food you can order. Hence the repeating of dinning here.I'm sure after another three more trips here should suffice   The French could learn a thing or three from this Arizona crepe sling. May the Parisians rise their white flag in defeat!   Arizonans have conquered the thin pancake arena...

lrunyKYmTS_Jqy6YGfsmXA.text: Small little place. Easy to miss from the road (look for P. Croissant's on the NW side of the road. It is located just north of the corner store P. Croissant's).  When you walk in, you will notice how tidy, clean and quaint everything is. Not ideal for huge parties though, but not sure who would bring a huge party to get crepes. Once you get up to the front and figure out what you want to purchase (which is a feat on its own considering their selection), you will be greeted by wonderful service. I have been here half a dozen times, about half to get take out, and the other half for to stay, and every time service has really been top notch.  While I was waiting for my food, I got a little sample of their granola. After our dine in, we got a little cookie as a thank you dessert. It is small touches like this which really bring customers back.  Outside their sweet (my favorite) and savory crepes, I really enjoyed their selection of beverages. I've had their chai, and their coffee, and both were wonderful.   The only thing I advise is that you come here with a few friends. This way, you can try more than one crepe because believe me when I say you will not be satisfied with only having 1 from their wonderful selection.

pARpT75BY3IMyya-iH8zLg.text: A hidden gem that I try to get back to on a regular basis. Initially I was intrigued by the breakfast burrito which is to die for.  This last time I had something with pork belly and egg.  It was ridiculously good.  I think they only have it at certain times a day so that is a must.  What's funny is that the clientele is a diverse as the menu.  I've seen soccer moms, couples, and a group of dudes ride up on their motorcycles.  If you can bring in people from all walks of life like that, then you must be doing something right.

M43Mad-BkvYS1CQ2LvUX7g.text: My wife is truly as cappuccino snob.  Guess what!  This happens to be her favorite place for coffee.  The crepes are great too.   I've had a few of them and of course some are getter than others, but overall, I love this place is available.  It seems, I will become a regular breakfast coffee type place.    This place seems to like it when you pull out a chess board or a card game.  Each time I do this, they bring me a desert on the house.  Gotta love that!  They will probably stop that now that I am posting this...

B5r4FgHk_hiiTdC52b0iFQ.text: So I had no idea this place was so close to me nor that it existed. I got the smokey crepe, which was turkey chorizo Gouda and avocado. It was so delicious! Staff was very friendly. They gave us on-the-house granola and two little toasted rose marshmallows with dark chocolate sauce. Enjoyed the atmosphere, felt unique. Next time I'll try the coffee and baked goods!  As well as a dessert crepe.

ewm8MDjGrt0utLyq1kOxHw.text: I just had the best brunch of all time...  I knew of Crepe bar food truck so imagine my delight when I was checking out hot new businesses on Yelp and saw they had opened a store front just a few miles from me! So I high-tailed it over there asap.  They did not disappoint! We were greeted as soon as we walked in. Everyone is friendly and enthusiastic. They asked if it was our 1st time in and explained a bit about the menu and how to order etc. We got the custard with berries and the breakfast burrito, a cappuccino and a pomogranate green iced tea.  I was delighted to see the square pay and iPad they use. It's so easy and efficient. And to me a sign of a modern efficient business.  As we were waiting for our food our server chatted with us a bit, she was great with my kids! We just loved her warm friendly personality.   Then our drinks came out. Heaven. My cappuccino was smooth and rich. I saw on the sign they use Ecco coffee...score! One of the best local coffee guys hands down. My husband got the pom green tea which also was delicious.  Our food came out next. It was beautiful. The breakfast burrito was huge. Bold flavors. Just delicious. My kids scarfed down the custard and berries so fast I was lucky I even got a bite. Those crepes were SO good that we went for another! This time we got the "first time" - banana and nutella. Classic and very good. I loved the brulee on top, kind of gave it a roasted marshmellow flavor and texture. Oh my stars it was so good.  While we were stuffing our faces, the owner came over and introduced himself and thanked us for coming in. I LOVE that. Then we had a nice little chat. It was great! We really felt like valued customers and I'm so appreciative of that.  No question, I will be back. A lot. This place is only 1 mile from my kids school. Awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Perfect macchiato
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;First time&#34; - nutella and banana
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

0ef-oo4Ntj7DsI0S74lQ0g.text: Great coffee, crepes and energy in this small neighborhood joint. Service is good, pricing great variety of crepes including sweet and spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Main dining.

qA4sENOsSMRzt8HZO53-BA.text: Yay! I finally got to try this place! I pass it every day but I never have the time to sit down...  Definitely lives up to the hype. I love the build your own and my Turkey, Gruyere and Mushroom was DEElish. One crepe is not all that filling (and that's True no matter where you get a crepe) so I had room for a sweetie to finish me off--the strawberry custard crepe with chocolate was Oh-so-good...and the beautiful cup of cappuccino topped it all off. Tres Bon.  Yup, I'll be back with the hubbie next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Savory and sweet plus a beautiful cappucino.

ag_yOa7dHZani6HsF-XJxg.text: I loved my experience here so much that I actually created a yelp account just to express it.   The coffee is unique, the crepes were amazing. I had the breakfast burrito crepe and the vanilla creme crepe with dark chocolate. Both were more gourmet than I expected from a random crepe place in a strip mall. The burrito came with chipotle sea salt, and the chocolate with my dessert crepe was legit dark chocolate, not just Hershey's.   Also, coolest part, one of the chefs came out and offered a miracle berry tasting platter. It was one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had! I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Miracle berry and tasting platter.

Lkx_10MPmIvbYGaZzklD_g.text: This place is ahhhmazing... The customer service is on point and the food is fabulous. This needs to be your go to breakfast place in Tempe! Nothing but positive vibes!!

NOKIoHmlvre_GkbeRIPXrA.text: As much as I love crepes, this place didn't do it for me.  It's very chic and trendy, which is fun.  But then the crepes are missing some of the "lightness" that I usually get when eating crepes. These ones had ingredients that made them heavy and greasy.  I felt like I was just eating any greasy/cheese omelette from any corner breakfast hangout.  I went with a group of 5 or 6 and that same afternoon we all had stomach aches, having eaten different meals.   I did enjoy the sweet desserty crepe I had.  So when I go back (3 stars doesn't mean I'm not coming again)...I'll get sweet crepes.

xIGamT14HkZTZONUlRhchQ.text: My favorite breakfast spot in Phx, hands down!  Their service, crepes, granola, coffee... basically everything here is top notch.  The wait and crowd is the only thing I dislike here, however it's been six months since I've been, and they were expanding last I was there.

I8Q77YLbZChuAVHDpa71WA.text: All I have to say is WOW. This is a hidden gem for sure. I had the Smoked turkey Chorizo Gouda Cheese Avocado Crepe Burrito with a side salad . It tasted how it was decorated and it was beautiful  my only problem was I was done with my delicious Chai iced Tea before my food came out.

zkJcVnRPO8mh09msIMzdJA.text: This small Crepe shoppie has so much charm!  It's packed Saturday morning but it's worth the wait.  Shelby (beautiful Ginger) makes everyone comfortable while they wait.  The coffee taste green.  Some people really love that taste and it is not your typical Starbucks roast. Great job being different and standing out.  The granola was really good.  Surprisingly good..  I don't like granola so you really should ask for it.  The first time crepe was AMAZING.  To the eye and the palate.  I will be back, for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. First Time Crepe!

ytnoPCfWlmB06ifCnvQNiw.text: Long wait in line to order and tables are limited for seating... When you do get a seat the table might be clean... Order the Jamaican Jerk and Breakfast Burrito, both tasted fantastic...

mKtYv3vFmzj6gFF8b0W5zA.text: OBSESSED! The place was packed and it was hard to find a table with the open seating. The food was absolutely amazing. I would have gave five stars but the service was lacking.

fd-0IMqtQGjx8OKB4od3nw.text: We were excited to try this place after all of the great reviews on yelp. With the 30 min wait just to order, we thought we were in for a great treat. The staff was friendly and the coffee was good, however we were disappointed by the crepes. I ordered the "pick me up," which is supposed to be a coffee flavored sweet crepe. Unfortunately, the dish was cold and sour and tasted spoiled. Therefore, I couldn't even eat half of it. When taking away my full dish, the waiter didn't even ask if I liked it. My friend got the breakfast burrito, which was just okay. We were sad this place didn't live up to the hype. However feel free to stop in for some good coffee if you think it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The &#34;pick me up&#34; crepe. Very disappointing. Would not recommend.

M565hJX817dSj47kEuhiAg.text: Yum.   I work a mile away from here but never noticed this place, and it made my lunch rotation.     It's a simple place with a simple menu: crepes.    And they do a great job of making crepes.    The staff was friendly and laid-back.  A number of workers asked us if we were enjoying our meal.     The menu suggests that crepes are large enough to share.  Not agreeing with that statement.   The portion is more along the lines of the "Hara Hachi Bu" level (80% full in Japanese).   But there's nothing wrong with that.  The venue could fit a few more tables.   I would think they will want to because people will love this place once they try it.

aoSVR631OyBGw6Ev6itxNg.text: Great food and friendly staff!  Definitely worth trying! We look forward to visiting again next time in Tempe! :-)

IXo43y_sHxmI9Ao7wMMPog.text: Absolutely delicious, fun, inventive food. Every dish on the menu is fantastic. A wonderful dining experience!

JTaBlUUlQxDiLRWBfoWFbw.text: Met a friend for lunch today. His suggestion was a new place around the corner from office, the Crepe Bar.  I  ordered the Papa K crepe.   The crepe  was well flavored with ham and much to my surprise had a  crispy texture at the edges.  The Crepe Bar will be a welcome addition to the rotation of lunch places around the work place.

1vme27FNV3LZZBgFYRHkxA.text: Amazing experience came in grabbed a menu and ordered drinks came out a little while and since the food took a little longer chef sent over brioche which was amazing. Food came out soon after looking pretty appetizing will visit again if ever in the area!!

FALtNuX1Nj7IhIz7w4oubw.text: Pretty much underwhelmed by the food here. Ordered chicken basil. Chicken is dry and tasteless. And they need to work on the smell of the place. I smelled like grease after eating there. Gross

vXJwV2qSbT1U1axMYXL7ww.text: You know how sometimes you find a little gem of a place hiding in a blah strip mall? Crepe Bar is one of those places. You could drive by this place a million times and never notice it. But you're luck if you do, because it's really good!  The boyfriend and I went for breakfast on a Saturday. It was busy but not packed. We ordered 2 crepes to share - the breakfast burrito and a banana brulee. The crepes came out to the table pretty fast which was good because we were starving. We started with the sweet crepe. SO good. We could have easily downed a couple of these, they were that good. They had a nice sweet syrup on them that wasn't too heavy, just right, and the sliced up banana complemented the caramely flavor well.  Then we moved on to the breakfast burrito. It was a nice change change from the typical tortilla burrito. It was stuffed with eggs, bacon, cheese and an avocado salsa. It had a little bit of a kick but nothing too crazy. The eggs were nice and fluffy and the flavors all worked well together.   Between the two crepes it was plenty of food for breakfast and it came out to around $12. Can't beat it! We'll be back for more crepes soon I'm sure.

GrmxGdjdgt6ZK0QADUy94A.text: One of the best kept secrets in Tempe.  The staff is fantastic, provided several complementary items for our group throughout the meal and great service even though they were packed. The Crepes were perfectly prepared, you will be happy sweet or savory. Great tea's and coffee as well. The owner even took the time to come out and check in mid-meal. We definitely be making a return trip!!!  Highly recommended this establishment.

qQNJP16iRpQBZYcux0iK4A.text: The burro is amazing and the customer service great.  Space is a little small but. I love it.  Most definitely will be back.

H4MqOPRfmGMhWtUFKCnOPA.text: My fiance introduced this place to me a few weeks ago.  I don't care for crepes but the Crepe Bar has to be one of the best culinary surprises I have ever experienced.  I regularly get brunch here and I often have to keep myself going there too often.   Meal:  I typically get the breakfast savory crepe, a cappuccino, and recently, some granola to take home with me.  Taste:  I don't know if there is any place in Phoenix that perfectly combines savory, salty tastes and different culinary styles (Mexican and French) as well as the Crepe Bar.  Granted I have barely put a dent in all the available options in Phoenix, but whatever Crepe Bar does, Crepe Bar does it right. The cappuccino and granola alone are enough to visit Crepe Bar.  10 out of 10.  Value:  The Crepe Bar portions are a little on the same size.  They are the epitome of quality over quantity . . . or maybe I just think the portions are undersized because I could eat their food all day long.  Yes, this does make me sound like a totally glutinous schmuck, but really, their crepes are that damn good. 3 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  Service can be slower than anticipated, but then again this place isn't trying to dethrone McDonalds.  Their staff of what can only be described as sweet natured hipsters are extremely friendly without coming off as insincere.  9 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  Simple, easy to get around.  While the lack of furniture and tables may remind you of a fresh-out-college kid's apartment, it works extremely well.  It is eclectic, slightly mismatched, and if there was anymore else in there, it would be too much.  It is kind of humorous that its in a strip mall, which I didn't expect when I first go there.  The walls are decorated with just the right amount of local artists' work.  5 out of 5.  Overall:  If you want to surprise a friend or decided to skip a day at work, Crepe Bar is the perfect place to go.  Hell, its the perfect place to go anytime of the day.  27 points out of 30, 5 out of 5 stars.

lsH4-1J3PM4QO2u42rYryQ.text: The food was amazing.  We were a party of three and we all absolutely loved the food.  The only reason i didnt give five stars is because the food took 30-35 minutes, and I noticed that was about the going wait for everyone.  The kitchen is very small (i know this, because you have to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom), so there is probably not a whole lot they can do about turnaround time.  Anyhoo, if you are patient and not on a time crunch during their busy times, its worth the wait.

IHV8y-BVI3GJIkMV-RUxFQ.text: Can't believe I haven't done a review for my neighborhood Crepe Bar since I've now been there several times. I'll just give the facts:  the ambiance isn't my style, but if you like slick, clean industrial, you'll love it. service at all four visits -- friendly, but distracted and overworked.   first visit -- with daughter and friend a few days after opening. not crowded. waited some time for our crepes. my nutella banana was good but not mindblowing. daughter's crepe was "bruleed" so hard as a rock. we wrote it off to opening week.  second visit -- no fault of their own, the second time I visited the power had just gone out. actually, the power went out for a mile square radius. while waiting for power to come back on, they served us their homemade granola with almond milk. pure delight.  third visit -- went for late morning breakfast with hubby. i appreciate a good cup of coffee, but it shouldn't take 20 minutes to get it, and it not be HOT. food came another 10 minutes later, so so much for coffee with our breakfast. food was awesome though -- we had a sweet and a savory crepe.   fourth visit -- went on a Friday night for their new dinner service. came with friends. BYOB. Service is friendly, but distracted. food was incredible...burrata with tomato jam and basil oil, swiss chard pierogi with brussels sprouts salad, duck confit arancini with some crazy pesto with cocoa nibs in it, the best pork belly i ever had and some insane sous vide cheesecake thing with maple apples.   we'll keep trying for a better breakfast experience, but wow, those thursday and friday night dinners? i may go back each week!

oP-U0O_DAM_KIV7JV8DhfA.text: Fabulous service and eclectic food. Coffee is an A+, too. We received free appetizers just because. Would recommend going early, as it is a small joint and very popular.

8-nHLIFmqB9qRiB2l5GbcQ.text: I'm torn.. The girl at the register / my psuedo waitress was awesome.. very helpful, and in general, knowledgeable, and kind.  She also made a DELICIOUS pourover coffee.  Also the food was delicious, very delicious, and portion size was good for the price... although I had to look past the HAIR on my plate under my crepe.  I would have complained, but I had already waited far too long for my crepe to arrive, even though there were only a handful of customers in the place. So, since I was on my lunch break, I couldn't wait around for another crepe to be made.  Because I was running late, I asked for a to-go cup for my coffee, and was forced to grab my own, as the food runner didn't actually remember to bring me one.  So if we count stars..  +2 for excellent service from the girl behind the register and the taste/quality of the food.  -3 for the forgetful hipster server guy, the long wait, and the hair in my food.   Let me just say that again.. HAIR... IN .. MY ... FOOD. To the mgmt.. please give that girl a raise, and have a talk with your kitchen crew.

2G6NzQ2bgoim0eBrWZQKMg.text: Solid transition from Awesome Truck to Easier-To-Find restaurant.  Had the Papa K, which is a buttery crepe with arugula, ham, cheese, and chunky grilled mushrooms.  Totally delicious.   Daughter had the Smoked Turkey, which was more of a "wrapped crepe" and was very good, but not on par with the Papa K, IMHO.  Anxiously awaiting the duck-fat fries to be offered......:)  Give these nice people and their super-duper crepes a try - the taste will assure that you won't regret stopping by.

mMQe5eqqvpWtgguUTz0I-w.text: I love the crepes here. It's comparable to the food in France. The Papa K with an egg is one of my favorites.

wFksba-Tk21O5g8LPjQOaQ.text: Great food, my sister took me here to try and I was not disappointed, ugh it was so lovely. I had one with pork belly in it (on the savory list) just to die for!!! If you're going on a weekend go at 8:55 not 9:03, you'll be stuck in a line. Awesome service also and they bring around little things that make for you to try. If you like crazy crepes and great tasting food, go here!

QPYdH5c0zF01wXHO4g7adQ.text: This place is so overhyped. Food is good, but if you want a substantial breakfast then don't go here! Small portions for an 'ok' price. Very disappointed.

2y9Sq7c47W0K5gyyvYT7VA.text: I've been following crepe bar since it's food truck days. I would love to see a local version of Cibo's vanilla bean ice cream and fresh fruit crepe. This place could totally rock it and I know they are down to experiment! So let's see it! Fresh ice cream crepes! Summer is coming show us some love! Xoxo

tWMyvV3XK4AmFracEVyPrg.text: Excellent. We had four different items from the brioche French toast to the savory crepe with the Hassayampa ham. I think my favorite was the avocado toast. What a delicious combination of greens avocado and soft boiled egg love that. Service was great we arrived there was a huge line and one of the gentleman working the floor found a table for us right before we were ready to sit and reserved it for us. This was mainly because it was packed. And rightfully so the food was delicious the service was excellent this place is amazing.

VcV0ofbIy6gjabPcUKolYg.text: Okay, So really good. Can't deny the quality of the ingredients and the passion of the staff. Price was a bit high and the small dish of granola to hold us over was kind of weird to me. Nice, but different. If you're looking for a hip spot with a Portland vibe this is it.

aTIB-7gEj0ZpfkBE5IMXQA.text: I've passed by this place so many times and finally decided to give it a go.   First Impressions: Very clean, industrial feel with a touch of contemporary. Good amount of seats, able to cater to small and big parties. Order first and seat down with a letter while you wait for your food.   What did I order: Lemon Curd, Grand Prix, Cold Brew, and Honey Latte  Lemon Curd: 5/5 - Crepes were cooked perfectly and slightly sweet. Lemon curd is tangy and smooth. Hibiscus gel is interesting because I never tasted Hibiscus before but it's similar to a raspberry pomegranate, where it has a bit of tart, sweet kick and a little soury notes. It pairs very good with the lemon and crepe.   Grand Prix: 5/5  - WOW..... looking at what went into this dish I was curious how the ExpressoMaple would taste with the chili Aioli. I took a bite of everything on my fork. I must say this is one of the best things i've tasted for breakfast. There is multiple layers of flavors here - perfectly cooked pork belly with amazing flavor, soft fried egg, crepe.  After one bite.... all I have to say is AWESOMESAUCE!! give this a go. It's worth it.   Honey Latte and Cold Brew: will wake you up! good Cold Brew and Honey latte is nicely balance. Not overally sweet.

RwI1dbk8G-QWxXWYl1fYeA.text: This place is hands down amazing! Also has a full coffee bar, place is hands down best in the valley for Crepes!!! 10 out of 10!!!

LSrcd-tMaIHZKi0qkPR22Q.text: One of the greatest breakfast places in the Phoenix area. You got to try this place if you have not! Excellent menu with many local and seasonally ingredients. 5 star all the way!

RSXVzufcnXy16JLxVyWrsg.text: So I am an admitted breakfast junkie.  Not your average home town breakfast (although those are great too) but a gourmet sexy breakfast that not only looks good but can deliver exquisite taste.  Crepe bar definitely does both!    I ordered a cappuccino, which did not have enough foam for my liking (check out the cap. at Merci if you like great foam), however the espresso was smooth and tasty.  A nice surprise we're the banana espresso scone tasting bites delivered to my table as I waited.  They were good but more like a little dense.  They had some of the tartness I expect but weren't as flaky as I like, but again, really tasty.    I got the Grand Prix crepe that is one of their special coffee crepes with an amazing espresso maple syrup, pork belly and a sunny side egg.  I tried each of the components separately, supper yum but together.....  I'm is breakfast heaven.    I am always glad to add some indulgence to the start of my day.  The feeling of being on vacation and finding a secret gem, adds a little smile to my work day.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cappuccino love
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix Crepe

pygRrmTILtbRlhZU_uUCBg.text: I have to say that two years after my first review, I'm impressed they've continued deserve big stars. . Most small,  hip, joints tend to become so popular and over worked, they have snippy staff,  subpar food, and an air of contempt for the customer. .. not here! Came to breakfast with hubby and our 13mo old (not the best idea, given they only own one high chair :/ and we had to ask the other family not using theirs if we could use it).     We both had heart drip coffee along with our meals. .i had the Grand Prix, which, if you are a pig lover, i urge you to see if it's available. .. it was so flavorful and had these great contrasting flavor combinations of coffee, maple, smoked pork. ..I'm salivating as i recall it now. I didn't try my husband's, papa k, but he enjoyed it. . Though i think mine was more memorable!   Great service,  memorable food,  cute and functional decor. .. definitely a place worth frequenting.

ZaE2ppDvMhFQYO-YnOfj3w.text: After reading lots of rave reviews and seeing the number of awards this place has won, I decided to venture over to check out the Crepe Bar.  The place was small and definitely not for big groups.  It was crowded at 11AM, with an almost bar-like atmosphere (think somewhat loud music, dim lights, and people talking over one another to be heard), but with really cute decor.  The staff were super friendly but as for the food, I guess I'm a little disappointed.  The menu was limited but as a coffee-addict, my eyes were immediately drawn to the Pick Me Up - a coffee crepe, while my boyfriend and friend both got the Breakfast Burrito (or was it burro?) - one with an add-on of potatoes, another with chorizo.  We waited about 30 minutes for our three crepes, straining to hear our names being called over the noise of the crowd, and by that time, we were starving.  And the portions were pretty small and not quite brunch-worthy.  The Breakfast Burrito was pretty good and tasted much better than my Pick Me Up but the potatoes were too salty for my friend's taste.  My coffee crepe didn't taste very coffee-like except for the two dollops of coffee-flavored whipped cream on the side.  The crepe itself didn't seem to have anything in it, which was the main source of my disappointment.  In a nutshell, great staff, great service, cute place, rather noisy, but more of a dessert place rather than a breakfast place just because of the portion sizes, and just be prepared for the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pick Me Up

MT0dvrCV2EPuDIa71F_a0w.text: The food is delicious. The BEST crepes. I had the Grand Prix and vanilla maple for dessert. Incredible food, good presentation. I only knocked down one star (and wish I could have done a half star) because the coffee in the carafes wasn't great. When I go back I'll try some of their espresso.

eu3ZTPEH5IZFdwiHjlNLoA.text: There is nothing negative about this place. The food is delish! The presentation is too beautiful to eat. Service is amazing! Ambient is great! And best of all, it is affordable for the quality you get. This gem is definitely my go-to place whenever I wanna take my friends out for brunch. We ordered a 2 breakfast burros: one regular and one with chorizo - delish'! Got some complimentary chipotle popcorn to try while waiting for our food. As we were finishing up our crepes, the server came out with a plate of rose marshmallows and a torch. He roasted the marshmallows right in front of our eyes and left after saying "It's on the house. Enjoy guys! ;)" I also checked in on Yelp and got my delicious lemongrass tea for free.  It is my second time here and it's just getting better everytime. Love it!

A4VGiPmR3KvMVdz02L_avQ.text: Great atmosphere, tasty cold brew, friendly staff, and UNREAL crepes. We loved!! Definitely coming back soon.

mKVQyDCRRk6vIVXppi2Veg.text: Gluten free chickpea crepe with any sweet or savory filling will bring me back! Strip mall industrial feel had nothing to absorb sound but nearing closing time 1-2 pm we could converse fine. Self serve coffee and cold water were available.

WI6-TCKaw34hXrtyytrBrg.text: WOW!!!! I traveled from North Scottsdale to this gem! I am not a huge crepe person but I was today! I had the sausage burrito/ crepe, scrambled eggs and a vanilla late. It was delicious! I cannot wait to go back! I hope he opens a location up here in Scottsdale!!!

wUiiy7VEePDKDDUqZqbs4A.text: Really good stuff here ! I had their take on papas bravas, a crepe -stada (a crepe tosta w/ beans and egg on top) and a blintz. All 3 items were really well prepared and very flavorful. You do have to wait in line for a bit and wait for your food for a hot minute on a weekend but definitely worth the wait imo. Good job Crepe Bar!

ayeWhw3FHP4Qgc0Lg9mfkQ.text: Been to Crepe Bar several times and each time I left feeling dissatisfied. The portion size is waay too small for the price I paid. Have given up on going there now.

GFaf0A_5GsVP7w3Q7_UPVg.text: I am in awe at how awesome this place is for a little hole in the wall the it was spectacular! Staff was beautifully bubbly and happy to help two travelers:) the food presentation was emasculate and just a beautiful place to eat breakfast! I was so impressed! Will be coming back!

1osIPd6MeMVj6F-Y-ZllNg.text: Great service and great crepes.   A great spot to catch a light snack.  You should try it.

x-atlojnyPYq3fyA6WQOJg.text: We were in the area! And this was such a find! If you love crepes you shouldn't miss this place It's a goofy location but the crepes and coffee are so delicious

r-WodSWx3MpOV3kNz5zPpg.text: Stopped by for breakfast while on Spring Break with my daughter and her friend. This is a pretty enjpyablel place and the food is good.  My daughter and her friend went straight for sweet and loved it, while I had a crepe wrapped breakfast burrito.  The food was all excellent.  The ordering at a counter then choosing a table made it seem fast food"ish", but it wasn't fast at all.  I think that tweaking their processes would give the place a sense professionalism and make the patrons feel better about the resaurant.

OCxLNqLP1bt1Tldu3zRJqw.text: Delish! Never Disappoints! Better flavor in the "Burrito" Crepe than some so called "Mexican" restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mild Spicy Chorizo &amp; Delicious Avocado, Delicious; beat that Carolina&#39;s Mexican Food.

oFO00rA1-gsdJvWoj9z4Hg.text: Great great find!! Super friendly staff, incredibly fresh food and an overall great experience. I may not live in the Phoenix area but I would certainly come back and recommend anyone to this place. Great job!!

xK5oaEgsnFHhka9VGm_bwQ.text: Since my first visit in January, I've decided that whenever I'm visiting Phoenix, I'll dedicate a good hour of my day to my newest quartier general (spot), Crepe Bar. Crepe Bar's carte du jour manifests an aesthetic and novel approach to the French pancake classic commonly known as the crepe. The creperie-cafe ushers in sweet and stirring encounters, both culinary and social.  On that account, I turn the spotlight on to Shelby for the moment. Barista Shelby Moore serves up seasonally harvested Heart Coffee in baby blue and orangesicle- colored cups and suitably signs each brew with a heart. The Arizona native is a connoisseur of good food and surely good coffee; the French title gourmand describes him in every respect. Shelby's penchant for the culinary experience translates into effective editorial columns. The Class of 2014 scholar at ASU's Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication recently contributed to the March issue of Bite, a local food and drink magazine.   Each meal on Crepe Bar's menu brings into play the winning features of its cuisine. The creperie's attention to texture is exemplified in each crunch and each chew; hints of masala and vanilla bean prove its palate full-flavored.  I dedicated an hour to this hot spot with my friend Navi, indulging in a heart-to-heart over our jazzy cups of Heart Coffee. The window-side table for two provided a modest breeze and warm glow of sunshine.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla Custard Crêpe. Photography by Diamond Troutman.

Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;Cappuccino Moments.&#34;
Photography by Diamond Troutman.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Duck Cuban Crêpe. Photography by Diamond Troutman.

m_1fXXgGO50R_6zhrA3w4A.text: Worst Experience. I was looking for a good new place to take my husband for a birthday breakfast. After reading amazing reviews we were excited and not surprised by the lengthy line when we arrived. I was surprised by how small and dingy it was inside, we could hardly just stand in line without bumping into someone. Due to the lack of tables, crying babies, and claustrophic atmosphere we decided to just order the food to go. After waiting 15 minutes we get ready to order and are told there is a 45 minute wait for food and tables!  When I asked about to go orders we were told its a limited menu, but it could be ready in 25 minutes. We tried to get the first time crepe without bananas and with strawberries because my husband is allergic to bananas, but we were informed there are no substitutions. Unfortunately, this meant no Nutella crepe was available to us on the to go orders. With no area to wait I asked if I could provide my number and get a text when the food was ready, they wouldn't do that and stated it would be ready in 25 minutes and to just leave and come back.  We set an alarm and went elsewhere for coffee. I returned 30 minutes later and was told sorry it's no where near ready come back in at least 15 maybe 20 minutes. At this point I almost cancelled the order, but we were starving.  We returned 20 minutes later (so it's now an hour since we had first arrived) and the food is sitting there.  We grab the food and rush home to find the food luke warm and the crepe soggy.  Such a disappointment.

9qYTQU_y8qGIMErK5FPCOw.text: I normally don't review a restaurant after one visit, but this place is just that good. Had the pesto chicken crepe and the Heart drip coffee. Those go together right? I had the coffee because it is free when you check in on Yelp (you can also choose tea.) The crepe, as you can see in the pics, was perfectly cooked. Thin, delicate, and slightly browned. The most prominent flavor was the cheddar cheese. My only critique would be that it could use more pesto, but it was still damn good. Also, the Heart (based out of Portland, OR) coffee was delicious and was a medium brew with a light oily layer.   The atmosphere may be just as fine as the food. The music was great and playing from an employee's iPod. I heard the Beatles, Gene Chandler, and Fela Kuti, a pioneer of Afrobeat music, among others. The wall art and friendly faces were courtesy of Andy Brown, who also did the murals on the Cabanas on McClintock in Tempe.   The staff was friendly and helpful. The price and portions are right. I'll be back and looking forward to trying their "sweet" crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pesto Chicken Crepe.

ngP3HjLNjs8QyJNw5teOvw.text: Came here based on fellow Yelpers reviews on a Sunday about an hour prior to the 2pm closing.  The place was packed, and I mean packed. All the tables were taken and the line was six deep.  The staff was extremely joyous and appeared to be enjoying the rush.  A staff member actually saved a table for us when one became available. The menu was easy to navigate and had something for everyone in my family. Previous reviews mentioned that the menu had lots  pork items, so we were prepared for slim pickings since were are a mostly vegetarian non pork eating (mainly personal reasons not religious) family.   However, there were plenty of items that fit the bill. My sons ordered and devoured the FIRST TIME (nutella, banana brulee) and the VANILLA BEAN CUSTARD with marinated strawberries and salted caramel.  My wife and I ordered the 13 MILE (Steadfast farm veggies plus French masala and buckweat crepes) and the BUCKWHEAT piquantee, mushroom ragout with horseradish havarti. The 13 Mile was surprisingly complex with French and South Indian flavors I certainly normally would not have made a crepe out of on my own, and the Buckwheat was savory, and had the right amount of cheese.  They brought out a granola sample that was light and house made with apricot slices ( fantastic) and also the House Brioche sampler which was too hard to eat-  about three times harder than an old crouton.  I am not sure what that was about.  Checking in on Yelp earned us a free coffee or tea.  Its a big bummer they have no decaf coffee or espresso.

Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

UuxWYZSMfcZmzRmUUo3kLw.text: Overall : 4 out of 5- Food is delicious. The ordering can be slow when they are busy. It's a little pricey for what you get (especially for drinks).  Service : 2 out of 5- when we first got in, we couldn't tell if we are supposed to sit ourselves and order up front . They were a bit slow taking the order, and the food came out slow.  Food : 4.5 out of 5 - I got the maple syrup with banana brulee crepe. It tastes very good. Boyfriend  likes the breakfast burrito , but he's not impressed with his cappuccino, especially with the price he paid for a small cup of it.

zmnCvk1JOPaQeYdCgGA9MQ.text: Love this place. The food is great and reasonably priced. And, the people who work here are charming and pleasant. Crepe bar has a great vibe to it probably partially due to the fact that the employees seem to really enjoy what the do.

ev2Hf19rGc50Nbva01T-IA.text: Great atmosphere busy indeed specially on the Friday noonish that i visited.  Very friendly staff by far the friendliest i have seen.  Ordered a drip coffee with the yelp check-in coupon and a carrot cake.  Both were fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. One heart felt drip coffee and one carrot cake

__VsPxFoS4TEwUhQVJFOxA.text: The crepes are incredible. All fresh local ingredients. They always are trying something new and letting guests have a mini appetizer to try with their crepe. I'm all about that veggie curry crepe. They source Heart coffee and their espresso, albeit it be a blend, is so tasty. I used to work at cartel coffee and often times preferred their espresso bean born to our single origin bean (unless we thew on some tasty Ethiopian on the hopper). Anyway. I remember the Guji by Heart being amazing. They also know how to steam their milk well. No large bubbles in my milk! Anyway, now that I no longer drink coffee due to a change of faiths, I still love going here for a crepe, and a herbal tea or hot chocolate. Wonderful hip, welcoming atmosphere.

ydt2hPPUveM518bro8u2rg.text: This place is amazing! I had the breakfast "burrito" which was delicious!  The eggs were perfectly light and fluffy, I don't even usually eat eggs but these I'd eat all day long. I added the Chorizo to it, the first one didn't have Chorizo in it but when they asked I told them it was missing and they made me a new one with absolutely no issues or fuss, it was amazing service.  Everyone there was really friendly and didn't mind answering any questions we had.

pRN9NbvlWVypOo5Xw5YSFQ.text: Oh snap this place knows quality and creative food. We have been wanting to try this place for over a year. I'm disappointed it took us this long to try it. We had one savory and one sweet crape......both amazing! Yelp Bookmark this place and come try ASAP!!

_TZGCbC3lIjdoQgijWxw5w.text: Very nice service. The taste of the vanilla bean crepe was great. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star is because i feel the portions are too small. I lived in LA where they were much bigger. I guess that was just me for expecting the same. Small place but nice for meeting up with friends to catch up.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean crepe with chocolate sauce

f1uFYx9NhOsQCppgVIu0qQ.text: Had 'first time' crepe (banana and Nutella) and farm. Vegetable crepe... Loved both and coffee tastes good too

2zDrg7epPL98KbvDz8BUrQ.text: Not at all impressed.  This is a very limited menu.  We shared a breakfast crepe burrito with cb fries (about 15 very small chunks of home fried potatoes sprinkled on top).  The presentation was pretty, and aside from a mouthful of a heavy salt seasoning that was on the plate, it wasn't bad.  We also shared a dessert crepe with fruit compote.  The crepe was served cold (????) and I didn't have more than one bite. It tasted like raw dough.   It was that bad.  The "communal" granola that a server brought over after we had ordered was just odd.   I don't want to eat granola with my fingers as my tablemate dips into the same dish with her fingers.  Weird.    An employee was standing outside the window by our table the entire time we were there.   She was writing the summer hours in the window, and it took her a long time.   We had a view of her underarms while we ate. Seriously.  Additionally, the door was propped open the whole time, and a fly was all over our table.   I think that maintenance work should be done out of the view of customers.  Can't the hours be added to the window BEFORE the place opens?  Shut the door, too.  Common sense, really.  I went to this place at the recommendation of an acquaintance and will not be back.

52pnuxNfX3BSaew0gCzZGA.text: The Crepe Bar is awesome! for someone who doesn't like Crepes, I really like this place.   -Great service -Great Crepes; savory and sweet -Great Coffee -Great build-out, its super cute!  I Highly recommended the Grand Prix prior to 11am.   Dogs are welcome to sit outside on the patio.

e79orCCUd0S1G3CsG2RydA.text: Came here on a Saturday around 10am. No line, but all the tables inside were full so I sat outside. Got the strawberry crepe. Was very good but small. Was still hungry when I finished. I might have ordered a second if it didn't take so long for the first one to come out. Got the cold brew, which was pretty good as well.

TjUO---RMHk3kUDMWyDi7g.text: Nice trendy place. Very hip.  Very nice staff that constantly is checking on everyone.  I had the second time crepe that was fantastic.   I like dessert for breakfast.  Will bring my wife next time.

ozG9wbUCwEmpaSDUNL0RJA.text: Crepe bar was a great suggestion from some new friends I made this week visiting Arizona. The atmosphere was unique and comforting. Great decor and pleasant people in the restaurant as well. The group I went there for breakfast with stayed there for a good hour after we finished eating. The staff was very friendly. The time between ordering and being served the food was a bit longer than desired, but the wait was well worth it. The breakfast burro is one of the best breakfast items I've ever tasted, particularly because of the avocado and chipotle sauce. The brioche with fresh jam was also delicious, one of the best jams I've ever tasted and the brioche was toasted perfectly. I intend on eating here the next time I am in the Tempe area.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The breakfast burro

HWhNGPqTfI89rJaY766GzA.text: I wasn't sure what to order since everything sounded amazing. We ended up getting the first time, maple butter banana brulee and the breakfast burro. The first time was a little sweet for me but the other two were amazing! Awesome service too! I'll definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burro, maple butter banana brûlée &amp; first time!!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. non-fat cappuccino

KgW_ZEzReTMXtBDE56-ZBQ.text: Today was my first time here and it was pretty freakin bad. I got cold brew and a crepe with Nutella and strawberries. The cold brew was so bitter and horrible that I couldn't even drink it. I got my crepe and it came cold, with a disgusting amount of Nutella on it. The strawberries were covered in basil, which I really dislike and they didn't inform me of it. I will never come here again and I think it's really, really over hyped.

nJCLcxrZV4Q3_-jQjNWcdg.text: While the food is good, there are a few things that really made my visit terrible.  My $5 latte was only barely warm, on the verge of cold really, the wait in line was over 30 minutes to order, and they only have one highchair in the whole restaurant. There were at least 3 other kids/babies there, in addition to my own, that all had to sit on a parents lap, or on top of the table, in order to have a meal with their family. I waited another 30 minutes for food, only to be disappointed by the small portion size.  So done with this place!

v3uTM6o3LSPvqYx8mXlG-Q.text: Simplemente desayunos deliciosos!!!!!!!!!... plane and simple delicious breakfast... this is gonna be a weekly stop from now on!!..

HbpOGMD1z-x89KBbIXw-eA.text: Amazing breakfast and staff. Looking at the unassuming sign outside I had no idea about the gold mine inside!

9dGOvQumENdwdTenwoYAGA.text: The food is incredible, the coffee is wonderful, and the hospitality is better still.

NbwJiPkUc5P3ILSSJ11R4A.text: Been here twice and loved the food both times.  Staff is really friendly.  Gave it 4 stars because the wait time is longer then it should be.   It's a slightly smaller portion but I'm OK with that as prices are reasonable.

wXAXN0rS5CbJp8_MbjB_qg.text: I only write when a place is extraordinary and this one is. My big fear is it will soon move to a bigger, $$$ place. Simple fresh ingredients in incredibly creative combinations. Apple butter on brioche toast w pistachios and mint. Orgasmic. Sushita peppers lightly sauteed w marcona almonds. Oh my goodness. Then buckwheat crepe w mushroom ragout and horseradish cheese. A meal better than sex most nights. All this food for $21. It's tiny and the line can be long but they seem to know exactly when to bring out a tiny taste of something to keep you from getting grumpy. If I could give an extra star I would.

ZO4sZtmUDYTUjJzc0gO-5A.text: We were super excited to try this place because of the really high rating here on Yelp and because we love crepes. The restaurant is really small and didn't seem to have any air conditioning and was very stuffy, and we went in December. Ordered 2 crepes and two drinks and the price was just over $20. the place wasn't overly crowded and it took a good 20 minutes before our crepes showed up, and when they did I wasn't overly impressed. We got the Papa K which was a decent amount of food, as well as the maple butter, which was just a plain crepe with some syrup over it. They weren't bad, but not anything to make me recommend the place and to go back. I'd say for what we got a price around $15 would be more reasonable as well.

Ddjz26t_yZadR8jfr9xbeA.text: Tiny place, with only 8-10 tables, but service is friendly and the food is good.  Tried both the savory and sweet crepes and wasn't disappointed.  They make their crepes a little thicker then I'm usually used to, but with the sweet crepes, they roll them up and drizzle lots of nutella (if that strikes your fancy), on them and are tasty.  But I think the savory turkey crepe was my favorite.  It was flavorful, not crazy big, but satisfying and yummy.

dktzILnbGa2U-m7chZYK0w.text: The only reason I'm giving them such a low rating is bcuz I asked if I could get scrambled eggs in my sausage crepe and was told NO as if building an effing crepe was magic unicorn chit and wasn't at all an option in this little hipster "crepe bar". Being that my experience w savory crepes comes from the Pacific NW, Portland and Seattle, I've been spoilt apparently. Because it's soo difficult to take common breakfast fixins, like eggs, sausage, cheese, spinach and marry them into a perfect french pancake called a savory crepe!!! These ppl need to take a serious trip to the NW and see the offerings of 20+ crepe combinations AND the "build your own" option ALWAYS included on the street fair menus at the farmer's market! I guess as long as ppl in Tempe do not travel and have crepes anywhere else, then this place will do well. Hubby liked his grand prix and wanted me to share that in my review. I'm terribly disappointed in my savory bfast crepe maybe the sweet ones are there niche idk. I won't be back to find out! Place was clean, servers friendly, (except when you ask to alter the crepe your ordering) cappuccino lacking in foam and rich flavor... Blah I'm going to dutch bros for a real damn coffee now. ;-)

0h9Dz0UepCGlqGzReSLpGQ.text: I've been to crepe bar a few times.  Service on the weekend can be slow, but when I was here on a recent Friday morning, the restaurant was busy without being crowded, and the servers were attentive and prompt.  I've had the breakfast burrito crepe a couple times in the past (four stars - spicy, savory, and very filling!), and decided to get the andouille sausage one this time.  It was good -- generous amounts of sausage, a perfectly-cooked sunny-side-up egg on top, nice spicy kick -- but a little bit too salty.  I mentioned it to one of the servers, and she said it was just that the sausage itself was that salty; they don't salt the dish, except for a sprinkling of sea salt on top of the fried egg.  I ate about 90%, then put it aside to turn my attention to the lemon crepe.  I've had these before with just a simple spritz of lemon juice and a dusting of sugar, but Crepe Bar's version was a little more elaborate: the crepes had a kind of a lemon custard in them that was really good.  It was very sweet (could have been a little bit more tart, but still, I finished every bite!).    Everything here is plated beautifully.  And, every time I've come here, a server has circulated around the restaurant offering free amuse bouche to diners.   This time, it was a maple coffee cake with vanilla custard; very nice!  The food is a little pricy, but it's clear that they care about quality and pay attention to details here. I will be back!

Nt14_nxFdTR2gSaV2Kxfxg.text: This place is EXCELLENT! Takes the extra step as far as customer service goes. My daughter and I went on an early Saturday morning, as to avoid lines and get choice seating....I had the Duck Cuban. It was cooked perfectly. I could undoubtedly taste the quality and freshness of farm to table ingredients. Dish was both aesthetically pleasing and reasonably priced. She had the Buckwheat, which was delicious, savory and beyond satisfactory. We left feeling extremely happy in all aspects.

eDnwb7OIkpJtzAsPWYhPKA.text: This place was incredible. I drive by all the time to and from work and have read great reviews and finally made it this morning. It was great and is will be back. We waited a while to order at the bar and then found a place to sit. I suggest having an idea of what you want and have one person stand in line to order while the other grabs an open table. The cold brew coffee was good coming from a coffee novice, and my girlfriend was a fan of the regular coffee and she is an avid coffee drinker. When I tasted my crepe, I was floored. I ordered the Crepe Burro, chipotle crepe wrapped around bacon, eggs, avocado, and pepper jack cheese. Not to mention the chipotle sea salt and sauce. My girlfriend got the vanilla bean custard with strawberries, and roasted walnuts. We each tried a little of each other's and agreed that we would be back to try the other options and have already found two favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

l5-qbPKTANVPzPumZS9SQg.text: Absolutely fantastic, creative and interesting food with awesome prices.  Can't believe there's such a gem in south Tempe, it's better than some restaurants in SF (one of the best places for culinary adventures).  Highly highly recommend.

ZLj_XBqCuow-g2yneB-HAw.text: The food is really good. The coffee is pour over which is the best way to make it. the customer service is outstanding.  the only downside to this place is the size. You want to enjoy your time at a place like this. But the aisles are narrow and you feel rushed and crowded when your there. so the ambience is way down which is important for me on a nice Sunday morning.

r4JjmHpBKhmRKxhDbiTOWA.text: 1 star for Very cool atmosphere. 1 star for Friendly Staff. However, the taste of the food was Not very good (the bottom of the crepe was too mushy, and watery). But, if you are looking for an upbeat atmosphere and trendy vibe, this is a good pic.

8z1t0ur6SJqa0K0gOCbJlw.text: Can I please add 2 more stars on top of the 5 stars given. I found this restaurant when I gave a friend the wheel and said "Where for brunch?"  (He is a frat brother, my guesses were I was in for; U.S.egg or ihop and I don't support corporate)  We walked in and were greated with open arms (literally).  Food - Everything.  Try everything. But don't try the Banana and Nutella because you will want it every morning after.  Drink - Not much of a latte or cappuccino fan. Only reason due to I was a barista in the past and wore myself out. However that cold brew in the fridge to the right. Oh my god. Really if I could buy it in the 6-pack. No seriously. I'll pay money for that. Damn good.  Service - Hands down the best. I felt like I was at a friends house. They took care of us.  Presentation - You had me blown away. That food presentation was culinary perfection. The granola even on that slate platter was beautiful.  (If I wasn't so heavy,  i would of took it)   Your local. You treated us well. Places like this I don't speak of due to i don't want you get played out. But you, I'm shouting at the roof tops.   Sidenote - Our food did take sometime. But look at that kitchen size. They are doing amazing food with the space given. Be patient. The food will come.

RWjlZvocuNrwZjlG8dJjxQ.text: Just tried it today based on the great reviews.  Others are correct breakfast burrito is GREAT.  I wanted to get a custom crepe for breakfast but it seemed expensive when you added ham and eggs to the basic $6.50 crepe so I ordered a breakfast burrito and was very happy with the smokey chipotle flavor.  Agree, the wait is long for such a small restaurant.  Tea prices were a bit confusing and the price is high for something that didn't seem refillable.  Understand why most were drinking free water.  I love sweet crepes with butter and sugar so I tried the bruleed crepe.  It was okay but my husband makes me better ones at home.  DEFINATELY will return for the breakfast burrito.

su7_H3Fq_upr2vNrrIPGFQ.text: After several years in the same location the Crepe Bar continues to impress.  We've eaten breakfast too many times to count, often enough to have tried everything on the menu and to know it by heart.  They bring a gourmet complexity to each dish raising their fare well above most breakfast offerings in the Phoenix metro area.  The only downside is the wait after 9am but you get that wherever the food is awesome.

ClOa2fpCyjh-3IoqVZI_wQ.text: Absolutely delicious.  The server recommended the Grand Prix to me and I am very glad he did.  It's a crepe infused with coffee (in the batter) topped with egg and maple bacon.  Is that not genius?  I could go for another one right now.  Can I get one of these in Colorado?  Please?

TustncnjqDvAWdMyd0ROzw.text: I have no idea why we did not explore Mesa places before. My fiance and I got tired of going to Tempe Marketplace or Scottsdale and decided to explore more places around us. Having made crepes at home, I knew what I was looking for. This place surpassed my expectations. The crepes are very yummy and not rubbery like the crepes I tried in one of the crepe places in Michigan. We tried sweet crepes, next time we will come to try their savory crepes. Presentations is very appealing too! Love combination of casual atmosphere and sophisticated looking food!

ij2cAvr-0oxHxsBCrR1GNg.text: This place has grown... guess thats good for business. Talented barista. Yummy Morrocan latte. Didn't try the food. Customer service is lacking. What ever happened to beinv welcoming and a smile? Busboy (man) was so sour, he just tossed the menus at us. Bizarro paintings. Interesting structure. I'm good with not coming back, thanks.

mdjPrQkhyfR_c8FkNxJH8w.text: Amazing flavors and a fun environment! We've loved everything we've eaten! AZ honey, hummus, vegetable crepes were great and the smashed potatoes as well. Very friendly staff who greet you and really seem to enjoy their work environment.   Would be 5 stars, but we were disappointed that neither bathroom has a changing table! We had to change our baby on the concrete bathroom floor-bleck. Would be an easy fix- both bathrooms have some shelving that would be a perfectly sized space for a changing table!

YWkUibvfnjPeD3CHz_WFDw.text: Wait time is horrible on Sunday mornings.  Not what I expected as menu choices.  Was hoping it was more a crepe bar where it's more buffet style where you can put toppings on vs the limited menu choices.  Disappointed

_x6ciCneNSHpY2foWmi8Fg.text: Overal Pretty good food!   I went around brunch on a Saturday, which I expect for it to be busy and have a lot of people. However their seating is not very group friendly. If you have a party larger then four... good luck finding somewhere to sit.   The food itself was pretty goods at least the option I got. I ordered one of the savory options that had chorizo and beans. It wasn't really filling but it was heavier then ordering a sweet option.   Drink menu was great. Nothing to complain about with that.   I will definitely be returning again to try some other options!

KPPEs1F2rW-KC2h3xL95ew.text: While on my way to the crepe bar, I was reading about long lines so I was hoping there wasn't a line. Luckily, when we get here, there was no line - Yes!! So we head in and place our order. The restaurant wasn't even busy with a number of empty tables. We get our number and sit down and we wait....and wait...and wait... it takes a little over 30 minutes before our food arrives. The guy next to us tells me that it's normal here, but he says it's worth it. Sorry, but that's crazy.   We order the Papa K and Dulce de Leche crepe. Both crepes were good, but not great. The price for two crepes was less than $20 so not bad on price. Of all the breakfast spots around the valley, I'm not sure if this is a spot I would go to if I want a great and quick breakfast.

fVP3Qn3mPdhVaOdYw-M_4Q.text: I can very clearly trace back to when I first fell in love in with crepes.  Though it wasn't at a creperie like Crepe Bar per se.  It was at one of Phoenix's best pizzerias.  Cibo in Downtown Phoenix offers a variety of sweet dessert crepes for those still with an appetite after a 12" pizza (*raises hand*).  The first crepe I ever had at Cibo was their Fresca crepe.  Warm crepe dough (basically a thin sheeted pancake) wrapped around vanilla ice cream, a variety of fruits and then topped with whipped cream, sugar, and even more fruit.  The portion was huge and the flavors were heaven sent.  It was a beautiful (if unexpected) dessert that I never would've expected to see at a pizzeria.  Since then, I've had my fair share of crepes from various restaurants including JoBot Coffee, Vovomeena, Duza's Kitchen, Vincent Market Bistro, and others.  Crepe Bar is my first foray into a crepe specific establishment.  Seemed like a good lunch option on a Sunday so off I went.  The restaurant sits in an unassuming strip center on the northwest corner of Elliot and Rural in Tempe.  It doesn't look like much from the outside (and was a little hard to spot at first), but the packed parking lot gave me some indication that I was in the right spot. Walking inside, the long line confirmed my suspicions.  A line about 20 deep at Noon on Sunday and the tables were packed.  There's probably seating for close to 60 or 70, but I needed some luck to get one.  Here you order at the front and they bring the food out to you.  By the time I ordered at the register, a stool at the front counter opened up so I raced to grab it.  Just prior to that, I examined the menu while waiting in line to make my choices.  No sides or non-crepe items for me this go around.  Today I was going to order one item from the savory crepe menu and an item from the sweet crepe menu.  The "Limited Availability" crepes in particular caught my attention thanks to the complex mix of ingredients each offers.  For my savory crepe, it was the Crepe-Stada.  A crepe that is fried like a tostada, topped with paprika chicken, black beans, avocado, greens, a fried egg, cotija cheese and a mix of chipotle and hot sauces.  For my sweet crepe, I chose the Ode To A Sundae (yes I know its Sunday, I'm corny like that).  This one is a chocolate crepe stuffed with bananas and caramel over a bed of vanilla custard, and topped with berries, more bananas, chocolate chips, and candied pistachios.  Total cost for the food and tax came to about $21.  Food took about 10 minutes to come out since they were crazy busy.  The portions for both of these weren't quite on the level of a Cibo or a JoBot (at least relative to price), but the plate presentation for both was quite lovely.  The Crepe-Stada was helped a bunch by the sauces that were poured on the side.  By itself, the beans, egg, and chicken were somewhat benign, but the chipotle and hot sauces both added just what the dish needed for a little extra kick.  Portion was fairly small, but the dish was nevertheless satisfying.  The Ode by contrast was a much more generous portion and had a lovely texture.  I was especially happy with the mounds of pistachios and berries.  Only thing I might've done differently with this dish is perhaps integrate a fruity custard instead of vanilla (say mango or apple or something along those lines).  Otherwise, a solid sweet crepe offering.  Overall, owner Jeff Kraus has done some good work putting his obsession with crepes to good use.  Some of the crepe dishes are better than others, but I can appreciate the creativity and the fearlessness he puts into a number of his crepe experimentations.  I wouldn't quite put Crepe Bar up with my most elite crepe favorites (Cibo's are especially tough to top), at least not yet.  But the place has potential.  And though it might seem like a small thing, it would probably be worth it for them to hire a wait staff rather than let everyone wait in line and fend for themselves for seating (today especially was quite a free for all).  Till then, here's hoping Crepe Bar keeps pushing the envelope on this humble (but delicious) thin sheet of pastry.

4BxdtGoXcM67WU27nhkmEw.text: Stopped here for a Sunday breakfast bite and ordered the Grand Prix (pork belly, coffee maple crepe). The proportions were perfect, the sauce was sweet, the over medium egg had a saltiness that balanced well, and the pork belly was expertly prepared.   I would like to add that the espresso was also expertly prepared and the staff was incredibly alert and attentive.   The place is small and the kitchen atmosphere was fast-paced, controlled chaos. Vc8vUbAYV7tn6bHbHl_V7Q.text: Hidden gem. Atmosphere is great. Cozy place. I visited on a Thursday so wasn't very busy. Took a look at the menu and was explained everything. Ordered and sat down. Grabbed my drink and while waiting they brought a granola appetizer while we waited for our food. Granola was amazing.   I ordered the breakfast burrito.  Great portions and very tasty. Added the chorizo for a little kick. Was highly recommended and didn't disappoint. Flavors were all there and the burrito didn't stand a chance.   After my burrito tried the popular Nutella/banana brulee. A tad sweet if you're not used to it but delicious nonetheless. Highly recommend it.   Overall great experience and will gladly visit again. Love the environment and absolutely enjoyed my meal.

X5dowKuggm7zZkBBac6HHQ.text: When I arrived to Arizona, the first thing that came to my mind was, "This place is hot as balls! How do people survive here?!" The weather was a smoldering 107 F and my car was dying a slow, heat induced death. It was only the first full day in the Grand Canyon State and I wanted to punch myself in the face for coming out here. But maybe I was simply this way because of the lack of nutrients in my belly. So I met up a friend at a place highly recommended by the locals and drove my poor car to Crepe Bar.  Deco: 4 stars  The moment you walk in, you're welcomed into a refreshing atmosphere. Not only is the air conditioning keeping this place cool, but the colors and art work also add to the aura of coolness. The colors are hues of blue with white background, the tables are refreshingly cold to the touch, and the front counter has a great homegrown feel to it that is welcoming to anyone, from local to tourist. I found out the scheme for the inside was supposed to feel like your eating outside because Crepe Bar started off as a food truck before having roots in a building. The framed art work on the walls are done by a local artist whom is quite famous but I forgot the name of. There's a lot of personality to just the deco and it was one of many examples I discovered of the creativity and artistic nature of the Arizona people.  Service: 5 stars  The service here was incredible. When I go somewhere new, especially far from my home, I like to talk to the locals and find out their stories. Add that with my unrelenting desire for food and I can get pretty inquisitive. But the staff here was amazing. Not only were they friendly, they were kick back and gave the type of service you only see in movies. Each person had a personality and wasn't only a face. There was pleasure and pride in the work they do and a sincerity that crossed over with their words and actions. It was great to interact with homosapiens who spoke to you without a facade. And the kicker to all this: while I was waiting for my food to come out, they brought out not only one, but TWO complimentary items of food while my friend and I sat and conversed. WHAT SWEETHEARTS!  Food: 4 stars  The food here was quite delicious, especially for the simplicity. They get the most flavors out of the ingredients they use and create something not just pretty, but also tasty. Although I'm not a huge fan of savory crepes, I was coerced to try out the chicken pesto crepe and greatly appreciated the choice. It was a great blend of herbs and chicken. The gooey cheese inside melted perfectly with the above mentioned ingredients and when the cheese hit the edges of the crepe, a delicious, crispy cheesy crust was created; a perfect contrast in flavor and texture to the rest of the crepe. The complimentary items were also small nibbles of what food they were experimenting with. Whether it was coffee grinds added to a cookie or the fresh granola made in house, the food was refreshing and delicious. Even now, I want to wrap my tongue around those flavors once more for there was genuine happiness in each bite.  Conclusion  Crepe Bar is a perfect example of how simple ingredients and amazing service can make a dining experience into one of pure joy. For me, Crepe Bar wasn't only a great lunch spot, but a place that opened my eyes to the creative side of Arizona that never gets mentioned. The people of Arizona have an eye for the artistic, a playfulness in their cooking, and a heart of sincerity. Crepe Bar showed me Arizona is filled with vast amount of stories to discover and I was excited, and still am, to see what more I discover.

hGaWEuJnRuM_ynbUdxTS_Q.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots. Friendly staff. Funky, casual atmosphere. Delicious CB cereal and wonderful, strong coffee. The crepes are amazing as well, of course.

dTsAWIs6Owlj4iqec2dQRw.text: Crepe Bar had a fun, casual atmosphere with a mix of high top and low top tables in the small and crowded space, which was bustling when we went.  I loved the photo light boxes lining the north wall.  What I didn't love was the wait at this partial-service spot.  Granted, I chose 11:30 a.m. on a Saturday for my first visit, but I doubt it slows down much any other time on the weekends - at least it didn't during the hour-plus we were there.    Forty minutes after ordering two crepes, my coffee mug was empty (Crepe Bar brews Heart coffee, which is a bit acidic for my tastes, but enjoyable nonetheless), I'd downed three plastic cups of the room temperature self-serve water, and we'd long finished the small dish of complimentary granola (which, frankly, is difficult to eat.  I'd rather they rolled them with some honey or peanut butter and made bite-size granola balls - picking up the individual oats, raisins, and nut mixture was messy and unpleasant).  Although the friendly (and hipster (I saw a lot of skinny cuffed jeans, flannel, and thick-rimmed glasses) staff had nothing to do with the delay, as it was clear the small kitchen could never keep up with the demand out front, I was a bit irritated by the time my Andouille Sausage and Pick Me Up crepes finally arrived.  But then, as I said, the crepes arrived.  And they were delicious enough to make my long wait a distant memory.  The Pick Me Up crepe, a coffee crepe with tangy espresso mascarpone, was delightfully rich and the crepe perfectly prepared - I could barely finish my half because it was so decadent, but it was ideal for sharing.  The Andouille Sausage crepe was also perfectly light and fluffy with a fantastic flavor reminiscent of fresh pasta dough.  The savory flavors melded perfectly with the Andouille sausage and egg, although the pimiento cheese sauce was a bit salty.  The accompanying fingerling potatoes were perfectly cooked, tender but crisp, tossed in herbs and what tasted like garlic oil.  I could have devoured a whole plate.  Any lingering annoyance I had from the wait was wholly dissipated by the arrival of two complimentary mini rose marshmallows toasted tableside and served with an artful splattering of dark chocolate.  The rose flavor really shone through in the marshmallows and the sweet treat polished off our meal on a high note.  In sum, prepare to wait - and I mean wait - if you head to Crepe Bar for weekend brunch, but definitely wait - it's worth it.  The best crepes I've had in the Valley thus far.  I can't wait to go back (and wait) to try the rest of the menu.

bLLhwW_frSd5DirSNlAvow.text: I would give this place 6 stars if I could. I went here today for my birthday with my boyfriend.  What. A. Treat.  We didn't even mention that it was my birthday until after we were done eating, but we were still treated like we were important. During our meal we were given three complimentary samples of some of their food. It was all to die for. Lemon bars, milk and cookies, and roasted marshmallows.  We started with a sugar crepe with berries then moved on to the "main course." My boyfriend got the breakfast burro and I got the smokey.  I cannot remember the last time I ate so much of my meal with my eyes closed, just enjoying every single moment of my food.  The coffee was also amazingly flavorful (with free refills!).  The staff were amazingly nice and the service was quick.   I've honestly never been so impressed with a restaurant.  Thanks for making my birthday so special!!! Crepe Bar ROCKS!!!!!

M3Ays3XuX5f1Ri0VlUmR1Q.text: Holy you know what Tuesday! BIG recommend.  Well worth the drive from Phoenix. I love watching my wife's eyes light up when I suggest we head to CB. The Papa K and a sweet Lemon Crepe is the usual. Espresso coffee is tip top. Jeff will knock your socks off.

XHiSg1Q2u3DyPhVATygpsQ.text: We love this restaurant, the crepes are excellent, as well, all the other things on the menu are terrific. I would never hesitate to go again! Best crepes in town!!!

lF5pK4xGHztEmDhx694gRA.text: Once we walked into this little breakfast nook, my companion felt she was transported to the "Kinfolk" style of Portland, Oregon!  I'm not an expert on crepes, but I really enjoyed my "Jamaican Jerk Pork Sausage"! It was bursting with flavors and beautifully plated! The portion was big for little ol' me, but probably perfect for a hungry adult person's breakfast. My companion's "Second Time" Nutella crepe was "meh," too much sweet out-of-the-jar Nutella filling, in my opinion. Next time, we'll stick to their savory crepes instead!  The only negative point I have about this place, is the food did take a while to come to our table, but they compensated that with complimentary scones while we waited (perfect with our tea, btw), and of course we're hoping the time was spent to plate a perfect, artistic and delicious meal! Will definitely come back to this place to try more dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jamaican Jerk Pork Sausage crepe: very tasty! The purslane garnish was cool too!

ON2WT12YCiZdtEym9_fZOQ.text: Brunch on a Tuesday???? Yup!!! We were around the Tempe area for an early appointment so we decided to have brunch around Tempe as well. We decided to have crepes. If you want crepes, you go to a place that specializes on Crepes, right? If a place is called Crepe Bar, I guess that means they do good crepes. We found the place off of S Rural. The place is small but can probably sit 50 people. The vibe of the place was upbeat. Music played in the background but it wasn't very loud. Just kept the place cozy and vibrant. The colors on the walls were appealing. Hues of blue and grey fill the place with accents of green, orange and pastel colors. Let's talk about their food. It was AWESOME!!!! My first five star on Yelp. From the service, to the place and ofcourse the food... IT WAS AWESOME (it was so awesome I wrote it three times already). We had The Burro (savory), The Grand Prix (savory) and the Vanilla Bean Custard (sweet) crepe. We also had the Maya tea and the Hot caramel latte for our drinks. The Burro... this is your breakfast burrito on a crepe. Crepe was chipotle flavored with scrambled eggs, chorizo, avocado and pepper jack cheese. I would have wanted a little more of the sauce used for plating. I feel that it really complimented the dish. The little sauce on my plate did not make the experience less enjoyable though. There was a surprising kick on every bite with a hint of sweetness from the crepe and savory delight from the chorizo. The avocado definitely completed that southwest flavor and added a refreshing flavor to the dish. The Grand Prix was my favorite. I love the creamyness of the fat from the pork belly that was cooked to perfection. It melts in your mouth. There was also the added crunch from the maple glazed pork jowl. The pork glory is placed on a bed of coffee Crepe topped with a sunny side up egg. I would have loved it more if the egg was little runny but overall I would order it again and recommend it to everyone. We ended our meal with the vanilla bean custard with strawberries, almonds and salted caramel. It wasn't too sweet considering the salted caramel and vanilla custard. The perfect bite would be a piece of crepe, a bite of strawberry, a dash of candied almonds, topped with custard and salted caramel. Everything just goes well together. We would definitely come back. Maybe we'll bring friends with us next time to share our new found favorite Crepe bar in Arizona. Certified yum for the buck! more reviews on themealexperience.blogsp...
