8OOjKD87RPid5d4YchxU1w.text: Seriously a tasty crepe can be had here. Ordered the Papa K savory crepe and it was delicious. Also picked up the chocolate chip cookie (theoretically given the size it was practically 2 cookies). It was flaky and oh so chocolaty.   Service was excellent and the waiters/waitresses were super nice. The only downside is given that this place is so popular, expect a wait for your food. My only suggestion is try and beat the rush, your stomach will thank you.

fIpX2OoEe6QEARlQSB-NEg.text: Soo good. I was resigned to the thought that no good crepe places existed in the Phoenix area...I'm glad I was wrong. Great coffee, awesome granola, amazing crepes. Definitely my new lunch spot

FGK1-W9eBgxEArV-ktFSVA.text: Crepe bar is definitely a cool "hole in the wall" place. It was CRAZY busy! Our crepes came in a timely manner, but were not the best. I was expecting a little more food and a little more flavor. The staff was SO nice, and the little milk and cookies we got when we were done was a nice touch! Not a place i would bring my family (too loud inside, plus the stoller for my son) but i would stop by again for a date or with my friends!

9Xmp-08yKHteF90rOTcm-g.text: Yum! Love this place. Friendly staff, great food. They know what they're doing here. Best crepes in the area!

2AAmgT9uNkUqrfK0S6M0-g.text: First time at this place and it was awesome!! Jeff the chef was super nice and his stuff is amazing, can't wait until he starts serving dinner.

79h2oh7EO6mupOnz1aWXEA.text: Amazing food. Hands down the best breakfast I've had out. Had chicken pesto and tried my friend's breakfast burrito, both of which I will eat again. We shared a strawberry crepe with chocolate syrup. Omgoodness...I could have easily eaten a whole one myself. Service,taste,and portion were all on point. Go try it out!

iTRah3_KCpLhGgFzznWMjA.text: I wish this place was around when I lived in Tempe.  The food is spectacular. We had a total of 4 in a group, we all ordered different items and we all are raving about this place. I had the bacon and egg burrito, and it was the best I have ever had.  The crepe, the salsa and the sauce absolutely heavenly. We also tried the strawberry and creme crepe - deelish.  The crepe with ham and cheese - deelish!  The place is small and the decor minimal, but who cares when the food is that good. The staff - really nice and helpful. They even brought out some new desserts for us to test for free. It may take a little longer than you think it should to get your food...but I am telling you it is because they are working magic in the kitchen to get you their deeeelish crepes!  GO!!!! EAT!!!!! ENJOY!!!!!

1c89YSruwApOZWdRbRCpTA.text: WOW! This place is amazing. I missed going here a few times by attempting to on a Monday. I finally went on a Tuesday for an early lunch with my wife and boy were we impressed. As I stood at the counter looking over the menu Chef Jeff came out from behind the counter to share the details of his amazing menu. We order the special Duck and a wonder crepe with ham and mushrooms (it was about 2 months ago...so please forgive my lack of memory). We also indulged with a dessert dish that had strawberries, creme, nuts....YUM!  The dishes that Chef Jeff creates are full of flavor and creativity. I highly recommend that you take the time to stop in and try the Crepe Bar. I also heard that they had plans to open for dinner on select evenings and I can't wait to go back to give dinner a try.

MUAGEQu7e3Gx30vVJJ5bZA.text: Hands down one of my favorite places for a weekend treat. Great crepes and great coffee. Yes the place is small so you may need to wait a bit for a table and your mouthwatering crepe. It's worth the wait. Or just plan on going earlier when it's not as crowded.

76DWwS-ugDT97oVlEKqtIw.text: I have been in the restaurant industry for 20+ years and eating in them for 35... That said, this is the most poorly run restaurant I've ever been in. You have to stand in line for 20+ mins to order while getting bumped into by their bumbling wait staff (with only three people ahead of you), you can't order the full menu Togo, apparently you can't just take what's on the plate and put it in a box, and the seating is very limited and when asking about it they say "if you're worried about getting a seat, don't be, sometimes you have to wait awhile but I've never seen someone not get a seat!"  Really?  You want me to stand there and hold my plate in my hand for god knows how long until a seat opens because you are incapable of putting my order in a box?!  I should have turned around as soon as I saw the hipsters behind the counter. Worthless.

xJbbekUhQn_5NoRIiNzECg.text: Oh man I remember my gf taking me to this place and the  good food service was okay could have been better and should have been cleaner almost fell and hit my head

wN-FiCNxf7oCS96QavfI9w.text: Excellent service and food. I got the Vanilla Bean Custard w/ Strawberries crepe. They are on top of their game. I love crepe bars in NYC and San Fran. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves crepes and great coffee.

WzH9NGbBlGpMgpW91AQQBQ.text: Okay so it took me 3 trips to this place before I was able to get a crepe. The first time, we showed up 30 minutes before closing and were denied service of anything except coffee or the small pastries on the counter because the kitchen was closed. In a normal restaurant I can totally understand this, but it only takes 5 minutes and a hot plate to make a crepe so I was a bit turned off by this. The second time we showed up with plenty of time before closing. We were told that we could order crepes, but that it would be a 40 minute wait. We asked if there was a special occasion and they said that this is just a typical Saturday for them. Perhaps they should consider purchasing another hot plate? I love crepes, but not enough to wait 40 minutes. The third time we went was today and we finally got our crepes! My crepe was ice cold when I got it. My fiance's however was luke warm. The crepe, though it was cold, actually tasted good and I think it could have been great had it not been so cold. I've been to Paris numerous times and know what a good crepe tastes like. The service was great and the people were friendly and attentive, but I don't know that I'll be coming back. My overall experience with this place hasn't been the best.

bfWkdFjyfK3Kqr9EkHkrbA.text: The place and staff are very very  welcoming, plenty of sitting available. We got a few free samples which we enjoyed a lot; however, the menu is somewhat limited for brunch/lunch. Otherwise a great spot to grab some tea and a delicious crepe.

I_mR22OyFUBp3vRX4HmZdQ.text: Went a 3rd time and again it was so busy and poorly set up/run that I again waited 10 minutes in line, only to not move forward at all, and walk out a 2nd time.  It's got the traditional hipster we don't care about service you will be lucky to have our good food vibe. Let me know when you move to a bigger location and don't run it like spoiled children who don't know how lucky they are to be busy.

WcNCyw6ERzTe1XQbloRWOQ.text: My boyfriend and I were going mnt biking at South mnt. Stopped here for brunch not knowing much about the place. Everything was Amazing. Deliciousness all around. Highly recommend.

CdTJqj7Ll0Q6skzSLTQ4KA.text: This place is amazing! I couldn't find one thing wrong with it.  The place itself is very cute and well designed, and the service was incredible.  The people there are really nice and always making sure you're okay at your table and asking if you need anything else.  The owner is also the head chef.... we had the breakfast burrito crepe which was to die for, and we also had the nutella and banana crepe which was also amazing.  I would highly recommend this place if you're in the area, or even if you're not... you won't be disappointed and I think it's definitely worth the drive!

XKKEnNY21K9CTETSxxCyRQ.text: I've been coming here since it was a small quiet coffee like cafe and watching it change over time has been great. This place is amazing. Chef is awesome and always putting together some fantastic creations. Staff is fantastic. It's usually busy so you have to jump to a spot if it opens up and don't come by if you are in a rush. This is a place to experience, not stop and run. Try everything you can Heard they might be expanding??

_N8Dtat8sJfQFrCIQdbRBA.text: Yummy deliciousness! Ordered the breakfast burro and the big k. Both were cooked perfectly and full of flavor!

LCjpRyfDbdoha4BBaczDpA.text: Crepe Bar offers excellent customer service, absolutely delicious food, great coffee and a fun, comfortable atmosphere! Definitely my favorite joint to enjoy a crepe

Ir8UsOZEJaGfvq_tYevPXw.text: I love this place! They need to expand because is always busy. Don't expect to go in and out. But do expect awesome food!

gMKIalcnR70UtiKvC071Bg.text: This place is just fabulous! The display is beautiful,  the atmosphere is sweet, and the food is delicious! It is reasonably priced and the service is wonderful. I think I have a new favorite spot.

xO7Cr7Ur1V-HA9P6zWRPkA.text: The food was unbelievable, and we got to try a few additional items because they lost/gave away our order.  We had the Breakfast Burrito and the First Time (Nutella and bruleed banana). The Breakfast Burrito is served with a spicy sea salt that pushes it into the stratosphere. The First Time is nowhere near as "desserty" as it sounds, but very well done.  Regarding our service, I have mixed emotions. On one hand, I worked in the industry for 12 years, and my wife for 6, so we understand that things happen. We waited 27 minutes (according to our check-in...) before we asked because we're super patient; also, at that point it was completely obvious something was wrong - everyone in the place but us had food. They felt bad enough that they brought us a small bowl of granola to tide us over while we waited, and cookies with milk after we were done. These were very nice gestures. Where the mixed emotions come in is the fact that the waitress over-apologized. She said she was "so sorry" about the mixup every single time she came by, probably close to 10 total - once was enough.  We will definitely be back, and I'm sure the service will be much better. I doubt the food could get any better, though.

MTJH_8cJ0pnIQihhjdD6SQ.text: Being breakfast lovers and especially lovers of local owners and fresh ingredients, we acted upon a few suggestions from people who we have come to know as wonderfully accurate about good places to eat:  local chefs! Believing that peer-reviewed places are likely to be excellent, Peg and I checked out this place this am. The place was "uber crowded,but Shelby greeted us cordially and gave us the info and layout of the land.  We knew that we wanted to sample both savory and sweet...and we are both coffee lovers as well..meaning lovers of GOOD coffee!! Heart coffee was wonderful. I had the sausage|local pork ~ pimento cheese~ roasted fingerling ~ easy egg crepe, and my bride sampled the papa k|local ham ~ mushroom ragout ~ pepperjack ~ dressed greens crepe. They were extraordinarily tasty. We did the usual sharing bites, and ended the meal with two sweet crepes: lemon x 3|butter + gel + zest and ^ vanilla bean custard|strawberries (straight up)...meaning you can add other goodies to the custard if you wish.  As importantly, the service and attitude of the people working there was stellar.  Shelby was very attentive and helpful (checking to make sure that our seating arrangement was acceptable) and  Brittney (I apologize in advance if there is a different spelling of your name!!!) and the server in the very nice "Miles" ( as in Miles Davis) were on top of things. The background music is a wonderful addition. All in all, this place is definitely worth a repeat/repeat/repeat visit!!!   BTW..it is literally next door to Pcroissant...another excellent choice.  Dr. B

LgkAz7DfB_2fm4jJJAz5vw.text: I remember seeing this place when I was at a restaurant next door. I remembered how busy it looked, and I really wanted to try it. Well I finally tried it today, and I have to say I don't understand why its so packed. Not that it was bad, it just wasn't in that great.  The Decour was cute, the line was long, the food wasn't bad but the portions were pretty sparse. I'm not looking for the grand slam breakfast, but a little bit more would be nice. Wait... I'm complaining about the food not being that great but yet I want more? Anyway...My daughter had the Nutella-banana Brule which was pretty tasty but a bit too sweet for me. I had the chipotle breakfast burro with roasted potatoes, and it just wasn't impressive on any level. The potatoes looked nice sparsely sprinkled on the plate, but they really needed to be in the burrito itself as well. On a bazaar note, at the end of the meal, they brought us out two tiny smidgens of marshmallows, broke out a blow torch, and lite up the mellow specks. Yummy...I love me some some roasted plastic. Not the worst but far from the best.

CA5Pa6CEBTtGtg3x-DRZ5w.text: Jeff and his crew are amazing.  Breakfast burrito: is it scrambled eggs or is it a souffle?  whatever it is, it is awesome. This place tries hard and it shows in the food.  Congrats

lZ2-ymJ7zma9PALkuHnTcg.text: Up to this point I have thoroughly enjoyed coming to the Crepe Bar.  This time I got the andouille sausage Crepe and my view of this place has jumped.  On top of that venturing into some of the baked goods such as bacon cherry oatmeal cookies and their great Granola, this is one of those hidden restaurants that I'll go back to over and over just to make sure it is always supported.  My coworkers are all feeling the same way, with the duck crepe becoming a popular option as well with very elaborate flavors going on.  The food here could sit on the menu of many high end establishments.  Great job!

ecmweI3-msjfkFBxMta9Jw.text: Amazing afternoon supper and affordable .  You would think that crepes are good but maybe a bit limited, but you would be wrong.  We each had a savory crepe and shared a dessert crepe.  I had the turkey roulade (sp) and it has some robust cheese with a perfectly tart stonefruit.  My wife had ham and mushroom with pepper jack and crusted parm on the edges.  I missed out on the daily special, but I was not sorry in the least.

Ipys971oLtHPuMv0N9dNVA.text: Crepe Bar is one of those unassuming cafes you drive by all the time and contemplate visiting, but never have.  The exterior is a strip mall without any anchor stores to draw you in. The gas station is there for a quick fill up and reminder that you still have never been to the Crepe Bar.  The interior is Spartan with small tables and metal chairs with cushions and high tops with matching metal stools.  The cash register is an iPad, and the tip jar is a pint glass.  There is also an artful flower arrangement on the counter with birds of paradise, and a cooler with cold drinks off to the side.  Some sweet treats beckon customers from the counter.  There also appears to be a rack with shirts near the entrance for sale.  The menu is also Spartan with a small variety of breakfast, lunch, and desert crepes.  There seem to be as many coffee and tea drinks as crepes, although you can also build your own crepe.  At lunch time on Friday and the place was busy.  I ordered the buffalo chicken.  It was good.  I'll have to try one of the desert crepes.

h8kknv2nJbsA0TArlKu7Mw.text: Went here the first time today, and it was a pleasant experience. I ordered the vanilla bean custard crepe with 55% valrhona chocolate and it was excellent. Order took a while to serve up, but the waiter gave us some granola to munch on while we waited. My boyfriend got the first timer banana brulee with nutella and that was very good too. Coffee was just okay, not terribly impressive...probably would skip the coffee next time. But definitely would come back here for crepes. This place is very popular and crowded, but their food is worth the wait.

lt8moWD-Nd3PqCQtTtwEVA.text: Was disappointed! When I stepped in the door, the place smelled less than savory. It almost made me leave but was meeting a friend, so stuck it out. I have a dairy allergy they could not accommodate since they pre-make their batter. My son had the kid's crepe, which was good, but the whole experience was overhyped. Bummed!

zl1cLEr6v3uOI2bmPp4TfA.text: Went on a Sunday AM. Ordered 4 crepes to go and the waiter brings them to me as an eat in order. No big deal, mistakes happen. Then he asks where my table was. "Nowhere, I wasn't planning on eating here." He then blames the girl at the counter for the mix up and says that he can't make the orders to go so he'll bring me some foil to wrap them myself, all while giving me a very smug attitude like this is my fault and I'm being such an inconvenience to him. The crepes were good but I'm not about to deal with that attitude again. If I had an employee like that I'd fire him on the spot.

ZiZFrLwsYs9U8DcRe4UY_A.text: DO NOT COME HERE, if you want to wait five hours (exaggeration). And if you do want to wait five hours, make sure you've used the restroom before hand because they seem to not believe in restrooms. Customer service was not great and the bedroom sized area was insufficient for the colossal amount of customers.

0EYpfkEHZ2hrEI6XP3njcA.text: i was excited about getting some good crepes in Tempe, but alas, was sorely disappointed by the outcome.  Assorted gripes in order of importance were 1) Pesto chicken was in fact 'curried' chicken. I make my own pesto and know the flavor quite well. No basil in the sauce which was basically a creamy light yellow curry sauce. What gives? 2)Plastic cups for drinks, 5 oz. for water and 16 oz. for purchased drinks. and the cheap flimsy cups you get in a hurry at Walgreens. Seriously? 3)No place setting on table, which, when requested only come with a knife and fork. (at least they were not plastic) No spoon, which i needed to stir my coffee. Another trip back to the kitchen.4) No sugar or sweeteners on the table. Had some in my wallet for these situations. 5) limited seating in which at least 3 tables were taken by Apple users with no food on the table. Did not Starbucks address this issue recently? I will just leave it at that for now. Hey, i do not expect the world at a crepe restaurant. But in my many years of eating out there are some BASIC things I have come to expect. When i do not get these basics i am not a happy camper. Had this place been open a short time i would give it  the benefit of the doubt. But i find more and more Phx diners have come to expect the minimum, and in the end, that is exactly what they get.

uMPIuHQx_BqL6NRZ1o1gww.text: We have a new go-to place for breakfast/lunch: The Crepe Bar.  We enjoyed the "Breakfast Burrito" which is a bit of a misnomer, as it's a crepe, but our other choice was the "Papa K" which I'm still dreaming about. Local ingredients, like fantastic local ham. Check out the tiny little 'doughnuts' which are really more like teeny beignets with cinnamon sugar.  OK - some have commented that service is slow.  It's made to order, so yeah, it's gone take a little more time.  So Mr. Cranky, don't come here when you're in a hurry!  But come when you have time to relax with a cup of delicious coffee while your meal is prepared  It's super hard to ding this place.  Worth seeking out, and worth the wait I promise.  Now if we could just convince them to open for dinner...That would be a beautiful thing!

sBkCrsow_St-nc32UH4CWQ.text: The food at this place is worth 5 stars WOW!  The breakfast burrito is perfect and the nutella and banana crepes are amazing!  They are topped with a sugary crunch that is absolutely addicting. What is not good is the coffee.  It's kind of sour and tastes more like Dunkin Donuts to me (if you're into that sort of thing go for it).  They also don't have cream to add to it which I thought was weird.  They don't have silverware out and I had to maneuver my way up to someone who looked busy and annoyed when I asked for it. The other thing I don't like is that it's too popular for the space.  It is PACKED and the line makes it impossible for the servers to even bring out the food.  Time to expand I think.  I also hate that the menu is not on display and is impossible to get a hold of from the back of the line.  There is however a list of hand drawn cartoons of all the people working there.  Quirky? Yes.  Helpful?  Not so much.   Sounds like a lot of complaints I know, but that food is just that good that you MUST try it despite the setbacks.

YNYGGkIFXgrw7ZDCaGqf-Q.text: Too bad Yelp won't allow you to give out 10 stars.  Located in a non descript strip mall like just about everything else in Phoenix.  This place has it together. Great food, great service, friendly people. If I had to complain about anything it is that one day I can imagine that one day the place will be too small and they'll be a wait but for now it is still somewhat a hidden gem.

Ie850xtbGZafLYpaaYnrPg.text: Delicious.  The food is fabulous and you won't be disappointed.  The coffee is great.

LMoDDCQasFa2xxEcif-v9w.text: I was out visiting family this past week and my brother suggested we grab breakfast at the Crepe Bar. I had the breakfast burro, sooo delicious and satisfying. Their coffee was bold and strong. My brother and I split the vanilla bean crepe afterwards and it was light and sweet. It was such a cozy little place! I am already looking forward to my next trip out to AZ so I can head back to the crepe bar!

KbRKQSn3FqGT2UlghgF_zA.text: brought my mom here for her birthday brunch. it was delicious, but it's really expensive for what you get. also, they use an ipad to place your order and to have you pay, and the tip amounts are predetermined, starting at 18%. i'm not opposed to that, but i just placed my order at the counter and seated myself. suspish.

MpX31lpLWoVYYJ6FzntOfA.text: This establishment I believe started out of a catering truck which is pretty impressive. I found this restaurant searching yelp and decided to give it a try do to it's overwhelming rave reviews. It's a bit too small of a place for my taste accommodation wise. I like a little room while I am eating. The lighting is very dim and not very good for a restaurant. Kind of feels like you're in a dark cave. It was a Saturday morning so you can expect a wait time, which ours was about 30 minutes before our food arrived. Unfortunately, mine came with it really long piece of hair all curled up on the very top of it. The server took it back and brought me a new meal in a couple minutes just as the rest of our order was ready. Besides all the lack of attraction to this place & my mystery topping I quite enjoyed my meal. We had ordered 2 breakfast burritos, 2 egg and cheese crepes and some nutella crepes with bananas. The breakfast burritos and the chocolate banana crepes were quite impressive. The egg and cheese crepes were a bit greasy and also had a bit of spice to them. Being that we had typical kids with us, it's hard to find something on the menu that would satisfy picky plain children so if you have these you might want to consider feeding them before or go for the gusto and give them a sugar rush of chocolate. All in all, I really did enjoy the food. I think this place is best if kept for people with a flair for food but probably not children. I will return and flavor this place again but with out the kids

0zgmfTb3_vpGk2rkNLhIZQ.text: Thank you for offering vegan options! They have two savory crepes that can be made vegan. Also they offer almond milk for coffee.

ioIpMUralwA-WnSqlW9fRg.text: This place was very delicious. I really really enjoyed it. The service was great. It was a relatively long wait time, but the super delicious food made up for it, as well as the cool waiters.  Service. For the service, it was a tad bit slow. But we were served some complimentary granola bits thing. That was cool. The waiters also had good personality. I can tell they liked to serve the public by the way they talked and how they constantly checked up on the customers.   As for the food, I ordered a basil chicken crepe. It was sooooo great. I love it. I would eat it again, but I'm gonna try their other selections next time. The two people that went with me ordered a brioche with strawberry jam and lemon drop crepe and also a burro crepe. Those also looked super delicious.   Overall, this place is so nice and the food is most likely made with love and care given the amount of time it took to cook our food. Time doesn't matter when food is this great. You should come here and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brioche with strawberry jam
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Basil chicken crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemon drop crepe

dlcN6bO6i4fDYJxR_L_shw.text: After eating at La Creperie Voila in Seattle last month, I developed a hankering for crepes! This place did not disappoint!   We came in around 9am Sunday morning expecting a very long wait. I had my boyfriend grab the first table available as I stood in line. There were about 7-8 people ahead of me. After about 15 minutes, I placed our order for 4 crepes and a latte. As we were waiting, one of the servers brought us a little treat of mixed nuts and granola. Pretty tasty but I wanted real food! Surprisingly, our order came only a mere 15 minutes later! I was skeptical before trying this place out because the wait was the biggest complaint from the majority.  The Papa K was tasty. Unfortunately, I had ham for dinner the night before and there was ham in the Papa K. It was kind of a turn off. I should have actually read what was in this before ordering. BUT the wonderfully marinated mushrooms saved the dish. It also came with a pleasant arugula salad on the side. My bf had the breakfast burro. It was good, but the guac made it very mushy. Add the potatoes.   Time for dessert crepes! I finished the Papa K and I definitely finished the vanilla cream crepe (with strawberries). The maple crepe (with bananas) was also a winner, but because I was so full from my two, I only had one bite. Boo.   I would like to return soon and hopefully I won't have to wait long again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla creme and Maple crepes. Yum!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K and Breakfast Burro
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Almost too pretty to drink

PfmGf0gWa2KHt8-P6xk9OQ.text: My friend and I showed up at 1/4 till close and the place was packed with a line of 4-5 people....great sign.   I had the chicken pesto crepe that was beautiful and tasty! The basil pesto had some original flavor to it that I would guess was some curry. Whatever it was it worked! The serving was bigger than I've experienced and came with a small side salad.   My friend had the vegetarian dish with roasted beets, carrots and who knows what. Very good!  The service and decor were spot on! Casual but comfortable and clean.   I enjoyed the free maya tea with your first check in and it was delish as well.   Great job Crepe Bar! I'll be back.

emuNrndqMz83nEHrpbpc2g.text: Small but mighty, Crepe Bar still seems to dazzle me. It takes almost forever to decide which crepe? Sweet or savory, the crepes always are delicious. I do suggest getting there early, because it is very busy. But it is worth the wait!

Rx1KYRJnmXdE6OEsTdqV7g.text: Highly recommend! Lots of great, out of the box menu options and traditional crepes for the less adventurous.

oI3r0nKckL7hf-sHARaypA.text: Been meaning to try this place out since I moved to Tempe (like, what, over 8 years ago now? I literally live 5min away, I'm so bad lol! Not that I'm saying it's been here for 8yrs, just that I've been in this area for that long, seesh, don't review at 1:30am folks) and after meeting up with Joyce W., Brett B., and Linh L. for the Lunch Bunch, it could not have come at the perfect time!  Honestly, all the feelings about this place is all in Brett B. and Joyce W. reviews. This place is AH-MAY-ZING! Cody was such an awesome server, I enjoyed the Chicken Basil Crepe (savory) and the Lemon Crepe (sweet & sour - which I love these combos!) and a free Maya Tea (iced) with my first check-in! We all shared what was on our plates and everything was delicious - from the Salted Radishes with the Cultured Butter all the way to the Homemade Chocolate that you swirl up in their own homemade Caramel Sauce!  Good food, good friends, crisp and refreshing atmosphere - inside and out - it made my Friday brighter, and I went home with a full stomach and rosy cheeks from all the laughter and good times I had with the group and the Crepe Bar staff (they rock)!  Definitely coming back here to try the rest of the menu out, cannot wait till that next paycheck rolls in!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The sweet and sour Lemon Crepe that cleansed my palette to enjoy the rest of the dishes!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The delicious and savory Chicken Basil Crepe!

E_Bl0i0tYbiGni5mCOZ8hQ.text: Came for mother's day lunch after reading about this place online and wow wow wow! Amazing attentive service, hip/pleasing atmosphere, and phenomenal food! My parents and I ordered a mix of savory and sweet crepes to try and we loved every single one. For myself I ordered the chicken tahini crepe and it was such a beautiful blend of flavors and textures. The chicken was well marinated and moist, and all the flavors blended perfectly. We were well attended to from the host, to the server, and even the bus boy. Everyone was friendly and smiling, even on a busy holiday. I will happily return here again to try some more crepes and I can't wait to show off this find to my friends.

8b5Yzi9qnVThLEWoALBrRA.text: I took my kids here for breakfast and our food was great!  We had them make a Nutella and banana crepe.  They loved it even though it was "fancy".  I had their breakfast burrito crepe and it was savory and filling.  Highly recommend this place!

GTsENws0ZTmpYPIfOiWDFg.text: My Parents and I ventured a few miles to arrive at Crepe Bar about 45 minutes before closing time. The line was relatively short but the place was packed. Even so, when we were up to order the staff helped us make the right choices.  Boy were they right.   Menthol and hazelnut brownie- wow Free granola while we waited for food- tasty  Coffee- some of the best around, honestly Smoked turkey crepe- just fantastic   The staff is on top of things, is friendly, and knows their menu well. The food is incredible. The prices are low. Very low. And the ambiance is good enough. Styled well, (read "hip") and is cozy.   Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delish

mTqJP2xOQxJlvaVWvrVjBQ.text: This place was very cute and cozy. I walked in and it was relatively empty, however by the time I got my food there was a line forming toward the door. I unfortunately felt a bit rushed to finish my food fast so that people could have my table.  I ordered a Nutella crepe in hopes that I could add strawberries. The lady informed me that they couldn't add the berries. Grrrr. Not a big deal but I just couldn't understand why I couldn't at least have the berries on the side or something.... I also ordered an iced latte and they served me a hot one. Also wasn't a big deal because I did enjoy the floral design they created with the latte foam.    The atmosphere and food were definitely good. A place I'll want to try again eventually.

f21_oH8Lpgwy-QPeMI2HXg.text: I like the hipster vibe of this place. The staff is super friendly and welcoming. I was with my son, his girlfriend and my daughter. We had the First Time, the Second Time, and the chorizo one. All were fantastic. The coffee was great too and I want to go back to try more of the crepes!

kbvm8rYYrK6WDm0Epbg3Gg.text: This place is great. It reminds me of Russia,because Russians eat crepes all the time:) It can get very busy,so come closer to 1 p.m.

YJCzR_ROKwzzHINtlgotnA.text: Besides many Crepe dishes I love, I fell in love with Egg up toast!  One of my favorite neiborhood gems since it opened.  Now the place goes under expansion for the next few weeks, I'm excited and being patient for re-opening. Can't wait!

hp2fW6K5Hi0-cyHeZmqMZQ.text: Delicious!! This is a must try if you're in the neighborhood. I highly recommend. Both great sweet and savory options. Yummy!

QshRYCRs32PRzPh_AqqEBQ.text: Just had a take out order of the paprika chicken crepe and one of the burritos. Seriously so good. Just genuinely nice people and yummy yummy food. It's a little hidden gem. The quality in taste of their food is awesome. Nothing tastes generic it's all so delicious and I can't wait to try more. You won't be disappointed if you come here.

VdOYs7XhkUX_uBkDXyf_PQ.text: This is a quaint little place with DELICIOUS food. There's not much seating so it can be difficult to find a spot on weekends but it is still undeniably charming. I love the nutella and banana crepe so much I sometimes dream about it. There's another really delicious breakfast burrito crepe. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I have taken all my friends here and they all love it as much as I do. Highly recommend!

GaMoft9vZTUNAiNleYTsDw.text: Great food and cool vibe in this place. I went to the re-opening where they expanded the place and it is a cool low key type of place. You order the food at the counter and the waiters deliver it to your table. I ordered the octopus tacos that were so good I order some to go. The crepe is a thin tortilla like base with humus spread topped with chorizo, octopus & herbs. The octopus was so tender and the flavor of the chorizo blends well with it. I am definitely going back to try other crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crepe served seasonally. Chorizo, octopus, humus spread and herbs. Get it while it&#39;s being served for a short time only.

3ecdYIEwLEG_bqm4lM5Ehg.text: Over a thirty minute wait, no misters, and very very limited seating? Also can't call ahead orders?   No lol. Not worth it for okay food. Exclusivity chic is lost on this place.

np4tL-V1fbd5FZOgNDMIfA.text: Such a charming spot with interesting lighting..nothing you would expect to see in a random strip mall. I would totally love to steal the cooks from here and pay them to make me savory crepes and baked goods on the daily. The crepes melt in your mouth!   Just went for the 2nd time this morning, party of 4. The server was extremely attentive and even brought us two free samples on the house..porridge bites and brownie bites!   If you live within an hour and a half radius...you MUST try.   Think they just found themselves a new regular!

Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dirty Chai

fnHTzASgkVMsJHlDkvbeOA.text: Amazing! The chorizo burrito is out of this world!

NF_lIIZg4mvTsfQZVWHUrA.text: Looking for something different and lighter than our usual brunch fare, my husband and I checked out the Crepe Bar. I'm not sure why this place has more than 3 stars except, perhaps, for the concept, or what it once may have been as a food truck. Right off the bat I had a few problems with this place. 1) We had never eaten there and had to figure out the protocol. Since there were no menus by the door, only at the register, ordering was a slow process. We felt rushed and pressured to make a decision quickly. Not ideal. 2) It is overpriced for a seat yourself "restaurant" and had insufficient seating with no organized area or mechanism to wait w/o standing over other diners. They should decide if they're fast food or conventional dining, then price and plan accordingly. 3) Cafeteria-style, grab your own utensils, but no spoons or sugar packets for coffee, which left people to grab the sugar cubes with their hands. Yuck. Food: I had the chocolate crepes, which were mostly flavorless (chocolate only in color), filled with a lengthwise slice of banana on a barely there bed of whipped cream, topped with the rest of the banana, one sliced strawberry, and a drizzle of caramel. The presentation was nice, but it was very dry. My husband had the burrito crepe, which he seemed to enjoy. We shared the tiniest side of potatoes...I'm sorry, 3 dollars for 1/2 a potato (literally) with thousand island-like dressing - come on. Add 2 mimosas and 2 coffees and we were $50 poorer and feeling just, meh. All that said, in balance I probably would have given them three stars - we've had better and we've certainly had worse. That is, until a couple came into the restaurant with their dog. I asked the hostess about their policy with respect to pets, and she confirmed that, excepting service animals, dogs were not allowed in the restaurant, which would be according to Maricopa County health code. She said the couple came in to place their order, and would be sitting outside on the "patio" afterwards. No problem, until they didn't, and instead went to the other side of the restaurant and took a table. I went up the counter and asked to speak to a manager, who refused to come out of the back room. I pointed out the health code (maricopa.gov/DocumentCen...) to the barista (the poor guy who was left to deal with the now incensed customer) and he graciously went over to speak to the guy. We were advised the couple was "affiliated" with the restaurant, and that the dog was a service animal. Right. Fine. Whatever. But even service dogs are not allowed to sit on the furniture and/or eat from non-disposable dishes. When I shared that information with him, he went back over to the couple and asked them to remove the dog from the seat. He returned to our table and advised us that they would comply, so I asked him to turn around so that he could see that they did not. I recognize that this is a very dog friendly area, and that's why there is a clause in the health code to provide dog-friendly patios if that is a restaurant's preference. Pets should not be in restaurants, unless they are working. Period. People have allergies or aversions, and should not have to share their eating space with someone else's pet. Further, people who characterize their pets as service animals for their own selfish purposes, do ACTUAL service animals a HUGE DISSERVICE. And, the fact that the management did nothing, placing the desire of their friend over the health of their other customers was disrespectful and bad business. That they don't care about violating the health code also makes me wonder where else they cut corners.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dog on seat in restaurant violates the health code (https://www.maricopa.gov/DocumentCenter/View/5895/Animals-in-Food-Establishments-PDF)

_tagdiFQ98SeCWQM3RGypQ.text: Arguably my favorite place to go for delicious, and inventive crepes in Arizona. The owner, Chef Jeff, is one talented and happy host. His creations are inspired by seasonal ingredients from local farms. It doesn't matter if you are a first time customer or one of their regulars, Chef Jeff and his staff will always make you feel welcome. My all time favorite sweet crepe from here is The Second Time. My favorite savory choice is the Chilaquiles. Enjoy!

cceDLs6DZRIkhf6DJjusxA.text: Came Sunday morning, just after they opened and wow do they get packed!!!!!  First time there. We got 2 and shared, me and the boo thang. We had the Grand Prix crepe and the Spanish sausage crepe- I can't remember the name, it wasn't the chorizo one tho. But this one was our FAVORITE!!! omg yummm. Really tasty and flavorful!  We also had the cold brew espresso drink- it was ok, we needed to add 2 sugar cubes and some half and half because it was too much coffee ($6).   It came out to $34 for each of us, just a little pricey, but good. I will definitely go back.

tK14OuRxQYIyizONIH3Bag.text: Oooo I love this place! Food portion was huge and it was delicious! The staff was very nice. Nice clean bathrooms. They have a large selection of breakfast items. They also have vegan options.   I got the chorizo crepe, very filling, in fact I couldn't finish it and saved it for a snack later.  It was creamy and cheesy inside. Filled with chorizo, eggs, jack cheese, and other fillings all wrapped in a crepe. Delicious!

4a8SpCsxMSkf1Uo9frsUSA.text: High quality ingredients, skillfully prepared. Had a delicious crepe with apples, figs and pepitas that was fantastic. Spouse had a lemon curd one that was perfection. Delicious pork belly on the side melted in our mouths and made a great counterpoint to the sweet. Excellently balanced flavors all around.

15M_B2LsvgCYpCWbaTPT_g.text: Amazing place for Crepes. I got the Jamaican jerk crepe with pork sausage. The sausage was amazing, nice flavors and not too salty and went really well with everything else the crepe had. My wife has a dairy allergy but had no problems finding many options. They have a chick pea flour option for the crepe for dairy allergies/vegan option and it tasted great, crispy!! The ambience is chic, and the staff is very friendly and cheerful too. Wish we stayed close to this area, we would be regulars for sure

kxSYbOwu6z1umVzb6Dr2Ow.text: I've thought for several years I should try this place.   I pass by there weekly.  I finally did, and have no regrets!  I chose the blintz.  It was perfect, not too sweet and flavorful with a great texture.  Its noisy, like all the industrial designed places are, but it's small, so that helps.  I could tell many people are returning customers,  comfortable with the arrangement of ordering and seating.   There is no cushioning on the chairs!  There are a few tables outside.  The coffee is decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. About a fourth of a Blintz and mocha latte with a bit of granola to munch while I waited.   The Blintz is perfect, just sweet enough

A4-CnIPiC27EZjEdAccgpg.text: My friend and I stayed at an Airbnb literally just two streets down from this place and we ended up coming here two days in a row! The first time I got the banana Nutella crepe and the second time I got the chorizo crepe, I also got lattes whilst I was here. I cannot remember the initial latte I ordered but I remember them getting it confused with chai about three times and I actually think I got served a chai tea latte instead of what I requested. I like chai so I didn't particularly mind but my only complaint about the chai was that at the bottom of the latte, during my final sip of it, there was so much cinnamon I felt like I did the cinnamon challenge all over again. If they chai wasn't gonna wake me up, that definitely did. The second time I ordered the chorizo crepe and oh my goodness, so good. I would definitely come back!

V5q7W0xvH_--Z7Y52KWuqQ.text: The crepes were tasty, and would rank high in the stars category; however, the price range per plate (crepes were one per order for the ones we got) at $7 to $9, with no additional sides included in the price, I felt it wasn't a great deal for the money. I did enjoy the Cidermosa from Cider Corps and although the place is small, the atmosphere was cute.

z4_onQj6R-grJroJEIffbQ.text: Very creative crepes with a lot of non traditional crepe ingredients and choices. High quality ingredients, complex flavors. 5/5 taste and quality, portions are Tiny. Left hungry, but would definitely go back

HbwfSYKfwVeOXOSkABuxOA.text: My favorite place! I try to make it hear at least once a week! I recommend the Grand Prix and the business!! Owner is super rad as well!

3ht4o2IANtHNh8ZzajuQlw.text: The coffee is ok but the presentation is awesome, I had the Grand Prix the pork belly is crispy on the outside oh so tender in the inside it's awesome never had it cook so good like this. The fried goat cheese balls is ok the chicharones is good the staff is friendly and was apologetic for the brief wait we had to endure, it was well worth the wait trust me .  I can't say anything else about the pork belly it's awesome best one I had. This coming from a Filipino from California born in the Philippine and traveled with us navy it is goood very gooood

n4r6EYjVEvt-_eFrZTSgCQ.text: Expect to wait and stand in line for brunch. They only have one cashier so it takes a while to order and receive your food.   Very hipster, artsy feel to it. Serve your own water and coffee at a beverage station near the coffee bar. Food was ok but not the best crepes I've ever had and nothing stood out as fabulous. They do have a unique menu but there just weren't a ton of items that I was dying to try.   Be aware they close at 2pm on Sundays.
