z5K2zqX4Yk-QUMn5a_IfiA.text: Post race breakfast day 1. I was in the area after running RNR AZ Day 1, I wanted to try some of my bookmarked place. Arriving around 10:30am on Saturday, they were busy but found some tables.  You order first then find a table. I don't like the fact they want to tip at the time of order but I didn't have cash with me to tip later. Very clean and casual ambiance inside. Two bathrooms, unisex, very clean as well. I know as I used both during my short visit.  Service was very friendly. They brought some sort of chips while waiting. I ordered Papa-K crepes for my breakfast simply because it was most reviewed dish. I really liked a little salt they put on the side. Not sure what kind salt it was, I tasted just salt by itself and thought it was good one.  Crepe was good but it didn't have that wow factor to it. Perhaps I expected too much based on really good reviews.   It was a quite out of my way to get here, not sure if I would return but if I were in the area, would consider coming back. Really friendly service here, perhaps my tastebuds were off for that moment.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa-K crepes

gbyFGneoi7YkBK7w-zCJVg.text: Crepe Bar is easily one of the best places in South Tempe, if not all of Arizona to eat. You really can't go wrong with any item on the menu, whether you're craving something savory or sweet. While you wait for your order, they serve their addictive granola and sometimes other snacks such as crispy pork rinds/cracklings. Outstanding coffee and tea options, including some from Heart Roasters and Provision.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crêpe chilaquiles

m3txU2kQ4B_3bbrz73LP0Q.text: Right now, I am so jealous of Tempe folks and other Eastsiders for having access to the Crepe Bar. I had one of the most delectable meals this morning.  Crepe Bar sports a cool and bohemian decor. Local artists' work are curated in their walls. Sign up to follow them on Instagram (the Crepe Bar) to find out when they have opening receptions.  Back to the artfully crafted meal, after checking out recommendations from my fellow Yelpers, I decided on the Papa K and the Sugar to satisfy my sweet tooth.  As I waited, they brought out a bowl of complimentary homemade granola, rich with dried fruit, grains, cereal, pistachios and almonds with honey. It was moist and was satisfyingly chewy and crunchy!  Now for the spiel on the Papa K. This beautifully designed plate arrived with a crepe wedge that had some crunch on the edge and crepe soft on the inside. They also dress it with a cheese crisp on the edge. Just how do they do that? The filling was divine, eggs, tasty ham and gooey cheese. Each bite flirted on almost being too salty but was perfect when paired with the lightly dressed greens with vinaigrette and caramelized onions. If you really crave salt, the have a spot of dealt salt and pepper at the edge of the plate. I have been forever corrupted, for I intend to serve a side salad with greens from now on.   The Sugar was divine. While the savory was mostly soft with a touch of crunch, this dessert crepe was crunchy with a touch of soft. Lightly powdered with a hint of citrus was how this sweet confection was dressed.  Congratulations to chef and owner, Jeff and the Crepe Bar team for delivering an AMAZINGLY meal. If you live on the east side, please note how to envious this Westsider is of you. Tip: If you don't want to fight the crowds, weekday mornings at 7 is a perfect time to dine.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Featuring local artists
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crepe with powdered sugar
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K

PEJW6jcts0xJgK9QWZCNaA.text: A couple of years later and I'm finally back here! I suggested this as a breakfast option with some friends who both live in Tempe but have never been here. Thankfully, they got here before me and were able to get in the long line to order. It was busy but didn't seem to take that long to move through the line and place our orders. We ordered a variety of food; one got the brioche toast, another got the eggs and poached fruit, and I ordered the vanilla bean crepe. We also ordered tea (earl grey and mint) and the Moroccan spiced latte).  After we paid, we found a table in the corner and grabbed another chair from a table that wasn't using it. I love the remodel, they expanded the restaurant which allowed for twice as much seating. There was even a table outside, which was cute. Despite the amount of people ordering and in the place, our orders didn't seem to take too long. The teas came out very quick of course but the latte did take time. My friends and I enjoyed our dishes; I absolutely loved mine and how it was caramelized to give it a marshmallowy flavor. Service was good and the atmosphere was fun yet intimate enough for our conversation. My friends gave this place positive feedback.   Yay crepe bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean: marinated strawberries, salted caramel, pistachio. Delicious!

boxgHoc8ekbEqyDCYNWr5w.text: Why does it have to end?   I'm always excited to come here because I know exactly what to expect: a carefully constructed combination of spice, balance, texture, and color. I've never been disappointed and today is no exception.   I'd like to compliment the expansion! The extended space is much appreciated since so many people demand this deliciousness.   The menu changes with ingredient availability. Today I tried a savory crisp crepe with local burrata cheese, pesto, a chutney, and mixed greens. Everything is painstakingly dressed to let the textures and flavors sing.   I hate that each bite means less food left on the plate.   The complimentary granola is a great touch. I'm not a coffee person and am pleased with their Earl Grey blend!   Love love love the crepe bar! Their hours are limited so plan ahead- you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Earl Grey t
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burrata and crepe! Could this day get any better?!

3gGm4sC5Vvvj5YX8VP4veA.text: This place is wonderful.  When my husband and I showed up today for brunch they were in the middle of rush hour. We should have known better, as it is Sunday, but we had no idea how popular this place was. For very good reason too! There was no available seating when we ordered our food, so one of the employees assessed the area and kindly asked a table if they could make some room for other customers.   We ordered some drinks, a latte and a quad espresso. The latte was one of the best I have had in Phoenix. The espresso was rather bitter and sour/acidic, which wasn't exactly what we were used to. We asked the same employee about it, which we were slightly hesitant to do seeing as though they were so busy. He was incredibly accommodating, offering to make a double espresso to see if that better suited our taste. He also gave us a cup of coffee to try in addition -- and left us with a to-go coffee to enjoy on the road. We did enjoy the taste of the coffee over the espresso, but that is likely due to our taste buds rather than the skill of their barista, who was also very kind.   Overall, the coffee was good, the food was amazing, and the service was the best I have experienced in a very long while. We are bummed to be moving away from Arizona and we wish we could bring this place with us! We'll definitely recommend this place to our pals and drop in during future travels.

QVSjL5ulROqtc_AoztQ8Cw.text: AMAZING!!!!! No other crepes can beat these! The service is great. I just wish it was open longer

81Je9VYgB4vDzPjwC_LXdw.text: We had read about this restaurant and had wanted to check it out for a while.  Overall the food had good flavor and was not expensive we got three crepes for $17 plus tip.  It wasn't quick but we didn't mind the wait.  The flavors were really tasty.  It definitely should not be a place where you go if you're really hungry.  Definitely worth checking out especially if you'd like to change up your routine.

KEKR3Q1sUkF7_WP-fGlXHQ.text: Crepe Bar is fantastic! Great people, great food, great service AND world-class coffee to boot.  My sister and I had the breakfast burro and the smoked turkey and both were delicious savory crepes. We also had complimentary little snacks and desert which were very well done. The presentation on the entrees, snacks and coffee were exceptional.  Now to the coffee! The good folks at Crepe Bar have brought some of the best coffee in the world from the Pacific Northwest to our home in the desert! I've had about 4-5 different offerings of Heart Coffee Roasters here and it never disappoints.  Crepe Bar is undoubtedly one of my new favorite places to dine in AZ.

zDql8TirUlqc9yUi4fyE8A.text: The food was okay. We got the breakfast burrito and the egg up. For the price we paid I was expecting something better. The staff is great tho! oh and the wait is horrible! I thought we would have to eat standing up, fortunately we got a table right before our food was ready.

FNMgeEtNZRI9UYYUA087iQ.text: Awesome place for some of the best crepes I've ever had... Get the breakfast burrito crepe. Classic Mom&Pop shop. And a "welcome home" type of service.

4irMDj4Xpg3H9yPJMfaFVw.text: This place is amazing everything was great I went there 4 times and I wish I can go there every 5 sec. I keep choosing the chicken pesto and the "first time" for the dessert. Also the hospitality and the service was sooo great. I know It's a little bet expensive but I think it's worth every penny.

cdCiYFXyAIOHwzIyMj2-zQ.text: You can't not love this place. The crepes are delicious. I always get the Vegetable one with a cappuccino and my mom gets the Papa K with a cappuccino as well. The service is always amazing and the staff is always friendly regardless of how busy they are. Thank you Crepe Bar!!!

7Q2MXy6sQw2w7YKA1xf7RA.text: what a cute place! my crepe was pretty good, I went with the basic nutella and banana and my fiance got the breakfast burrito type crepe. They were really good but we did wait a pretty long time for it.

oyvWrWduvnSq2KGFNJR99A.text: Unexpected deliciousness in an unassuming strip mall. Keeping it simple with the menu, Crepe Bar delivers in spades for breakfast and dessert. The cool, hip vibe is reminiscent of something out of San Francisco or Seattle, but with a staff that is both personable and efficient, I'd readily choose Crepe Bar any day of the week. This is a definite must for anyone in the Phoenix area -- or in my case, from DC.

agy7VkNtLRWfzc9gHdEsfg.text: This place was amazing!!!  im a big eater tho and could have eaten 10 crepes.  They were amazing and it was a cool place to hang out and enjoy some good food.

J5eAKuu4_zoUevYLkLq4pg.text: Such a cool (and delicious) place! I went here on a weekday morning and it was surprisingly busy. I got the vanilla bean crepe, and it was really good. The only thing I would change is the portion sizes. I think they put a lot of presentation into the dish and not enough food. But, they gave us granola when we were waiting and a lemon bar when we were talking after we ate. That really made up for the small portion. Anyway, really good place. I will definitely return.

vipZ6tA0ZmBKGY-UpTR0zA.text: One of my most favorite places! The things Jeff and his staff create with local ingredients are out of this world. Truly an incredible foodie experience!

oKbyX5G18k_5g6GEN5Wkmw.text: Damn I wanted to love this place!  The interior was beguiling and the staff friendly, but the eat and drink was only okay on my first visit.  The much raved about breakfast burrito just didn't do it for me (it was pretty to look at, but the flavor was monotone, the amount of cheese overwhelming and only half melted in a layer on the bottom of the lukewarm crepe instead of mixed in with the eggs), and the drip coffee was lighter than I personally prefer.  I'll definitely be back to try their sweet selections and cold brew, though.  Crepe Bar is a really cute spot and a good addition to the area.

NRwWKau3vFnxGpcSjtJ4Uw.text: Super friendly staff.. They are only open during lunch hours and they do take credit cards. I've had the breakfast burro and it's very tasty. The dessert there is just great. They don't allow to-go orders but for good reason.. the dishes are prepared beautifully and it's worth the time to sit down and eat there.

J3QDrc6mXbGZ-0Ia9XSQWA.text: This place is great! The most delicious coffee and crepes. I got the breakfast burro and it was amazing. The atmosphere is hip and funky. Totally recommend this place!

ssFTVNGtLpOERJO8_rx-gA.text: Second time at crepe bar. Not only was it delicious, but instead of glaring at my friend and I for spending hours there talking away, they gave us treats to help us keep up our strength. They really know how to treat people here.

c_saOEYaZ3Vd0P2LNMezlg.text: I wish I lived closer, but then again it's probably good for my bank account that I don't. I could easily make this my routine breakfast joint. I had a buckwheat veggie crepe and my fiancee had the pork belly one (she won). Complete random find that turned into a wonderful experience. Thanks!

gBq5RqaPzuvHNQdvpHoOAQ.text: I love this place, everything was excellent from the tea and coffee to the savory crepes and the sweet crepes.   Be prepared for a bit of a wait as it gets busy and everything is freshly prepared.  Don't let that put you off though,  sit back and enjoy your coffee, the crepes are well worth the wait.

GaoCDzqWDaw34ZYhbLNoKg.text: I know, this place gets so much foodie love I'm probably breaking laws to give it three stars, but...  We arrived on a Sunday morning in December. It was busy. There was not a seat to be found inside or out. Nor is there a waiting area, so get over feeling bad about hovering over someone. And there isn't a wait list, so yes, you might have to slide into a seat before someone fully vacates it. Aaaannnd there seems to be some etiquette lacking--people sitting at tables waiting for to-go orders, people camping out for hours (not really the place to do that, you selfish six top). What can I say? I like some rules, or someone in charge at the restaurant who keeps things moving along.  We waited 40 minutes for our food. I took a phonecall outside and while I was on the phone, a server walked up and asked where I was sitting. She then delivered the dessert crepe to my husband. Starving, I sat down and started in. Then someone else reappeared to tell me I was EATING SOMEONE ELSE"S FOOD. I was mortified. They brought it to me! She took it away.  10 min later our food appeared. I took a bite. It was pure bliss. I mean, just incredible. Really gourmet taste, beautifully plated. 5 star food, but I give 1 for service (slow and bad) and atmosphere (I should not have to fight for a damn table). We won't be back--the food wasn't worth the hassle and embarrassment.

5DiOIeeMBtjacbC6hiPAqg.text: Nice little place with a hipster vibe.  I've never had a crepe before but I was expecting something different.  Menu was a little complicated and wait was long to order and get our food.  They were nice about it and gave us free coffee.

2um6B-pbDdr4xHnqCowUXw.text: My husband and I came here because I was, with my whole being... craving some damn crepes. We drove here all the way from Queen Creek and it was COMPLETELY WORTH THE DRIVE! I wanted something sweet and something salty, but didn't' want to look like an insane cow for ordering both types, so I convinced my sweet husband into ordering the sweet crepe I was eyeing while I ordered the savory.  He ordered the strawberry creme and I ordered the chicken crepe. To make this simple, we didn't order enough.   The only reason I took one star away is although the employees were kind, they were very unorganized and there wasn't enough seating. The told us that they would find a seat, and so we didn't try to hawk our own table, we waited. A young couple came after us and while one ordered the other stood right next to the table that the server had told us they would clear for as soon as they had gone, so when they left, the young girl sat on the chairs and hailed someone else to clean the table for them. The server looked at us and shrugged and told us he would find another seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. I look happy, I was happier after I started eating.

RkNsBAvcZKwVlcVeCjnYmQ.text: If I can give this restaurant a 10 star, I would. By far, this place serves the best breakfast I've ever had. I had a iced tea for drinks and burritos for breakfast. Instead of using tortillas, they use crepes to wrap it.  O M G! It was absolutely delicious. All 3 of us cleaned our plates and I couldn't be happier to start off my  weekend here. I will definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

j5O71RSdGQfgeePfOOAoCg.text: I was debating between 4 and 5 stars because of the long wait but then I reminded myself great things are worth waiting for !   They have very limited seating and a huge crowd.  We woke up pretty early on a Sunday and I wasn't expecting it to be so packed. So it's the kind of restaurant where you order and pay first then a serve brings you be food.   It has a very hipster feel and if you check in on yelp they give you a free coffee or tea. We got the pomegranate green tea, loved it. The tea wasn't watery as most ice teas are. I  have yet to try the coffee apparently it's all European.   We got the savory breakfast burrito and papa k with scrambled eggs. The crepes were amazing !!!   Breakfast burrito- I thought the breakfast burrito was a bit overwhelming because of all the avocado but my boyfriend who is a big fan of avocado loved it, the chipotle sauce perfectly complimented the flavors. He felt that the avocado balanced the crepe very well resulting in it not being too overwhelming. So I guess this one is open to your own opinion.  Papa k - inside was ham, pepper jack, scrambled eggs, cheese, and mushroom ragout. My first bite was the sides where they crisped up the cheese. Explosion of flavor in your mouth. It was satisfying from beginning to end. Must try !   In past experience savory crepes are always good at the beginning and overwhelming at the end.  Did not feel that here ! I finished every single bite.   Overall a must try, long wait but your stomach will thank you after.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa k

mbsz2Y413r_zKagfKujqNQ.text: This is my family and I's favorite place to eat breakfast and to also get crepes. They have a very unique menu and the food and service is ALWAYS amazing. You can tell the people who own and work here love what they do because there is so much thought and little details in everything, even the granola is amazing. I go sometime just to buy the honey and homemade granola. The burro is hands down my favorite crepe to get her.

-Ye0Y6QHnm6NvOEl6RQeNA.text: I give two stars for great customer service, which does go a long way. However, this was the worst meal I've had in a long time and I paid $16 for it. I ordered the morracan latte which was okay and very pretty although a little too sweet for me. The cast iron skillet toast was literally soaking in olive oil (and I love olive oil) but it wasn't edible. I also got the breakfast burrito crepe which was so soggy and had smelled really bad. I tried two bites and couldn't go any further. I'm so sorry that I didn't like this place. I love crepes and had high hopes. I will give it another shot one day and try a sweet crepe instead. I'm still hopeful.

Y82y50gEuUdiu3_OHkXagA.text: I've been coming here for years and have been eating Jeff's food since the Truckin Good Food days at the Ahwatukee farmer's market. I miss the simple food truck crepes served in paper cones. I especially miss the duck fat fries. Regardless, I'm happy to see the restaurant doing so well. The food is consistently outstanding and the staff is always friendly. They usually offer a complimentary small bite to eat before your main meal comes out, which is appreciated. This is also one of the best places in town to get coffee as they carry beans from Heart roasters. The only downside is that can get crowded. Since they expanded a few months ago, that's not as big of a problem.

BdC_JoJwTiBxrmq1xE9hIg.text: I do not understand the hype about this place. Went in waited in a long line and ordered 2 crepes and a coffee. It took us ~40 minute to get our crepes, meanwhile I saw 2 sets of people who ordered after us get their crepes before us. When our crepes did arrive, the portions were seemingly small for paying about $14 for one crepe that doesn't even come with a side. There a better and cheaper places in the valey for a crepe, but if you want to look trendy this is the place for you.

Bhy6sN_EwEL9k-4bpf_XWg.text: I ordered PICK ME UP crepe this afternoon.  After waiting for 25mins (what?) , that STUFF finally came. It looked pretty awful, you will never want to order it again. It looked like a stained dumpling. What's worse, it is totally cold. And I don't even want to mention how it tasted. I have no idea why they deserve 4.5stars on yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. PICK ME UP, stay away from this!

az2HWwrtw9_hdZT0zbNLwg.text: I will say this, the place won me over. When we first arrived, I was put out by the complicated & difficult to understand menu. There were lots of terms I've never heard of before (like pork jowl), so it took me a while to figure out what to order. I ended up going with the smoky. And, while the coffee was quick to be made, the only sweetener they had was this really weird stuff in a green package. But after about 10 minutes, the food arrived and then I could see why the place got such good reviews, the food was excellent! And the staff was very friendly!  Pros: *  excellent food *  very friendly staff *  an amazingly little surprised treat (see picture) *  coffee refills ARE free, even though that's not obvious  Cons *  pricey, this place is at least $$, if not $$$ *  bad sweetener for the coffee *  confusing menu *  you pay for your good & tip BEFORE you can evaluate how the service is, so, here's a tip, pick 0%tip when offering & leave the top in cash at the table  Overall, the most important part of any restaurant is the tastiness of food, followed by the service you get, and in those 2 categories, this place Rocs the Casbah!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tasty surprise treat at the end of your meal! In REAL 50ml breakers! #GeeksRock

9iFpODV_wngBAN_G3lDWpQ.text: Nice people and good food  This is a hipster-crepe paradise.  Really nice, young staff working.  Food is fresh-tasting and not overpowering.  And overall experience was good.  When you enter, you seat yourself and someone visits to let you know to order at the register. Quick process, though the orientation could have been a bit smoother with a sign up front.  We also struggled to find a table big enough for four-- couple two-tops available in different areas, so we went with a three-top and used a lap.  You also get some snack granola that we liked.  We had the Breakfast Buro, Smokey, Curd, and Vanilla Crepe.  Smokey was the best of the bunch. Habenero sauce I added to the Buro added heat without flavor. The Vanilla crepe had very little vanilla or chocolate (add-on) flavor, but was still worthy overall.  Again, food was good, if unremarkable.  People were super pleasant.  It's one of those places that is really close to fan-worthy, but is one step away.  Just can't find a way to say four stars or higher.

3Ns9i4Exx6bTIe3WftBYug.text: This is my favorite place for coffee and breakfast/lunch. Fresh. Original. Amazing chef and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Noble toast egg up

6veriQU93QiTwu4NJnzv1g.text: This place is a little gem of a neighborhood spot. This place was a nice way to end our house hunting trip. The staff is super nice and they gave us samples of their treats as we were waiting for our food. They have free WiFi and are fine with you hanging out for a couple of hours as we did.  I was looking for something light as I had too much ice cream the night before and was feeling sorta quesy. I opted for the vegetable curry crepe which turned out to be a tasty crepe full of beets and parsnips with a slight hint of curry. The vegetables were tender but not overcooked. The crepe came with a garnish of some turnip pickle (absolutely fantastic) and a parmesan cheese crisp. The portion size of the crepe was perfect for lunch and my stomach felt miles better after lunch. My husband had the chicken pesto crepe which he enjoyed.  For dessert we had the popular vanilla custard crepe with strawberries. The star of this dish was the crepe itself whose flavor and texture really came through. Many crepes are all about the filling, and this one had a delicious vanilla custard but it wasn't overly sweet. It was almost like a whipped cream.  While we were waiting for our savory crepes, the kitchen sent out a sample of their sage teacake with a fruit compote. The flavor of the sage really came through and was scrumptious. While waiting for dessert, the kitchen sent out samples of their homemade snickerdoodles with little milk tins.  Overall, this place is warm and inviting, The staff makes you feel at home and like you are a welcomed customer. This is rare these days. The only drawback to this restaurant is the bathroom is in the kitchen area so you have to be escorted there.

TOrQ47_GEzt1ur2zX0O59g.text: I'll save you guys a long review and keep it short and to the point:  1. Decent number of crepe options to choose from.  2. Delicious food 3. Nice fresh coffee 4. Smaller portion sizes (didn't fill me up - I had the Papa K) 5. Pricey for the portion sizes  May come back every once in a while. Not looking to becoming a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cappuccino

h7jxc1CN_pk_up0oTvJTbA.text: I've never had a bad experience here. The food is great, and the service is amazing. Everyone is super friendly and this is easily one of our favorite breakfast spots. The Moroccan latte is perfect every time and they have fresh house made granola in to go packages as well. Great place.

AwnrB0dql756g9xHvd0s4A.text: Good crepes, just a tad overpriced for one. I loved the vanilla latte. My girlfriend got a tea, but I wish they would have granulated sugar and not sugar clump rocks and simple syrup

XbwP7M03VpRhPh--KB-8hw.text: Yet another place my review is horribly out of date for.  The Crepe Bar is such a fantastic place to go for breakfast ( I should really go for lunch ).  They are small ( but expanding! ) so sometimes it gets a bit crazy there, but it's definitely a friendly neighborhood spot that you just kinda flow with the wait times. They are the farthest thing from a fast food restaurant and the pride they take in what they do is very welcome. Their entire staff are incredibly nice and the few times I have had an issue ( I order the burrito without bacon, I know crazy! ) they have been accommodating and extremely nice. If you ever have an issue do yourself a favor and just say something. They go out of their way to make you happy in my experience. They also bring out cool gastronomic treats for you to try while you wait for your food.  I can safely say most of them I have never even seen before, but are always delicious. I am a creature of habit so I stick with the Breakfast Burrito no Bacon when I go for breakfast. They have changed it up a few times over the years and it just gets better and better. It one of my top things to have for breakfast in the valley. Their coffee is always exceptional., The expresso drinks take a bit of time when they get slammed.  They really take pride in their production, but it is very much worth it if that is your thing. If you are in a bit of a rush the cold brew coffee is excellent and quite a bit faster.  TRY:  - Breakfast Burrito Crepe - Cold Brew - Expresso Drinks

gLoEfzwZvoh-QBHnzNBrkw.text: Came for the coffee, stayed for the food.   We showed up when they opened and only had to wait a few minutes to order. The whole restaurant and staff have a great vibe that makes you want to come back. We used the yelp check-in for free drip coffee which was so great that we got back in line and ordered a cappuccino and a one and one (shot of espresso and a macchiato). We ordered the fully loaded maple butter crepe and the Papa K...both were delicious.

06r7EaWOEG8sYlvHgPH2JA.text: It is the first time I am going back to this place since the renovation...I was tempted to put 3 stars because of the wait time. The place looks nice, food is still amazing, staff is kind, but waiting 40 minutes in line just to get the order in is not acceptable for me. If you are going to go bigger, please add a cash register (there is still only 1). We were told that this would have people waiting for a table, which is True, but the space could be utilised in a much more efficient way. Basically, I love eating here but I will seriously reconsider my craving when I think of the time I spent waiting.

xTbkEcAZNt4tbvE38baEQA.text: The maple butter crepes are amazing. Decent portions. Everything is a la carte but the sides are inexpensive and the service is extremely friendly! I will come back again.

Fexeo9R0PL-yQrOKgZgZIw.text: I have a confession to make: I don't like crepes.  Now, before you all consider burning me at the stake, check out those five stars and hear me out...   Crepe Bar is one of those places that makes you feel like you're almost not cool enough to go there. The coffee is from Portland, the vegetables are local, and there are ingredients on the menu that even a foodie will have to Google. Yes, there's usually a wait. Yes, it's hip. Is that really such a bad thing?   Plus, the recent remodel has seriously upgraded the space and the atmosphere. It has made dining here even better than ever. Not to mention, there are even more non-crepe options like the incredible lemon curd brioche.  This place obviously cares about what they send out on each plate. They take their craft seriously. If you want to eat so fast that you've barely started to digest by the time you leave, this isn't the place for you. If you want to savor a unique food experience, then come here and have one.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pure Maple Crêpe with Almonds
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Avocado Toast
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farm Vegetable Crêpe

YCgAyY5O8eNfRh_Ws43s2g.text: This was a solid 2 star experience. I say that because the place was too pretentious for me and the food really wasn't all that great. Seriously, its fine if you're in the mood to blow some money. Besides that it's just a typical hipster breakfast hangout. The ingredients seemed from and the staff was great. It just thought it was kinda stuffy.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

UBNakldZ3pWKObUWUK_brA.text: Tried two sweet and a savory crepe with the Mrs when we stopped by, would highly recommend the Chipotle and Ode to the Sundae.  Coffee wasn't too bad either.

iVbcGZtApksRxc5lvcSX2g.text: It is a good place to have unique brunch and dessert:).  I did think I can eat as a meal with crepe! It was good and fresh to me !   And really good and friendly crews !!!  I will go back soon !:)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

hOYpm8cQYFzjduAdUSWqrQ.text: First time visiting, it was awesome.  We had both sweet and savory crepes and they were equally delicious. There was quite a line when we got there, but they all moved as quickly as possible and got through rush like professionals. When they brought the food out it was as beautiful to look at as it was delicious to eat. 4 plates and 2 drinks was $62 dollars...plus tip, so it is a bit spendier than a regular breakfast out; but sometimes you have got to treat yo self 2018.

CbDDRZsM7tbP2tZwm2W7dQ.text: Very creative crepes, both the savory and sweet crepes are bomb. I've tried almost every crepe on the menu and don't have anything negative to say about any item on the menu.

n0xJt5yOhGIxptP_PfrCLA.text: Sooo good! Everything is fresh and the customer service is great. I always come here when I'm craving Nutella crepes.

KA-vGTLLYfsarsXclS0hGA.text: This is my favorite breakfast in the Tempe/Phoenix area. And it's a competitive category. The ambiance is European, minimalist, and still colorful. Treat yourself to a Moroccan Spice latte. You won't regret it. The crepe combinations are creative and superb. The burrito crepe and paprika chicken are our favorites (with a sweet lemon crepe to share). Love supporting small places like this doing incredible work! Thank you, crepe bar! we love you!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

rYkjW7PIi7YdszsNAgeZBw.text: Crepe bar got it perfect on mother's day! Coffee was killer and the food/service was outstanding. You won't be disappointed!

hb1iTXHEtM7fwKk-4b8dhg.text: Best crepe place I've been to ever! Happy people and outstanding food..  Must come back

2mGvCcH8t99Ufg7oCjEvZg.text: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Food is unique and delicious! Been there a few times over the past few years and the service and quality is consistent. Definitely would recommend trying this spot!

E7kV5WkQSb8Y5KcnXpGMJQ.text: Went back, against my will but I'm glad I did. The food only took 20 minutes this time and they set the expectation that it'd be 30 when I ordered.  That's how you under promise.   The line to order took another 15 minutes so there are still issues but the food was excellent this time around.  Both spaces next to the Crepe Bar are empty.  For the life of me I can't understand why they don't expand or move to a space with a kitchen that would allow them to service more people. If I could get my food in 20 minutes from walking in the door I'd be here weekly. As it stands I'm here annually. I know I'm not alone in that.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Andouille sausage crepe

Z2YPl3p-4mcE2lLzthu2aA.text: I am disappointed by the price and the quality they offer. The quality is the same as the crepe place in my university. The crepe in my school costs around $5. I ordered a Vanilla Bean crepe to go and they didn't include eating utensils with it. The price is super expensive, around $8 for that. Savory crepes are even worse. The crepe was alright. I ate the food immediately even though it was to go (to rule out that crepe would taste bad if it is left out long).

a0Ua-YsLS2wWajv0YGHRng.text: Such an unfortunate experience this time around. Met up with a friend for lunch where this was her first time. I raved about how delicious this place is and how it's always busy!   We each ordered the 13 mile vegetarian crepe and I also ordered the butter toast. When I ordered the toast she said they only have marmalade - which to me is fine because it comes with marmalade. It wasn't until I was given the toast that it looked like it was missing the cultured cream. Now I see what was missing! Well...the toast definitely didn't taste as good as it should because it was missing the coolness of the cream.   Prior to receiving the toast we were given a kale bite salad to munch on. This was a lift bite. We were also given fried cauliflower bites.  Looking around the place a customer before received his plate and so we were soon to get ours. After another 15 minutes or so we noticed tray we still have not received our plates. Tables around who came after us received theirs too!! What the hay?! We inquired about our plates and one of the workers told us it was on its way. Another 10 minutes go by and still no plate. My friend went up to the cashier to ask about it again and they said it was on its way. The to-go order of the dessert crepe from my friend came. But still no 13 mile vegetarian crepe!!! Veggies should not be taking this long to cook!!   Almost an hour wait from the time of ordering the server came to our table with 2 to-go boxes! She asked if we would like to eat it here or have it to go. The whole point was to eat it while it's lunch time! Not sure if they confused my friends to go dessert crepe with the rest of the order especially when they brought my toast as a dine in plate. We said we will have a plate. We essentially had to plate the meals ourselves which was kinda weird. The server apologized for the mishap. Unfortunately I ended up only eating half of the crepe and re-boxed it because the whole experience of waiting almost an hour just shut down my appetite.    Also, this place is busy but not busy enough because a line was not forming and it was closer towards closing. A table of 4 behind us (who also came after us) also had 2 orders of the same dang plates! The servers gave away our plates!! No bueno!!   We walked away smelling like we have been the ones cooking in the kitchen all day. I felt bad for my friend because I told her this place was such as awesome place but I don't know if she would agree. What a bummer. Although the food is great the service for this time around definitely lacked. :/ Probably an off day?

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. 13 mi vegetarian played by me from the to go box.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Toast without cream
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kale bites

X3Knj-2MCH09zQaDlCJAIw.text: My first time here and someone was telling me about a remodel to this place. I was craving some good crepes and followed the Yelp trail to this place. From the outside, it looked like a small shop (it's located in a mini business-park esque area). When you walk in though, you're immediately taken aback by the tasteful decor and atmosphere. It's almost hipster-ish. Felt like a Portland coffee shop.   I thought it would be packed on a Sunday morning, but there were a few free tables luckily! This is one of those spots where you order first and they'll bring your food to you at the table. The menu is very comprehensive and has some very unique and innovative approaches to both sweet and savory crepes. I ordered the Ode to my Sundae and loved it!   Also- get the Moroccan latte. It's a combination of spicy and sweet and I almost bought a second one. Will definitely be back next time I'm around.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Moroccan latte- spicy and sweet! Also the stone cup was a great touch.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside ambience post-remodel
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ode to my Sundae- one of their limited availability crepes. You can really taste the freshness of the fruit! A delicious choice

VxNXEWjUcqllHduokZYbzg.text: Two words - coffee crepe. what?!  I'm actually not a fan of either coffee OR crepes, but I liked the coffee crepe I ordered!  It came with very fatty and rich pork pieces.  They also brought out a tiny little appetizer of pork rinds before my crepe, that was cool.  I'm very glad we came RIGHT when it opened, because the line was already forming.  My friend and I also ordered the Nutella/banana crepe for dessert.  It was lovely.  It inspired both of us to go buy Nutella and bananas on our way home.  That is a combo that can't be beat!

w39olcwUf-M5oJzN--yQWw.text: Thought we would give this a try. Heard so many great reviews. Ordered the First Time crepe, Vanilla Bean, and Ode To Sundae and the presentation was very pretty, however, they were just okay.  We ate it since the cost was pricey and didn't want our money to go to waste. Including 3 milks and a coke, our bill was almost $40.00 and the portions small. All of us were quite disappointed and the 4 year old didnt even like the chocolate crepe. To each his own, just not for us.

RgFyV-rDu-66v69r9C7RtA.text: Excellent breakfast spot in Tempe, AZ. The menu is small, but everything is amazing. Good mix of sweet and savory options, and the prices are reasonable ($9-$11 for a crepe).  A word of warning - if you are looking for a "typical" place for breakfast (eggs, bacon, and toast), then this is not the place for you. The flavors are very unique and primarily consist of crepes. My favorite item on the menu is the Pork Chorizo burrito (eggs, black beans, jack, ancho salsa, avocado, cotija ), but the Papa K (Hassayampa ham, eggs, chili jack, roasted mushroom), Grand Prix (pork belly, espresso maple, chili aioli, egg up), and Buckwheat & Honey (lemon curd, Sonoran blossom honey, AZ pecans) are all incredible. Happy Eating!!

E9pVAxfXy4UUAZ-LEjcZ1A.text: "I want it, oh, I want it Oh, I want it for my own I've got to know I've got to know What is this place that I have found?  What's this?" - J. Skellington  The lunch bunch had wanted to enjoy Crepe Bar for many months, but had been previously scared away by reports of insane wait times and limited seating (sohwee Janee P).  Realizing that they took reservations, I set aside a table for 6 (really 8) about two weeks prior.  And boy, am I glad I did.  Walking in with Ann R, I didn't see an available table in the place... which is when I noticed J-WoW and Linh were occupying the table of highest honors... the reserved hi-top.  Realizing that our party of 4 was not getting any larger, we shifted to one side of the table to free up four contiguous chairs, because we're thoughtful and stuff.  Our Sep outing found us at Salut Kitchen Bar with the greatest waitress of all time: Keary.  I found her male counterpart: Cody.  This dude embodied the essence of Crepe Bar, fun, witty, timely, and able to turn down a bribe.  I'll be back with more cash...  Being our first time, the table took a while to lock in on palatable entrees, and Cody didn't rush, even though the place was packed.  Even better, since we were at a reserved table, we didn't have to order at the counter.  Dining in a group really is the only way to go.  I paid for one savory crepe, yet was a partaker in four amazing crepe combinations.  I couldn't pick a favorite, they were all so good!  And Cody had the sensibility to hold off on the sweet crepes until our party had completed round 1.  But what's this?  We were being treated to a sampling of paper thin cut radishes on cultured butter.  Hey, it could have been served with ignorant margarine, and I wouldn't have known the difference, but it was nice to feel so froufrou... because, you know.. I'm in the fast lane from LA to Tokyo.  Okay  Upon arrival, I knew J's dessert was going to take the cake.  That crepe was bananas, B.A.N.A.N.A.S.  That crepe was also nutella, N.U.T.E.L.L.A!  One more round of free resplendent Rollos and we were ready for our PhotoOp... which Cody and team made happen.  Overall, it was a FABULOUS lunch.  I'll award the Crepe Bar an: A + + + + + + + + + + !  And I didn't even have to use my AK, today was a good day

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Because you just need to see it from another angle
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. I ate it all and went back for more

FOl-mdU58540f-rhtBcVgg.text: Consistently good! I love this place. The food is so fresh and light. The cheese and egg crepe is my favorite. The cappuccinos are so good too.

Jwl9MxiSsNWL8AdbEqLesQ.text: Love this place! Awesome crepes, their granola is amazing! Especially love the chorizo crepe. A must try.

t32vyK1NSUTsLY5oD563ow.text: I came in for a quick breakfast, and walked out with one of the best dining experiences I've had in the last year. Don't you dare complain about the wait, just shut up, sit down and feel lucky to experience the food when it comes. My only complaint was that the plates are not edible. Keep up the great work and by the way, all of your staff and service are amazing. Perfect caramel latte as well. BOOM!

VnHDh0c9acSJt4wh9GRcNQ.text: Very disappointing place. Lines were long and waiting time around one hour.  The food was heavy. Too much cheese and you did not really taste anything else. I took the paprika chicken. I was looking forward for a good crepe and was not thrilled at all by this breakfast. My boyfriend took the Jamaican crepe, and same thing, way too much cheese. I'm from Belgium and know how a good crepe taste. The location is nice, remind me of Europe for sure. The paintings exhibition looks cool but beside the decor, there was not too much positive things. The tea was great. Herbal tea, Le hameau and coffee tasted good. The latte looked delicious but did not try it. I feel I wasted my money:-(

YV4lIzEqtgxDFki8u4GIzw.text: These people take their coffee seriously and I RESPECT that :) the crepes are amazing, both savory and sweet. Service and decor are very pleasant. I got the chicken pesto and it was amazing, Anastasia got the chorizo and it was awesome as well. At this pint I'm writing things to make sure this doesn't get tagged as a tip because I'm speechless at how amazing it is. A breath of fresh air in the desert. Prices are reasonable too.

HbK_30PLRuskMzF1S7mfFg.text: The food is divine, the coffee is delicious and the staff is lovely. You can feel and taste the passion at Crepe Bar.

udG30oUsZ3yUk_GGDzelmQ.text: My first time here at this place, anyway it is the perfect place to catch a good breakfast. The prices are really reasonable and the food is really good as well; so its like both a winning situation, because you get good food that doesn't break your bank. The ambiance is really urban and nice I advise you arrive at like at 9:15 because after that it is quite busy and good luck trying to get a table with a group of friends. Oh also the servers are really nice while I was wanting for my food one server came by to give me fresh granola very nice of him.

rrFhjtcFBUvMZHudrfefLA.text: Friendly staff and owner was super nice.  First time visiting and the staff was amazingly helpful and even went out of their way to make something for my non-crepe loving child  :)  music was a little loud inside though but too hot to sit outside so we are making due.....great cappuccino too :)

bUNfgo0k1M2oNuj8-8j9Bg.text: Crepe bar is a great place to go if you're looking to grab a light breakfast/lunch or if you want to indulge your sweet tooth. The crepes are very good, although I think the crepes could be a little lighter, texture-wise. Nevertheless, the flavors and portions are good without making u feel heavy afterwards. We started off with the butter toast which is served slightly charred but still soft in the middle. The cultured cream and sea salt was a tasty combination on top. I ordered the breakfast burrito crepe which was very filling and tasted very much like a traditional breakfast sandwich/burrito. I'm not sure it was worth it to add the "fries" to the crepe because the fries turned out to be tiny breakfast potatoes scattered on the plate which I didn't really have enough of to enjoy. I also ordered the vanilla custard crepe which was filled with yummy custard, but the custard was light and reminded me more of a very velvety whipped cream or yogurt even. It wasn't overly sweet or dense and was the perfect compliment to our entrees.   I also really enjoyed the attentive and friendly service from the employees. Throughout our meal, we were surprised with a few samples of their yummy desserts. Speaking of desserts, their dessert case looked very tempting (cookies, brownies, sweet buns etc.) and had we not indulged in a sweet crepe, I definitely would have ordered one of the pastries on display. Overall, our experience was divine and I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu!

RCSlyFRrZu5N84ahFSSl4A.text: Wow... who knew crepes could be so good? Well, probably crepe lovers, but these were really, really good! The crepe menu gets a 5-STAR review. Same for the staff who are friendly and helpful and seem to like being there and making sure you like being there too.  That said, the baked goods only rate 3-STARS, and were dry and underwhelming, despite their impressive appearance. At the table, I bit into my cookie with disappointment and remarked, "This is like having the biggest box under the Christmas tree, only to find it full of socks."   The real disappointment was the coffee, which is surprising because a bunch of college age kids in a crepe bar serving breakfast should serve a mean cuppa joe. This was not it. 1-STAR on the coffee.  But please remember, the crepes very easily get 5-STARS and after all, the place is called "CREPE BAR", so that's what you're definitely going to go there to eat. And probably go back again to eat. And again. And again.

oJjkmCdaEbiDcCusk23gpw.text: Great little shop. Decor is minimal and kept hip but it's a bit dark for my personal liking. Made me a bit sleepy but thankfully the manager/ owner/ someone of power kept feeding my cousin and I complimentary sweets (ie gooey cookie and cheesecake mousse) while we waited for our crepes.   The crepe batter was great. I particularly like it better than Cupz n Crepes . It's well seasoned and the texture was the right amount of sponginess. I got a a ham and cheese with spinach crepe. (The creative menu name escapes me.) It was okay. My cousin got the Chicken pesto which was stellar!!! I'll come back for that one. :) And to make a good meal even better, you can't go wrong with the First Timer, which we shared.  All in all, I was on a bit of a sugar rush from all the unplanned sweets I ate but will be back.

LnArZ3swzMfJWoRHbPqwEw.text: I love the Crepe Bar. We were waiting for them to open and when they did they did NOT disappoint! I have gotten the vanilla custard crepes every time I have gone, and an iced vanilla latte every time, and it's a perfect combo for any vanilla fans out there. Their coffee is good and strong and not bitter and their crepes are soft and caramelized on top. I submitted a few photos and one of mine was the main one for a while, so you can see exactly what the food looks like. I will definitely be going back! It has been a weekly jaunt for my breakfast crew ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. From inside the bar of crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Different berries this time, just as delicious!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. I got vanilla custard with dressed berries!

pXwQYgKHppfJ5-30ZdL6zQ.text: Our typical Sunday brunch haunt. Never disappointed. Sweet or savory crepes are excellent.

_8zMtBNGzoZMtYBq_-Ml1A.text: Stopped in this morning to grab a drink. There was a free drink with check-in offer which made things even better! I had a cup of their Christmas blend tea to-go. For this reason, I can't yet comment on the food, but the service was excellent. The baristas helped me pick out a tea and were very cheerful about everything as well. This place has a trendy yet accessible vibe, and I look forward to going back again soon for breakfast/brunch!

OZI-ciN0VMviKyBHOsoHrQ.text: Been here for the first time, it was amazing. Their customer service is very good. They give some granola, kale salad while you wait for the food. Brownie bits for closure. Their crepes are all good, we got a breakfast burro and vanilla crepe and first time. Definitely will come back here soon!

VAJP6x9k5Ixx-V-cApS0uw.text: Awesome locally owned niche business. Be prepared to wait on the weekends but it is so worth it. Love this place.

kmatBOI8RllKNfBN0_OEZA.text: Food was absolutely incredible. Long line to order and seating area is small but well worth the inconvenience.

bcQhKdEua--HnNXE4CPoNA.text: Absolute awesome! Went here for my birthday breakfast and it was our first visit. We each ordered the breakfast burro and the first time. Simply perfect! So glad we found this cute little cafe. We will be back !

x9oJa-XQ45VG2tvSCRwU3g.text: I had the andouille sausage crepe with a sunny side egg on top. It was heavenly. The staff kept bringing me samples and made the experience quite unique for a breakfast/coffee house. The atmosphere was calming and music was just the right volume. Will definitely come back and recommend to anyone.

p8eMAfB4jDuPvrzzoYgJVw.text: Like me, a lot of people will want to try this place because of the yelp rating.  It is not worth a 1 hour+ wait on Sunday. The place could use better organization during the rush periods as I noticed people were getting served out of order. If you must try, give it a shot on a weekday.

lgdVhvMym0G4cq4rqTvLww.text: Oh my. Not only was the food amazing both times I went, but the coffee was on point too. It's in a little run down strip mall, but there's always a line to the door. Can't wait for them to expand.

39GQIJaRwrdl92Yk7BuGpA.text: The weirdest/worst place I have ever been.   I had decided to come here one day with a close friend to grab lunch before work. we were extremely hungry and had heard good things so decided to give it a try.   First of all, it has the most AWFUL smell to to store. Once I walked in I lost my appetite because that smell was horrific. then they handed us a menu and I had explained I had never been there before. the menu was very small and extremely confusing. she had us sit down just to get back up again and give our order up into the front, and sit back down AGAIN.  when we had first came up to the line the man behind the counter yelled at us saying we went to the wrong line. it was very rude. the girl who took our order has multiple facial piercings, which I didn't like because it they were trying to represent themselves as a classy restaurant.   i got the "first time" crepe which was Nutella and banana and my friend got a creame strawberry crepe. it cost about $7 each which was outrageous compared to the other crepe places we have tried.   we couldn't even stand the smell so we chose to sit outside in the 90 degree weather. although no one was really there (mind you it was a lunch time so that was odd), our food took a while. while sitting in the heat outside the facial piercings girl brought us 3 sweet potato chips "on the house". it was very embarrassing that they thought that was a good appetizer and the chips weren't good at all. finally we got our food after 15 minutes.   IT WAS HORRIBLE. there were 3 mini crepes, and I mean very mini. not worth $7. it was nothing special at all. my friend and I were still very hungry afterward and ended up walking to the croissant restaurant next door and spent the rest of our time there. I will never be going back to the crepe bar.

1pg_20_q3vuPBViRtnjt0w.text: This place has a very bland exterior but when you walk in, you'll be greeted by a trendy, grungy interior with plenty of indoor seating. When I walked in, one of the employees greeted me with a menu and helped direct us accordingly. One would order in the front and once you put in your order, you're given a number to place on the table at which you choose to sit. I was here with my family so we ordered a combination of sweet crepes and savory crepes. The Burrito Chorizo crepe had a very good, almost curry flavor to it. The Maple Butter crepe was perfect level of sweetness. It was not overpowering, and I didn't feel like dying from a sugar rush. Both crepes had a nice ratio of crepe to crepe filling. I was extremely impressed by the crepes. They do also offer non-crepe items for those who are not crepe fans. Service here is mediocre. They were helpful enough and quick! They did a good job keeping the place clean.

zYDgfsjtOZKCMgYdKkdv5g.text: This place is awesome what can I say. Amazing quality food.  Only down side is that it gets super packed and it's open seating so fining a table can tak time. It's no big deal overall though.

s00LuVVwlOR-E7lf2H0pcA.text: So. Damn. Good!!! Get there early to beat the crowds as seating is limited. Use the restroom beforehand too otherwise be forced to awkwardly go through their kitchen to the small bano in the back. Last time I was there, the espresso was really gross and salty. Something wrong about the machine that they were quick to apologize for and remedy. Get a savory and sweet crepe both as portions are small & to have a "breakfast-dessert"

zn1-e9DVZjoFWr0hvSsoww.text: I may have found my new breakfast go to.  Everything was devine.  I love supporting small local businesses that pack a big punch.  Crepe Bar delivers with  friendly staff and food that that tastes much bigger than its reasonable price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Smoked Turkey.... Heaven on a plate.

mfvOxaOcBNi6_pIUvzw9TQ.text: To paraphrase Hamlet, "Get thee to the Crepe Bar!"  I've been a fan of Jeff's since the days of the truck, but he's brought crepes to a whole new level here. They're simply delicious, bursting with flavor, and perfectly prepared. I had the grilled chicken with onions, cheddar, arugula, and an herb sauce that complimented everything perfectly. Finished with a dash of pesto and a touch of sea salt, you really couldn't ask for more.  I had to razz Jeff a bit about the lack of duck-fat frites, but he told me that was owing to the lack of a hood in their kitchen and that he was hoping to experiment a bit with his oven.  Either way, the price is right, the crepes are absolutely BRILLIANT, and Jeff & co. are just lovely people to visit.  Do yourself a favor and have a lovely crepe lunch or dessert. They're really stick-with-you fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken crepe

Z86mBlVvzTA5NRaNb0ow4Q.text: Hip place but they really should use organic ingredients and coffee given the typical demographics of their customer base.  Not doing so detracts from the place a fair amount.

-ighkx-XdqlF66WLdfAgRQ.text: This place is sort of a victim of its own popularity. It's hard to find a seat, and when you do, you're pretty well packed in. Sometimes, like this morning, it might take 40 minutes to get your food. So, why the five star review?  Here's the thing: I don't care about the wait or the cramped quarters, because the food is so good. Every time we go, my wife and I comment that we've just had the best breakfast of our lives, and then, the next time we go, we say the same thing.  The Grand Prix is my favorite: a coffee crepe covered with a smoky maple syrup sauce. Laced with thick cubes of bacon and perfectly caramelized pork belly. It's also topped with an over-easy egg - great for anyone who can't decide between sweet and savory. Then there's my wife's favorite: the pick-me-up - a coffee crepe with Nutella and chocolate dusting. The duck Cuban is no slouch either.   My kids love it, my vegetarian wife loves it, and the rapacious carnivore in me loves it. We always leave happy and full, even if it took us a long time to get there.

j6nvfSo7zl66Alw5aJE89Q.text: I never really understood what the big deal was with crepes, but the Crepe Bar made a believer out of me.   The menu is basic, but that simplicity also makes it classic. There are three sweet crepes - nutella and bananas, cream and berries, and a house special of creme brulee. The savory crepes include a burrito and a few others (sorry, can't remember!). Husband and I ordered two berry crepes and a vanilla latte. As we waited for our food, we watched the burrito go by and decided we'd have to come back and give that a try - it looked delicious and enough to split. My latte arrived in a black ceramic cup with a foam heart on top, delivered by a smiling employee. First sip - heavenly. (One of the better lattes I've had recently and I'm a coffee snob.) Quickly our crepes followed, looking beautiful on pristine, white plates. There were strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries dancing over sweet cream with a singular crepe rolled up and sliced into rolls - might have looked skimpy, but definitely filling. Husband requested caramel be drizzled over his, adding a sweeter taste to his crepe. Crepe was light and airy, no crispy edges and just sweet enough. The cream and berries were definitely fresh.  The location is a bit hard to find and for us the drive takes 30 minutes with no traffic. Committing to that kind of drive time just to get some breakfast food, it's gotta be good, right? Damn straight. The inside is a bit sparse, I don't remember any wall art, but there are plenty of tables and chairs. On the steel counter top, instead of a regular cash register, they use an iPad - which gives them cool techie cred. You can also see the chef at work, which is nice to see where the food comes from.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to take your date, relatives, friends, maybe even strangers - just gather them all up and prepare for deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla custard with berries.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte.

Z8GX8nQDGTRObGtdmp8vaQ.text: I was gonna give this place 1 star so I could keep this place a secret..lol  but then that would be selfish.....it's a bit small and crammed but best breakfast I've ever had...

HcBtYBhZcPvRkpXfD0s9jg.text: What Can I say about Crepe Bar?  Well, I know one thing, I'm a huge fan of Chef Jeff Krauss and Crepe Bar's former incarnation, "Truckin Good Food" and have high hopes for the success of his newest venture.  The space is chill and if the experience at the friends and family pre-opening this weekend is any indication of the quality of the food and service, i'm betting they will be hugely successful.  My first bites included a buckwheat blini with candied almond mousse and strawberry basil, refreshing, light and tasty.  A yogurt parfait with lemon cream, dressed berries, spelt & pistachio fragments and my choice for "favorite of the day" a "breakfast burrito" in the form of a smoked chili crepe with bacon egg & jack topped with avocado salsa.   All were worthy of note and I'll be back with a full write-up and pictures in the next few days after i've had an opportunity to have full portions of the menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mr Gars DeCrêpe Himself entertaining guests @ Crêpe Bar...
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The &#34;other half&#34; of Crêpe Bar! Mrs Erin Ware Krauss
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Crêpe Bar

ZNOXeFAl_TYnMFK6J2J5iw.text: There is nothing better than this place for fresh, local ingredients, delicious tea and coffee (fair-trade). Oh man. I love their desert crepes, their breakfast crepes, you can even design your own crepe! This place is by far the real deal.   They have one sort-of rude girl who works there. But that can be easily overlooked.   After you place your order and sit down they bring you something small to snack on. One time it was granola, the next time it was small scones. The lunch crepe I ordered came with a small salad. The first time we ordered dessert we had the banana and nutella. A good option an stand-by. The second time we ordered the lemon. WOW! Both are amazing.   This is always a great option for lunch. But they get super busy, so keep that in mind. Indoor seating is limited, too.

cosgSv2_ky4W15hWtR3phA.text: Best coffee that I have been able to find in all of Arizona!!! Crepes are also out of this world!  I will definitely be back before I go back home!

C710iCEjE1Lx2ARw0xJX5Q.text: They are expanding!!  Now I can get my coffee and crepe quicker, so very happy.  Introduced 2 more to Crepe Bar - my sons were visiting from Albuquerque.  They enjoyed the Espresso Pick Me Up and Breakfast Burrito.  Thank you Team Crepe Bar!

87ErTpwEtCE_psxjNRigiQ.text: This place is amazing! Fantastic food and the best service around! You don't even have to love crepes to love this place. Perfect for the whole family or an intimate date!! Oh and don't forget the iced caramel sea salt latte! So so good!

2Zuua3kjExs4rYqaRDVjrQ.text: This was our first time here so we didn't know what to expect. If you are familiar with the famous Macy's in Flagstaff it is a similar vibe and setup with a modern twist. We have never had a savory crepe and they were well worth the somewhat expensive price. They start you off with some granola and you finish with a little mike a brownie bit. Highly recommend this place even if it just for the great coffee. We tried the Chipotle, Smoked Turkey, and a first timer. Way to much food but we wanted to try savory and sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Milk and brownie.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The First Timer.

nAEdbfEuK61xZUXREVtObg.text: Don't let the modest strip-mall front and Spartan (though artistic) interior fool you: this place is a gastronomical nirvana for lovers of breakfast and well-prepared food!  I don't live in Arizona, but whenever I visit, it is a requirement that I eat here. It's that good.   The food: Where to begin?  The crepes are presented wonderfully, with a rim of Parmesan at the circumference, and neatly folded. Their taste and texture are sublime.  The fillings are fairly evenly distributed within, so you always get a little bit of everything with each bite (which really pleases those of us who suffer from OCD). The mushroom ragout is seasoned and caramelized to perfection! I could eat it alone and leave delighted and satisfied!  My children are picky to the point of malnourishment, but they scarfed down the amazing banana-Nutella crepe and the equally dazzling vanilla-strawberry-chocolate crepes voraciously. This saddened me somewhat, because I wanted to eat a larger portion of their crepes. :(      The service: No one is dressed up here, but no one is a snob either. Progression through the line to order is slow, but when it's your turn, the always-friendly staff never make you feel rushed, and they are well-acquainted with the menu items, which is great, since this is not mundane wafflehouse fare.  On weekends, it is very busy, and seating can be scarce. Don't come if you're in a hurry, or you will be unhappy.  Once you are seated, you often get a complimentary bowl of their homemade granola, which is outstanding (and truthfully, I normally hate granola).

YQ19xAFdhSR5gUI1KxLPYA.text: What a great place to eat while we're visiting Phoenix. I really encourage you to go to this place if you're around the area. They started us off with a little bit of popcorn, then we had our crapes we ordered which were delicious, then ended with a couple pieces of chocolate. Everyone in that seem like they really enjoyed what they do and spending the afternoon together.Will definitely be back

tkXQPOx30QHYWjHqCquPJA.text: It's different and good. I wouldn't say it's Exceptional, but it's good. Average price for an item is about $6-$7 and I wouldn't expect a full plate - even if you Do order the fries as a side. The portion is enough to take away hunger but I wouldn't say that it's filling to where you'll be stuffed.  My husband and I ordered the breakfast burro which is a chipotle crepe within a toasted burrito. The sauce has good flavor. And if you order the fries (potatoes) expect a sprinkle of it on top as opposed to an actual side size. Btw that sprinkle was $1.  Will I go back? Sure, if I'm in the area, not starving, but need something to eat...

X90HnMMdIEMXQN770Q0iPA.text: 3.5, really. Been here a few more times. Again, the staff is super nice.   Outside the breakfast burro, I find the portions pretty small for the prices. It's like they need a fancy presentation to compensate. But yeah, these are fancy crepes. They sort of innovate simple ingredients for them.   The main thing for the updated review is that I tried the Grand Prix and I was so disappointed. I've been meaning to try it for a while and it's been hard for me to get there early (it's served 7a to 11a) mainly because I am incredibly lazy. The meat was tough and dry. There were like, two or three pieces. They're suppose to be the star but they acted as a garnish (figures), as separated from the plate as they are. I did enjoy the coffee flavor of the crepes. There were probably other ingredients but I don't recall.   I might come back for new menu offerings but, SIGH.

uaq3xpw1aVv5-SYXhOpODg.text: I settled on the Duck Cuban instead, ham, jalapeno fondue and candied mustard seeds.  I also ordered a Cappuccino and the hubs had a black coffee.  The coffee was nice and smooth and the beans come from Heart Coffee Roasters of Oregon.  We were given some granola with our coffees, which was gobbled down quickly.  It was a sugary, crunchy treat, perfect to curb our appetites, while we waited.  Our crepe came out quickly and it was piled high and presented beautifully.  Doesn't it seem like when something is brought out looking so gorgeous that it tastes better.  It feeds all the senses!  I loved the textures and flavors of all the elements, personally, I truly enjoyed the fondue.  It was delicious and I can't wait to come back to try some more, especially the sweet ones.  With choices like maple butter and pick me up, how can you resist?!  (The only reason I did was because I've indulged a little too much this birthday week already).  The service was wonderful and very attentive.  I'll be back Crepe Bar and you best have some Grand Prix and a Pick Me Up available.

603jOuzHFBmO3r4g4IEUmg.text: My order was completely wrong. I have no idea how I order a build your own breakfast crepe, list all of the items I want in my breakfast and end up with the breakfast burrito? The waitress was writing for a while when I ordered and I thought she just wasn't short-hand writing my order which is unusual.. I have no idea what she was writing because when my order came out wrong she showed me the order she had written down (like that solved anything) and all that was written was 'burro'. I had to ask 'so when I said I would like to build my crepe and listed off mushrooms, spinach, ham and onions you heard burrito?' (which obviously has none of those ingredients) her response was 'well, that's what everyone orders'. Are you kidding me????   Anyway, I ate the burrito because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for my food. it was actually really good I can see why other people order it but I was really craving mushrooms.  #dayruiner

j8a5ivZBsdNROpgCZ_xtyw.text: This place is a jem. The staff is excellent and always aware of everything. The coffee is one of my favorites around. The food is fantastic in not only taste, but presentation as well! I love how they bring you little samples of items on their menu as you wait for your food! If you go on Saturday or Sunday morning, there will be a little wait for a table.

vqeSDdoYQCCUzbIZ2P6SPw.text: My amazingly "in the know" girlfriend recommended we try Crepe Bar for breakfast and was sold the moment she said "crepe." They did not disappoint!   I ordered the savory breakfast burrito filled with fluffy scrambled eggs, bacon, avocado salsa, jack cheese all tucked inside a chipotle crepe. The crepe was soft, with a spongy texture and with that chipotle flavor, it really made for an interesting twist on the usual breakfast burrito so prevalent in Phoenix.  Keep in mind you will need a fork and knife to eat it, but the quality of ingredients and combo of favors made it a solid option. I also ordered a hot mocha from the counter and it was fantastic.   We arrived around 9:30am and it was already pretty busy, as other reviews say it can be a bit of a wait, so plan accorded. But it is definitely worth if!

-xNm-mtWgPNkKGESGlTzbQ.text: My wife and I stopped in to sample the crepes, coffee, and meet the owners of this cute little place in Tempe.  What a hidden culinary gem.  The bar is trendy and well laid out with a mix of tables and high-top seating.  The menu is well sized and simple in the number of offerings.  Don't be fooled, there is sea of complexity and culinary genuis under the surface in each dish.    The staff is very friendly and well versed in what they serve.  Upon ordering our crepes (two savory, and one sweet) as well as a few unique beverages to wash them down with, we were greeted (unexpectedly) with a several courses of small appetizers.  I'm not going to do any of them (or the owners) any injustice by attempting to incorrectly classify them or butcher their names.  I will simply say that each was masterfully prepared and presented.  The component ingredients of each seemed to be hand selected to bring something to unique to the composite dish.  All were very well executed.  The crepes themselves?  Spectacular.  I'm a sucker for anything that contains cheese and avocado, but the proportions have to be right as to not distract from the core ingredients of the dish.  The turkey crepe with chorizo, smoked gouda, and avocado was prefectly balanced and rediculously good.  The duck crepe toped with what appeared to be roast beef and a whole-seed mustard sauce was also perfectly done.  I never though much of crepes before, and they were certainly never on my list of culinary cravings.   My how that has changed.   Well done guys, well done.

gliDFdpYsFG7XZFH-sOI6g.text: Have you ever been to Crepe Bar in Tempe? We took a day excursion to the valley for lunch, movie, ikea and SunSplash and this was our foodie adventure. It was different and surprisingly yum. Not super filling. Perfect for my appetite, but left everyone else still hungry. Here was our order: duck Cuban crepe (duck cuban Hassayampa ham, smoke serrano soubise, mustard seed chutney 8.75), papa k (Hassayampa ham, pepperjack, mushroom ragout 7.00), vanilla bean custard crepe (marinated strawberries 5.75 + salted caramel .50 + chocolate fudge .50), rose marshmallow crepe (chocolate hazelnut, rose gel, salted lakrids 8.00 - tasted a bit like soap; the rose, I imagine), and toast egg up (allowed us to substitute cheese for avocado since it was for a kid 6.00). A bit on the pricier side, but you're paying for the inventive combinations and presentation. I really enjoyed the flavor pairings of the savory crepes and the custard crepe, the marshmallow, not so much. We also got complimentary house-made granola while we waited for our order. I really loved the granola, though sweet and not really crunchy. Not super family friendly seating available, mostly tables for 2-4 and bar tops, but excellent service and attitudes. It's a walk-up, so no tips necessary. Good times.

MJX7Mrp_AtfVRN1a8OOLAw.text: LOVE Crepe Bar!   So excited that this place recently opened in my old Tempe stomping grounds - if only it had existed while I attended high school nearby :)   Crepe Bar offers both savory and sweet crepes and both aspects of the menu are enticing.   On the savory menu, I've had both the Chicken Pesto and Papa K, which were delicious.  The Chicken Pesto has more muted flavors, but is crazy satisfying. The cheddar cheese is delightfully crispy at the edges of the crepe (my favorite part!)   The mushroom ragout that is part of the Papa K has amazing flavor that I can't get out of my head - highly recommend!   I've had the Vanilla Bean Custard with Strawberries for dessert multiple times - I find that the addition of Valhrona chocolate is absolutely integral to a particularly delicious sweet ending to your meal at Crepe Bar.   Something that I really enjoy is their presentation - the plates are absolutely beautiful. Considering that the prices are about $8ish a crepe, that is impressive and lends to the feeling of a very upscale experience, even in such a fun, casual setting.   The service at the restaurant is wonderful - the employees are friendly, solicitous, and accommodating. Keep in mind though, it IS a counter-service restaurant, where you place your order at the cash register and your food is delivered to you. When you order multiple courses, they try to space it out, but on both of my visits our dessert arrived prior to our entrees being completely finished. Also, the food typically takes awhile to arrive initially (even when the restaurant isn't uber busy)   The drink selection is a bit odd... coffee is obviously their deal and they appear to be very committed to the art of coffee, which is commendable. I will say that the non-coffee offerings suffer a bit ... there aren't any fountain drink options, but they do have a few bottled sodas available in a cooler beside the register (the "microbrew" rootbeer they offer is very good - tastes just a little herbal and is delicious) This detracts from the experience somewhat because the restaurant is very warm - and the alternative to sitting inside the somewhat stuffy dining room is to sit outdoors, which is also often very warm. The drinks from the case are coolish, at best, which means that, combined with the hot temperatures, there isn't a chance for a particularly refreshing, cold drink (especially after waiting awhile for your meal) Sooo... that's a little disappointing.   Lastly, they don't allow modifications. At all. After working with Chefs for a living, and eating at many, many restaurants where I've learned that it is in my interest to trust the professionals, I am absolutely a proponent of "Chef knows best". I also know that with a small kitchen and labor intensive dishes, special requests and changes can be very challenging. So I get it - I get why you would try to be up front and strongly discourage modifications. BUT I think that sticking to that policy without exception comes across as pretty customer unfriendly... especially when it is something basic, like instead of chocolate on the side, requesting nutella (an ingredient that is offered with another crepe)? But again, I do get it...  Anyway, Crepe Bar is great! Such a wonderful addition and I can't recommend it enough - very unique, well executed and just so much fun.

It does take some time for the food to come out but that's because everything is made to order and you just cant rush good Crepes!  We had the breakfast "burrito" and a sweet crepe.
