nFztvI3Azev0HQh84vYGuQ.text: IMPORTANT NOTE First of all, I stand by my original review of Crepe Bar, which I included below, and I even think Crepe Bar just keeps getting better and better! UPDATE A lot has changed since my first visit to Crepe Bar! Most notably, the new renovations, which are amazing! I've come so many times since I first found Crepe Bar on Yelp in 2015. I love trying their daily menu, as well as their mainstays. I usually get the daily special AND the vanilla bean with strawberries. I know, I know, I'm a glutton, but I prefer to use my extra calories here. Since my last visit, I've tried the Breakfast Burrito, the Duck Cuban (hassayampa ham, smoked Serrano soubise, and mustard seed chutney), Grand Prix Crepe (Coffee Crepe, pork belly, maple glazed pork jowl, egg up, espresso syrup), and countless of their counter treats too! Their free Yelp check-in coffee is so strong and delicious! The service is usually 100%, and it's a FANTASTIC place to hangout and get free coffee refills! CONCLUSION Although Crepe Bar is in an unappealing strip mall in Tempe, Arizona, the food is WORTH THE TRIP! 5/5 RECOMMEND *************************************************** **************ORIGINAL REVIEW************ I recently started really getting into Yelp and I kept seeing the people I follow rave about the Crepe Bar in Tempe. I don't even remember how many reviews I actually saw, but it seemed like everyone had been there except me. Maybe I just had crepes on the brain. Anyway, I went to try the Crepe Bar and it was closed. I guess they're closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. I went back a few days later and wasn't even sure I was in the right place. I had seen so many pictures from Yelp, I was expecting something with a bit more "wow factor." The Crepe Bar, however, is in the middle of a strip mall on the North West corner of Rural and Elliot. The inside was super busy and reminiscent of a hip European cafe. It was a little confusing at first how to order, but obvious once you figure out their system. At the counter, they have amazing homemade daily treats on display. When I checked in on Yelp, I immediately won a free tea or drip coffee, which was pretty cool. I ordered one of the meat crepes and one of the dessert crepes each visit. The first time I had the breakfast burrito crepe and the vanilla bean with marinated strawberries (total under $15). The second time, I had the Papa K and maple butter with bananas brulee (total under $20). (see pics) The flavors of the mixtures were unbelievable. And the quality of the crepes is outstanding: Light and flavorful. CONCLUSION The environment is small and unassuming, but clean and a super cool place to have an amazing breakfast and hangout. 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Hours: Wed - Sat 7am - 2pm Sun 9am - 2pm Mon/Tues CLOSED *For more information: crepe-bar.com

HpMwsEmFgJcaJ_NiFQNt5w.text: The food is great and inventive.  I had the Grand Prix which has pork belly on a coffee crepe. It's delicious and obviously high quality.  The only issue I've noticed is some inconsistencies with what the menu says and what ends up on the plate,  specifically with salads on the side.  My friend had gotten a savory crepe that comes with a side salad and never received it. When she inquired she was told the greens were on top of the crepe (it was just cilantro)

pkvjCeCBRKamXLnGVc3drA.text: The crepes were delicious and the ambiance was relaxed. The perfect brunch environment. It's a great place to take your whole family.

QvnobZcJoiqpbqyHGod3tA.text: This is the first breakfast place I hit when I moved to Tempe. I have been going here for 5 years. It's a great joint with a cool atmosphere. There area is spacious with ample seating. The walls are painted and decorated with art from locals.  The food here is amazing. My favorites are the papa k and burrito. The coffee selections are good but I always go with brewed. The staff is friendly but the wairs can be long in the morning since it's a popular place. This is still a great place and I would not hesitate to go back.

LAZZxcXvetc7ZFDr_sxRkg.text: Food: 5.0  Coffee: 4.5 Ambiance: 4.5  In an unassuming plaza lies what may have been the best savory crepe I've ever had in my life. Plus their coffee (Heart coffee roasters from Portland) is really solid.   Food: 5.0 Wow. I'm impressed. I had the Grand Prix--a pork belly crepe with chipotle aioli, espresso-maple syrup, and a fried egg. Absolutely fantastic--a delightful balance of bright sweetness from the maple-chipotle and toasty grounding from the espresso and seared pork belly. Beautiful plating. We also tried the maple butter and the one with curried vegetables--both very tasty. But that pork belly...absolutely the star of the show.   Coffee: 4.5 It's very difficult to successfully put forth such high quality food and coffee...but I was impressed by their baristaship. Despite not being a fully-dedicated coffee staff, they did justice to Heart coffee's magnificent beans and really just made great coffee. Just shy of a top tier coffee shop--which if you ask me, is really impressive given their obvious dedication to food.   Ambiance: 4.5 Fun, open area. Only wish it wasn't so busy...although given that food, I can't say I'm surprised.

g-9ZEON5kU-zj-AUWvl3DA.text: This was the cutest little breakfast place. Pricey, but cute. If I drank coffee I would love it even more. I had the crepe with Nutella, banana and strawberries. There was a lot of banana and very little strawberries.

jj811xLkITIBeYgniWYExA.text: Good mix of sweet and savory creeps here.  Before I took my wife here, she didn't even know crepes were a thing.  Now we come here about once a month!  I tend to go for the more savory offerings, such as the Jamaican jerk or the Chipotle burrito.  Last time I went with the chipotle burrito was not disappointed.  My wife tends to play it more safe with the nutella & banana crepes.    The set-up is a bit odd.  You wait in a line that runs out the front door while trying to wait for a table.  What ends up happening is people who are waiting in line will send someone to reserve the table once a table opens up.  This is frustrating to the people who just got their food and are standing around looking at each other wondering where to eat.  Also, there is a barista who makes flavorful lattees such as sea salt caramel, vanilla, and honey.  In my experience, the drinks sounds good on paper but all tend to taste similar.    I recommend coming here as soon as they open up so you are not left doing battle with people to get a table to sit.  Also, the lattes are worth trying out, one should be enough for you and your significant other.  Lastly, if you and your wife are having a tough time deciding what to get, get one savory and one sweet and split them.

6WOITL0U6LGkb35Syhy4Cg.text: Let me say, I was very skeptical from the moment I walked in here because I saw the food & it looked fair. Not stuff I would typically go for. However, IT WAS SO VERY GOOD!! I became a fan instantaneously!  My mom on the other hand is such a picky eater & I was even surprised she LOVED the food! She had their fresh fried pork-skins (chicharron) & the second time crepes and she loved them! The chicharron was so fresh & when the lady dropped it off at our table you can just smell how delicious they were! I ordered the second time crepes also, as well as their side of potatoes & everything was splendid! Their potatoes were tossed in a delicious savory sauce that complimented them very well!  We had such a great time, that we will definitely be back.  They open at 9am & we got there around 9:08am and the line was already to the door & it was very packed. I'd say get there as early as possible because they serve great food & the lines don't lie! Lol Thanks Crepe Bar for the delicious breakfast this morning!

keWE5GKt959PzqEVbdWzXg.text: I was so excited to try out Crepe Bar!  I went on a Sunday around noon. It was busy and a bit loud, but I expected that.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. They let me know that it would be about 20 minutes for my food. That was fine.  Sometimes amazing food is worth waiting for.   I got an iced latte, and it was one of the best I've had.  I also got the pesto chicken and a "first time" crepe (Nutella and banana brulee).  The wait was a little longer, but one of the servers brought out a bacon scone for me to snack on. Not a big fan of bacon in scones, but they get points for noticing that I had been waiting. It's that attention to detail that makes me a loyal customer.   The pesto chicken was awesome!  I think I prefer my crepes sweet though so next time I will stick with a dessert crepe, but it was delicious.  The "first time" was incredible!  I had the server box up it up after a few bites. Otherwise I would have eaten the whole thing and been ill. :-)  Before I left, one of the servers let me know that he would be brining out something to try if I had time to stick around.  He brought out a mini mascarpone cheesecake-like thing with whipped cream and granola on it.  Wow!  Rich and delicious.  Apparently they serve those only for dinner on Friday and Saturday nights.  Go there with an appetite!  It was excellent!

AsNaMVnmOPaA6h7AnugsUg.text: This place.... Oh. Their crepes will make you wish you lived in a cot inside under the counter. They have a buffalo chicken crepe! And they always have a good seasonal veggie crepe that is mind blowing. I wish there was more seating, but if you come early (or later) you usually don't have an issue. This place.... It's like the binkleys of crepes. So many different little nibbles being passed around! I love.... Lovvvvvve their granola.   Also. They bring around a delicious little rose marshmallow sometimes, it's amazing. Don't ever turn it down, no matter how full you are.

f1FKreetlihjjfyc4EFXLA.text: FIrst of all, the food here is excellent. Even if you have never had a crepe, or didn't like the one you had you will find something here to like.  They have both savory and sweat crepes and all are delicious.  The sauces are complex and unique on their own, the flavors blended perfectly and every bite a delight.  They also have farm to table relationships with local growers and bakers which yields great results.  With that why only 4 stars? Mainly because they are a victim of their success.  This is a order at the counter then take a seat place and on weekends the line can be almost out the door.  They recently expanded their seating space but the kitchen struggles to keep up with the demand.  Thankfully, they don't compromise on quality but the wait can be a bit long (especially when you know what is coming).  I recommend you stop in for breakfast or lunch on a weekday (Wed - Fri, they are closed Monday and Tuesday) and get the five star experience.

XU5WkhKAeZAB0YwgXbEB9A.text: Been driving by this place since it opened 5 years ago.   Finally went in today.   Recommendation, don't arrive right at the opening.   Half of Tempe was in line to get in.    Well worth the wait.   Crepe and Latte were outstandingly delicious.    Nice people everywhere to take care of you.     Let's just say, I picked a bad day to start my diet!!  Very unassuming from the outside.   Don't pass this place by.

lH4mAYHWXcIj6AJfDiWKBA.text: I cannot begin to express how I feel about Crepe bar!! We were driving around Tempe and my friend wanted to have some meat and while I wanted something sweet. So we decided to go to Crepe bar.  Crepe bar is located in a strip mall kinda place and as we entered I did not expect too much from this place. Seating was open, so we ordered the basil chicken crepe and the banana Nutella crepe.   While waiting for our order to arrive, we were served with a croissant looking amazingly delicious bread!! It was complimentary and I could not believe how delicious a fried croissant could taste!!!! We were also served with a bowl of multigrain oatmeal kinda cereal which was excellent as well!! These two tiny appetizers that they served us were amazing and I started expecting more from our orders!!  When our order arrived, I had the best chicken basil crepe EVER!!! This was by far the best savory crepe I have ever had. I love basil and I loved how nice and juicy the chicken was. It was perfect!!   The banana Nutella crepe was pretty awesome too!! What on earth could go wrong with warm Nutella and caramelized bananas!!!  I had a great experience at this place and I am sure to visit this place again in the future. I would definitely recommend everyone to visit this place for crepes!! The service is awesome and their food is the best!!

oJXM-exnjVUOv6E-l9TRfA.text: Absolutely love this place.  Food is well balanced in flavor and texture....the chorizo and scrambled egg crepe is superb.

G8OA55SboNHXO6kbnO_V6w.text: I love this place! From savory to sweet, they have something for everyone. They pay attention to the details, and it shows. Their breakfast crepes are a work of art and that chipotle sauce is to die for. Save to for something sweet - good luck picking just one!

ddqBgUt-CDmrrgfR-V4DYg.text: I have a bit of a "crepe" issue.  There is just something about a meal that could technically be breakfast but it tastes like a dessert!   The problem is if you want crepes then your options are IHOP, Village inn, or you have to drive to a far off place  and it's like a trip to never-never land..... And the entire way your thinking do I really want a crepe this bad??? Does this mean I have a problem? My subconscious is telling me that if crepes were illegal then I would have a street corner dealer on speed dial.   First, the crepeier is a modern little place full of hipsters and long haired hippies or in today's lingo the "bohemian" look. If you want to see man-buns this is the place.   Well, my very late 30s soccer mom hopped up on caffeine and the thrill of being childless for 25.6 minutes was not a good blend for the "emo cafeteria" but I played it cool........I drove 20 mins for strawberries wrapped in a thin pancake then smothered with whip cream and some type of magical sauce.   Well things started to go down hill fast.   Have you ever seen the soup nazi Seinfeld episode? Well.... I just strolled my way into the crepe nazi and my blood sugar was moving into dangerous levels and I had started to sweat.   I'm sure it's because on some primal level my body sensed that "crepes" were close by.   Here is the deal. I didn't want to eat this heavenly snack surrounded by people who are wounded with the you don't "get" me face and I had to pick up 3 hyper children in exactly 40 minutes so these strawberry delights were coming with me and I had limited time.   I rarely get to eat out and rarely at restaurants with "rules." This joint is in a semi-run down 1982 shopping center. So I wasn't expecting rules like you get at Flemings or Capital Grille!  First, you can only get about 1/2 the menu to go because it has to be plated/presented in a special way.   The strawberry crepes happen to fall under an extremely strict "no take out" policy.   As, this was being explained, I dug for more detail on this no exceptions policy.   The Hipster Explained there is a magical way that they smear sauce on the plate however this magic cannot take place in a to-go box. Then she turned away in a aloof depressed silence and I'm pretty sure she was either extremely offended or practicing for a Shakespearean play.   Suddenly I felt like Queen Leer had just run over my cat.  I began questioning about alternatives to my first choice that would not "break" the take out code.   After about 5 minutes, I had the options of beets and of something else that sounded unappetizing.   I was ready to leave empty handed when I decided to run a Hail Mary and order the strawberries with an announcement of staying to eat. Wink wink....  20 minutes later in complete Y generation glory ( the place was empty and well they had important things to do like solving all the worlds problems by sending out good vibes to the universe) I finally got my meal.   I have made crepes myself and it takes less time to make a crepe then to mix up some pancake mix and flip a flap jack.   I grab a to-go box and scoop the yummy tart in faster then my kids can brush their teeth.   Then I try to avoid eye contact as I beam for the door.  I dodge the stares of disgust only to get a full wave goodbye and a silent glare from who I would guess to be the hall monitor of crepe rules.   They were good.... Not amazing but good! I might just make them at home next time but if your I the area then try it out but only if your staying to eat!

ogWn6rCRWlfr161f79lEwg.text: I have been waiting to try Crepe Bar for months now. I see it mentioned in my twitter feed all the time, and it looks so delicious. I finally stopped by there today, and my veggie crepe *looked* delicious, but the taste wasn't there.  Sadly, the best part about my veggie crepe was the parmesan on top that was baked into a crisp cracker. Without that crunch and salt, the crepe would have been an utter disappointment.  What really bummed me out about the crepe were the choice of veggies for the filling: zucchini and yellow squash. Really?! So lame and cheap! I expected Crepe Bar to focus on seasonal produce. I know they use produce from our neighborhood farm, so why do they use these ubiquitous summer veggies in a vegetarian crepe? There could be so many better alternatives this time of year. Root vegetables, winter greens, or something from the cruciferous family.  I was happy with my cappuccino, It had a very pretty leaf on top, and the taste was great. It reminded me of Cafe Grumpy in New York which is a very good thing.  I'll come back for another try at their savory crepes in hope that Crepe Bar can redeem themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Veggie crepe

jdM355K6mKajexlyA9uQBA.text: Peace, love, crepe bar. I've been twice so far, only because those were my only opportunities, lol. Can't wait to go again! The first time I got the "first timer" and the second the I got the "second time" because I'm a rule follower? Both times I ate the whole thing within 5-10 min because WOW. Besides the yummy food, the place is cute as can be! Love being there. The staff is so helpful and sweet and there's also interesting people inside. Definitely a new favorite spot of mine. I highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Second time. OJ. Fresh fruit.

7NxhnNln5OyC0U7QA86ACA.text: Came here two days in a row! Yesterday, I met a GF for brunch. It was her first time. She noticed that the restaurant ordering and design exuded a European flair-- order at the counter, and self-serve napkins, cups, and sugar cubes. (She didn't notice this at first, but staff didn't mind fetching the sugar cubes for her.) She doesn't drink coffee and wanted English breakfast tea, so I let her use my free Maya tea with Yelp check-in. She ordered the Papa K, while I went with a Mocha, made with 55% Valrhona chocolate and rose essence, and maple butter crepe (no surprise there). yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... When Leah (one of the staff members) delivered my mocha, GF immediately ordered one for herself. While we both thought the rose essence was a bit too strong, I finished mine and she abandoned hers (and ended up asking for just black coffee, instead). Whether it was the additional food aromas/flavors mixing in with the rose essence, or just the mocha-rose combo mellowing over time, I was able to appreciate the beverage to the last drop. GF tried another sip and said, "No. Still too strong." Her Papa K entree looked and sounded terrific! I could hear the crunch of the top and edges as she sliced through the crepe with her knife. She ate every bite of it! yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... Her crepe also came with a side salad, dressed with a simple citrus vinaigrette. I also ordered a choux, made with the same batter as a cream puff/profiterole, accompanied by date butter, and a brioche du jour, which came with date butter and macerated strawberries. yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... I didn't care for the choux's soft textures, but I very much enjoyed the date butter! I also loved the brioche. So much so, that I ordered it again this morning... Tastings for the day were sweet potato chips with salt, house-made yogurt with crushed hazelnuts and buckwheat streusel, yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... and house-made rollos. yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... I almost didn't have my share of the rollos, as I was quite full from brunch, but GF made me eat it! She said it was fantastic and that I had to try it. Oh-kay! :) For this morning's adventure, two GFs and I met and ordered two breakfast burros, minus the guac yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... and a vanilla bean crepe with strawberries. Oh, why did I not take a photo of the sweet crepe?? I went with a pretty and tasty cup o' cappuccino yelp.com/biz_photos/crep..., while the two had Maya lemon drop tea (with lemongrass). I was able to tell one GF to take advantage of the free tea at Yelp check-in by downloading the app, but forgot to let the other one know, as she ran late and I had no time to tell her. They both LOVED the tea! So much so, I'll have to give it a try on my next visit. I again ordered the brioche du jour, which hadn't changed from the day before. This time, we all enjoyed it (GFs ooh'ed and ahh'ed!), while GF yesterday must've tried a bite of the toast sans date butter. She only tasted sour berries, and apparently, she doesn't do sour. Tastings for the day were sweet potato chips with date butter on the bottom, house-made yogurt and local Agritopia radishes, with fresh-ground black pepper and salt, yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... and two mini-flutes of rose hot cocoa (this time the rose/cocoa ratio was perfect!). They originally came with popcorn bits, but Leah graciously made another one for me without them! yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... Thank you so much! One friend left too early (had to go to work), while the other enjoyed all of the tastings. She said it was one of the best meals she's had lately! Kudos to Jeff K. and CB's staff! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. House-made yogurt, Agritopia radishes, fresh-ground black peppercorn, and salt.  I liked it!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cappuccino.  Always a beautiful and tasty choice!  My GFs loved the coffee art!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. House-made rollos. Solid dark chocolate, caramel, yogurt, and crushed banana chips (?).  Very good!

JhFuEI74uND_WMGD_WNthw.text: Perfect breakfast place. The chorizo burrito and First Time (pictured) is my go to every time. We branched our and tried the limited time dulce de leche crepe (also pictured - I still like the Nutella one the best). We also had the Tahitian Vanilla Maple Latte which I highly recommend. The ambiance of the place is pretty chill and relaxing. There's usually a wait, but it's so worth it

9ZE7ID5oeI4tymahFamabQ.text: I come here all the time!!! They have this amazing crepes and hot chocolate. I personally recommend the breakfast burrito with the 'first time' crepe!! Amazing. And the people there are so nice and friendly you just want to keep coming there. They are not open on Mondays so don't bother to go there, just be patient and wait for Tuesday :) And they close around 2 every day that they are open.

tXRoeJqhQENGt2ojQE30Bw.text: I used to travel a lot for business,  I have been in quite a few Crepe restaurants and "The Crepe bar" is bar far the best Crepes I have ever had.  A very nice touch of uniqueness with exquisite flavor.  I visit here regularly and felt compelled to review.  Highly recommended

aecT6ogea9enQla6YgAw0Q.text: "You don't win friends with salad."   Homer Simpson  I'm not sure how the quote fits but I've been wanting to use it for a while.  Anywho!  Crepes.  Those delicious thinly cooked pancakes with yummy stuff packed into them.  Who doesn't love a good crepe?    So the Lunch Bunch had a long overdue brunch and we've all been dying to try the Crepe Bar for quite some time.  We had a reservation at 11:30am for a party of six.  Two party poopers didn't show but that didn't stop us from having a straight up feast-party.  We all had checked-in and used the handy Yelp check-in offer for some Maya Tea.  After a quick "Cheers" or "Okole maluna" as twinsie Nadine C. of Honolulu has taught us, we gave our incredibly charismatic and knowledgeable waiter Cody the most difficult 5-minutes of his life.  Seriously, how can four people have such difficulties when ordering?  For savory crepes, we had ordered an Andouille Sausage, Maple Butter with Pork Jowl, Basil Chicken, and the Grand Prix with Duck Egg [thanks for letting me order this even though it was past 11am].  For sweet crepes, we had two Vanilla Bean Custards, a Lemon Drop, and a First Time.  We also got to try a Radish dish from Joe's at Agritopia Farm with cultured butter, smoked salt, and lime; homemade Rolos with vanilla bean custard, caramel, and a banana chip crumble; and some sinfully decadent, salted, dark chocolate with a creamy caramel sauce.    Although we all ended up sharing and picking off each others plates, my dishes were the Grand Prix with Duck Egg and the First Time, all of which were recommended by Cody.  Everybody had some pretty amazing dishes but I felt like I had the best dishes of the day.  The Grand Prix was like something out of Iron Chef Michael Symon's twisted head.  It  was a coffee crepe with giant pieces of juicy pork belly, maple-glazed pork jowl, and an upgraded sunny-side-up duck egg.  It was sooo incredibly rich and so fattening but absolutely delicious.  The pork belly was just literally melting under my fork.  I'm so glad there were three companions I can pawn off my pork belly to because oh lawdy!  Where's my siSTAR Aline N., Marc M., and his cat Flash  to share this with?  I seriously hope a cardiologist doesn't need to be called in because whoa!  Of course I ended up being thirsty all day since it was rich and salty goodness but it was well worth it.  I think I'll have salad until Thanksgiving now.  As for the First Time, that Nutella and banana brulee man...  Enough said.  All in all, I had definitely one of the best damn lunches in a long while and I definitely will be stopping by again.  I promise I won't throw my menu and stuff this time.  The wait time for your food to come out can be a tad of a wait but it's only because it's so busy and because their food is so damn good!  The wait is easily bearable when you have the best group of friends ever.  Feeling so lucky today!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our fancy table for our brunch!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salted dark chocolate with caramel sauce.  It looks like a dragonfly!  Thanks Cody!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. First Time: Nutella &amp; banana brûlée.

MHIaSopZ0hjQk-vUcmDZnA.text: Went to Crepe Bar on a whim, also based on the very positive reviews, and we were delighted!  Sweet and savory crepes and great service!  Very fresh ingredients and wonderful coffee.  Don't miss this place!

AMYXA_5jUb9uub7bW8WYLA.text: Crepe Bar is my go to place for breakfast. Sometimes I want to keep it light and be greedy at the same time, so I get one savory and one sweet crepe! The crepes are so delicious. The self serve setup bugs me a bit, but it's worth it once I bite into a crepe. I don't have a pic to share because I ate the crepe already! Yum.

s0FW63d3RjyA2FmYm72YwA.text: Fresh, well prepared...you don't see many places like this in the Phoenix area. The service is personable and welcoming. Highest recommendation!

fpey9E0nPyhD-geX7MTuvg.text: I was so excited to try this place, as crepes are my favorite food! After standing in a line for 30 min. (Which I WAS fine with) placing my order was horrendous. All I wanted was a Nutella crepe with strawberries. No extra anything. This is largely in part for my food allergies, but also I just wanted a classic Parisian crepe. I was rudely told I could not change anything on the menu. If that's how it is, fine, but the attitude after standing in line for so long I was completely uncalled for. I tried doing a Nutella crepe with a side of strawberries, No. I offered to pay whatever else they wanted to get the side, no. In the end I had to purchase 2 $6 crepes, to create a crepe myself. Total ingredients -was a crepe, Nutella, and strawberries.  Paying the extra was not my main issue. Standing in line for that amount of time, letting them know about my allergy, and the complete incapacity to help or make suggestions. The only way for me to outsmart situation was to purchase the two  completely different crapes, subtracting everything besides the one ingredient. The only reason I did that, but because of the amount of time already wasted. I am someone who would eat a crepe every day, or at least a couple times a week. Apparently a simple change to something is not worth the money they could have made.

hYmdQ2OBG-iDlMrakHsJSA.text: Extremely disappointed after reading all the smashing reviews and the "Best of" awards. They were out of a signature dish (Vanilla Custard crepe) at 8am on a Saturday morning. Seriously?  You've been open an hour, and you're out?  Not good planning on the part of the kitchen.  The breakfast burrito was good with the exception of the white bits of "powdered bacon" sprinkled all over it. I LOVE bacon but I couldn't even tell what this stuff was. It tasted like baking soda and salt. It was horrible. The little cinnamon sugary donut-y things they brought to the table prior to bringing out our meal tasted like they were deep fried in oil previously used for cooking some sort of meat.  The coffee was bitter. The staff was friendly and the only reason I'm not giving 1 star.

SXgwOwOR55_uiWDvb9kSxw.text: My sister heard about this place and took me while I was at home visiting. The place is decorated minimally but I think that might be part of its charm. The lab flasks with coffee beans on the table is a cute little detail we noticed. The staff were helpful and friendly, and even chatted a bit when we instigated conversation. The menu was a bit scarce, but nonetheless, I ordered a breakfast burrito and my sister got the veggie (and added chicken). I didn't try hers, but mine was amazing: I'm huge on Mexican food and breakfast burritos (I mean, what native Phoenixian isn't?) and I loved how light and fluffy the crepe was in comparison to the tough tortilla. The avocado sauce and touch of chipotle pepper was the perfect balance of light and spicy. We were also greeted with freshly made granola as an appetizer on the house, which was absolutely delicious. I had a chai tea, which was yummy, and I quite liked how they didn't carry any name brand soda products. And of course, free wi-fi is ALWAYS a plus. Love this little bar. Can't wait to come back and I'm back in town.

ej-CnZknHpUpZa4r_tFT7A.text: Heart Coffee served in Tempe, AZ?  Yes, please.  And delicious cutting-edge cuisine----highly recommended!

K1KE518rg0YvxFwjG062Ag.text: We have recently vacationed in Monterey, CA where we dined at a couple of fabulous crepe restaurants, so when we returned we were so happy to find this place!  We ordered the breakfast burrito and the Papa K, and both were amazing!  The ambiance was not what we typically enjoy, but the amazing food made up for it.  It was not crowded at all around 11:30 on a Thursday, and service was great.  We will be returning customers for sure!

_NXQmX1cVkZoV3xcmX9kHA.text: This place is a hidden gem.  My husband and I went on a Sunday morning.  We shared the burro and a maple butter crepe.  The savory crepe was very flavorful with egg, chorizo, and cheese in a chipotle flavored crepe.  The sweet crepe was good as well, I am definitely glad we shared though because it is a splurge calorie-wise.  Servers were extremely friendly and attentive.  Food took around 30 minutes to prepare, a bit longer than your average breakfast spot, but this place is far from average and it was worth the wait.

IqH2d-G-IZGRkVNGTXn8Uw.text: Great vibe. Thoughtful menu. Serves Heart Roasters coffee from Portland. I have no problem driving an hour for breakfast here.

-XIOB067zCx8sTkQQjzY1w.text: Crepe bar is one of the best places i have ever spent my time in. The food is absolutely phenomenal and is a gateway into the heart and mind of chef jeff kraus. Crepe bar bleeds passion, and it is an amazing experience just to be there. It's the small things that the cb crew does that makes this place ahead of the game in so many different aspects. Not to mention you can get an insane yet tasteful caffeine rush in several forms just take your pick! Music is on point and always diverse, the colors and artwork inside provide a badass way for you to eat breakfast and feel cooler only to leave and  realize the wall was cooler than you. Haha all in all you should just eat here, just do it! i don't know why the fuck your still reading this awesome review. Go get it while the gettins good buddy, fresh as it gets "stellar way to start ya day!" Yow!!

OxAe1sh99YJH1swm7qh3Cg.text: Crepe bar is, in a word, awesome!  Great atmosphere, fun employees and great service.  I went on a Saturday morning, with what seemed like the rest of TEmpe, and my food came out in a timely manner.  I have a problem with dropping things, as my phone's cracked screen can attest, when I dropped my fork, without even asking a waiter came up with flatware in hand saying "I heard something drop".   The food was great, I had the breakfast burrito and my only complaint wasI should've ordered two.  Fun place, try it out.

VugQJgZ2RhsS4Bj4y-jtbw.text: I'm not able to conceive of a restaurant of any kind in the Valley that is as well conceived and executed with such attention to detail and dedication to the highest artistic and culinary standards. I'm pretty knowledgeable about coffee. There are fifty ways from bush to cup to spoil it. They choose the highest quality, Heart beans and prepare them perfectly whether by drip brew or v60 pour-over. The staff will be happy to help you choose the blend you'll most enjoy no matter how busy it gets.   The menu is unique and creative, offering a variety of sweet and savory crepes. Of the savory, my favorites are the Grand Prix (order early!) and 13-mi Vegetable, but everything is very good. The plate presentation of everything is a work of art that stimulates and delights the mind before you taste a morsel. Somehow, even during the busiest periods, they manage to deliver complimentary, tantalizing, exquisite little finger-food before and after your order arrives.   Actually the venue, a casual, strip-mall spot, is incongruous with the surprisingly wonderful food and drink, but to me and my wife, this just adds to the charm. The lack of pretentiousness lets you relax, let down, and have a joyful and memorable time.

IK7i_wex8FeIiuKi3BzCwg.text: Great service! Took my senior manager there instead of a Starbucks between meetings. The people up front helped us figure out what to eat and it was DELICIOUS! My manager raved the second half of the day about the wonderful experience.

LmtY2MG5U7ofIEdDF0UOzA.text: I'm not a crepe expert but the free coffee from checking in was fantastic and so was the crepe, crazy packed but really quality food cooked awesomely at a very reasonable price

VvOpjOIZb_I8RswBUm4apw.text: Super delicious! Only complaint was the wait! Will be back for the Nutella crepe

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

XYPai-Lkk5xsua4NrE-RHw.text: If I could, I would give this breakfast spot 5 million stars. I love the people, the food, and the atmosphere. Best breakfast in the Phoenix Valley by a mile.

tggIIr5sFU2OW1sF9D0jUQ.text: Most creative and innovative breakfast place in Phoenix. Can't wait for it to reopen!

30u6ONXik_vxh7_1XsHcwQ.text: Oh man! There's so many good things to say about this place... where to begin?!  First of all, did you know that Crepe Bar started as a food truck? Just an interesting side note :)  You might want to get here early, there are always lines and the food takes a little longer than normal to make, so plan on spending 1.5-2 hours here. With that said... it's totally worth the wait! They give you an option to get sweet or savory crepes, all of which will make you drool just reading through the descriptions! I went with their Breakfast Burrito (savory) crepe and would definitely order it again. So delicious!!!  Also, while waiting for the crepes, they started us out with some homemade granola. This may sound odd, but man oh man, it was amazing! So much so, that I asked if it was possible to buy some. Sure enough, they sell a small ish mason jar for $6. And if you bring the jar back, you can get a refill for $3.  I give this place an A++. The staff was super friendly and the food was even more amazing! Definitely give this place a try!

YiOiclSCdtgWYv2on3wkaA.text: My first time back after the reopening. I love the enlarged space and the food was fantastic as  always. I really appreciate the smiles and friendly service. I love this place!

8awxUFEElRlwhkzC9QNqnw.text: I really wanted to like this place, but it was a disappointment. Prices were OK, service was friendly but unacceptably slow, food was very disappointing.   We had two different crepes; the Grand Prix and the burro. The flavors of the burro - while definitely southwestern - were poorly balanced. The spices were front and center rather than being complimentary. The crepe itself was heavy and doughy rather than light. The Grand Prix was served with an egg sunny side up with grossly under cooked whites. The crepe was also heavy and doughy and the flavors were poorly balanced. Perhaps our expectations were out of line but 24 bucks for two coffees and 2 below average crepes just seems wrong. Sadly, we won't be back.

BccUeWIeKtkmlSukE9pYaw.text: I love this place. It has become one of my favorite place to go for breakfast/lunch with my boyfriend. Yes, the meal is a little pricey but I feel like it's worth it. Everything they make is fresh and they serve pretty good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burro with Chorizo - definitely a hit!!!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;Pick Me Up&#34; - coffee crepe!

-Yqh7_1p81z5UWbdSRqkPQ.text: If I am gonna open a restaurant one day, this is what I want it to be. Every dish is a masterpiece. I felt guilty that I ate that luxurious for breakfast!   The Duck Cuban is  sophisticatedly flavored and presented. I love to order duck whenever it is available, and how they paired it with other ingredient is brilliant. The portion is on the small side, but I don't mind, how about ordering more flavor!  They should totally open a full restaurant and serve dinner. More please, not just crepes.

bvWH6ssdfDDWJ_eJwx55_g.text: Very good, very fresh!    The menu is not as large as I would like, but they were able to make new things on the spot with the ingredients they have which is pretty awesome.   The staff/chef were really nice, the place was clean and the food was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cherry and Apple crepe. They made it special for us. It was soooo good.  Not overly sweet, just perfect.

Qt6R6W89-4viUvtzYx8H3A.text: This PLACE IS INCREDIBLE. I can't say enough good things about their food, their service, and their coffee. If I could eat here everyday, I would. Try the vanilla bean crepes or the breakfast burrito. You will not be disappointed.

4tgdqW9iBEd2mXURK7i4tg.text: Brought a friend here on a Thursday morning for her birthday treat. It was her choice and I'm sooooo glad she did! In a nutshell, Crepe Bar is a very cool place that serves delicious, well presented food with a side of awesome customer service. It's the small things that mean so much; from your decorative coffee foam, to your complimentary granola while you wait for your order, to your cute marshmallow dessert to wrap things up!  My breakfast buddy went for the tried, but True, Bananas & Nutella. Can't go wrong there! When I saw that the Grand Prix was served only at certain times (which fortuitously married with the time of our visit), I knew it was my destiny to experience the wondrous combo of savory pork belly, crisp pork jowl, sunny side egg, and sweet coffee crepe. Yes, you read right! Coffee. Who knew, right??  Upon my very first bite of pork belly, my eyes rolled up into my head and I just had to close my eyes to fully enjoy the ... dare I say it... fatty goodness of the pork! There I said it! My kinda comfort food. I kept saying I should take some photos, even as i chowed down; the chance of a good picture diminishing as fast as the tasty morsels on my plate.  Two thumbs up! Can't wait to go back to try the rest of the menu, though not sure if I dare face the wait times on weekends as mentioned by the other reviewers.

Qr7A1rkS7lL4BUUhCenl7Q.text: This place makes me weep its so good.  Jeff and the team are amazing.  So glad to live so close!

TtnW0OmlHEcukENFLQ34uw.text: Andouille sausage. Best breakfast I've ever had in my life. Hands down.   Breakfast burro equally incredible and the maple crepe also delicious. Great staff.

1SDaTE1ERu_Wew1bf0PvJg.text: There's a lot to like about Crepe Bar.  It feels "cool" inside, with an independent vibe that's a valuable commodity in suburban Phoenix.  It's bustling and noisy inside, which I enjoy but may be a negative to some.  The crepes are reasonably priced, and they come with a salad and an unexpected appetizer portion of granola.  The crepes were good but not excellent, and the portions were a little smaller than expected.  Unfortunately, during peak times, you can expect a difficult time finding a seat, and a long wait for your food.  Also, the options for non-pork eaters such as myself were limited.  This place is ideal for killing time sipping coffee on a weekend, but not for much else.

BxHN2-Vvn4Z5rYQEI1Y3uA.text: Fabulous employees, wonderful foodie menu, and amazing lattes. They started as a food truck and moved to a permanent location. Try a honey vanilla almond milk latte and a breakfast burro crepe, your taste buds will leave you craving more!

gwoPPAhj5u1N8nTHRlur0A.text: I have to agree with the other reviewers, this place is top notch. I went for breakfast this past Saturday and got the Papa K. My husband got the Smokey. Both were delicious. Excellent coffee as well. We also were given a little sample of the granola. It was a little salty for my tastes but not bad. Overall, I would say this is a great little breakfast place. It's too bad they don't have a few more tables and possibly table service (this is an order at the counter type place); however, all of the staff were really friendly and helpful. The only real negative was the location, which is unfortunately in a strip mall. I hope they have a lot of success and can afford to move to a place with some atmosphere. Regardless, I will definitely return to try the sweet crepe offerings.

33D7EU0WC42VvOxkfGH7Ew.text: Ok I must say I was not looking forward to going to this place for breakfast but my wife insisted.  However, everything changed as soon as I walked in the door.  The vibe was awesome and the place was bustling.  Although the line was long, we were greeted with menus to peruse while we waited.  The line moved incredibly fast and the team that was preparing the food was super efficient.  So, when we made it to the front I was excited to order the grand prix but found out that it was completely sold out..so me and the wifey both went with the breakfast burrito crepe and the ode to a sundae desert crepe.  Both were amazing!  I cant even put to words the joy I felt in my belly when I left this place.  If your in the area you got to check this place out...

MJPhjJl8P5ThwYXqMCVPmg.text: Was looking for a place to have lunch on Yelp last week and found the Crepe Bar!  This place is fantastic! Sweet and Savory Crepes!? Unbelievable! I think the price is just right, because it is a specialty dish so I don't have any problem paying the $7 for an amazing crepe. The First Time dessert crepe is to die for, as well as the Chicken Griddle.  Be sure to try one of the Grown Up Sodas they have in the fridge. I spoke to the owner about them and he just got them and they are fantastic! (And I'm not really a soda kinda guy)  I thoroughly recommend this place to anyone, I just found it last week and have already been there twice since and have recommended it to everyone I know!

cHVir6f7L8wZqBTJIDJRfA.text: I have been going to crepe bar for a while and still have never had anything but an amazing experience accompanied by amazing food and coffee. Every time I go in some of the employees remember my name and make me feel welcome. There is one employee named Shelby who always takes amazing care of every guest. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy good things.

eiIdGetn_hRziNzUyrsBrQ.text: This place is unique and there was a line when we got there only 10-15 minutes after opening.  The indoor tables were already full, but we shared a larger table by the door.  The place is small, but nicely painted--whoever designed (& painted!) did a great job!  But the menu is the masterpiece.  There is a savory and a sweet menu.  My friend ordered from the sweet side and I ordered from the savory side.  It was really hard to choose with so many creative combinations!  I chose the Grand Prix, which is a coffee crepe, large cubes of pork belly, small cubes of pork jowl, an "egg up" as they call it, with some maple syrup to enhance everything.  My friend got the Cherry French Toast (not the menu name-they have a much more clever name than that).  It was large enough that she shared a quarter piece of the 1" thick toast with me.  What we both noticed pretty quickly is that this kitchen likes to offset the sweet with a good dose of salt--think of salted caramel.  I ate all of mine but my friend couldn't finish hers.   By the end the flavors were almost a bit too much.  I would give them a second (& maybe a third) try though.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Grand Prix from the savory side of the menu.  Pork belly and pork jowls included.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Cherry French Toast from the sweet side of the menu.

Yq7ODaJMk5HmbPDViWh1sw.text: Wow.  We have enjoyed this place when it was mobile, mainly at the Scottsdale Farmer's Mkt. But it appears that when the wheels fell off the truck, rather than calling triple AAA, they simply set up shop with some bricks and a lil' mortar.  The nutella-banana crepe was as good as I remember, but the star was the breakfast burrito!  This burrito is now the benchmark as to which all breakfast burritos will be compared.  The crepe takes the place of the ol' flour tortilla, and boy, what an upgrade! The crepe was super delicious on its own, but then when you add fluffy eggums and mexican cheese and whatnot, man, I wanted to order a second one...   Also, the latte's were delightful!  We are sure to be back :)

Oy9JiY5RGyxQI_gOFMuDMw.text: I'm sooooo excited to found this lil gem of a resturant.  I love crepes, especially when they are good as this place.  I ordered the vanilla and strawberry crepe which was amazing.  I also ordered a vanilla iced coffee which was also very good. Highly recommend this place.  I see myself becoming a very frequent customer.

irj_dx7-QphyEvE6Krw_vw.text: First off, I'm not a breakfast person. I always skip breakfast spots because it all tastes the same to me. That being said...this place is amazing! I had no idea what to order, so I ordered the Nutella Crepe and the breakfast burrito crepe. The Nutella Crepe is mind blowing. The breakfast burrito is pretty good too, and I would definitely order it again. I'm pretty sure anything you order here is going be great, so check it out the first chance you get.

qFfFliqTxxCRM3oX91CwGA.text: "Hipster service" can be a frightening thought but the kids at The Crepe Bar must be majoring in culinary services. The atmosphere is laid back but there is nothing lazy about the quality of food and service. This isn't the regular chain style breakfast joint, as soon as the food arrives you can see it in the plating and most importantly, taste it.

OFN3g7uZz4RQU4qy_cfBpg.text: Great food at a great price!!  We got the smokey, buffalo chicken, and first-time.  Everything was outstanding but the first-time was our fav.  They close at 2:00pm so get there early.

MEscxl7IcZiWBkQJs0gDSQ.text: I am blown away from the food and service here. I believe our server was Cody. Just above and beyond with all of the extra small dishes. Each unique, delicious and described in depth by our server. It is so obvious that the staff here are into the food and drinks they are serving. And they truly want you to have an amazing time. This is my fourth time here and I never regret it.

kQCVPCYTyoi_xuiP_N6E5A.text: I can be a tough critic, but this place exceeded my expectations. A little hole in the wall of a strip mall. Ambiance is pretty bland. There was a long line to place an order - at 10:30 in the morning. And you are oddly asked to provide your tip before you have had any service at all. Don't go if you are in a hurry, but it is a wonderful place to linger with friends or a book.  Now the good news- my lemon crepe was the best I've had this side of the pond. Authentic crepe with a lovely presentation. Just the right amount of sweet and tart.  Skip the hot tea- it wasn't hot enough to properly brew. - order more crepes! I can't wait to go back!

mFnH-xmwQ8jVCO0nlq62SQ.text: This was a very nice experience. The breakfast was wonderful, and they were super kind. The crepe was very crispy and savory. They provide delicious small finger food, which was awesome. The atmosphere was good. They helped me begin the day in a very nice way.

VV8W06KBMKOhqU4OI2fu_w.text: Keeping this review super simple. It was a busy Sunday, it was expected that seat were gonna be limited. They brought out some "appetizer" that just felt out of place, super salty popcorn. The main dish were super salty and the eggs they used were not real eggs(liquid eggs). My girlfriend got food poisoning from this place.

z7OsAKzVYmtk8M3n5sjraQ.text: The ingredients inside the crepes were excellent!  Our family tried three different kinds of savory crepes and two kinds of sweet crepes.  However, the crepes themselves were underwhelming - pretty rubbery.  The further downside of this restaurant is the lack of proper ventilation.  Everyone's clothes reeked of grease by the time we left the restaurant 45 minutes later.  Had to change my clothes when I returned home.  Super bummed to see this highly rated place have the quality of its namesake be average and ventilation so poor that you have to change after eating there.

uVlA5R5uHRwQ0Tyg6k5ZBw.text: I visited this place for lunch with the excitement of trying some savory crepes and was highly disappointed.  The drip coffee was served lukewarm and when asked if they could heat it up, I was advise that when coming late in the day (12:40pm), they will not be brewing a new batch.  Awkward as it seems, wouldn't drip coffee be made fresh and served to individuals as ordered?  Not to mentioned, when you offer only a select number of beverages, you would think the quality would be good not mediocre. The guy did offer me an Americano (also served lukewarm) and not good at all. As for my lunch; I had the burro and it was bland, nothing spectacular and I was still hungry 30 minutes later.  Let it be known, I did add the potato on the side  for an additional cost and to my surprise, I could count on my fingers how many pieces were served.  Next time, I'll donate a bag of potatoes from Fry's and maybe I can get 1/2 a cut of potato. This hippy, small joint was busy but I'm not sure why as the food was not very good and the service was slow.

XEwJnyyAGwfAhG2nF4hBSQ.text: NIGHTMARE. Poorly designed. Poorly organized. Disastrous dining experience. But the food . . . Dammit the food is good. Less hipster service, more ambiance, and no screaming children would make this place a winner.

BhBT-MHDTvZwQhoFZiP-TQ.text: One word: phenomenal.  The crepes are so good- all of them!  Not a huge fan of their coffee, but the crepes are da bomb!

HpxNqCNdAe-Sm4BQfJLuLw.text: Went here a few months ago and tried their savory crepes. Nothing special. Is the hype due to their sweet crepes? Don't think I ll be going back to try them

IJ0FLOahmLXqjqupeZfLUA.text: The Crepe Bar must be doing something right, since it was crowded.  The food was acceptable, but not exceptional.  The crepes ordered (Maple Butter and Tiramisu) were crepes with topping on top, not wrapped within as one normally does for a crepe.  We waited 20 minutes or so for the crepes to come out, and the presentation of the crepes seemed rushed--toppings were just sort of dumped on top of the folded crepe, like it was prepared by someone in a rush.  I suspect they did not have a kitchen floorspace or staff adequate to meet demand.    The staff was friendly and considerate and the decor was pleasant.    While not terrible, it was not really worth the wait or the price.  I doubt I will go back.

ryU5OekCV5X8Tyi_F92mHA.text: Glad I found this awesome new breakfast spot! Great customer service and even better food!

w5VXL3R7duw_bn8dU2gfZw.text: Holy Crepe...this place is amazing!    My friend and I came in and were dazzled by the friendly staff and delighted by the gourmet crepes.  She got the papa k with ham, pepper jack and mushrooms and I got the veggie stack. The expertly prepared high quality ingredients resulted in hard core multiple crepegasms.  We wrapped up our crepe escape with the vanilla bean custard crepe served with berries. They won't give it to you to go but stop crying and just eat it there - it's totally worth the 5 minutes.   I suspect the ambiance in this place is pretty cute but I was so hypnotized by what was happening in my mouth (and a hot chef) that I can't really remember much about the decor.  Even if these crepes were being served out of a dumpster I'd still be back to try everything on the menu.

XxLN26vOZfBVEFHJZf4fxQ.text: Two visits here and you haven't let me down. Small and busy on weekend mornings but so friendly and your servers are incredible. Thanks for the tidbits while we were waiting last week. Really tasty stuff! The crepes are divine. I love to share one savory and one sweet crepe with my hubby - quite a nice treat. The lemon sugar is amazing. Best crepes around, period!

ljHjhqK7DUCvFPZNceD5Tw.text: closed for remodelling until the end of june 2016.   went there today and a little pissed that after viewing the website that there was nothing telling us they are closed for remodelling.   a wasted drive from gilbert and no crepes for me!

L6gCeeA9uY3Cu4gj3emXWw.text: Took my friend from Maryland here this morning for breakfast. We had the breakfast burrito and one with mushroom ragu and horseradish cheese. Omg so good. My son had the Nutella stuffed crepes and those were amazing. My friend and I split the Lemon Drop crepe. By far my favorite thing on the emu, sweet, tangy and just damn tasty.

JD9qmcHek0Jf2OINJlKyMA.text: Love this place, food is great people are nice, service is 5 star why go anywhere else on sat, sun mourning. My fav are CB cereal, burrito and any of the crepes they serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buckwheat crepe FTW

rSeBpjRBFHzzWIrmgJ9HRw.text: This day for $5 I paid for a lemon crepe, this included a dollar tip.  As a collective they gave me a piece of art, a total experience of excellence in a craft.  -A Joyous Lemon Crepe Danced Before Me & In My Mouth  Display 5 stars Taste 5 stars Atmosphere 5 stars Hospitality 5 stars Specialty Coffee 5 stars

ceAk6ty6dtoTRO4qgSHCvA.text: Tried it with girl friends and came back the next week! Love love love the Vanilla Bean Custard crepe, it's mine and my boyfriends normal  Tuesday morning spot now! Light filling crepe with a nice latte:)

4tR6lzgVlNSw7p0_7xsWlw.text: Absolutely the best crepes I've ever had. Many creative twists to even the most traditional crepe. The Buckwheat crepe is such a brilliant creation. The mustard enhances the taste of the chunky mushroom melted in Havarty. Every bite is like the first...  heavenly.   *Fist bump* Crepe Bar!

8GeGNfSoxzWk4GEkI6ajpw.text: The atmosphere is casual and fun, love the light boxes on the wall.  The vanilla cream crepes with caramel are delicious.  It was also one of the best Americans I've ever had, so great coffee beans.  Would love to see what the do with a cappuccino!  Great place to take visitors.

vOiUpEvzxQOFCH5RtdxUCg.text: outstanding breakfast- We arrived on a Sunday morning at about 9:25ish.  While you are in line watch to see what dishes are being delivered in order to make your selection.  Be prepared for a long wait in the order line (10-25 min) and a long wait to receive your order (30-40 min).    This is not Burger King.  The food is fresh and made from scratch so it takes time.  The food was so fresh that I was trying to peek in the kitchen to see if they were harvesting the veggies, milking a cow, and picking eggs from under the chickens.  We ordered the Papa K with scrambled eggs and an entree with chipotle crepes.  Both were incredibly good and served hot.  The coffee was good but I do wish that they offered decaf.  There were quite a few kids there and I did not hear any complaints from them.  We sat outside and it was chilly (ok, it was about 59 degrees.  You get spoiled with the weather.)  For you with small dogs, we saw a water dish outside so I presume that they are dog friendly although we did not see any.  If you are not in a rush to dine, you will be very pleased with the quality of the food.

d76MwEtxCtJNrWYwnU4lgw.text: Went for breakfast this morning and they have the most amazing crepes here. It was delicious! Definitely going to be coming back.

Nub-eN0dhgY1fs3jrnzygQ.text: A quick comment on Laura's soda dislike - I tried the Gus Dry Cola today.  It is definitely different from classic Coke.  Made with cola bean extract, caramel, and cane syrup, it has good flavor and is less sweet.  95 calories per bottle.  Yes, it is different, but a premium product.    I had their brulee desert crepe today.  Tasty mildly sweet crepe with caramelized sugar on top.  Nice.  But, they also served some sliced strawberries, a few blueberries and some candied orange peel as a garnish.  One thing common to all the dishes I have sampled is they are a little better than I thought possible.    Strawberries taste pretty bland these days.  I use to pick strawberries at a local "you pick it" farm.  Most of the fresh red strawberries never made it into my bucket.  The days of finding great tasting strawberries that you did not personally grow are over.    At Crepe Bar, the commercial strawberries are infused with flavor by processing in a vacuum (sous vide) with simple syrup, vanilla and other spices.  Result, great tasting strawberries.   And, the blueberries were pickled.  Lots of wow factor.    Expect food that tastes a little better than you thought possible at the Crepe Bar.

QvJsNiO2DdPMS2PAZbTrtw.text: I love sweet crepes.  Picked up my mom from the airport, and went to try this place. Being a small restaurant, guests are to stand in line and order at the register with a girl using an iPad.  I saw on the online menu, sugar crepe, with optional $0.50 added for strawberries.  She said I cannot pay extra for the strawberries on the sugar crepe, and I must purchase the vanilla bean crepe for the strawberries.  I didn't want the vanilla creme.  (But I'm glad I did, because it was delicious.)  The problem is, they gave us a small bowl of popcorn (like 8 popcorns...) that were soggy, cold, and UNBELIEVABLY SALTY.  My mom ate it first, and told me they were salty.  So I tried, and within a micro second, I spit it out into my hand.  Revolting; it was unbearable.  I went up to the counter to return those awful popcorn, and let them know it's absolutely inedible.  I got myself some napkins and cups of water (ALL SELF SERVICE, btw).  Then, they brought out a bowl with TWO potato chips.  TWO pieces.  And, it had the SAME seasoning as those disgusting popcorns.  Scared to try, but bit into it; immediately spitted out.  I mean, we didn't ask for these.  Please don't offer nasty freebies.  Don't these people have any taste buds???  Then, the breakfast burrito crepe.  Nasty, with sour garnish.  I wanted to return the item but my mother was trying to be nice and told me it was okay.  It was extremely salty again.  Seriously, the chef's tongue must've been under anesthesia.  The bacon tasted horribly artificial.  Extremely soggy texture, really disgusting.  I must say though, the vanilla crepe was pleasant.  (As I'm reading others' reviews here, I would also be really pissed off if they were out of it.)  Seriously does not make sense that they cannot charge us to add strawberries. Maybe I should order sugar crepes, go to a grocery store & pick up some berries, and eat at home.  NAH, NOT WORTH visiting again.  Oh yea, and the amount of food on the plate is smaller than the size of your hand, for about $8 including tax & tip.  (Someone here wrote it's cheap.  WTF?) I wish I had not tipped but already had, as you have to pay when you order in the line before receiving any service.  Oh wait what service?  There was no service other than delivering the food.  Might as well make us pick up the food at the counter too.  Why bother having servers when we have to order in line, pick up napkins, and fetch drinks ourselves?  And, it is very very noisy inside.  I don't understand the 4.5 stars.  Are they trying to be hip & trendy?  I've had various fine dining.  This ain't it; only looks stupid & pretentious.

8ixtlXHXbb1eIsOaezobSg.text: Two stars strictly for the cute atmosphere and friendly girl at the register. My friends and I waited 45 minutes for our crepes! After 25 minutes of waiting, we asked how much longer and the lady said 3 minutes when we actually waited 20 more. People who got there way after us were getting their food before we did My friend also approached another server who was completely rude about it. Unacceptable.

vnZ4DEN8zsF7Cf8knP9C3A.text: All I have to say is wow the food is absolutely amazing, I never thought I would find a good crape bar here in Arizona.

i1e0D-DhCMRInKHcYRiyuQ.text: Huuuuuge fan of their crepes, especially the savory ones. I can't even chose just one, all crepes I've tried are nothing short of perfect! The little nibbles that come before the meal are always brilliant! Today I had the blistered peppers and never knew peppers could taste that good! Anything that comes out of this kitchen is exceptional! Their coffee beverages are carefully and skillfully crafted with high quality ingredients!

hcskVLhhDRooydUg8ttNKQ.text: I went here and had a five minute conversation with the girls at the front about how to order my crepe to accommodate my lactose intolerance. They gave me some good advice about which ones would taste best without cheese. I also ordered a glass of almond milk. I chugged half of the glass of what I thought was going to be almond milk, only to set down a glass of regular cow's milk. I spent the rest of the day in agony. They also took 30 minutes to make my crepe, and my friend's crepe that was suppose to have duck on it was made with beef. This place is NOT allergy friendly. I will absolutely never be back.

wyaFB7kw23WVXLl5o-CxBQ.text: The good: The staff is super friendly, even though service is limited (counter service, drink station, food delivery only). It was hopping - not necessarily full to bursting, but with a steady stream of people - when we visited and our food took a long time to get to us. They brought out a bowl of housemade granola for us to munch on while we were waiting. It was a gorgeous day outside and we brought games with us. No hurry, but thank you for looking out for us.   You have to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom, so I'm also assuming big group assembly here is tough because they don't have a ton of space.  The menu isn't super expensive but you don't get the portion sizes you would ordering breakfast from a diner or sandwich place, either. An order of potatoes (for a $1.00 upcharge) granted us about sixteen centimeter cubes of potato sprinkled over the crepe. Boo.   The breakfast burro is very salty. The bacon is salty, there's definitely seasoning in the crepe itself and in the eggs. And then the plate is sprinkled with flake salt. That was too much. There was very little of the avocado inside, as well. Now, what it has it in is awesome. It didn't feel like an accurate description.  The drip coffee was nice - they were advertising Ethiopian so I'm assuming that's what I got. Slightly fruity. The only sweetener available was Truvia - I hadn't tried it before and it works differently than other sweeteners. (Not a problem just an observation.)  I may see you again, Crepe Bar. You're a short jog from the highway and both the dog and people watching was nice.

zWG3s-CONMZsyvWCxkJxlg.text: The food was good and the staff was aces/first class! They definitely need to do something about their seating. At busy times, which seems to be most of the time, there's a good chance you'll get your food before you get a seat. Also just a simple order numbering system would help the staff get the food to your table smoother.   Again, can't say enough about the staff...friendly, inviting, and professional.   I would give them a better score if they got the seating figured out. Expand maybe, rearrange the space? It's bad enough to where if we walked up and saw it was busy then we would go somewhere else....the food is worth the wait though!

Sq5-9Gs0Mh5NJVGmanAxRQ.text: Dude. If you haven't been to Crepe Bar - you need to get off your butt right now and check it out! Holy deliciousness Batman! Cute little place, pretty convenient location, SUPER friendly staff, ah-mayyyyy-zing food! I can't list ALL my faves, but I will say the Papa K is fantastic, as is the Smokey (and the First Time if you want something sweet). Every visit has been nothing short of fantastic, which is why we keep going back. Also try their coffee (yummy mocha for your sweet tooth) - and cookies/scones/etc are YUMMY!   GO! NOW!! You can thank me later.

PrCEQHN1hwf05QHaeRUAjA.text: One of my favorite places in Tempe, I get really good vibes here, all of the staff are friendly and the owner is great! You can order anything off the menu and pretty much be amazed by it. I am upset for 1 reason though, after having a vanilla latte here I can no longer enjoy a latte from other places, it isn't the same! I wish I lived a bit closer to Crepe bar, but when I go it is always a great treat! I recently had a meet-up here: youtube.com/watch?v=m9xB... Thank you for your superb customer service :)

rENuvi4jt2xBIgpFOF0gFg.text: That person you just woke up next to and want to impress with some international-local fare? Check Crepe Bar.  The first thing you'll probably notice are the decorations. Some nice maison-style blues and whites are all over the place, along with plenty of room to walk around this little home next to P. Croissant bakery.   I had the breakfast burro. It comes in a chipotle crepe which even has the same color as the sauce. Decent prices (although...they are crepes, take that remark how you will) and excellent service. Some dude came by and blessed our table with some house made granola which was salty as hell but a nice touch nonetheless.   Apparently the coffee is awesome, I didn't get a chance to try it because I skipped my morning poo and thought it best to skip.

hpl8013d-lpT4VFEH0AJ3Q.text: Absolutely amazing food and reasonable prices.  They recently enlarged their place!  Go early & often!

6fLqfmPRFR7MVSc_0tI56g.text: Best service, food and coffee out there. My crepe was beyond amazing, the vanilla latte was amazingly perfect and tasted like the beans had just been roasted. The burro crepe was so so good. They brought a free appetizer and dessert. great place for an amazing $13 breakfast. I would have paid $30 for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Marshmallow dessert. Fantastic
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burro crepe

pO87OTh7PnQCS3T2JsgrzA.text: I am a little bit obsessed with The Crepe Bar!!!!!! Their food is incredible, I am never let down. Their coffee is the best that I have had in Arizona. The people that work here make the experience all the more enjoyable. They are attentive to detail and even though it's usually a packed house they never make you feel like they are overwhelmed or rushed to move on to the next guest. They always bring out a unexpected appetizer while you are waiting for your food!   They have so many delicious food options that my boyfriend and I can never order just two things... It's always three! One savory and two sweet!   My favorite way to start the day.

bfLouZyD2uT-rZ2az4dyIg.text: I love this place and I wish I lived closer. This would be my breakfast choice every morning. I love the layout, menu and the staff is super friendly and awesome! I really want to buy the tea that they provide as a check in item. Can't go wrong with this place.

i1Aps_fSRFPL66UaUoeYoQ.text: AMAZING crepes. Great service. Went on a weekday and we got there around 10am right before their rush. We got free green tea cake while we waited for our food. I got the pick me up (coffee crepe). It was SOO yummy! I felt like I was eating a piece of heaven. Then, afterward they gave us complimentary cookies and milk in a real 50 mL beaker! Definitely would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Milk and cookies!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pick me up. Best crepe ever!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummr green tea cakes

Hs5GHPvj1YrgIq60DDSymA.text: Very DISAPPOINTED!!! I do not think I am going back for a while. I was so excited for them. I have been a big fan before their construction. The food this morning was terrible. They gave me a crispy crape (very hard and a little bit burn) after I waited for an hour. I went there at 7am to avoid the wait. I do not understand why it took so long when there was only few people waiting for food. I asked for a exchange. They just redo the crepe and gave me the old meat and egg on the top of the new crepe. Therefore, the pork belly and egg are cold. The pork belly is very dry and too salty. Also, pancetta is missing from my plate. My husband got a DLT. It is very very very salty. The chocolate cookie is very dry too. The coffee is too sour. The portion is a lot smaller than before the construction too. I really do not enjoy today breakfast. I hope it is just a temporary thing.

UPdqxDyHbbxCIaEhHOwWfA.text: Cute place and good food! Seating is limited, go early or during the day.

L60kTGFKctzWigBYsrcLpA.text: I continue to be a believer in yelp. Believe everything you read about Crepe Bar! I took my teenage boys who were a little skeptical. Breakfast Burro won them over!  I had the Smoked Turkey. Would go again in the morning if the fam would let me. We finished it with a First Timer and a Vanilla Bean Custard. I'm telling you the flavors the chef incorporates into these concoctions is ART!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Converted teenagers

-siAUnH1Ut1sDoJEhyqd9g.text: Love this place very clean and such a great service supper yummy  the waiters and cashier are very attentive and great always its such a great environment in there and ull love their food

28Nnn8lwKXeroRAB7DI5uQ.text: Good food, but absolutely painstakingly slow. On a not too busy day my sit down food order took 35 minutes(3 crepes and a toast) finish eating and have to wait another 25 minutes and remind them that I am still waiting for my single crepe to go.  Good food but not good enough to deal with the hectic dining area and very slow service

or7jNaXU7WIgfknInBEyDQ.text: just stopped by for breakfast this morning. was pleasantly surprised with the staff, cool atmosphere and great tasting crepe. I had the lemon grass herbal tea and a savory breakfast crepe. the Chipotle salt was great while the complimentary chocolate was the perfect final touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. morning crepe...yum

_pXByDc96HnaCE9y5rxl9Q.text: Had the Pick Me Up crepe because everything in it was basically made out of coffee. Pretty good stuff. The coffee itself was pretty good as well. Expect to wait a bit for your food since it takes some time to make a crepe.

6wANMS7DekojDRcUJxtEXQ.text: Free refills on coffee but they only brew one at a time, so if you want variety this isn't the place. Walnut spiced scone with great homemade flavor and received a complimentary sample of granola. Indoor and outdoor seating but this place is on the small side. Also, they are closed Mondays.  All in all, a first good experience. Will have to come back for the crepes!

YYQr2-tVHfiBPvwkdSkQEw.text: Very friendly staff and amazing food!  So glad we found this gem.  And don't forget to pick up some of their house granola on your way out.  Delicious!

Cza5ZOyzH18oOfZREVlbeA.text: I haven't been here. Made this review on accident. There's no option to delete a review so this is now stuck up here.

zcMphFEhATk5oeblhVst8A.text: This is my favorite place to come eat in the morning in Tempe. Best Crepe's I have ever had! The staff is very welcoming and friendly, the food comes out within 5-10 minutes every time and is always cooked to perfection. 100% recommend it!

McG59wEACwW9Ceo8H09vMQ.text: Would have given this a 5 star if there was more seating and maybe a tad more a selection of crepes.   We came on father's day and had no problem getting a table.  The crepes were wonderful. We had the Papa-k, buckwheat honey, sobasada,Tahitian vanilla and second time. Nothing but delicious and satisfying. I also ordered the Tahitian vanilla maple latte iced. MMMMMMM.  Staff has received some negative reviews, but I have nothing but praise for the staff and food.

jaDkZPWZWhIzVumntVbH3Q.text: Food was excellent. Lattes just ok. Service the best., so why only a 4 star?  Find your own table. Stand in line to order your meal. For 5 stars, I want to have a waiter take my order. A bit spendy for breakfast but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Latte. Very pretty, not hot enough and light on flavor.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito with chipotle sauce
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean crepe with strawberries and pastachios

nzEgDBd2-HTnF2hO2vbL5w.text: OMG that food is amazing. I got the chorizo breakfast crepe burrito. So amazing. Lattes are amazing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

eO6bD6pMJuBLe4t5iFBfhQ.text: I went here for brunch today and it was a neat little place but the food was just a little above average.  First they give you a small bowl of granola, which tasted salty to me but it tasted better on top of my crepe.  I ordered a vanilla bean crepe which is a large crepe, chopped up strawberries, candied pistachios, vanilla bean cream on the side and a big dot of caramel. It wasn't bad but it wasn't amazing either.   I came in around 10am and it looked like every table was taken but luckily I found 1 table inside that was available.   The setup is you order and pay first then you go pick your seat and the person looks for your number to deliver your food.

LqCV9sNWkZv1_fXQZzIhrQ.text: This is a follow up review and one I am more than happy to submit: Really glad to see the expansion to the restaurant; food is just as amazing as it has been the past few years since I was introduced. I am there every Wednesday as it is a pick up location for my vegetable box from Steadfast Farm and I want to thank them for that service. Thanks! Coffee is just as amazing as the food and the service has been really improved upon. On more than one occasion, a small plate of food is brought before me as a snack by the chefs in the kitchen. I like surprise snacks that are delicious. Who does this?! To be fair, I frequent during off peak times so be prepared for a full house on the weekends. Prices are reasonable and portions are plenty. Enjoy!

tgzkZL19r0ixrtWsFHy1PQ.text: Bravo! My husband and I are restaurateurs here in Tempe, have one day off per week, and chose Crepe Bar as our Sunday destination.   What to expect: An interesting space aesthetically, clean and well organized. Counter service is located toward the back of the restaurant. One, slightly awkward jont toward the back, and you will be greeted warmly by the cashier, handed a menu, and invited to stand in line.  We took our order to-go, so whilst waiting, observed a VERY well-run kitchen, wait staff, barista and FOH staff. Upon dining in our home, enjoyed the creative take on what we know as a crepe (The Burrito and Jamaican Jerk), which was super delicious! Congrats on a great restaurant. We'll be back!

1BSR753aOH2evGkihZEKfg.text: I meant to write this review last week, but totally forgot and then realized that I owed them a beautiful review.   From the moment my wife and I came, we were greeted with a smiling face and delicious coffee. We said that we had never been before and she explained the menu and we were on our way.  Two crepes and a donut later. Not to mention the included granola, cookie bites, and Nutella toast, it was the way customer service was dreamed to be.   I kept telling my wife, "no way this place is this friendly." But it was and I was so happy about. Come one, come all!

BCyFa6NNqe_7bik4Uhp8mQ.text: Best crepes in the valley!!  Had the Buckwheat crepe with Lemon Curd, it was amazing.  My wife had the Vanilla Crepe with Carmel and Strawberries.

oiOj60piunmXy3T9W31zkQ.text: Really great brunch/breakfast spot.   Had a latte with a breakfast burro. The latte was perfect; I think they source their coffee from Heart Roasters in PDX. Breakfast burro was also delicious. We were also served Complimentary granola and pork rinds.   Love the concept and awesome service.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burro.

IVX5XoFngE2kjq90MdEPmA.text: I can't say enough about this place. I've never had anything here I didn't like. Most (if not all) of their ingredients are locally grown which I love. Today I ordered the vegetable crepe and lemon drop crepe. The vegetable crepe has seasonal, local veggies topped with a delicious crispy cheese topper. The lemon drop crepe came with a lemon curd sauce that had just the right amount of lemon flavor.   The staff is always super friendly and even give you something to snack on while you wait for your food. This is a restaurant to go to when you're not in a rush (especially on the weekend) because it's pretty small and usually busy. But totally worth the wait. We only waited about 20 minutes for our food today even though it was crowded. Their coffee is also great. I usually get a honey latte and it's perfect! I'd go here every weekend if my wallet and waistline could tolerate it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegetable crepe and Andouille sausage crepe
