LzXdCH7WJpls7-NNsuVyEg.text: The Crepe Bar was a nice find on the go.  We enjoyed the food and my wife loved the Iced Chai Tea.  She had Crepes and I had a burrito.  Both were very good.  A little pricy for what you got but want outlandishly.  My only complaint was the noise in the restaurant as the room echoed and it was difficult to carryon a conversation.

MKh59LHIINPkATRTu6wtHw.text: The Sausage Burrito was so amazing and just the right spice that my spice free friend still enjoyed her meal. We also shared the Lemon and I guess from the description I was expecting more filling but still a nice tart treat. The Honey latte was perfect and they do carry Almond Milk. The staff created us at the door with a menu when we walked in even though you order from the counter so that was a nice touch and we got complimentary granola. Also a very modern space.

NRVLnAYHSj88NKhPMrN_sA.text: Crepe bar is so hipster it hurts. The walls are brightly colored, which I enjoyed a lot, but along one side was a series of illustrations depicting... a person? I think? Regardless, the environment was very modern and made good use of a fairly small space. I would have preferred chairs with backs to stools, but that wasn't by any means the end of the world.   I had the cheesecake crepe ($7.50), and my friend had the nutella and banana ($5.50). My crepe wasn't bad, but I would have preferred a little more of the cheesecake filling. It was good, but not anything spectacular; I was expecting a lot more from this place based on the other Yelp reviews that I've read. I didn't have any of the nutella and banana crepe, but my friend complained multiple times that it was overwhelmingly sweet -this coming from a girl who happily eats nutella straight out of the jar.   I had the heart drip coffee because you get one for free if you check in on Yelp, and I was not a fan. I feel like a place like this should have some pretty solid coffee to accompany the crepes and pastries they serve, but it was mediocre at best.   Overall, it was a pretty standard experience. It wasn't bad, but also not anything mindblowing. Next time, I'll probably just stick to P. Croissant right next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheesecake crepe

T7vrxtxFl7kMebZuktnLUQ.text: This place is seriously yummy! My boyfriend came here a few weeks ago to try a unique breakfast.  I ordered the Grand Prix and a cappuccino. They were both delicious. The cappuccino was served in a cute cup and of course had a nice little design on the top. The Grand Prix is a pork lovers dream. The crepe itself is good but the real star of the show is the pork belly.  It is so tender, sweet, and succulent. And the maple sauce just takes it over the edge. Luckily the portion isn't too big or else you would probably go into a coma after eating this much deliciousness.  My boyfriend had the first time and really loved it. Bananas and Nutella, can't really go wrong. Both crepes were presented beautifully and we even got a free treat to snack on while we waited for our food.   I would highly recommend this cute and tasty cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lovely cappuccino

AcIT75VfWsEdHHZrkvckmQ.text: Wanted to try something different for breakfast and decided to stop by. The service was very good, he explained the menu and made some recommendations. We also got a little sample from the chef. After we got our food, he checked on us and our coffee was refilled quickly.   While we waited we shared the "mole" cookie which was super yummy with the coffee. Try if you can.   Tried two savory crepes- Breakfast Burro and the Grand Prix. This is the first time I had a savory crepe, just a little FYI. The hubby liked the Grand Prix and would have again. I also enjoyed the burro, except that the menu said it had bacon. There was some "sprinkles" in there, and maybe some with the eggs but not enough to taste or see it. I would have the chorizo instead and no potatoes. I wanted a lot more of those too.   I would go back... I have to try the sweet crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla Latte--- yumm
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix

deYhi7f3DCcTPUz1XdPCrQ.text: I adored this place. It's cute. They offer free wifi. I had the Guatemalan roast and the buckwheat Lemon Curd & Pecan crepe and couldn't get enough of either. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the atmosphere was a great place to work. I will be coming back here frequently!

f9378726coFxEpMCr--hDQ.text: One of my favorite places to go on the days I actually wake up in time for breakfast/ brunch. Their crepes are original and full of bold flavors. I like that you can always distinguish each ingredient when you take a bite. Having said that, some times the combination can get a like too salty for my taste like in the smoked turkey crepe. The chorizo and the gouda are a good combo but the smokiness of the gouda adds to the saltiness of the chorizo. But this is one of the few places I have found that does the savory crepes right.   The sweet crepes are awesome with the combination of simple toppings with a twist. My favorite is the vanilla bean with the nut du jour. I also love the fact that most of the time they come around with some of their in-house cereal for you to snack on while you get your food, as well as a small dessert to try.  Next on my list is to try the Grand Prix crepe which they only serve 7am-11am. Either they sell out or I'm too late, but I am determined to try it eventually.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Strawberry Crepe

cTowADBaNFLQ6vMemRmLnQ.text: Once again, I'm reminded of a place I visited and that I enjoyed, but allowed to drop off my food radar. I guess for a while I traveled so much last year that it's not too hard to imagine I'd forget about a few places. I remember my first 2 stops in to the brick and mortar of what used to be Trucking Good Food. I really did enjoy the food. Almost a year since my last visit and today was no different. I stopped in today for a lunch, solo. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken savory crepe and I also ordered the Sugar/Bruleed Crepe just to have a taste. The Buffalo chicken crepe yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... was sided with a shaved pickled carrot mixture. I don't eat a lot of "bready" foods, but by gholly, this is one dish that I can just dig into. The buffalo-blue cheese sauce was delicious. Not as spicy as I like, but still good and definitely not to salty as some sauces like this can be. The sauce was not in a quantity to make the dish messy and hide the texture of the crepe. The crepe was delicate and thin and moist. I loved it. it would have been nice to have some fresh bleu cheese with it though. I should have gotten something on my sweet crepe. I thought the Sugar Crepe would be a little sweeter. Still, it was delicious for a small taste of something sweet after lunch with a cup of coffee. yelp.com/biz_photos/crep... I discovered that the Crepe bar now carries Hayden Flour Mills products. The fact that this company is attempting to bring back native grains to AZ is a great story. If you're not familiar, check it out. haydenflourmills.com You can buy some of their products at CB now. My last review still stands!!!! Where are the duck fat fries? I did ask about the, but it looks like there is no plan to bring them back. I have to monitor Facebook and Twitter to find out if they are on special. which pretty much means, I probably won't have theirs again. *sad face*

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sugar/Brûléed Crepê
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buffalo Chicken Savory Crepe.

jDDbIqhgj5-GPB903gB4_w.text: The atmosphere right when you walk in is warm and   inviting. The decor is modern and youthful. It was a busy Sunday but we didn't have to wait too long. They have a little coffee bar to the side of the cashier. I ordered the Burrito and a caramel sea salt iced latte. While we waited a small sampler of granola was given to our table. It was amazing, very sweet but I have a bit of a sweet tooth myself. Soon the barista called out our names and we went and picked up our drinks. The latte was pretty good, however I couldn't taste the caramel or sea salt very well. The espresso wasn't very strong either. Not too much longer I received my crepe. The presentation was beautiful! Again it tasted pretty good, although I thought the flavor of the chorizo was a bit lacking. With more avocado, and perhaps some pico to brighten the flavor palette the plate would be a lot yummier. There was also a sauce on the plate mainly for presentation, but it was amazing! I wish there was more on the crepe itself. Next time I'll try a sweeter crepe.

Ly4gM_papPytn5m93CKAEQ.text: So i'm not a crepe person, however, this place is a game changer! My friend recommended the Grand Prix and, luckily, I gave it a try.  Grand prix - coffee crepe, pork belly, espresso maple, chili aioli, egg up. It's rich and VERY VERY FLAVORFUL. The pork belly was cooked perfectly and the hint of sweet from the maple and accents of coffee makes it the best crepe I've ever had! If I'm anywhere in the Phoenix area, I'm going to make a pit stop here for the Grand Prix crepe!  The brioche is housemade and sooo good! Also highly recommend the French Toast Brioche: caramelized apples & figs, pure maple, whipped cream. It's not overly sweet and the figs are sooo perfectly matched to the bread. Yummy!  My friend really enjoyed her sweet crepe. She's had a several and says they're all good.

G6lYS2AedP0v07f9i1BULw.text: Amazing! This place is a gem! I've never had anything bad here! Chorizo burrito is fire and so are the sweet crepes!

nUplF8IzCM2Li6O7sTzmyw.text: Simply the best! Migas are delicious. They have the fluffiest scramble eggs ever. Lemon crepe for a sweet treat. Love this place

iYLSAvNB39In0r1TVXh9jw.text: Yum! And love the options! Had the cheesy egg, avocado and black bean savory crepe made with chickpea batter, the vanilla bean sweet crepe, and yogurt and homemade granola. It is awesome that they have gluten free options and the coffee is serve yourself with free refills. My friend had the chilaquiles. They were tasty but she didnt know the crepe would by crunchy. My chickpea batter crepe was a bit chewy, but the regular batter vanilla crepe was perfect and oh so good! I recommend getting here earlier. We arrived at 10 and didnt have to wait in line. From about 10:30 - 11 on Sunday, the line was practically out the door. We also got lucky finding a table. It is seat yourself. There wasnt too much hovering though, people seemed to move quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean crepes
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles....so yummy forgot to take a picture first.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheesy egg, avocado and black bean crepe with chickpea batter.

w3gZ2cEl6D7Azhym-eSjkw.text: I'm a stingy reviewer. I think long and hard about 5 stars and whether a recipient is truly worthy of the best possible grade. And here, not much pause was needed.   This place is drool worthy. From the moment we arrived, with the smiling attention (verging on too friendly) while we stood in line trying to absorb all the various options and their detailed descriptions, we knew this would be a memorable experience. We decided on the coffee Crepe with pork belly and the chilaquiles as our savory dishes, and the mission fig Crepe for the sweet.   While waiting, they dropped off free samples of their homemade granola. Brilliant marketing move!! This granola is sooooo out of the world. All 3 of us decided to each purchase a bag to savor later at home. I'm still enjoying my bag and wish I had picked up more. Note to self for next time.   The pork belly with coffee was an amazing combo. Slightly earthy combo and the belly was oh so tender. The chilaquiles was tasty and novel in that they fried up the crepe so that it was crispy "chips". I'm drooling as I remember eating these. Finally, the fig Crepe was just as amazing on the opposite end. Not too sweet, lovely dollops of local honey, and generous with the figs.   I can't wait to take the fam here. It's worth many, many more visits.

FT0EAZrsh7hDhDYBzqIY0Q.text: Great good and excellent service by the team here. Love it when you start your morning by being welcomed with a smile in the restaurant.   I had a cortado and avocado toast. Delicious. They also served a sample of their homemade granola and a splash of almond milk. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

FBG_2mzCSovD1GO-Hk4OBQ.text: This place is adorable! I met up with some girlfriends here recently on a search for good coffee and conversation. Both were had in this quaint little shop in south Tempe!   I found them thanks to Yelp and their redic amount of reviews. It definitely is busy on the weekends, mostly in part to their limited seating and popularity. I arrived a little early to grab seats and luckily was able to get a table for us. One of the employees greeted me as I sat down, and cleaned off the table because I staked claim right after the former claimants got up. The ordering line definitely skews toward long, but it's worth it!   The cold brew is not bottomless, but if you ask for a few cups of ice, you can always make their bottomless hot coffee a cold option. As much as I loved my burrito crepe [dat chorizo tho], I had severe FOMO looking at my friends inhaled ate their sweet crepes.   We were making plans to return as we left - it was that great! Definitely a good place for coffee, breakfast, or even dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. You can get cold brew, or ask for a cup of ice and get their hot coffee
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burrito breakfast crepe! So good.

Ql2Mrw7Z0u7FppxuIFo0ew.text: The food is outstanding. Along with a great service and atmosphere... it's a neighborhood gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

WqlRikrA2LSW9ofvJMDxFA.text: Completely and utterly obsessed with the Crepe Bar! Every item on the menu is delicious! It's a bit of a hike for me- so I have to plan it into the weekend. It's well worth the trip.  On weekends: get there early in order to beat the crowds. The space is tiny, thus seating is limited   Coffee: Heart coffee  I cant wait to keep going back and seeing which new crepe they come up with.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amazing crepe&#39;s and breakfast!

TNV4qZuzd5ezpuJLs3rfPw.text: The crepes are very tasty with creative ingredients that are not run-of-the-mill. Presentation is definitely top notch. My favorites are the Papa K and the Grand Prix. Not a lot of portion but nice quality. It's cool that they have local artists' art for sale but that is the art Decour on the walls. It's on of our favorite neighborhood breakfast spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

wAd8Z0Na28t97tVU79WqJQ.text: Oh my goodness this place rocks. We got 3 different crepes to share and were happily surprised with the different variety of vegetarian options. The service was good and we enjoyed the ambiance- but were most impressed with the granola given as an app.

cz0Qcld_5gcrF6rmN89LkQ.text: Love this place for a unique breakfast. Only wish they could brew some decaf coffee or espresso.

nZ_P-ZoTSqEVP9Z3opwyIA.text: We visited the Crepe Bar on a Saturday morning shortly after opening. When we arrived, there were only a couple other groups. Presumably they become much busier later in the morning.  We ordered at the counter, picked an empty table, and then had a couple small appetizers brought out. We weren't expecting the additional dishes but really enjoyed the tempura bread. We had also ordered one of the bread with figs and honey and it was a good combination of sweet with a little savory.  I ordered the chorizo chipotle crepe burrito and my husband had the paprika chicken crepe. Neither of us loved our crepes - maybe we're not savory crepe people. Service was excellent, I enjoyed the ambiance, and the bread dishes were both good. 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loved the interior.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chorizo chipotle crepe burrito
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Paprika chicken crepe

4LHbTVMO7rZfwmLTYTUsvQ.text: We always plan to try new places for breakfast every time. After reading several reviews we finalized on this one for our weekend breakfast.   The outer appearance looks like a regular store but the inside is really cute cafe interior. The walls have nice paintings of coffee and dessert landscape.   There was a waiting line to order and it was fast paced so didn't wait long and the service was pretty quick.   We ordered chocolate sundae crepe, chicken crepe and spiced latte. The chocolate sundae was pretty appealing with strawberries, Banana and nuts. The crepe as such was not overpoweringly sweet but after getting through the plate it kind of went over the top. Chicken crepe was delicious and the chick pea along with it gave a Mediterranean taste. I preferred that over the sweet one. Coffee was a huge disappointment, it costed $4.50 and there was no spices and was a regular coffee.   Overall a good place to have breakfast, price is decent and for two with coffee costs $30

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sundae Crêpe, latte, chicken Crêpe

oqXJ8q0yCnDzTUtaDEat3g.text: Everytime I come here, the staff is the sweetest. They make me feel like family. They serve you a complimentary glass of milk and tea biscuits and house made granola--what could be better??  I will say the options are limited, but I've never been disapppinted. Their savory crepes are some of the best I've E V E R had. Also 10/10 on presentation. You can probably find cheaper crepes around, but you are paying for the quality here.   The location makes it hard to find and you'll want to experience this place when it's not too busy to get the full effect. It's on the smaller side and fills up fast. Also be sure to check the hours because they close early! But I recommend Crepe Bar over every other nearby Crepe spot in tempe. So it's worth the effort friends. IT IS WORTH THE EFFORT.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cute AF Crepe Bar. You are cute AF.

eKIzwx5Nbri3vzsgC2gfcg.text: I've been here hundreds of times. My absolute favorite place. The owner, baristas, chefs, employees are always the nicest. Very much a Cheers like atmosphere. I love the innovative seasonal coffee drinks and different roasts they use. The avocado toast and lemon drop crepe are what I order the most. Make sure to grab some of their salty, sweet granola to go!

YcMuB8WJGSnD6U24FfP-UQ.text: Another placeholder so my pictures link. I'll update with details later, but the 4 star rating holds True.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix - coffee crêpe, pork belly, espresso maple, chili aïoli, egg up

QE2F7bSBaoTXVDNZG1wELQ.text: I'm new to Phx & needed a breakfast place. I found this place randomly on MAPS. My first order was the avocado toast & side of pork belly. Omg the pork belly was like butter melting in your mouth. Juicy & crispy. It was so gooood. I have been back maybe about four or five times mainly for the pork belly & toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. French Toast and Pork Belly

TfVxxZvxiZuv74odn4Df0w.text: 5 years later and we still come here regularly.  The place is much bigger now, with owner Jeff still greeting everyone with a fist bump.  Coffee is not from Heart Coffee anymore, so it's not the best coffee in the valley anymore, but it's still good.  I appreciate Jeff's dedication to local businesses, reaching out to local vendors whenever possible for his foods, and encouraging interaction between businesses.  Plan to stand in line for a while, but it's indoors, well air conditioned, and makes for a good conversation time with friends.  Vegetarian options have expanded and are well worth it.

HtfEEhuOydZSsX7c1q5IfQ.text: This used to be our favorite place to visit when we are in Arizona and have been here at least 15 times, but this last visit the portion sizes have been cut in half! The hibiscus jam and lemon curd Crepe is honestly so disappointing compared to how it used to be. There was no form than just a thumb-sized portion of jam on the entire plate. They decreased the portion from two crepes to just one, so now you're paying for one crepe with half a cup of lemon curd and a dot of jam.  The chipotle burrito was completely liquid mush in the center and is half of the size of how it used to be.  Now you definitely need two dishes to be full here. This was really disappointing.

ba-0MjkD0VD6MlX8shOUeQ.text: Started out as a food truck and did well enough to turn into a restaurant. As someone else noted, located in an unassuming strip mall but hipster heaven with a number of excellent food items. I do a morning monthly toastmaster meeting (new president of the club) and I'm moving it from some horrible chain breakfast place to here where the coffee is good and the food is even better - hopefully I'll work my way through the menu over the next year! ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Porridge with fruit compote!

ZlFv-ZJKWJgsgGb9z2r-LQ.text: Very yummy crepes and a cute atmosphere! Plus the coffee is really good! I recommended giving it a try if you love crepes! My favorites are the vanilla bean and papa k!!

G7y25JsLLZccFI5MNLm2Rw.text: The wife found this place and came and then brought our group back on the way to the Air Port. Everything we had both the Savory and Sweet items were absolutely delicious. The vanilla Latte with two shots of Expresso was great too. At the end they brought us a complimentary cookie and milk. Outstanding food and service in a very casual setting.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Complimentary cookie an milk.

piM9rfdwv5isjVu5FS32WA.text: Wow, so delicious.  I don't have any pictures to post because we ate everything too fast!  We used the check-for free coffee and tea to start while we munched on the complementary granola, which was a nice roasted salty and sweet flavor.  Then our savory crepes came out quickly, the breakfast burrito for him and a custom buckwheat for me (white cheddar since they were out of Gouda, with local ham).  Mine came with a side of dressed greens that complemented the crepe well.  I was disappointed I could only order scrambled eggs on the side when I wanted a gooey poached egg because they had already cracked all the eggs, so I skipped the eggs.  As we finished up our main course our sweet crepe came out.  I was surprised how full I was from the one savory crepe, but I made room for my half of a simple bruleed crepe with nuts.  You can really taste the quality of the crepe itself when it's minimally dressed.  We finished with the complementary dessert of chocolate triangles and a rose infused marshmallow roasted right at the table.  Overall I'm very happy with our experience and the friendly service.  We struck up some good conversation with the server and found everyone but the cashier to be friendly.  I will definitely be back soon!

PLfIGhS-ff2el8FnEaW4VQ.text: Not many places great you with the best granola you've ever had. Crepe Bar is a delicious experience that I recommend to everyone! I ate the savory curried vegetable crepe and had Heart roasters Kenya Githiga in pour over. The Crepe FAR exceeded my expectations. The taste was well balanced and the way they plated it was beautiful. The coffee here is by far the best drip and pour over coffee I've had at a restaurant. On top of the great service, they caught wind that my lady and I are coffee enthusiasts and brought over an amazing sample dish of their seasonal cold brew (steeped with rose) and their oak barrel conditioned cold brew for us to try! The staff are knowledgable, friendly, and outgoing. The atmosphere is great, and the food superb. 5 stars from me!

54fw2UEPvz8ZGHXTf1eK1Q.text: The cheesecake crepe was freakin wonderful. Vanilla bean custard, strawberries, salted caramel & candied fruit on the side yum! I died. My friend got the breakfast burrito crepe & loved it too! Great coffee drinks. We had excellent service this morning, they even gave us a free snack they were testing out while we waited for our crepes!

Seriously get the Grand Prix if you can or the other limited availability things, oh and the cast iron toast.

Sv_B7GviJsEz1_vaGRu8Ig.text: Ah yes, I remember when this place used to be the original Pleasant Croissant.  Like a bleached white hole in the wall bakery with croissants so perfectly wonderful that they sold out almost every day well before noon.   Not we have the Crepe Bar occupying this suite.  An interesting addition to the neighborhood and an intriquing option I felt the need to try, at least once.   After reading reviews and then scanning the menu we decided to share a savory and a sweet crepe from the menu.  Darn good too. May not be worth the price for he papa k with egg.  A three egg omelette will cost you about that much, with toast and hash browns. But this was a welcome change from the usual and darn near ideal for the weather and the day. Will be coming back again to try one of the other options on the menu.  Hopefully soon. I think the yelp symbol for price range should be $$... I guess I'm sort of a fan but I don't anticipate becoming a regular at this place.  Prices just didn't seem reseaonable for the options available. Also, the first time we came in there were no crepes because of an event the were participating in or something.  That wasn't so good. ONLY because of the location did we decide to give this place another try.

The Crepes were delicious, the popcorn appetizer was fun & the chocolate marshmallow brulee was the perfect sweet to end the experience. I was treated to the best chai I've ever had - they used Almond Milk. It was smooth, light & delicious! The decor is fun, vintage, lively & cute...the perfect combo. Of the two Crepes we ordered, the Papa K was my favorite. I can't wait to come back & try others!! And someday soon - a sweet crepe!

vNQ6WOsMGyx6CEiIs2XOKA.text: One of the best spots in Tempe! The service was amazing. We were waiting for a while for our food to come out, we didn't complain or anything but they gave us complimentary appetizers for the wait. Great service :)

bpThYE5g_WQSpSl6jnc7Ig.text: Always amazing! They've got it goin' on for sure...food with flavor, heart and soul!   For me, it was love at first bite back in day at the Ahwatukee Farmer's Market on their "Truckin' Good Food" food truck! Now, I continue my fare affair here at the Crepe Bar, where they've amplified everything in the most excellent way.   This is my number one place to recommend to friends and each and every one of them loves it just as much as I do. Classic favorite for me is the Papa K, but everything is delicious. Honestly, it's like asking me what my favorite song is...impossible to choose! Oh! I definitely don't want to forget to mention their amazingly creative seasonal goodness... Whatever you decide to go with - I promise you'll be in flavor heaven.

fsN2FTp6bf-87oh3tqzPrw.text: The service was great!! The staff was so friendly and they give you cute little freebies while you're eating. 9iANsbXBaIRIPRrG3VdFxw.text: This is the best Crepe Bar in town! Great savory and sweet crepe options.  My personal favorite and recommendation is the Chorizo Buritto Crepe. 6f6-gdTOhHw55DwqzCW2vw.text: The quality of the food is good, Though the menu is somewhat limited. Also, they are not available on Postmates, DoorDash, or Uber Eats. 6HAoG_bm4TwvkNtTKMcFiw.text: Love introducing the husband to new and exciting foods! This place was amazing! We both ordered the breakfast burro one with chorizo and the other just egg & potatoes. Delish! For drinks the hubby had plain coffee and I had a latte with Moroccan syrup. Both drinks were great! A very busy place for a Saturday but that happens and we were lucky to get an inside table vs. outside.  We will visit again and try one of their pastries or their version of French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Now that&#39;s a latte--Moroccan flavor

HwE3cHQYabtUGaZp3FhruA.text: I went to Crepe Bar on a whim to treat myself. I walked in and the guy at the counter, whose name I neglected to get, suggested the 13mi vegetable since I wanted something vegetarian. I also got a Moroccan latte and a lemon drop crepe to-go for dessert.   That day, the 13mi veg had beets and (I think) leeks. It also had some pickled carrots with a cheese cracker thing on top. The veggies with the french masala was a little tangier than I would have liked. It wasn't bad at all, it just was too vinegary for me with the carrot pickles and everything. I think it would have been awesome with some parsnips in there with the beets. The cheese thing on top was good too.   I got the Moroccan latte with 2% milk (finally a coffee place that has more than whole and skim!). It was good.   I'm usually not a big fan of lemon flavoured foods, but because the guy (whose name I can't remember) highly recommended it, I got it. Plus it has hibiscus gel in it, so that softened the lemon flavour. It was nice. I liked it.   I decided to go back a couple days later, and I got the First Time (nutella and banana crepe) and a vanilla latte. As expected, both were good.   The employees are super nice, and the food is good. I will definitely be going back esp. since I didn't have to go far to get there.

Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. First time
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemon drop: It sat in the hot car for a little while,  but still good.

SRjM2Uz2q9P0QsovVouf2A.text: We enjoyed our savory crepes although we were apprehensive at first from having pretty awful crepe experiences in Tucson. The dessert crepe had fruit and chocolate, great combo. Only downside was that the restaurant was ridiculously crowded so we had to watch for someone to leave and sit down immediately. Eager to try other menu items.

DNIQf_NsHODHw244mkLNWw.text: I think this was the first time I've ever really had crepes and I'm glad that I did! This place was packed on a Saturday morning, so I could tell it was a hit haha. There weren't even any tables open, we thought we were going to have to get food to go and sit at the restaurant next door! Luckily a table opened up and we snagged it right away. There was also a bit of a line but it seemed to move pretty quickly. It was smaller in there than I had expected but it was cool! It had a coffee house-type vibe which I liked! Was very clean too. I was excited to check in on yelp to get a free tea! I decided on a loose leaf earl grey. It wasn't my fave tea, but it was free so I can't complain. There were two savory vegetarian crepe options. I thought the horseradish on the buckwheat one would be too much for me so I went for the 13mi Vegetable crepe. I also spilt a first time for dessert, which is Nutella and banana! Presentation for both was A+, very fancy, I loved it! One downside is that portions are small though. Would be a good place to come for a light meal, but I wouldn't recommend if you are wanting a good hearty meal, unless you're down to be spending a lot. Something that I liked about the vegetable crepe was the variety of vegetables in it, lots of my favorites too and they all tasted fresh. I also enjoyed the difficult to eat parmesan crisp on top. I appreciate that they use lots of local stuff there too! The crepe was a tad spicier than expected and I wasn't super into the spices used in it and stuff, but it wasn't bad! I did like it overall. The first time was delicious, very simple and tasty. I especially liked the banana on top. Typically when I go out for brunch I personally want a huge meal so for that reason this place wasn't my absolute favorite. However, it was a great introduction to the world of crepes for me and I am glad I had the opportunity to try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. 13mi Vegetable

F5WsspAlWFCmx1YY8Qr72A.text: We tried this place for the first time today. It was excellent! We read where lines and waits can sometimes be a bit long so we were there around 8:20 and had no problem finding seating. But the time we left ~9:30 it was getting pretty crowded though. I checked in and got my pour of Heart coffee from PDX (I was told) for free and didn't have to stand in line to get it; they let me show my check in at the coffee bar station and sent me on my way back to my table. The service was friendly and efficient. They make you feel at home with the amuse bouche. A great touch that is thoughtful and classy w/o feeling over the top or like too much. I really wish it was the norm at more places in the US. It shows they care about the customer. (It's the little things, right?)  These guys really have it down. My wife had the breakfast burro (chipotle crepe, chorizo, avocado, I forget what else) and said it was perfect.  She raved and said it was the best breakfast she's had in PHX in several years. I had the andouille (w/ pimento cheese, potatoes and egg sunny side up). I wish my egg was a bit more runny, but the flavor combos and complexity of the dish was top notch. Then we had the lemon drop crepe b/c our cashier said it was a staff favorite; (and I believe her) I would be hard pressed to find another crepe that would beat it. We'll get it again that's for sure. I also had a perfect macchiato.  Finally, the fresh sea salt and chipotle salt and rock sugar they use to finish on the crepes (respectively) is an awesome touch that enhances the flavor profiles.   I am glad we tried Crepe bar and will certainly be back soon. These guys have carved out a niche and do what they do really well!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemon drop - staff favorite - I agree !!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Macchiato fantastico.

js8cLVv4hO9fMEURkiQm4A.text: Had their Irish Oatmeal yesterday and was pleasantly surprised on how tasty it was! Creamy with good texture. Chutney at the bottom was a great touch but the side add of a curry-like spice was a life changer! I want to get this spice for my own, but until then, this is my favorite breakfast now!

5RgiVg8qy714AIX2zcfEjA.text: Adorable place to grab some breakfast/brunch. Unfortunately, it was too crowded at the time we came for us to dine inside, so we dined outside instead, but it was still lovely. Sunday brunch seems to be a very busy time. It was a long wait to order and long wait to get food. Go before the rush if you can.  Smoked olives appetizer was yummy, so that abated my hunger a bit during the long wait. I ordered the veg crepe, boyfriend ordered the breakfast burro. The breakfast burro was too heavy for my tastes, but I enjoyed my veg crepe a lot. It's basically like a samosa in a crepe, with a little fried/baked cheese on top. You get the tamarind and mint sauce you usually get with samosas.  Yummy breakfast/brunch place, but go early if you can to avoid the rush!

Great place for kids and adults and has a range from sweet to savory to those who are limited to gluten free and veggies.

39Ib9aFH4HM56SKAKoHmWw.text: Was in the area seeking new places to try for lunch and found Crepe Bar , so off I went.  It was Friday little after 11 and the place was busy, but not overly busy, I was able to get my order in and find me a seat. I have to say I love the vibe of this place.  I originally went seeking a savory crepe, but after looking over the menu I went with a savory & sweet crepe. Oh boy, this was not a good diet day. Haha  I ordered the breakfast burrito crepe, eggs, bacon, queso jack, avocado salsa. Let me tell you, this was amazing, it took an entirely different perspective on the breakfast burrito, and the chipotle crepe just made it that much better! The flavors of everything blended perfectly, was surprised when I noticed I ate it all :( where did it go? Who did that?    I also ordered the first time, I was sold on this because it was with Nutella - that stuff is crack!!! Love it!!!.  The crepe was beautifully prepared it was filled with that glorious Nutella (either you love Nutella or you hate it) and surrounded by mind blowing banana brulee OOHHH MMMYYY FFFFFNNNN GGGGGAAAAAWWWWDDD!!! Banana Brulee Who thought of this!! Bananas with crispy sugar coating mixed with Nutella!!! Genius!!!!   Crepe Bar expect to see me on a regularly basis!

AxUpsi39y6CfBcmUcDI2oA.text: This place rocks! Everyone that works here is super friendly, the drinks are delicious. I'm a huge fan of their cold brew, and the crepes are amazing. The location is a bit odd for how great this place is (it's small - although it did somewhat recently expand - and located in a somewhat random strip mall), but everything else makes up for it. They even bring out something to snack on (homemade cereal, churros) while you're waiting for our crepes. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. The &#34;breakfast burrito&#34; crepe -- so amazing!

STk-oLLCnSXTTKg0FWle2A.text: We came here almost once a week when we lived in the Phoenix area - and now that we live in Los Angeles, we miss it like crazy. We simply haven't found anything out here that can hold a candle to this place!  The owner, Jeff, is serious about using fresh, local ingredients and combines them to make one-of-a-kind quality dishes that you can't get out of your head. Our favorites were the many different flavors of scones and the savory crepes. I'm not usually a cookie person, but whenever I saw that they had coffee cookies, I had to snag one before it was gone. Also, their toast showed me what the toast craze was all about. Biting into a slice was a delight, and somehow I always came away feeling like it was exactly the right amount of food. Their absurdly good scrambled eggs made me realize that I make mine all wrong; somehow, these taste better than you would ever think scrambled eggs could.  Their coffee is good, but they especially shine in their espresso bar drinks. Their cappuccinos were expertly made, and I also enjoyed their iced special drinks during the summer. The vibe was also perfect - very hip and airy without feeling like a carbon copy of the latest trends. It can be a bit difficult for a big group, but they do have a few larger tables. Their music always put me in a good mood with its mix of indie and oldies, and it was just loud enough to create a fun atmosphere without being so loud that you can't hear each other talk.   Lastly, let me say a good word about the service. They acknowledge you when you walk in the door, remember you when you return, greet you by name, and make you feel like they appreciate your business. Sometimes, depending on how busy they are, they will even bring over little treats like small bowls of granola - it makes you feel valued as a customer and helps keep your tummy from growling too much before your food arrives.  Don't let the long line intimidate you - it is 100% worth it!! Thinking about this place always brings a smile to my face, and if we come back to South Tempe for a visit, this will be at the top of our list! Crepe Bar is the best of the best!

GQfT2MRe5JB5jTD0YCSx3Q.text: Ugh I live in the neighborhood and sometimes just wanna grab something to go. This restaurant is so yummy. But if you are the business owner and happen to read this: Answer your damn phone! The number of times I'm starving, settle on your place, pick out my food only to call and get a recording with directions? It happens and then I forget how HANGRY I am wanting a crepe only to be denied. It's almost criminal... maybe I'll see if The place next door makes carryout possible for their patrons...

77Ojt_bxffxV1VdM33J3rQ.text: Arrived around 730am this morning to this very pleasant feeling cafe. Indie sounding music, lower than average lighting and minimalist table and chair arrangements contributed to an overall hip and trendy vibe.  I came alone and craved quiet so sat outside at the long tabletop with about 4-5 high chairs. Even though it faced a parking lot, the morning sun and birds chirping in the palm trees nearby contributed to a laid back feeling perfect to greet the day.  Enjoyed an excellent savory crepe called "Papa K" with ingredients listed as "Hassayampa ham, eggs, pepper cheese & roasted mushroom". I chose to wrap all that in their "alternative Crepe batter" made from buckwheat & chickpea. It included a small side salad of mostly arugula. Helped slide that down with sips of their macchiato expresso which completed my overall excellent experience.
