F4XOrY5fGiwlYJiVQtqx8w.text: Crepe bar has a very relaxed vibe and minimalist decoration. Every piece of art work on the walls is for sale a meal and a art gallery interesting concept.   They have various crepe options savory and sweet we tried a few. Portions were a bit small in my opinion, so this would be more of a light morning meal. Don't expect to find a soda fountain they do offer glass bottles of coke and a few other can drinks. There is a large water pitcher where you can serve yourself and if you want ice, with these hot temperatures I imagine most would, you will have to ask at the counter.    The chilaquiles crepes were tasty it had a unique favor, the second time crepes was sweet. I personally would eat it as a dessert or accompanied with other protein sides such as  eggs or potatoes.   You seat yourself and you can pick up  a menu by the register and when your ready you can place your order at the counter.

aV6dLbiuawf95w0cxRHNRw.text: I've been wanting to come here for a while now and I'm glad I had the opportunity today. There was a long line to order the food, but it moved quickly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We settled on Grand Prix and Chilaquiles.   Grand Prix had pork belly which had nice flavor and was not very fatty. It was melt in your mouth texture and it paired perfectly with over easy egg and the crepe wrapper.  I can see this one being ordered along with a vegetarian crepe to round out the meal.   The  Chilaquiles was also nice flavor and it had tasty bean topping along with egg. It is served with tortilla chips rather than crepe wrapper. Good choice if you want something light and healthy.   We also tried their sweet crepe, the Second Chance. It was very good, perfect texture and sweetness. Fresh bananas and strawberries were spot on.   I also tried their Moroccan latte. It was interesting and I'm glad I tried it. It had nice cinnamon flavor. I'd like to try their other flavors next. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Second chance
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix

QYJ2KgwEY7pUJSWBze-VTQ.text: I L O V E this place. They probably have the sweetest employees in the valley. Also I can't get enough of their crepes!  The chickpea Crepe is gluten free & it's so fluffy + delicious you wouldn't think it's gluten free. All of the ingredients- especially the veggies - taste very fresh too.  This place is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Egg &amp; cheese crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. My friends banana &amp; Nutella Crêpe

SY1f6r9DAqnZ9RHlLPEbKA.text: This is a solid fun breakfast stop. Indoors this place rocks with plenty of space for sitting comfortably. Outside, very limited to just one "highrise" table and metal stool seats. The food of crepe with duck and ham to a "blintz/crepe" with "12 hour" ricotta (on the 13th hour the ricotta turns into a pumpkin..:), apples, figs and my fav whip cream was most delicious. Our best breakfast while visiting this cool town. Thanks for reading. Avram

52wq18lsxgiwGmh861IgNA.text: Love going here for breakfast or early lunch. I always thought of crepes as a sweet dessert, but this place definitely changed that. I have actually never had one of their sweet crepes, but I'm sure they are great like everything else.  Crepe Bar tends to be pretty crowded all the time, so you may have to wait for a table. Don't worry though, the food comes out fast and tables turn quickly. I pretty much only get two things here.  Burrito Crepe: If you're on the fence about crepes, but like virtually anything in burrito form, this is the ticket. It's essentially a chorizo breakfast burrito, but has a crispy crepe instead of a tortilla. Need I say more?  Grand Prix: This is what I order when I want to mix it up or am feeling fancy AF. It's a little more out there, but the flavors work really well. It has pork belly and some kind of espresso drizzle. Really good, but rather rich. Great if you're in the mood for that.   Side note: They have really good granola. Consider bringing home a bag as it's delicious. They give you a little bowl of it while you wait to get you hooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burrito Crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farm Vegetable
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix

P1jhoOg7vmxxXxagYnEo_A.text: This place is amazing and probably one of the best crepes I've ever had.  It's packed but staff makes it all worth while and we got here just in time. Right after we sat down the line almost went out the door.   We started off with a few bloody Mary's and wow we were in shock at how good they're.  Not to spicy and great flavor and felt home made   The crepes alone are award winning we got the burrito crepe and pork belly omg.  Loaded of flavor and taste and just melts in your mouth on every bite. The present it amazingly and just ready to dive in. We finished with the dessert Crepe with Nutella no need to say more after that.   We will be back for many more times to come

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

EkPmt3aAOBmU2eS-BcANQA.text: Crepe bar impresses again and again and again and again. Why don't I frequent crepe bar more? Because I would probably be 50LBS. Heavier. I am part of the clean plate club when I eat here and if you don't know what that means, you'll soon find out. I have always ordered something new off the menu and have never, ever been let down. The food is GRADE A. I enjoyed the crepe burrito with a side of potatoes. Best decision ever.  The burrito was stuffed with avocado, black beans, cheese and the plate itself is plated like a little work of art. Gordon Ramsey would APPROVE. I love it here!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

bEMikULALnB1eS6zKea2yg.text: If you stop to eat at this breakfast/lunch spot you will not be disappointed. This trendy restaurant has the best crepes in Arizona. My only con is that there is only one location. I wish they could would open on the west side of Phoenix!

1PQHsLCrQJcGKXzdMJGhyw.text: The food is delicious but a little pricier (hey it's fresh and as local as they can get so totally worth it) so we don't go in as often as we wish we could.  Stop in and try a sweet and a savory - they are so good!

e1l_MyeZM3QoTMD384mxlg.text: Best breakfast in tempe. The best people work here and every one is almost as beautiful as the food!

wIT3LPQFYpHqAKcqPm6h5Q.text: I like this place a lot. Great food and drink options. Their sweet and savory crepes are all wonderful. Their coffee is wonderful and artsy. The mimosa was solid, but I guess it's hard to go wrong when you have fresh OJ and them bubbles. They have other alcoholic and non alcoholic options, including teas, cocktails, beer, cappuccinos, et cet er ah.  I've had the crepe chip one (chilaquiles, or however it's spelt, it's paprika-y and delicious, with Crepe chips, which is just so good!!! ), the tahini chicken (FILLING and wonderful with a tangy crunch from the pickles), the chipotle chicken one (very filling and very good) and the ode to Sunday one (i think that was the name. It was ode to something). In the future I want to try the rest of their crepes, especially their vegetarian ones because veggies are delicious.  The gist of this review is that everything is solid, staff are very friendly, and I'm glad this place is close to where I live, and I plan to come here again, and again, and again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tahini chicken, ode to Sunday (I think), and the chilaquiles? one. With the Crêpe chips. All so good!!!

wZxl2h1BafD3aOGmfJayuA.text: Excellent! Doesn't look like much from the front but this place SHINES!   Service: very friendly, greeted as soon as we walked in and asked if we had been before. The server explained the process of ordering then sitting down. We had house made granola served to us to enjoy while we waited, the server kindly explained all the ingredients. It was so tasty! Reminded me of a healthy Frosted Flakes :)  Food: so flavorful! I ordered the farmers vegetable buckwheat crepe with paprika chicken added. It was super savory and topped with fresh greens, hummus & crunchy chickpeas. They offer a lot of vegan and gluten free options! Crepes can be wheat, buckwheat or chickpea. I finished the entire thing happily! I may even order again if I return because I enjoyed it so much.  Very reasonable pricing! Good portion sizes and great staff, highly recommend this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

QMe2j7_DwiqeehfYogtMdA.text: I loved it here. Simply put it's amazing.   I was lucky enough to not have to wait long for service, although I've heard that there can be a long wait time.   The food was good and the prices weren't that bad. I ordered the grand Prix and really enjoyed it, it was a small amount of food but it was really filling. My friends ordered the smokey and the Papa K. Both were delicious.   I used the coupon for free coffee on yelp and it was good, plus free refills.   It was nice be a use after we were done eating one of the servers brought us milk and cookies to enjoy "while we talk." I didn't expect that and was very happy with it.   Overall I'd say that you should definitely go here, even if it means making a drive.

GRZDkR8oWvwqikXlAStPlQ.text: I will definitely return.  After leaving dog training, we smelled of Great Dane but left our dog in the car (windows down, in January) so we could enjoy this place. We were greeted by a lovely hostess/order-taker girl and I decided on the First Time while my boyfriend had the Breakfast Burrito.  He had a coffee, and I OJ.  Before sitting we asked if there was a bathroom to wash our hands as we smelled of dog.  The owner, clearly a dog lover let us wash our hands in their private bathroom in the kitchen.    (Watching people make crepes is beautiful. Like an art form)   We thank them profusely and sit down.  The food comes and both of our meals are dreams.  I will say I was not prepared for how sweet my meal would be that early in the morning, but it was so decadent and scrumptious. I might not get it again unless I'm in more of a dessert mood, but I like more savory breakfasts. There will be the sweet-toothers out there that will be titalated at the idea.  I smelled a buffalo chicken while I was there and will DEFINITELY be trying that out next time.  Now for anyone that knows me I absolutely detest eggs. I hate them and think they're gross. Then came the Crepe Bar Breakfast Burrito... ::swoon::! This is the ONLY DISH IN THE WORLD THUS FAR THAT I HAVE BEEN WILLING TO EAT WITH EGG BECAUSE IT IS SO DAMN GOOD!!!  I was actually jealous that my boyfriend had it and I didn't, since he has the sweet tooth and I die for savory.  He devoured his meal giving me a few small bites, but that thing is AMAZING!!! I might have one of my own next time dependent on whether or not the buffalo sounds better.  I love this little place, down to the art on the walls and the well decorated walls.  I even love that you pay with a Square card reader and an iPad. It feels like a pop-up art gallery.  Great vibe.  We live all the way out in Laveen, and will make a point to come here WHENEVER we can.  Thank you!!!

DnoHUy4mjGBZtGZRGpm6Uw.text: we had the buffalo chk, vannilla bean and built it with veg egg and buckwheat. The buffalo is a little salty for me, and they are so kind to change it to breakfast burrito for me. Love the vanilla bean! Just love it! Although the breakfast burrito is still too salty for me, but the sweet ones are so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. breakfast burrito
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. vanliia bean
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

hcGEhpesh2rp6qdtDPlz6A.text: This was the first time I have been here and this place was absolutely amazing. It did take a little bit for the food to arrive but the place was packed. Shelby, our waiter, went out of his way to make us feel welcome and even brought a complimentary app as an apology. The food was completely worth the wait. High quality ingredients and all 3 dishes were cooked perfectly. Their coffee is also amazing and was highly complimented by our barista friend. I will definitely come back and their friendly staff truly made the entire experience way better! I recommend the Grand Prix (pork belly).

y1bQOHig8OGyysi2tTJWEQ.text: My SO and I drive 30 minutes each way just for the Crepe Bar; it is that good. We have been on a Saturday and a Sunday morning both of which were packed--Sunday at 11 lines were almost out the door. We have now ordered the Burro, Andouille Sausage, Smoked Turkey, Vanilla cream, and Nutella Banana Brule crepes so far. All of these crepes have amazingly complex and well-balanced flavor profiles. The head chef is truly talented and goes the extra mile to make each crepe an experience. Their coffee is fantastic as well. This is by far my favorite breakfast place I have ever been to anywhere. Also, they always come around and give little samples of their pastries and cereal--which are great, but since I am making the long drive I can't help but to get anything but the crepes.

gCRr5LNQbLcgg53EU6FYsw.text: Just went here for the first time yesterday for my wife's graduation party. First off going to comment on how hip this place decorated on the inside; I wasn't expecting such a clean, slick look.  The food was amazing. I had the breakfast chorizo burrito crepe, half of my wife's ode to a Sunday, and some of my friends avocado toast. The  eggs, chorizo, jack, salsa and avocado were done in a way that allowed them to melt inside of the crepe to perfection. The spicy mayo and cotija laid on the outside of the plate gave a nice dipping option like a traditional burrito and the amount laid out was enough not to overtake what was inside of the crepe. My wife's crepe looked like a dessert tray from the melting the pot. It tasted delicious and I would recommend it for someone who loves sweets. The avocado toast w/ open face egg was also delectable. Our waitress brought out tons of side dishes on the house, including some funnel cake like treats, sweet potato chips, granola, and these crazy dense chocolate house made rollo's that were packed with insane flavors. On top of the amazing service, they allowed us to bring champagne for the celebration and sold us orange juice for mimosas. This is probably one of the better breakfast places in all of Tempe and the best in South Tempe. Looking forward to going back and trying the pork belly and Jamaican jerk sausage crepes.

pUnjUIW8nSFToTN24o5FrQ.text: Love love love the Crepe Bar but had such an unfortunate experience with a friend. I talked about how wonderful this place was & how delicious it is & just the overall atmosphere was so chill. When we went to order, my friend who has server food allergies found a crepe she like & could eat and ordered it, unwrapped without the crepe. I was really taken back when they said they couldn't do that because that have to present the food in a certain manner, REALLY? Completely ridiculous if you ask me, haven't been back since which is a bummer.

NpItKud3IWV4K9FxX3BzNQ.text: From the mocha to the special to the vanilla bean dessert.....GIDDY UP!  So very delicious and all served with a smile plus a little bonus....a sampling of their amazing cereal.  This was my first time at the Crepe Bar.  Shouldn't have waited so long.  The only reason why I can't rate this higher is because of the cramped quarters.  Hope you'll expand soon, Crepe Bar!

q_gHEcmpb8CzFQe_UYGvbw.text: My husband and I had been wanting to check out the Crepe Bar for about a year but kept forgetting to go. We were so blown away by our first experience and can't wait to go back! Everyone was so friendly and the food was delicious. Looks can be deceiving from the outside, this place is a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito with fries! So good!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummmmo

Y2FS56CqPrEdypViFKXfhA.text: Crepe Bar is an awesome place for a culinary experience! I randomly met Jeff (the owner) at another favorite restaurant of mine and as we are both foodies. We hit it off and hung out for a couple hours that evening.  I told Jeff that I would be in some time in the near future to check out his establishment.  As life gets busy and he is not located super close to me some time went by, and I was finally able to make it in today for a glorious meal!  I did not look at a menu, I just asked Jeff to serve me whatever his best dishes are.  He started off with the CB Cereal which is a small helping of home made cereal with oats, almonds, pistachio and stone fruit.  Excellent start to the meal as it was original and very tasty.  The next course was some Noble bread served with Rosemary, Honey, and a house made butter which was outstanding.  I was caught off guard with the next course which was the Octopus Crepes which included a little humus, chorizo, cotija, and adobo and avacado.  Now that dish was a flavor explosion!  My final dish was a Coffee Creme Brulee which was the perfect ending to an awesome meal!  Go check out Crepe Bar, I promise you will be happy!!

X5ahctNll3DDZE1tuYelLA.text: I would have loved to try a crepe...but after waiting 30 minutes in line and arriving at the counter we were told that food would take another 30-45 minutes. The line was 20 people deep the entire time. You geniuses could have informed everyone BEFORE making them wait. Have had quicker and more courteous service at DMVs.

ZkYN2gJm_1pMmHVC77peDA.text: awesome lattes! equivalent to NYC level of coffee/latte. crepes and brioche is also very unique and delicious. definitely coming back!

o3s2IATxhwZjQ3qbI_FkFA.text: Methinks a fair portion of the cost is for the presentation of the food.  The food itself was fine.  Nothing spectacular.  I had the breakfast burrito, on the recommendation of the staff.  Tip:  there's more water in the large metal container near the register.  Fill up your table's 'jug' there.

91Zo68oVVZTzwWnYUH-1fg.text: The Grand Prix was worth the wait.  Had to stop eating the brioche before my breakfast came out, it wasn't easy. This place rocks

Cg9ej8pi-Lp00tmhxEB7hg.text: I'm not really sure what all of the hype is about.  The food is definitely good, but the portions are very small and the prices are way too high.  This place has achieved "cool status" for some reason, and now seems to be growing on the trendy momentum.  But I've eaten here 3 different times, and each time I'm thinking - "this is ok".  I won't be back - I've given it 3 tries, and there are far better crepe options in town.

o1MQgOO6_vDy2NiBUnmlug.text: This place has everything you want in a little restaurant - great service and amazing food. The smoky crepe was delicious, and I also tried some of my wife's which was the vanilla bean custard, also very good. While we waited for our food they also gave us a bowl of granola to munch on until our crepes were done. It was very busy, right when they opened on Sunday morning, but they still went out of their way to treat us like royalty. I ordered an iced chai tea as well and it was the best one I've ever had.  I'd like to eat here every week if possible!

0RzNJlFK8uyU0gfX3evoxQ.text: "Crepe Bar. Go time."  "I looked at the menu again last night." "I've looked at it 36 times this week. Their FB menu link went live." And so we were off - mom, lil sister and I - hungry, hyped, and ready for all kinds of tomcrepery (it's a word now).   The play-by-play:  Breakfast burrito (sans bacon) - egg, cheese, chipotle crepe, avocado salsa. "The best part is the crepe. I just crunched a huge piece of fleur de sel." "What? I can't hear you over the salsa-egg symphony in my mouth." "Why not everything just be crepes?"  3 mini crepes - spicy buffalo chicken, carrot slaw, blue cheese.  "Would have been better as a taco. The slaw needs taco." "The flavor is good, but it's all kinda mushy. It does need the crunch." "Wait... it's not one of each kind of those crepes?"  Griddled chicken crepe (sans everything) - chicken, cheese, crepe. "Dude, you ordered a quesadilla." "A fancy quesadilla." "Sorry for eating all the edges... the crispy cheese and fluffy crepe were meant to be together. In my stomach."  Vanilla custard crepe - dressed strawberries, caramel, crepe rolls. "There are three crepe rolls! Perfect!" "Omg taste the brulee'd top part." "Why not everything just be vanilla bean custard? Mor custerd!"  Yogurt parfait - lemon gel, berries, spelt & pistachio granola. "This granola is salty... it's so good." "Oh, there's fruit and stuff on the bottom. Dig!" "What is this stuff? Not quite yogurt... not quite whipped cream. Lemon fluff. Mmm."  Almond milk latte + Chai tea - "What do you mean there's no decaf coffee?" "The coffee's sweet. Not intense. Not quite Village Roastery, but still good." "I am still in awe of this Chai. It's perfection."  Complementary cookies in coffee milk - "This is like Cookie Crisp for grown-ups." "I'm putting a cookie piece in the vanilla custard crepe. Brilliant." "They should make that a thing! Cookies and cream crepe."  TL;DR- The service is friendly and cheery, the lemon parfait was really something special, and the vanilla custard crepe and breakfast burrito are also worth a re-eat sometime. I'm not usually a huge crepe fan, but consider me a fan of the Crepe Bar.

uXwGQ1VCo6L030G_kZHm5w.text: Excellent crepes!  Very high quality ingredients makes it worth the price.  I had a ham and gruyere crepe and it was very good - loved the crispy cheese on the edges of the crepe. The place is cute, the service staff were all very friendly.    One thing though needs to be corrected.  When ordering my coffee (refills $0.75) I asked for milk.  I was handed a gallon jug of milk, the lid still screwed on.  I thought the girl was maybe being lazy but when I went back for a 2nd cup I was once again handed the gallon of milk.  Just wrong!

8EQF10hvzx2lZERkMqMTsA.text: Policies? Hipsters don't have policies!! This place drives me insane! The food is good, no question, but they have "policies" that you cannot substitute any of the ingredients in their crepes.  At first we were told that they have a policy against that because they have such a limited supply of each ingredient that if they substituted anything then they'd run out of ingredients for the other crepes.   However, when my girlfriend and I wanted to switch some ingredients between the crepes we ordered so that the careful balance of the evidently finite universe of crepe ingredients would not be disturbed, we were then told that they have another policy that you can't switch ANY ingredients at all, even on the same order. WTF?!? I must have missed the Michelin Star rating and James Beard award hanging on the wall of your dilapidated strip mall crepe bar. My apologies to the chef!  Oh, and their coffee is awful.

WGm0QIZoCxEzx5ugvnkfgQ.text: Just moved into town and found this place for breakfast. Arriving at 9am, the line was going out the door. The service is incredible as everyone was very friendly and courteous. Menu is short and sweet, having all the right mix of sweets and savory. Trying the pick me up this time, but will definitely try others soon. We will definitely be a regular.

hmD3EipLt5yxioQVEDYgLg.text: If I could be in love with any breakfast place, this would be the one. Crepe Bar has the best service, sweet crepes, and ambiance there is to offer.  1. Service: The staff here are exceedingly friendly and willing to help you understand any menu item. This is a sit-down type atmosphere, though you will have to order at the front. When you are waiting for the food (sometimes the wait might be a bit long) servers will bring out a delicious starting dish for you. Thus far I have gotten some various exquisite little pastries to munch on.  2. Sweet crepes: Hands down the best sweet crepes in the Valley. Thus far I have tried most of their crepes and coffees, and most of them have blown me away. I have a large sweet tooth so I would definitely recommend getting the sweet crepes, though (most) of the savory ones are delicious as well. The sweet crepes are soft and delicious, without being too sweet or flavorful. They are usually topped with sugar that makes just the right amount of crunch and satisfaction with every bite. I would highly recommend the lemon flavor.  3. Ambiance: The ambiance here is extremely calming. There is natural light streaming through their windows, and their chairs are painted with happy colors. They have funky art lining their walls as well, which serve as good amusement if you have are having an awkward conversation. The outside seating is really accessible as well. The only downfall would be the fact that the place is fairly small and the lines sometimes go out the door.  If you have an hour or two free on your schedule, definitely hit up the Crepe Bar- I doubt it will disappoint.

5csiDaindmqqmY9ieXSB-A.text: No menu substitutions. Poor customer satisfaction. After waiting in line for 15 minutes while deciphering the non-descriptive menu, we get to the front of the line to ask some questions about substituting a regular crepe with a buckwheat crepe. We also wanted to add some turkey to our meal. We were told no for any substitutions and were met with no solution for someone who wanted a gluten free option. Unacceptable! We left frustrated and hungry. What ever happened to satisfying your customers. No substitutions?!?! Really!?

L31rvA0H42jVkDkuGCUpKQ.text: This place is awesome, it's busy but that's because the food is great.  The staff is also very friendly.  Just ate here today and will be back very soon!

7fFcyd1dQ3_exFjwr0hZMA.text: Fun ambiance with a hipster vibe . Very slow service at the counter, should consider having waiters. Lots of workers but feels very disorganized. As we waited, they brought little delicious bites of cereals and then bread pudding.  The food is AMAZING. Everyone working here is great, they just need to invest in a better way to serve their customers. They did mention that they will be expanding, which will be very helpful. Printing more menus would be a simple improvement. Will definitely come again. The ingredients, presentation and taste are wonderful...

NShziGpEwynxVdqGIUqYng.text: My boyfriend and I used to LOVE the crepe bar. Inventive, fresh and delicious. It's a bit far for us so we only go every few months. This was our first time back since the remodel and updated menu. We ordered 3 savory crepes and 1 dessert crepe. The dessert crepe was phenomenal but the other 3 savory crepes were so salty that it was tough to eat. We managed to eat 2 because we didn't want to cause a fuss but left an entire crepe behind. When the girl came to pick up our plates, she didn't even bother asking why we hadn't eaten the other crepe. I guess we could've just told them straight up that the crepes were bad but we had a difficult time ordering in the first place with them unwilling to make any substitutions or let us order any sides that weren't listed specifically as a side on their menu. It was very off-putting and a disappointing experience.

PQU9DuobGi1mefS2kpDZGg.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! The crepes are amazing (I always get the Papa K and add an egg) and the service is wonderful.  They always bring additional treats to your table.  This is a real foodie place and I love that they use local ingredients, etc.!

EYfd6CqU9kJaeuICE-BAJg.text: Came to this place for the first time because of the great reviews. Not sure if they were just having an off day or if this happens a lot, but we had a horrible experience here. We ordered our food at approx 11:20 and didn't get our food until 12.  I can understand that this place gets busy, but we saw people who walked in shortly after us with similar orders get there food at least 20 mins before us. After 30 mins of waiting, I went to ask if they had forgotten our food. They said it was about to come out, and we waited another 10 mins before the food came out. Eggs and crepe's were cold, burro was the only thing hot. Food overall was not as great as reviews that we had read, and the wait time just killed the experience completely. Will not be returning.

FYkaNVSgiMFqxAtk_lB_kA.text: Coffee was delicious. It's so hard to find good coffee and this place is perfect for a morning

s22jDPOSge7faJehucw4gw.text: This place is the ish!  Got off the plane, yelped breakfast tempe and there I was.   Coffee: They use reputable roasters and have skilled baristas. These guys would be a very good stand-alone coffee shop. Cheers to that.  Food: I tried the breakfast burrito. It hit the spot and then some. Flavorful, fresh and extremely well-prepared.  Staff: Extremely friendly and smart staff. Had a great conversation with them and it is obvious that they care greatly about their product.   I HIGHLY recommend Crepe Bar!

bNfCSMZ5gynSWJJAvQZReg.text: I like the food, the attitudes of the staff, the decor and the prices. Their crepes are light and fluffy and the fact that they serve fontina cheese is a plus for me. Thank you very much.

HhPFOVTbuYJDIjJRWrAQ9Q.text: Grand Prix baby!!! My hubby's and my new FAVORITE place, can't get enough of their superbly quality food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. You can&#39;t even imagine the amazing aromas!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

fClUcKN69CjP9tTilsJPcg.text: I was the person that required attention in the review below.  I have a heart condition that was corrected in 2001 that seems to be an issue now.  I was unconscious, disoriented, and embarrassed through most of it, but I do remember the staff was A.MAZ.ING - so kind, caring & well-trained to assist until medical help arrived.  They even gave me a flower for the ambulance ride.  I loved the food and the service before the incident occurred, now I can't thank the Crepe Bar enough.  Best restaurant ever.

M3WtpVdLuovuhmtmjglqLg.text: Interesting restaurant... Very small and food delivery is slow, but the quality and presentation of  the food is excellent. I must say it is a unique dining experience.

QCsbJJvT57sE0r1QisWTcA.text: As close as I lived to the Crepe Bar, I never once tried it until February of this year. I kick myself in the ass for not trying this place, sooner...   I ordered a vanilla bean custard crepe, which I've had with both the salted caramel and chocolate, and it was amazing! The portions are perfect for me, although some might think it may be too small (only because other establishments over feed you, anyway). I have brought many friends to indulge at the Crepe Bar with me, and have had the pleasure of trying the lemon drop, buckwheat and the papa K crepes; which all were very tasty in their own right.   I also love that they bring you samples of their desserts, granola, or bread at the beginning, and at times at the end, of your meal. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Being from a family in the restaurant business all my life, I'm quite particular about how service is handled, and they're on top of it! It's a fun, small, comfortable atmosphere as well. I've since become a regular. :)

YlSm1oSUZlY1J6w06nBmRA.text: Id have to say my experience here was truly awful. Did the crepe itself taste great? Yes. I ordered a nutella crepe for take out and after at least 35 minutes of waiting i finally got it. When i took my crepe out of the bag it was literally wrapped in a ball of tin foil. It was a crepe ball. On top of that they had NO plastic utensils even when asked. They are not at all prepared for take out. The food is great tasting but not something i would recommend for take out. Id say its a great place if you dont mind sitting in an extremely small and loud resteraunt, waiting half an hour for food. But yes, the crepes do taste quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is literally a ball of crepe and nutella. It was given to me in a ball of tin foil. Very disappointing.

tMVeILoYo9Kp1Ihq233okA.text: No substitutions!?!?! Your telling me I can't get a side of turkey with my omelet? Or add a buckwheat crepe instead of wheat because the flavors won't taste the same? You have got to be kidding me. I left and will not be back.

DBBrGkjzmqchzXJaT1NBUQ.text: Found this place during my online delivery service job at doordash which while I waited for the takeout struck up conversation with the friendly staff.  The place is cozy and makes the best of what they have available in limited space, but the long line speaks for itself the great food they have to offer and they are soon expanding.   my best friend was in town from California, so along with my roommate (aka other bff) we decided to have a Sunday fun day before he's flight back home (anyone else watch You're The Worst on FXX?).  Never had a savory crepe before and got the vegetarian Buckwheat with egg, nice bit of spice with the horseradish havarti. If you're a hobbit who loves mushrooms get it. And their in house hot sauce is perfect blend of heat and tangy zest. They could profit selling it in  bottles.   My friends felt the wait staff had a certain air about them but concurred with food this delicious they deserve the attitude. They had that smoked turkey Crepe and breakfast burrito with chorizo.

EIPSNhVc1Sb_4NCy3pYTKQ.text: Can't say no to this place! They have small snacks for me while waiting. Very sweet place and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

bREGQywNS-kB7uVQ-mXXyA.text: My husband and I wanted breakfast but we wanted something different and I couldn't have picked a better place.  The food was delicious and the staff was great.   The Crepe Bar

4j_H0yZ7UYGqXMHPB9rzEg.text: I had one of the breakfast crepes with ham, mushrooms, cheese, and eggs. It was delish. The side salad that it comes with is pretty awesome as well.   My friend and I split the vanilla bean custard crepe with strawberries. Eh. It was ok. The custard was not quite what I expected, and tasted/had the texture of a less fluffy whipped cream. Meh. I could make this better at home.   I'm really interested in trying the coffee crepe w pork belly. But you have to get their before 11am I think, for that one. So.... yup. I'll be back to try that out! I might venture to try another dessert crepe.

UsEIcoBbJD_fXC-yWpN6NQ.text: Waiting for 2 weeks to meet a friend at Crepe Bar. Of course, read all the reviews on Yelp! Was a bit concerned about the size of the crepes after reading one review- really- the size of a business card? And, I do have a good appetite!!! Had pretty much made up my mind to try the Papa K as it pretty much had rave reviews.  Today came... and, geez... I was not disappointed!!! Love this place. Daughter lives in Portland, OR and I have never been to such cool and tasty restaurants as she has taken me to while visiting, Well, Crepe Bar could easily be in Portland and do GREAT business!!! Love the scene...decor is minimalist... which in someways was the only bittersweet part of the restaurant... by noon the crowd was coming, seemed the music picked up, so with the talk and music difficult to hear my friend as it seemed to echo through the room...but we managed. Small detail.  Service-as many other reviewers have said-was great. Young lady discussed the menu... after sitting down, we received a sweet small bowl of tender sweet potato potato chips... If they sold these I could eat a bag in one sitting. Delicious!!! A young man offered more coffee... And, toward the end of the meal, received two taste-size spoons of some sweet mixture topped with a slice of chocolate... Delicious!!!   We both ordered the Smokey... a delicious (how many times can I use this word for the Crepe Bar???) crepe with chorizo, turkey, avocado, and smoked Gouda. Did I say delicious? The combination needed no additional seasoning, and if the chef did, I could not tell. Truthfully, I have never eaten chorizo before, so I am now a convert... The flavors melded together. At times the smokey flavor of the Gouda would hit my taste palate reiterating the deliciousness of the Smokey. And, I was not disappointed by the size of the crepe...just enough. A small side of spring mix salad, with a light oil dressing accompanied the crepe and gave a just right change of texture when needed.  Can't wait to bring my husband here...or just return solo. Am hopeful the Crepe Bar makes it and remains in Tempe for a long time. Wish we had more of this variety of restaurant style and unique food in Tempe.

7coFEC3cCUuUwuzdPqNV-Q.text: Never disappointed in the delectable food. And the wait gives you a chance to reflect, meet new people or listen to the one your with.

EICxDfa8U2y80FFTeCKjcg.text: Meh. The food was pretty good, but the wait was insane and the crepe was so teeny tiny it didn't really seem worth the wait unfortunately.

kw-9QIjIQX729PtffkzuxA.text: Been here twice, both times on Sunday and had no problem getting a table- service was very quick.  Came once at 10 am and once at noon.  The first time, my sister and I got 3 savory crepes to share as another review said portions were small.  I don't know what that person was talking about The crepes we ordered were huge and even though 1 each would've been more than enough, we ate Every last bit because everything was amazing.  Got the papa k, duck Cuban, and the one with turkey/Gouda.  I think duck Cuban was the best.  Went back today and was excited to try the Grand Prix but wasn't too crazy about it.  I love anything with pork belly but it was a little overcooked and pretty salty.  I think it needed some cheese or greens to even out the saltiness.  If I had gotten this the first time I went, I probably wouldn't have been back but my husband Loved the pork belly and had no complaints.  BUT due to the 3 other delicious crepes I tried previously, I still want to try more on their menu and I'm sure I will be back.  I love the cute little designs they make in the lattes which are very good as well.   Their drinks are pretty pricey though - I think it was $3 or $4 for a half a cup of iced tea which was super sweet and didn't really taste like Iced tea.   Best to stick with the free water unless you're getting coffee  Overall, really great breakfast place.  I'd give it a 3.5 if we could give half stars

EM8RzEC7HVz-CyAi761jog.text: Great options and good crepes. The mocha was really good. They have the BEST chai here!! Must order that or a dirty chai. OMG!  So so good. The custard filled crepes are the best and the coffee flavored one. Banana Creme brulee was just ok.

rBWD_63VACxomIoKN4IkDg.text: OH.. WOW. just WOW....  The food A-MOH-ZING The service so good! The atmosphere.. i could stay here for hours!  I loved this place, it was great and i really will become a regular. It was a great brunch date and I am so happy we found this place. Try... Everything. And definitely get a Chai!

eyMQvfiJSwX-xj4Qvx9zTg.text: Been here twice.. I LOVE IT.    We ordered the Papa K which was excellent.. the ham and cheese.. so savory, every bite i took in super slow.  I ordered it with a fried egg on top, which i recommend.  Also got the Turkey crepe which was even better! Flavors so good you don't want to spoil them with any kind of hot sauce or even salt and pepper!  Also their latte art is really good and cute =)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K with fried egg

IG-zkPDVi9BTODmBrJmukQ.text: Amazing! Got the fried brioche, turkey crepe and the wake me up. All incredible! I don't know about 1 money sign though... Probably more like two. But that's kind of to be expected. Really dang good ingredients.

P7oSgTMCi78r6Yt5IYvLLA.text: Nice place.food is okay. Portions are small. I purchased two plate and was still hungry. I would expect more for the price.

DR7BCq0UTRTeS-FLCXGakQ.text: This place is awesome, the location is not so desirable. But, wow the food and preparation technique is fantastic. The quality and quantity of food for the price is perfect!  If you have a chance to order the pork belly you certainly won't be disappointed, and a side note the coffee is always on point!

wCRSIM4nn0menGl9tqMR3w.text: You know what? I can't really knock this place for anything. Good food that makes you feel like you're at a Brassierie in Paris. Delicious. Its mostly Crepes and eggs.  Very good.

oaKqbEjGhXjDkSE-5zYJOg.text: Delicious. Inexpensive. Awesome. Atmosphere is cute, a little hipster-esque but not obnoxiously so. We went on Valentine's Day morning, and it was not as busy as I thought it'd be. The service was quick and friendly, and there is an obvious indication from the gate that there is some serious heart going into cooking your food and making your drinks. Beautiful patio that was nice to enjoy our morning meal on. I got the chicken pesto crepe, and the chicken was cooked perfectly (not too dry) and it had some serious flavor. I got a mocha, too, and it was really delicious.  I was a little sad I didn't get a chance to go back to try one of their sweet crepes. Yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Valentine&#39;s Day mocha

Otkcwg_xaJAu_FzJuUIvaA.text: So amazing! My first time eating crepes, and I couldn't have chosen a better place to start! My caramel latte was also so delicious. I've been here the last two days in a row, and Crepe Bar just might be my new obsession!

KN4GzYM0Jiu6mVIDETlg6A.text: I wasn't expecting an upbeat little cafe when I thought that crepes was what I needed this morning, but that is what I got. Music going, people smiling, and my belly growling. I have passed this place many times, and never really felt that I was up for a morning crepe.. but it does beat an omelet IMO.   Crepes I had the pesto chicken crepe and it was awesome at first bite. OK, truth be told, after almost wolfing the whole thing down I found it a bit salty - still very tasty. I will go back here again for the crepes.   Coffee Being from Europe, so I have some expectations on coffee. This coffee is awesome. I didn't expect it, at all. A cup of coffee is like $2 and apparently comes with refills.. sweet deal.     You'll be greeted with a smile and the whole staff is easy going. That's all I am looking for in a cafe-kind-of-establishment anyhow. I really enjoyed it, and I definitely will be back here.

_iZhG6HqbEf7bcd3cJBY_w.text: This place was awesome..easily some of the best breakfast crepes I had. Unfortunately i did not have the sweet crepes but i am sure they are awesome. The only reason i gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is just for the length of time it took for our food to come out. Other than that i had a great experience.
