Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

pfP-3DxNfK-Sjc7VBHfw9g.text: Fantastic service and amazing unique food! This is a definite must if you want a great breakfast or brunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chef and Karl
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amazing desert

Jaak70jb4Tl2e3plXMBSZg.text: Located off the beaten path in a non-descript Tempe strip mall off Rural Road- they are putting out some very flavorful and creative crepes here! I have yelp to thank for discovering this gem of a cafe! While visiting Chandler for my son's volleyball tournament, I needed to get something to eat. I wasn't sure if I wanted breakfast or lunch, but when I saw Crepe bar, and its nearly 5-star rating on yelp, my curiosity got the better of me...  Apparently, crepe bar got its start as a food truck. Being a former small business owner, I always root for the little guy, so I was happy for their success in opening the cafe. I decided to order the one item on their menu that they had at the original food truck, The Papa K. I got mine with added scrambled eggs, and was it ever delicious! Made with local ham- served fresh and warm with a mushroom ragout, pepper jack cheese, plus a side of field greens (with an olive oil dressing), and crunchy Parmesan cheese around the edges- it was fabulous!   The service here is extraordinarily friendly and efficient... They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and appreciated. In addition to hearty, main course type crepes, they also have sweet crepes, with names like sugar Brule, maple butter, vanilla bean custard, and the one everyone seems to rave about- first time Nutella. I thought the complimentary starter of house made granola was a nice gesture. Full espresso bar and drip coffee, along with teas and beer are offered to complement the excellent food. The vibe here is young and hip- with concrete floors, colorful walls, happy people, and semi-loud music. I would go back in a heartbeat, and look forward to trying the sweet crepes next time.

SqzypI_yTHuUuqKZSyOkcg.text: I've been here 4 times now and had 6 different items on the menu so I figured its time for a review on Yelp. Everything I've had is delicious, smokey, papa k, andouille, pork belly, dulce de leche scone, and a coffee sweet crepe. My favorite is the andouille, sooooo much flavor and it compliments the delicious coffee perfectly. The coffee is Heart coffee from Oregon and it's my new favorite. I was told Heart coffee is liked by beer drinkers because of its unique taste. Drink it black the first time you have it and if you prefer cream and/or sugar after trying it straight then go for it.  Finally, the ambiance is upbeat and energizing with a perfect mix of music, mostly oldies and classic rock. Hands down my favorite breakfast joint in AZ. Well done to the staff and owners!

TUIsLlV4sJPYPcf8tM4KEQ.text: I'm in love w/this place! I tried their Breakfast Burro, which is something I normally wouldn't order.. but since there was so many great recommendations on it, I decided to give it a go! It was delicious; So many great flavors in one bite! While I waited for my order, I also got a complimentary granola, &cookie w/milk afterwards.. which always tastes better when handed for free :) To top it off, their customer service was excellent! Extremely helpful &kind. Overall, this little gem makes the drive from the West side well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burro &amp;granola

o60PlGNEAvaBhDr1_6P63w.text: Crepe Bar is a hidden southern Tempe secret that houses great food, affable service, and fantastic coffee. While it may be a smaller store that attracts hipsters like a sale on Pabst Blue ribbon, it's a wonderful place for a quick delicious lunch, and a satisfying cup of joe.  Before I talk about their namesake, let me first mention their coffee. I believe it's locally sourced, but wherever it's from it smells and tastes delicious. I love their cold brew for the sweeter flavor, but their latte's are excellent as well. Their coffee is always a nice pairing with anything else they serve.  I've sampled most of their "Savory" and "Sweet" menu and can't complain about anything. They have fresh and delicious ingredients and an ever changing menu that when paired with their expert understanding of ingredient ratio's creates a wonderfully balanced and sometimes surprising flavor. Their crepes are light as they should be, so expect a palate satisfying, not "carb intoxicating" experience. Despite what others on Yelp think, if you're complaining about a crepe being light, you might as well complain about soup being wet.  I don't have a lot of time off for lunch, but it's more than enough for a trip here. I've never felt that they've taken long with my order, despite the crowds, and the sample treats they bring to their customers always gives me a smile. I can't think of another pace that does this that doesn't also require a second mortage to eat at.  As for the reviews saying that it's too expensive or takes to long, please compare your experience at Crepe Bar to other similar restaurants. I mean, Essence bakery offers similar fare and they cost almost twice as much and always take much more time to prepare. I love Essence dearly; I'm just saying that good food takes time to prepare, make, plate, and serve. Twenty minutes for two crepes is nothing, and two meals out anywhere for less than $20 is an accomplishment. The only place faster and cheaper would be McDonalds, because even Ihop takes longer.  All in all, for a sweet & satisfying or perhaps a savory & satiating experience, check out Crepe Bar. Everything from their food, coffee, and service is wonderful, and as long as you have a well developed sense of reality, you'll have a great time.

4wwwM0pUxnD3uy2IM_HXPg.text: My husband and I discovered the crepe bar in a strip mall only a mile or so from our home.  The breakfast crepes were outstanding!  We got sweet and savory offering that were accompanied by a very fresh salad.  The coffee was delicious and the wait staff were very friendly and helpful.  I suppose the only negative was that we weren't sure there would be a table available.  I'm not sure how many the restaurant seats but it is rather small.  They have a few outside tables available but it would be nice if they could expand to an adjoining space.  The food was excellent and I highly recommend the business.

CMgDYotXZYOQ8KqbtU6nGQ.text: Incredible crepes! Very friendly and helpful staff!! Just passing through town, but we would definitely eat here again. Thanks, Crepe Bar!

gL9USc_jbHYbvUm7BCxzDA.text: Seriously delicious breakfast. Took 40 minutes to get our order but it was innovative and perfectly cooked. Friendly staff. Nice design. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand Prix.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla Creme with strawberries and caramel

lGzSVyQ5Gw7vEqgvdp-u5w.text: Creative food, creative space.  I love eating here, especially because they source food locally and the menu changes to match that.

ocGEkHad-krVLgQWfPHHTw.text: Love this place. They are really friendly  and crepes are wonderfully good. I take many of my girlfriends here for lunch.

vh1zCUiJSp5-viQEouAGNg.text: Love them french pancakes oh my so delishious. Like all kinds the desert crapes are awesome and enjoy the breakfast ones in morning i go here every other day to get one i highly reccommend them to everyone who  enjoys the taste of a thin pancake.

Wp5SAd8jbWREYeD2sBiN6Q.text: Crepe Bar will not disappoint. It can be pricey but you get what you pay for: quality ingredients in quality crepes, all of which are fresh and hand crafted with every order. The breakfast burro with potatoes is a must. Also the dessert crepes will leave you completely satisfied.

KtN55aJ896fROYYyJO8YVQ.text: I'm apparently a huge crepe lover, at least if they come from this place. When a friend suggested we get together for lunch at this restaurant, I begrudgingly accepted, thinking I'd end up with some small plate that would leave me hungry an hour or two later. I was incredibly wrong to cast any doubt on his recommendation. I got a turkey crepe that was both delicious and filling. In addition, we had the chance to try their vegan cereal which was just about one of the best cereals I have ever tasted (and as you can tell by the turkey crepe, I am not vegan). Even the iced tea was delicious and far, far above average.   If you question going out to eat crepes, stop right now. This restaurant is an amazing option for an area of town underserved by good restaurants. The staff is very attentive and, more importantly, friendly. I will most certainly go back and recommend you make a special trip even if it's out of your way. It is well worth it.

VgRGFAYEAnogu5qTUfYKEQ.text: Giving this place a 2 star review is like pouring a glass of water into a house fire. Whatever. Here's my 2 star review:  I really wanted to like this place. I really did. I enjoy crepes a ton and I LOVE JoBot in downtown Phoenix, but this place... it just left so much to be desired.  I ordered a Papa K and my girlfriend ordered the veggie stack. Her crepe, no joke, was the size of a business card. I still remember how heartbroken she looked when the server (who was very friendly) placed it in front of her. She spent all morning trying to find a new crepe place on Yelp and was really stoked when she came across Crepe Bar. It would've been nice to have been able to add egg to her's, but I can see how for her particular crepe, it would interfere with other tastes. My crepe was larger than her's--more of a standard crepe size, but still pretty small compared the other crepes I've enjoyed in Arizona, Chicago, and parts of California (haven't had crepes overseas yet). Coffee was decent.  Now, we're not big fat gun totin' 'Merican eaters--we don't do all-you-can-eat type of stuff, we never "biggie-size" anything. But c'mon. We never, ever say that a meal was "too small". This meal was measly, even for a 105 pound girl.  Size aside, the crepes were gourmet. Both were. You can tell that time was taken when writing this menu and the chef delivers in all avenues of taste. All two bites were satisfying, but you don't have to make your dish the size of a Gameboy pocket to make it seem more like "fine dining" or to make it look like it is out of a magazine. I know that the world of fine dining and culinary arts pushes for quality over quantity (rightfully so), but even quality food should be sized and plated appropriately. You wouldn't serve someone a 1oz Kobe beef steak just because you spent so much time and energy perfecting it.  The search for a new crepe place continues...

Mp1Uc9OE6LneUSphlaV5RQ.text: This is the best thing Tempe Chandler area has! The crepes are delicious and will leave you craving them again. The menu is sophisticated and ingredients are of high quality. Finally a respectable place in the southeast valley!!!!

C3c7NLFMlPLpKncJlCRBRQ.text: Clean, open airy place.  1 Star Nice, friendly, smiling workers. 2 Star Cold brewed coffee. 3 Star Yummy, fresh crepes with all sorts of wonderful ingredients.  4 Stars I really would give a 4.5, I'll need to go eat there, not take take-out to really experience the food.   I would recommend everyone check out this place.

-x8sSIMqrCCgkHBXv4_20A.text: Breakfast here was delicious. I had an iced latte and it was one of the best coffees I've had in a long time. I had the brioche with homemade jam and the bread was divine.  The turkey crepe was so good. My boyfriend had the chorizo burro with the CB fries. Their chorizo had the right amount of spice. The wait is a little long and the restaurant is a bit small (looks like they will be expanding their eating room).  The food was definitely worth it.

Buev2ZtVcrSZ9i3XD8_-tg.text: Awesome lunch meeting here last week! Both of us were first-timers and will definitely be back.  Sounds like weekends here are insanely busy but weekday lunch was perfect.  Great service, cute atmosphere, wonderful food and above par service! Lots of nice little to touches: granola and milk with apricots and cherries as a taste before the lunch dishes arrived and house-made rolos with sea salt as a nice post meal treat.  Had the chorizo and turkey crepe and could have eaten three more it was so good.  Have been craving it ever since and will be back soon for more.  Also looking forward to picking up some of the licorice sauce as a gift.

mtfsC9I5X_ylHJn2pvIp6g.text: Got a maple butter crepe with bananas, a cheesecake crepe with strawberries and chocolate, and the lemon crepe. When I checked in with Yelp, I also got a free coffee. All the crepes and the coffee were great - the maple butter one being my favourite and with the most flavour. The prices ($3.50 - $5) were reasonable for the size and ingredients as well.  The only problem I had was with the slow service. The cashier was writing all the orders down by hand really slowly and I stood there while she wrote the last person's order for a couple of minutes without much acknowledgement from her or the many people working behind the counter. The crepes, something I have experience getting fairly quickly, took a pretty long time. My coffee was brought to my table without creamer or without being asked about cream and there was no cream at the self-serve bar - all of which I found odd. It was a good thing I had no where to be or I would have been pretty upset.   However, the taste of the crepes outweighs any time inconvenience I experienced this visit. All the crepes were exceptional and I might try to come back to sample the savoury offerings.

nxyKK0K5MvuxQYZZymMUCg.text: Hmph.   We went to Crepe Bar on Sunday for breakfast, around 9:15. When we arrived, I'd say about half the tables were occupied, but there was no line. The girls at the counter explained the menu, but they were unfortunately out of my first menu option. Had to modify my second choice, since they were out of apples. Oh well. We still came up with two options we were happy with. Ordered a tea, and took a seat outside.   The tea came after five-ish minutes. Chai with almond milk. SO good I had to order another. And then we waited. Silverware came out, and we waited some more. I almost wish I had looked at my watch when we ordered, because it felt like a good 25-30 minutes before we got our food. Normally it wouldn't have bothered me that much, since I was sipping my tea in the sunshine, but I had a 10 o'clock appointment, and I'm not a fan of hoovering my food.   Alas, hoovering was required, and both crepes were gone within three minutes of being on the table. What little I was able to taste while inhaling was pretty yummy.   I wouldn't mind giving them another shot, but this is definitely not the spot if you're not planning on a very leisurely meal.

GxeUSOF8hX1TcAQDiWFL7g.text: The beauty of Crepe bar is their customer service and attention to detail. Yes, they offer some of the best coffee and food around but the True greatness of this place is how they treat you each time you come in. They offer free samples of their coffee, food, and deserts...and that's in one sitting. My friend and I  were offered roasted walnuts, a small cup of coffee, and a classy marshmallow with chocolate.   If you have not visited Crepe Bar than do yourself a favor and check this place out. You will be greeted with a smile and you will leave with one.

frScqusJoMZ7R2Xg8moydA.text: This is the BEST crepe place in the entire city. Banana Nutella crepe, first time crepe and other savory crepes by far the best I have ever tried. Long wait during lunch time but it is worth the wait.

FDT1qXu4zkn_-c1rOHPACA.text: We went in on an early afternoon. The place was busy but not packed. Placed our order and waited and waited and waited. We notice several people sitting next to us getting their orders ten minutes after sitting down. We went to complain and they said that the pesto chicken crepe takes longer. I'm not buying that. 40 minutes later our crepes came.  The food was good but I think the looonnnngggg wait left a bitter taste in our mouth.  Coffee very good as well.  We will try this place again but if we wait another 40 minutes and see other people get their orders before us despite seating after us, this review will be changed. We really want to stay in Chandler and support the small biz but we didn't like being insulted on our first visit here.

gs5BXb4WgK5Y2d7UkJx67g.text: The maple crepe with candied almonds: A sweet crepe that sits on a cushion of maple butter, doused in maple syrup and folded in with candied almonds. Crepe Bar can get (they don't) everything else wrong, and, I will still go back to eat this. Enough said.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Maple butter crepe

b4tjTQ6M1Rh1L4OgnFnhgw.text: Jeff and the team at Crepe Bar are awesome!  The Papa K with an egg is a delicious breakfast and highly recommend the First Time (Banana and Nutella) for dessert.  The occasion free bites are always a visual and tastey treat.

UKeicF5PruTJQrhfdN5p4Q.text: Definitely check this place out. The Wifey and I love to go here on weekend mornings. Staff is awesome, food is better if you can believe it. Can get busy, and the line confusing. However, the staff are definitely invested in the food, experience, and ambiance and do their best to accommodate everyone.

jozlb-jaemPTv6GgxID-lQ.text: We went as a group of four. My friends all had amazing crepes! The Grand Prix was the best. My chicken paprikash was pretty good but definitely not as good as theirs. Also, we ordered "the Business" cocktail. but there is also a non-cocktail version *also* called "the business." it's the same thing, just without the bourbon. but why call them the same thing?? anyway, great food! great ambiance.

dVjdQkGAHXuO8K2X-aTn8A.text: I enjoy crepes and hadn't had the opportunity eat them for sometime.  The Papa was as good as anticipated, a great combination of flavors and quite filling.  The atmosphere is casual and relaxing, fine if you are not hurried.  Just in the area for a few days, but will likely be back on my next visit to Scottsdale.

SjL23aDrbbGzXmVQn2bG2g.text: I was in search for an amazing crepe place and in The Crepe Bar I found it! The selections of savory crepes are just delectable!  I am quite fond of the chipotle crepe with chorizo and egg!  Yes they get busy and the dining area gets packed quickly but it's so much worth the wait to enjoy an amazing coffee and crepe!

BSETkJCWatF-zrd14mp0AQ.text: Awesome crepe's - creative, sweet or savory, and a trendy atmosphere. Made fresh, so take your time and enjoy the expirence!

ASa7F6na5wXAcPNA9xWT3w.text: This place is wonderful, the food is fresh and made from scratch, the owner is kind and friendly and the staff is always making sure each guest is having a positive welcoming experience- often they treat their guests with surprise free samples!  ;)

9R5M440glUOz90-G7ydMsA.text: I love this place. I've been there multiple times and it never disappoints!  Amazing, fresh and creative food.  Best vanilla latte in the valley!

4U-qmrXmEfAdLc_-8w2-vg.text: If you're out and about on the weekend you got to hit this place for some great breakfast or brunch food! They have recently expanded their seating capacity to accommodate the lines that always form at the counter every time we've walk in the door.  Always fresh ingredients and great flavors and spices. I either recommend the Papa K or the Nutella and banana breakfast that is out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K!

OKRUwPxjCaxbHO3xnyEing.text: Came here randomly one day since I was in the area. The food was good. Definitely not a place to go to if you're thinking of stuffing your face lol servings are normal sized not super sized the way most of us Americans are use to eating nowadays. Their chai tea was pretty good, you get them in cute cups with designs in your tea or coffee, you know that thing that's super popular on Instagram right now.   Overall the food was great the drinks were great the environment was great, the only thing that made my experience bad was the head cook or manager (not sure what his position was) he was being extremely rude to the girl at the register. I'm not sure if she was new or not but the way he talked to her made a lot of people uncomfortable. You could tell she was embarrassed. He was complaining to her that she kept allowing people order the same thing and I guess they were running out. He could've handled the situation a lot different. Maybe take her to the back and speak in private? Not yell at her while theirs a line to the door of new customers. Won't be going back for that reason. People need to learn how to be kind to one another regardless of the area or situation.

T49bAlY-WX9vDxf_-WnzkQ.text: Crepe Bar was excellent!! This was my second time here & brought my mom.   First time I went with my friend Melissa who introduced me to it. I had the Grand Prix with a Moroccan latte because I was craving something savory.   Second time I had the same latte and the lemon curd crepes.   Service is fast & the staff is friendly & there are great things to buy if you happen to be in the market for locally made granola, honey, or other new arrivals on the shelf.   Will definitely be back again.

MlSTtA3mFv2hOWObvTKC1Q.text: The lemon drop was delicious and not overly sweet. Also had the Jamaican jerk. Both we're plated nicely. Good balance, relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely come back!

UyfTJPgFTFXQ2HEeyrurrw.text: So I ordered the Lemon Crepe, it was alright, if you like the tart flavor. First time going, but imma come back. The food looks good, great social atmosphere. It's funny cause I never knew about this place, and always drove past it.

hORIHV829obC6MWkOVrzsw.text: Good food, maybe just not for the traditionalist.  Everything looks almost to beautiful to eat.  and tastes almost as good.  Wasn't a fan of getting up to get my own water and coffee, but again the coffee was good too.  The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.  Good food, just not the traditional restaurant with a server to bring you everything.

WEheC2x9LAxfTEdBFntFaw.text: Just moved back to town after an expat stint in Europe for a few years.  One of the staple items was Crepes in Europe.  You can find them at all the festival and usually a cart every other block in the city center. So... I was a bit hesitant if I was going to like Crepe bar or not.  We went there for brunch on Sunday and ordered a savory crepe, sweet crepe, and one of their brioche breads with nutella and fig jam.  I was pleasantly surprised at how great everything tasted.  You can definitely taste the Crepe very well on the vanilla bean.  The brioche was also excellent, and I'll try to order that next time I'm in the restaurant.  The other bonus was ordering a scone to go.  It was fantastic and definitely beats out anything you'll ever find at Starbucks.  All in all the food was great, the restaurant had a nice hipster feel to it with some local artwork.  There was a nice mix of young, old, and families.  I will definitely be coming back.

Aeb9_yWeIbXqPZ-clM_KjA.text: Loveeeeee me some crepes!!!!!  We came here for breakfast one morning.. I ordered the breakfast burro. This comes with chipotle crepe, eggs, bacon, queso jack, avocado and salsa. I also added chorizo to it. This crepe was sooooooo delicious! I do wish that it came with more avocado though. The chipotle sauce that it comes with was really good. I washed everything down with a chai tea that wasn't too shabby.   I really liked this place except there's a really long wait to get your food. I'm not sure if it's always like this but we waited about 30-35 minutes for our food. Maybe longer. I didn't know what to expect when I came here. I thought it was a full on restaurant. But it's not. You go to the front, get in line and order your dish. The place is really small so seating is also very limited. They should think about expanding the place. I'd come back to try out some more crepes though. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burro

yJKb_hLZwKQq5oT7WMQxwg.text: We came here for brunch and it was packed! There was a line out the door and while the wait for food was about 25 minutes the cashier was pleasant and warned us in advance. We got the One and One which was a perfect tasting of espresso and macchiato and it, along with our toast came up rather quickly despite the warning. The butter toast with cultured cream and jam was my favorite, great flavor combinations, different and a refreshing change. Out of the entrees our favorite was the Andouille crepe, tons of flavor, savory and satisfying.   If you are looking for a locally owned spot with inspired dishes, you should check out Crepe Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. One and One, espresso tasting plate.

nSLQWlB3zgknG7AI0RLmDA.text: This place gets it. In all of the ways that matter for a breakfast/brunch spot, they're nailing it. The space is cool, the food is delicious, the coffee comes from some legendary roaster out of Oregon (not sure that really matters, but the coffee is great!) all of the people that work there are friendly and take exceptional care of their guests. This morning I watched a customer walk up to the counter to ask what happened to the side of cream  he asked for (10 seconds earlier) The server politely replied that they were steaming his cream first so would make his coffee iced cold. Sometimes it's the little things.  The point is if you're thinking about opening a breakfast spot yourself, you should stop in to the crepe bar to see how its done. And also to have a delicious breakfast.   Thought about knocking a star off because they're closed on Mondays but I can't do it. It's too good a spot and besides, everybody needs a day off!

2DDL8ESutQXdz_lGTJRBfw.text: Pros: + High quality food and drink  Cons: - Super busy (is that a con really?)  Would I go back: Yes  Solid modern breakfast spot. I got the Papa K and a coffee, and left feeling quite happy. Definitely want to try their other offerings.  If you're looking for a nice relaxed morning meal, this is not the place. It is super busy and noisy, and finding a table is difficult. So depends on what you are going for.  Probably due to the popularity, the staff was seriously looking overwhelmed when I was there. The barista was clearly doing the work of two people at once and getting zero thanks for it. The manager was berating his staff all around even as they were moving at breakneck pace, though he did some leading by example so I'll give him that. With the kind of business they're getting I hope they increase the staff!

y6chH5aNaZcZiLTPHh8PZQ.text: Polite service but the longest wait ever for food. There was a child behind the register, not a good business practice because her hands were in everything. I thought the crepe was too doughy and bland. Pass.

zA6Oz6r870rBoWhC9iszWA.text: Just a little anecdote to add for my love of this place.   Came in for brunch today and they had a tomato salad special with CHEROKEE PURPLES. I love these guys. Ate our first order and I went back up. I asked if I could pay for another special but just have chef slice a tomato and finish with some olive oil and finishing salt. The kitchen said no, but they gave me a Cherokee Purple for free to take home. I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

ehvMwDOFEf1c4SgZE7oKDA.text: This place is awesome! Randomly found it on yelp, needed a breakfast spot to meet a friend. What an amazing find. We had the Smokey and the Grand Prix. Also the toast with fresh jam. All delicious! Cannot wait to go back and try something else.

SyK-yGK3VFIrLLBdNCPcsw.text: I went to Crepe Bar with a friend earlier this weekend and must say that if I lived in the east valley, this place may be my number one breakfast spot. We shared the breakfast burrito crepe and the vanilla bean crepe with strawberries and walnuts. The breakfast burrito crepe was delicious, it was spicy, salty, bacon -y, and all around awesome. The only thing I think is a little funny is that it doesn't really need the crepe (I know, blasphemy!), The eggs on their own would have bean equally as delicious. The sauces were wonderful as well. The sweet crepe was also very tasty, but definitely did not hold up to the other. It was much smaller than the breakfast burrito, but it had a subtly sweet flavor....it didn't hit you in the face with the sweetness, I think because of the buckwheat crepe maybe. Anyway, I would definitely return for breakfast! So why only 4 stars? The coffee.....the coffee was really acidic and I didn't love it so much....I was glad it was free with my Yelp check in (thanks Yelp!).

Fgp6wdxOQRFw2V_PMm2DgA.text: Cool space in a typically soulless AZ strip mall. The food is excellent as are the espresso drinks.(Besides Giant Coffee in Phoenix, this is my favorite coffee shop). The Pesto Chicken and Lemon Crepe are top-notch flavor-wise and the presentation is always impeccable. I laughed at one of the reviews that called the presentation "pretentious". How dare you make your food look like an art form! Anyways, the wait time can be a little excessive but it's worth it.

wmNnJcEfYLYRUbJRZKDiHg.text: Very delicious crepes!! I am yet to try the coffee. The staff is friendly. when I was there,  a lady on the staff, walked around starting conversations with the customers and it was very welcoming.  The place is small and most times that we have been there, it is packed. A good sign ya!

chP3ZwmSKLJBDy9MpO0ICg.text: My husband and I went to the Crepe Bar when it first opened and had a lovely breakfast. We used to visit the Crepe Truck at the Ahwatukee Farmer's Market, so we knew the crepes would be good. For whatever reason, we didn't go back for quite a while (probably more because we are creatures of habit and usually go to the Good Egg when we go out for breakfast.) We went back recently with 2 friends and were blown away! Everything is delicious, and the presentation of the crepes now is so beautiful and artistic. My husband and I shared a lemon drop and a smoked turkey. The lemon drop was beautiful,  it was wrapped to look like a flower; the flavor was wonderful, perfect combination of sweet and tart. The smoked turkey was incredible -smoky and savory and completely addictive.  I wanted to lick the plate! It came with a nice little side salad as well. We also got two complimentary treats. Before our meal, we were given a small bowl of marcona almonds with rosemary, and after we ate, we were given sea salt chocolates -both were lovely and nice touches. The one thing I wasn't crazy about was the house coffee- I thought it was really acidic, but that's just my taste. Next time, I'll probably get an espresso drink. I can't believe this place is in south Tempe, it would fit in perfectly in Scottsdale or Phoenix. I am so happy to live just a few minutes away from it. Can't wait to go back!

y7dVKUjtyk4-P7Avv8PNRw.text: Service was excellent and friendly. Breakfast burro was tasty. Coffee was good. Been here a couple of times. Packed for breakfast on a Saturday morning. Highly recommend visiting this place.

rqZ0fmZK2Th4s4zUYrULfg.text: This place is delicious!!! I highly recommend it. I had the smoked turkey savory crepe which was outstanding and the lemon drop sweet crepe which was amazing! Definitely recommend this place for crepes. The customer service was great too.

zvJin2Ew1S__40JBSOGxRA.text: I'm so full and I still want to eat more of these PHENOMENAL crepes. This place is amazing. The food is made with love, I can taste it. It's such an awesome place that they deserve a better location!

R2VYOt-0IXn6vdOLGQmUhg.text: Quaint little place next to p.croissant. They've got a bunch of savory and sweet creeps as well as some damn good coffee. The ingredients are all so fresh it makes it easy to love. I had ordered the duck Cuban but they were completely out of duck. We switched it up without any problem and they gave me a dessert on the house for the trouble. Really great customer service. Far exceeded my expectations. Everyone who works there is nice, chill and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

GKbAExJQXf8Qyl7ZSktIgw.text: Took our pastor and his wife there this weekend. Wonderful and they loved the coffee. I am gluten free but can do the Papa K with ham, egg and Buckwheat.  Highly recommended.

POzR45YbvkWviaxI9q8fXQ.text: My favorite place for crepes! I've been going since a couple of years back when they first opened. Authentic crispy thin crepes with innovative toppings. There isn't much option on the menu but it seems just enough to satisfy my cravings - a little bit of every breakfast option from cereal to scones to egg crepes. It's getting a big too crowded for me on the weekends but I'm glad Tempe has come to discover it's neighborhood gem. Great food, great people, great business.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Andouille
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

Dkz_iTF2MpE5p7ddkBm8MA.text: The Crepe Bar's popularity has outgrown the original serving/seating design. I find the restaurant now frustrating and no longer worth the wait or frustration. The owners need to rethink how diners are seated and served, what worked originally no longer works. You stand in line to place your order, you stand in line for a table, and then can wait as long as an hour for your food. I've also seen some folks rudely place keys or coats on tables then get in line to place orders, and then watch others balance their plates and stand & eat while they are just sitting there waiting for their food - the staff should have more control of the flow. The owners need to do something similar to the Farmhouse in Gilbert where folks signin upon arriving so that tables are flowing along with the meals.

16CQ1qYcxOGfZPHyd8qhGw.text: The smallest detail doesn't go unnoticed in this excellent breakfast spot. By far the best food and service I've had in a long time! I love the vanilla crepe as a favorite go-to.

3brsgTiPG8nMV87zv5OMJQ.text: I love this place! The coffee is delicious, the crepes are outstanding, and the quality of the ingredients as well as the creativity in preparation can be tasted in every bite. I came in on a Sunday, and the place was packed - service was phenomenal! I did not have to wait for long, staff found a way to make sure all the patrons were seated comfortably in a small (and adorable!) space, and I was even treated to samples of a delicious dessert. Pictures will come soon, but I needed to make sure to recommend this place - one of my neighborhood top 3. Go now!

gTK3sZAkqD0GYlCVR7w0Ig.text: Just finished a delicious breakfast.   I got a build it crepe with white cheddar and chorizo and devoted it.   My friends got the vanilla bean crepe and it was so light and a perfect blend of sweetness.   Highly recommend.

jcXC6o7h4-tWpAeodWRi4w.text: Solid food, trendy, and creative.  I was disappointed that they stop serving their maple, pork belly crepe at 11, as that is the highlight of their menu.  We enjoyed their breakfast burro, but found that the crepe itself was slightly soggy today, a little too much moisture in their batter.  My only other criticism of this place is that I wish they would dress up their patio, a few potted plants would go a long way to making it nice to sit outside. Will keep returning for the food though.

vyoTY23fv3jkx7h2hP5y8w.text: Food was superb, flavorful, and diverse. Coffee was excellent. I will definitely be coming back for more!

9lQZBQ3_RN6XHenkc-OhIw.text: I want to support this place and I think everyone should give it a shot. Great customer service and friendly staff. The coffee rules. I really just wish they had another vegan option besides cereal.

awFvbs3gO0HT-rhAMpDjkQ.text: This place is phenomenal!  I had the veggie crepe for breakfast & banana & Nutella for dessert.  Simply amazing!  Great job to the chef/owner for bringing quality food to the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Banana &amp; Nutella crepe.  Delicious!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Veggie crepe - beets &amp; pickled veggies.

LfjJ4SYxWPaVeS4mDkdRlw.text: I've been here with my son and ordered Vanilla custard crepe and banana chocolate crepe. Very good . Nice presentation, cool atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla custard

tUimFKEbBqiFScK1YhRwfw.text: Vanilla bean custard was so light and delicious, i don't like over doing it for breakfast and the crepe was just the perfect level of sweetness and the portion was good too, very tasty, the service was very good and they even got us granola before we ate as a starter, and dark chocolate for dessert after we ate for free since it was our first time there. Very nice staff :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

HqmQ5i6mWX7SGfOIIJF_pQ.text: It's few times in [my] life that you/I find a breakfast place that is just in one word: everything. The decor is cute as fuck, the food was amazing & we got 3 complimentary snacks and a dessert. The service was stellar, the food was.... Phenomenal. I will definitely come back. My boyfriend and I are on this mission to try as many new restaurants as we can in 2015, & this place is the first I've been absolutely enamored with. I will DEFINITELY be coming back super soon!

Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burro.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. So many snacks! I can&#39;t keep up!

Hd969s_GvTl_OfaAwqPAfQ.text: First. Aside from the niche cuisine genre, I would venture to say there are few who care more about their craft in Tempe (and dare I say greater Phoenix) than the folks at Crepe Bar. They care more about their food and community than I've seen elsewhere. It's remarkable.  Second, if you've ever watched Andrew Zimmern do that thing where he takes a bite of food, closes his eyes, has a little moment, and nods in agreement with the deliciousness of the morsel he just savored...   This is that sort of experience.   If you've never had a savory crepe (and I would guess there are quite a few of you out there), you'll never forget the first bite of a savory Crepe Bar crepe. It's masterful, and I can *barely* wrap my head around it. This is, by my knowledge, one of the only spots in town you can get premium cuts and preparations of duck, pork, chicken, etc. for a reasonable price, in a nearly anti-grandiose setting.  Highly recommended. Also, Coffee is a must.  Pros: other-wordly food, presentation, service, and fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. Craft. And coffee.  Cons: they're SUPER anti-substitution / omission / addition (which hasn't really ever been an issue for me, personally, but I've heard a few gripes from friends). Craft! They often get terribly crowded around brunch and throughout the morning / mid-day, and seating becomes a real issue because of the size of their space, availability of tables and chairs. I can't knock them for being popular.  Bonus: Oftentimes, complimentary miniature samples of their desserts and sides are delivered to your table mid-way through your meal. The first time I visited, this sample was a house-made rose infused marshmallow cube (brulee'd... at the table.) atop a shard of miso dark chocolate. Divine. Also, some of the staff at Crepe Bar (who knows- maybe *all* of them) are well in-sync with current craft coffee culture and trends. Crepe Bar is one of the only places in town where whole coffee beans from Heart Roasters (Portland) are available, as well as beans from the late local Phoenician roasters Nom de Plume (RIP).

GzAU4Em3pYLbx7v7knxd1g.text: I love this place so much! As soon as I walk in the ambiance is light and bright. Every time I go I am torn between crepes so I make sure I share a sweet and a savory one too. I love their lattes, rspecially vanilla! The milk is creamy and foamy just enough and the espresso shots are not bitter. I wish there was another location in the central Phoenix area.

mw72_SvWa9CHgj5cKtPNoA.text: We've been waiting to dine at crepe bar, and were ecstatic they had reopened after renovations;  however, our much anticipated visit was a letdown. After 20 minutes standing in line to order, we waited an additional 40 minutes for mediocre, cold crepes.  My girls had ordered the First time and Second time crepes, both were served with overly blackened banana.  Their kitchen is small and doesn't seem to be able to keep up with the demand well.    We won't be returning anytime soon.

yWMV4rhH5xx1RgI9UVpLVA.text: Cute little restaurant, had to wait about 40 minutes just for two crepes. The crepes themselves were pretty good but wouldn't wait that long again.

55-ULIdapXtM3h0aLxky4w.text: Seriously. This place is awesome. I have never once had a bad experience here. They are always nice, accommodating, and genuinely friendly. They offer you free granola while you wait for your food, which is homemade, and when you get your meal, it looks like a piece of art! A gourmet dish! I almost didn't want to eat, it looked too good! I had the lemon drop crepe, and the lemon curd and raspberry sauce was painted onto the plate. Seriously beautiful. Keep it up crepe bar! You're doing awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Editing at crepe bar! Love the creative environment! Very stylish place.

MldMifeJAPCsxUwip6NNNw.text: I adore Crepe Bar! Wonderful staff, delicious food prepared with a thoughtful hand, and fantastic coffee.  If going in on a Saturday or Sunday I recommend getting here early. I'm usually standing by the door when they open for business and usually there are others waiting. Don't go when you are in a hurry ... Go and bring a friend or two ... Enjoy the flavors and relax!   There really is nothing bad on the menu but don't be afraid to ask questions! The staff are so friendly and super helpful! My personal favorite is the Vanilla Bean Crepe with Strawberries (I usually order 2 for myself) and a drip coffee. You won't go wrong with this combo! I promise :-)   If you are really good ... You might even happen upon their CB cereal to munch on before your food arrives or a delicious surprise to finish your meal. I love it when they bring by little samples of their other menu items. It's the extra attention to detail that keeps me coming back!  Great job CB! Thanks for making delicious food :-)

gxEsnVsAZieG_SIizQhKmA.text: Only complaint is that it is a little small. Went there for brunch today and the crepe I had was delicious. If you're in the mood for coffee, the Wake Me Up is for you. My friend got the Vanilla Custard and said it tasted amazing. So two ideas for you. Can't wait to go back and try their savoury crepes!

Ora5bhwXr1Qaw_XYsuNbOA.text: Wow.  I never would have expected this in a strip mall eating place.  The crepes are out of this world, and they make expresso like no other!  They took the French recipe for crepe bars and recreated it here.  Very good selection of different crepes too (savory and sweet).  Love it.  The staff was excellent and helpful.  The whole place has a very hip vibe to it.  Great for the 20-30 somethings (I'm much older btw, but still loved the vibe).  Note that this is a "stand in line to order then sit down and wait for the food" place, so don't expect to be waited on (although they do deliver your food).  Anyway, I highly recommend if you love crepes and real expresso.  If you are an Eggo and Folgers person, then maybe you won't get it.  If you have never had real French crepes, I think this is the closest you'll get without going to France.  So much better than the American standard interpretation of a crepe..

rrp9S2w7F7Sl6PDGz_B6lA.text: I was really excited to try Crepe Bar because I LOVE crepes. LOVE crepes.  And Crepe Bar does make a nice, thin, authentic crepe - which I prefer.  I ordered the breakfast burrito sans bacon. The crepe itself was delicious - nay, perfect. The contents, however, were nearly inedible. The inside contents were so oversalted I wondered what it would taste like with salty bacon inside, as it is normally served. Blech. I don't know if it was their salsa that was too salty... Or the eggs.  Perhaps it was both. My lips are still dry from all that salt.  I don't know if someone forgot they had salted it and then salted it again, but it was just yuck.  This is a perfectly fine place to come for a dessert crepe. I tried a few bites of the Nutella crepe and thought it was delicious, mainly due to the caramelized sugar and bananas.  I am not a fan of Nutella because it is too sweet for me, but the crepe was really good.    One other positive?  Kids under 12 get perfectly portioned versions of the crepes for 1/2 price.  My daughter took advantage of this fantastic deal and ordered herself a simple crepe with caramelized sugar.  I snagged a bite of it and it was uber-yummy.  The space was very bare and I feel it could have about four or five more tables without feeling cramped.  There was art on the walls, but I didn't get a sense anyone helped the restaurateurs with their decor.  It did not seem minimalist on purpose.  It just seemed like they found some cool light fixtures they liked and threw some tables in there.  I KNOW it used to be operated out of a food truck; Now that it is a restaurant, I feel it could use some more thought.  Finally, and I know it is kind of gross to mention, there were two hair incidents here today.  First, there was a curly black hair that I noticed to the left of my plate almost immediately after it was set down in front of me.  Second, there was a blondish/white hair stuck to my daughter's caramelized fruit garnish (lemon or orange?).  I don't let these things get to me since I know they can happen anywhere, but I had to mention it since it wasn't just one.  I am not too concerned about the conditions in this restaurant.  It was otherwise very clean.  I just had to mention it.  In sum, I may come here again for a dessert crepe, but I will avoid the savory ones.  P.S. One pet peeve of mine?  They don't have regular soda brands.  I don't mind it when places carry only the Mexican Coke in bottles.  Kinda cool, retro thing going on there.  Crepe Bar only has GUS cola and, as a cola drinker, I found it gross.  It still had 24g of sugar, but it tasted like a diet.  If you're going to have cola soda at all, please consider carrying even a few bottles of Coke!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nutella crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

7rVGa-SqCCDu89i9JgPYXA.text: I recently moved here to the Phoenix area & I've been on a mission to find the best coffee shops in the area. This is my first review since moving here and with good reason. This cute little place trumps all coffee shops so far mainly because of their customer service. I can't even remember being treated so well as a customer. I wish I got her name, but one of the ladies brought us a few sample goodies while we waited for my sisters Breakfast Burro (which was so fricken amazing I.just.can't.).   My sister enjoyed her latte, I enjoyed my coffee, I enjoyed their playlist, & I enjoyed the calm but not library like atmosphere. Plus free wifi? Holla. Definitely will be a regular spot.  OH. & first place with free, that's right, FREE, coffee refills. Pure win for an avid coffee drinker like myself.

I4MRIGZ3Ren3uxjd4zg9FQ.text: The Papa K was excellent and the service was great.  The atmosphere, to me, feels a lot like a stationary version of a food truck. That's not a bad thing; I've had great food from trucks. Just be aware of that I'd you're expecting a fancy bistro-ish ambiance.  The menu is pretty simple: Savory vs. Sweet crepes, coffee/tea drinks, and a few other offerings. There are kids sizesI haven't had the coffee yet, but the iced chai wasn't bad at all.  I've only been here a couple of times, but I have yet to be disappointed and will most definitely be back to try the 'Sweet' side of the menu.

YEzhfcuvxf4hsoLmpjnnRg.text: I heard about this place and it went above and beyond anything I could have imagined. Great people working, the owner Jeff is a cool cat and you can tell his love comes out in his food.   Got the breakfast crepe burrito and it was out of this world!!!  I am going to make this a regular stop!  You gotta come check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is a cute little treat of cookies and milk as a gift from the owner! He is so cool!

4Z9YD3OdvQxBgcR5CASHYg.text: I love this place all of the crepes are amazing! The only reason I do not give them five stars is it takes FOREVER to get your food. Either way we will continue to go back when time permits.

k-wLkeCFxIWzyEtxTeDwHw.text: Hubby and I went on a rare morning without the kids. Maybe it was the fact that we were able to have a grown up conversation and have a normal meal without having to feed one child while having to listen to another child talk about farts, but the food was amazingly good and coffee tastes great. Loved that they gave you something to nibble on while you waited for your meal and then a little dessert to end the meal.

FlcDr4VW9NVMtGkRHVeW1Q.text: Took the family here for breakfast and was the 3rd one in line.  The line only grew and I never saw it get shorter than 5 people so they must be doing something right.  The family enjoyed every moment of it.  The staff were extremely helpful with our orders.  Remember to check-in to receive free coffee or tea.  My wife really enjoyed the coffee and the tea was refreshing.  Will be back next Sunday.

bHdua4y8DYTuyNc9nkp7Zw.text: I don't think it's possible to have a bad meal here. Try anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed. Chef Jeff sends over yummy treats if he's in the kitchen and makes you feel attended to and special. It's a little gem in Tempe that needs to be visited!

LlLh1EWZ4fR3mrpXuA5OdA.text: My review play by play style:   Came in and was greeted by the staff. Started looking at the menu and decided on a Papa K (spinach, mushroom, ham, pepper jack) and an iced mocha. Paying using Square Pay on the iPad being used as a register is awesome, screw the credit card companies.   As I sit here waiting for my crepe I can only think that if the food is as awesome as the service my mouth is in for a treat. Everybody is helpful, friendly and enthusiastic. The owner is out talking to everyone and letting us know he appreciates us coming in, something I love seeing business owners do.  For my mocha pretty quick and it is really good. I am not a huge coffee fan and don't order them often but this one is good. Maybe it's a bit extra chocolate making me happy but it works. Not to mention its not all ice like Starbucks is.   Holy flavor explosion in my mouth that is tasty. Just got the crepe (maybe 5 minutes wait if that) and took a bite. That is great. I got a first bite full of flavor and the edge of the crepe with a little but of just crispy cheese oozing out. This thing is also a big crepe and stuffed to the max. All the flavors go great and the pepper jack is spicy but not over powering the spinach and mushroom.   The flavors work very well together and it's  fantastic. The crepe itself is just right and takes me back to being in Paris. The crepe is the right density to be filling but not heavy, and light but still be filling.  The density is the biggest problem I have seen with crepes outside of France.   This thing is packed full and filling me up quick. My stomach is saying stop but my taste buds and brain are screaming for another bite. The saltiness of the ham is addictive with smoky flavor.   Ok finished the crepe and totally filled, amazing considering how hungry I was. Pretty quickly the staff sees I am done and  clears the table for me while I finish mocha and this review.   Final thoughts this place is great and I cant wait to come back and try the other crepes. Oh crap I see a strawberry topped one next to me, I need to get out of here before I order a desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K and an Iced Mocha

UEz3PFkCyGByK4TqUNapDQ.text: I discovered this gem in the East Valley by chance. I simply noticed a new sign had gone up in a neighborhood near my home that I was interested in exploring more. They hadn't actually opened yet, but I was able to find out about their soft opening after some on-line research, and dragged a roommate to the venue. This didn't give us a complete understanding of how wonderful their menu is, but we were able to sample some delicious free bites that inspired us to come back again. This was also the first time that I had been served anything in a disposable pipet, which indicated to me that the owners might be attuned to the finer details of a good dining experience.  And that's what the Crepe Bar is all about... subtle but deliberate choices on delivering a delicious meal. The crepes are perfect! There is so much more finesse and nuance to a breakfast burrito that is served wrapped in a crepe than you can imagine. They also provide a small pile of gourmet salt on the plate so that you can apply just the right  sprinkle. I urge you to try this place for breakfast sometime and see how it stacks up to your other favorites. What I like best is that the portions are not overwhelming but satisfying, the finesse and attention paid to fresh ingredients and flavors is spot-on, and it has the feel of a casual coffee shop... but with food that is truly exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. interior of Crepe Bar

07GPjuuGB3Nbs4gG0nboMA.text: My first visit with coworkers - was very surprise to see this place -  love it. I had the veggie crepe for lunch. I am going to try something sweet next time. This place is only 5 minutes away from my work, how awesome is that!

9FV3b9khrPjilOASXoeLYw.text: Delicious crepes, at least the vanilla bean custard and strawberry one! Busy place on Saturday morning so a long wait for our food but good. My husband and I each ordered the vanilla and strawberry crepe which was delicious but we were both still a little hungry afterward. Will order more next time! Great neighborhood vibe.

dwRTShmiJ9_OZF3P3oFwXQ.text: Why was I the only one in here on a Wednesday morning? The "breakfast burrito" was perfect. A crepe filled with egg, covered with both crumbled and powdered bacon. Yes, powdered bacon. The portion size was just right for breakfast, not too filling and I didn't feel like I needed to eat lunch by 10:30am. Staff was friendly and attentive and my food came out quickly, though that should be expected with no other costumers. Maybe it gets more crowded after 7:30 or on weekends?

dflEI7Ffl9O9F6mvJIMhbQ.text: Had the breakfast burro---and it was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is relaxing, with great music. The staff is very friendly as well.

f5yuYE_B_7pF0wKRPizBsQ.text: This place is fantastic. The breakfast burro and duck cuban crepes are truly standout. The brioche of the day is always an enjoyable way to pass uour morning. The only downside is that people know about this place now so don't expect to be able to get in and out during lunch. That being said slow down and enjoy life a little by lingering here.

tdvxAiewZRChChUbKGBkcw.text: This place is so awesome! The food is so good, I haven't had crepes this good in years! People are friendly and they have a good barista along with a ton of different drinks. Only down side is they are only open until 2 :(

0QysbSJgIzN_ZaFbFte9Wg.text: These were seriously the best crepes I have ever eaten. The staff was super friendly and gave us some complimentary (and incredibly delicious) homemade granola while we waited for our breakfast. It's refreshing to have a unique place like this in south Tempe.

uRfj0yX473hGpuwpxO-KQg.text: Literally the best customer service/experience/breakfast in town. The coffee is amazing and the staff rocks.

jNhhVPPWHI11XUi09wtGFg.text: After our first experience there yesterday, we went back for more today!  It's really a shame that I live only a mile from this place!  We have tried the Papa K, the Roasted Chicken, Ham and Gruyere, and the First Timer (nutella and banana).  The server was passing out samples of granola today, I would definitely order this next time - a sweet and salty flavor that I wasn't expecting of housemade granola.  It has been a long time since we have liked a new restaurant so much we went back again the next day.  The chef obviously has a love for the craft of creperie and food in general.  We overheard they may be opening for dinners soon.  Can't wait for the next venture there!

qVAiZwFcp2CjuTBzozkArA.text: Not a fan of crepes, so I'll leave that out and rate based on experience and service. Got invited here with friends. Grumpy employees all around. Tiny space. Cramped and uncomfortable. They were out of vital ingredients for my first three dishes I wanted to order. Cashier got annoyed with me that they didn't have items they were displaying as available. Took an hour and fifteen minutes to get food. Complained after 45 minutes and they said they'll bring out some complimentary appetizers. The complimentary appetizers were brought out by a young guy who called himself a chef. He explained his experimental apps- torched cocoa powder. It was a dish. With cocoa powder on it. That he pointed a torch at. At first I thought he was making a joke, and then I felt a little insulted. Another half hour later, and our food came out. Which was edible at least. I wouldn't come back here if it was free--again; my distaste for crepes aside. Maybe it was a bad, isolated experience, but what else can I speak to?

J3byjYkIKe4xSehM5EPpIw.text: I found this restaurant on yelp & have been back once a week for the last month or so... I'm from the Bay Area & it feels a like a little bit of SF transplanted to AZ. So far I've tried the PapaK crepe once & all the other times I've had the breakfast burrito crepe. The burrito one is very yummy - it has the right synthesis of eggs, avocado, cheese, and chipotle sauce.  The staff is really great. They are attentive without being overwhelming, which is a difficult balance to strike.  I've been here both at lunch times during the week and also on the weekends. I haven't had any issues with slow service, so maybe things are getting better compared to the earlier reviews? Or maybe I just don't notice it because I know what they are making for me during that time...!

wm6Reouk37iUMiPVjrtsKA.text: Delicious and very unique crepes! Awesome service! I highly recommend this place. Can't wait to go back!

I99Ej7FTQbFOCpkPyHLEzQ.text: Ca fait longtemps que je voulais tant les crepe!! (excuse the improper accenting). You have got to go here! It's been a long time since I've had a really good crepe period, let alone one savory (the chorizo one) and one sweet (nutella and banana) all in the same day, and let me tell you- it was heaven.  So rich and delicious.

wLTzRDJ-kmALzXFd9E8wGA.text: The whole staff was very chipper. Me and my group all ordered something different. Everything that was ordered was amazing. This is my new favorite breakfast place. I love the different spin they put on their food. And the atmosphere is amazing!!

2iqp_XXuEKQeFGXP_qsYMA.text: Food was very good. It was our first visit and we came away impressed with the food and staff. The wait however was a little long. Waited over 10 min to get to the front of the line to place our order and over 35 min until our order was ready. Overall it was a good experience (we weren't in a rush) but don't be in a hurry if you go on a Sunday morning.

GHkPlJfw5wefwBrImd88nQ.text: Just amazing. Had a real cappuccino (not the diabetic coma induced sugar concoction that is the green apron trend) and my bf had a tea that was simple and perfect. His burro crepe was wonderful and my Grand Prix crepe may have been the best thing I have ever had for breakfast. Funky space, great staff and homemade food that made for an excellent Saturday morning!

m19Xntluoq7AwZ8Fb5dQZw.text: Delicious...thoroughly enjoyed my nutella and banana crepe.  The presentation was beautiful, the service was quick and friendly and the atmosphere is simple, but nice.  Definitely check this place out!

mHgfNcT1MZ9-mvt6OGyJ7Q.text: Absolutely the best breakfast in the area! Make sure you pay attention to the hours. I highly suggest the brioche and coffee! But all of the crepes are amazing!

e581zUm6epxyBNBMt6M3Cg.text: Great place... We had the vanilla custard with strawberries and chicken pesto both were great. Coming back very soon!!! I wish this place was open in the evening as well.

rchFRXBazqq4F8M16EnV3g.text: Hmm.  Just made my 6th visit to this place in the last couple months.  Needless to say, I am a fan.  The coffee and crepes are excellent - the savory turkey is a favorite.  The house made granola is killer.  They amped up the ambience recently by adding art work which makes for a nice, homey feel.  Prices are absolutely reasonable.    However, they appear to be suffering from some growing pains.  My husband and I visited last Saturday and waited 45 mins (!!) for our meal.  By the time our order came our coffee had grown cold.  When I asked for a refill I was told I'd need to get it myself ("because if I go get it, they'll charge you".)  I also ordered a bag of granola at the counter and had to remind the cashier twice before I finally received it.  The food was good, as usual, but overall the visit was frustrating.  Even the staff seemed confused.    My suggestions to the owners are simple.  Figure out your service model.  If you're offering counter service, then develop a system that lets me know when my food is ready.  An even better idea would be to hire wait staff.  I'd rather drink hot coffee with my meal and eat my desert crepe after I've completed my entree.  I'd also suggest losing the t-shirt rack near the front door.  None of the shirts said Crepe Bar (?) so it was hard to figure out what the point was.    I'll definitely be back, hoping for the best.  Good luck to the owners as they continue to work the kinks out.  UPDATE:  Last 3-4 visits were flawless so I'm upgrading to 5 stars.  Go Crepe Bar!

TwJCMKisgxg-uXMmKIyzcQ.text: Tried this place out a few weeks ago and come back almost every weekend!!  The crepes are absolutely delicious and prepared perfectly and the place itself is so cute! Everyone is very nice and welcoming. This place is always busy (which is a good sign)!  We will continue to come back!   We've had the maple butter (sweet but SO delicious) the Papa K (savory and amazing) and the Jamaican Jerk (FAVORITE savory one). The flavors are all delicious and wonderfully paired. We've also had the vanilla latte and the mimosas. Both are also delicious.  This place is definitely worth going to! We love it here!

WUJuzAmxgU1dpNmIsI6ZmQ.text: The Crepe bar was amazing! It was like I was brought to heaven,and the workers are very nice they deserve a raise!! The food is high quality.   You should try the avocado toast!  (Kid tested & approved)

7KLyeWpgb27WegDSapJD2A.text: Whenever I hear "crepe" I think of banana and nutella, but this place definitely turned that thinking around. The breakfast burrito was very flavorful without being too heavy, even with the mayo sauce. I actually really liked the crepe as a substitute for tortilla; it's a lot chewier and moist without being soggy. I gotta try their sweet crepes next!  The service was outstanding as well. I was apprehensive about the staff being snobby hipsters, especially since it was only 45 min till closing time when we got there. To my surprise, they were super friendly. Actually some of the patrons didn't get their food until almost 2pm, but I didn't feel like the staff was rushing them to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grand prix. Interesting salty &amp; sweet flavor.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Complimentary cookies and milk.
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Classic nutella and banana

GolrdLuU9qggrydwMETdsQ.text: My first time and I will be back! The presentation of the food was spectacular and the taste was spot on. Great flavor. When you arrive, you are served with a small dish of house granola. Atmosphere is great and customer service is excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cappuccino. Love the art work!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean crepe with lemon curd and strawberries
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Veggie crepe

92FLtWzUErP-NskJjD0k0A.text: To be honest, I was skeptical of the location of the Crepe Bar. It's in a brown mall next to Fry's or something. But all I'd heard about this place was- Perfection! Savory goodness!- so I walked in...  When I entered this restaurant/cafe, it was a different story. Every wall is decorated with a local painter's touch (most likely) and every server I encountered had the biggest smile on her/his face.  AND I had the honor of meeting the Chef Jeff who made delicious dishes that filled me up just right.   Don't forget to try the following: - FREE drip coffee if you check in with Yelp (what a deal!) - Pork Belly dish (forgot the name but ask for it!) with coffee infused crepes!  - Hot chocolate that smells like rose and has a melting marshmallow on top (heaven!) = Chef Jeff's newest creation - AND the maple butter crepe that's so simple that it's perfect.  This was my last meal in Phoenix and I couldn't have had a better meal.  THANK YOU to all the staff members I met today; it was truly a miracle that such a lovely gem was the last place I got to go to on my last day in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amazing service, delicious crepes and friendly people!

jQbC8yp_jv_dsJfSfOW_iQ.text: If there is a wait, wait it out. You want this. My aunt and my sister go a lot. And seating has been a issue but you are never disappointed by the food or customer service, always friendly giving you samples of the thing that they produce in house (Haven't been since the expansion). I always love their savory options.   I work in the service industry and they always impress me.

Krow5Uj6OBuZgkTJLUc6SQ.text: Fantastic breakfast.  Had the buckwheat chorizo crepe with a coffee.  The crepe was perfect and the coffee was nice and strong.    The people were very friendly.  Definitely worth a try.

vdo7nexs9_HbisKsmGP_oQ.text: Hands down a mouth watering artistic piece of art that took me on a very satisfying culinary journey. Ordered the 13th Mile savory crepe and it didn't disappoint. Seasonal farm to table local veggies inside with an ethnic Indian twist. The flavor was exquisite and well done. The presentation was immaculate and was above my expectations. Very welcoming staff that also brought me a little free extra: a housemade scone and I don't like scones, but LOVED this one. Was bacon and blue cheese and mild, not overpowering flavors. Very well done, thank you, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. 13th Mile crepe: A work of art, exceeding my expectations. Fabulous exotic flavor!

eO3V5c476rU1dOv2MbDhUA.text: Hole in the wall. Before our food even came out they brought us some granola, which was to die for.   I got the Breakfast Burrito with Chorizo, it was pretty good. Instead of your standard tortilla they use a chipotle crepe. And it's only $8($6.75 w/o chorizo), you can't really beat that.   For dessert I went with the "First Time," which is a banana and Nutella brulee crepe, it was perfect. Not too sweet, just right. There's not much room for error when it comes to bananas and Nutella.   Overall it was a great place, highly recommend it. It wasn't busy at all when I went but it was a Thursday, I can only imagine what the weekends look like.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

GnKNPLCVq41D3T21x8i1gA.text: I love their food but the service is pretty bad. Waited for 30mins for a crepe and a side. Waitress brought me the wrong side and told me they had ran out of ingredients. When I checked with other staff they told me she was in fact lying. So pretty disappointed with the staff but love their food. Will probably try somewhere else next time

efUf-kmV9H5CZpBEqdD5gg.text: Ok this has now become my wife and mines weekly place. Simply amazing. Today we had a smoky and for the first time an andoui. Really good but I prefer the smoky because of its more complex flavor. My wife had the breakfast burrito. Its Her favorite!  See you next week!

ebnbJqcMQJniZKQUSVY59g.text: My husband calls this a "hipster haven," and I love it! We frequent Crepe bar often for breakfast as it is right around the corner from our home. If you a first timer, you cannot go wrong with the "First Time" crepe. BEST NUTELLA CREPE OF YOUR LIFE! Not joking. I seriously consider myself a sweet crepe lover, and lover of anything Nutella, and this crepe will blow your mind!  Papa K is delicious if you are looking for a savory crepe, as well as the Breakfast Burrito. I have yet to have something unsatisfying there, and I truly think it's impossible.  Oh, and the latte art! So cute. Not only do you get to enjoy delicious hand crafted love in a cup, it looks cute too.   And lastly, the friendly staff are always walking around with snacks for you to munch on while you wait for your food, whether it's their house-made granola, or sage tea bread, it's all so good!  Fav breakfast place by far.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. love in a cup

1MhmZRCH0htp8UG0d8Sp1Q.text: Went here yesterday for the first time based on yelp reviews and I have to say YOU GUYS WERE RIGHT this place was excellent. From the time my guest and I arrived (11am) we were greeted (with a smile) while in line - which was shorter than I expected for a Saturday morning and given a menu to look over while we waited.   At the register the girl asked us if we had any questions about anything on the menu, which we didn't and we proceeded to order - I ordered the breakfast burro crepe and a vanilla custard crepe for after and my guest had the basil chicken and maple butter crepe. Both options were absolutely amazing I would post a pic but I didn't take one before I had the chance to bite into it.  While seated we were given a sample of granola which was also excellent and we also ordered 2 chai teas..the entire meal came to a total of $42 which for the service, fresh offerings and atmosphere I would gladly pay again. The Grand Prix was sold out but I'm determined to try that my next trip out.  If you haven't been here you must bookmark this spot as your go to for a light breakfast/lunch.

BcPSd89edehFXOdPpjAjDQ.text: We ordered two crepes the AZhoney crepe (banana, pecans and honey) and the winner circle (pork, poached egg, maple syrup).  The winner circle crepe was delicious and the coffee as well. The winner circle came first , the AZhoney didn't come on time, we had to ask the server about our order. She came over with the AZhoney and  it was cold, the bananas were not ripe enough totally not worth our money.  The AZhoney  was literally a bare crepe with a little honey ( tasted like a pancake without syrup) given our service and the quality totally not worth the price tag.  We told the waiter and the lady at the register about it and they were indifferent.  We will never come back.

COpTvKaP2pEOihSMpopUrA.text: This place is absolutely perfect.  I never give 5 stars yet this place is worth it. My 1st visit this morning and I had the basil chicken crepe and shared the lemon drop sweet crepe as a dessert.  Presentation was beautifully plated,  the flavors very distinctive.  I can't wait to come back

qh0SwXm9FH08-MQHHSnJdg.text: Somehow I always get the TLC song stuck in my head when I come here "So I crepe, yeaaaaahh"   Ok, enough bad puns.   Everyone already knows about Crepe Bar and how awesome it is (as evidenced by the jam pack-edness on the weekends), so here are a few tips to make your trip extra enjoyable.   1. Be ready to meet some of the nicest servers in the valley 2.  Grand Prix - order it early before they run out 3.  If they do run out you can resort to the Maple crepe and add the pork jowl (similar but not. the. same) 4.  Coffee - just... Yes... To all of it.  5.  Go during the week to avoid the crowds 6.  Or go during the weekend to get your fix of "Yum" and a lively atmosphere

Fw8FimOwnPxrgtj_2ZvCYw.text: Jeff is generous, funny, and a MASTER of his craft. We love his face off.   He really understands how to create complex flavor profiles (and I don't use the term often because I have no idea what I'm doing when it comes to cooking), and literally every dish stands out in its own way. I have yet to try something here that I don't like, and I would venture to say I've at least sampled 80% of the menu.  The maple butter banana brulee blows my freakin' mind every time. The appetizers here are also a mind explosion - they have these smoked sweet potatoes that taste like a campfire in the most delicious way possible.   If that weren't enough to sell you, everyone on the waitstaff is super friendly and knowledgeable and they always offer my dogs water when I bring them. Can't get any better than that.

Cvoov4RrOjdYiuSLd72wdA.text: Amazing place. Food was delicious. I had the 13mi veggie crepe and my mom had the chorizo crepe. Wow! We finished off with the salted caramel crepe and 2 lattes.  Service is above expectations! Told server it was my moms birthday and he brought out 2 chocolates made in house and wished my mom happy birthday.   Will definitely go again.

7NnB39NHZ0HU50CgBDh0WA.text: This place is hands down quality! I've had crepes all over the world and this place definitely makes you feel like you're in France w out having to worry about speaking french! ;p Their recipes are unique and delicious. My absolute favorite is the rose marshmallow hazelnut crepe. Definitely not like anything else out there. It's a mix between Turkish delights, s'mores w Nutella infusion

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. always fresh &amp; goes straight to my heart  (and belly)
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. This was a great way to celebrate my birthday morning!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Macchiato !

CMrp0U78VC10_pgR3m6vog.text: The pork maple dish is incredible. At first put off by the order at counter format (was there for a biz meeting), quickly got over it with food quality. Nicely done!

jCjzeFT5mMAfYY16bh0dLQ.text: Oh my goodness. The crepes were phenomenal. My fiance and I ordered 1. The vanilla crepe with the candied pistachios and marinated strawberries and 2. The tahini crepe with chicken (savory). Both were really delicious! Had a tough time choosing a savory crepe, the other good choice according to reviewers is the paprika chicken crepe. The paprika crepe is for those who prefer more seasoning and the tahini crepe is for those who enjoy hummus and creamy flavors. The vanilla crepe has the perfect balance of sweetness and can only be described as perfection. Love this place and would have breakfast here every week if I could! We also ordered a vanilla and seasalt caramel latte which were okay, 3/5. The coffee roast didn't have much flavor, and didn't awaken the senses. The crepes are the real stars here!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

ROhhcwpZtkTjuxIE2FhhUQ.text: Pretty good! Had a hard time deciding on what to order since everything looked so good. Shared a sweet and savory crepe and both were delicious. Got an Irish iced coffee that was good as well! Long line, but the wait for our food wasn't too bad. They've got plenty of seating which is good since it was so busy.

DLBKHFIfy5Y2mtwZqPp7iw.text: Soooooo bomb and staff is very friendly. From the sweet to savory flavors we loved them all, all homemade. Very busy on the weekends, it's a small quaint spot so it felt a little crowded but we took it as a good sign.

xX15FQPkDtpG-ycGMZEGtw.text: Not only does this little gem have great food and coffee, but buckwheat crepes too!  I don't understand why crepes have not taken off as a thing around here, but I am sure glad this chef decided to give it a go in South Tempe. The staff is super friendly, but today they truly went out of their way. We were celebrating Father's Day with my octogenarian parents, and the restaurant was packed (as it is often on Sundays). Only high-top tables were available which were not suitable for Mom and her walker.  I asked if they could help us out when a regular table came available, and they were quick to place a reserved sign on one close to being available.  The staff checked on us a few times too. Thanks for the great service.

vcive3rysH5YT6hnCHzlPw.text: AMAZING! The food here is amazing. I had the crepe-a-changa with chicken and it was delicious. Crisp shell, flavorful black beans, chunks of chicken, avocado.... She had the brioche toast. Boom flavor bomb! Sweet fluffy toasty bread with a zesty lemon curd and strawberries. (Mouth watering). And they bring you a complimentary bowl of granola that I can only describe as F'ng amazing. Salty and sweet. Stop reading and start driving to this hidden gem.

WdJ7sVDnnhRCafSVj-f2hg.text: This place is wonderful! The space is cool, the staff has always been so friendly. We've been going for two years at least and we love it so much. They've recently added onto their vegetarian and even some vegan options. Their CB Blintz is my (current) favorite, my partners fave is the avocado toast although he's always trying new things bc he loves the restaurant so much. It's over the counter service which we love. I used to have the Ode To Sundae all the time. They've got such fun twists on their menu and I think they're all something to write home about

JKcjU_doNBw_phHCoZCgyA.text: Love it! As soon as you walk in you can smell the aroma of coffee and variety of foods. The time I went it was packed, but the wait was worth it. I ordered the Papa K (savory) and Vanilla bean (sweet). Both satisfying very much! You have a combination of high tops tables and low. As well as seating outside. I would definitely recommend. Absolutely delish!

YDzKLdXaE9LVZqmYV0PUSw.text: Delicious food and friendly staff. First timers. My family will definitely be back! Thank you Crepe Bar.
