Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ode to Sundae-not too sweet-yummy
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Roasted Vegetable Crêpe-Yum  My fave

1i4qpCMF-5cT5KVlYh_3VA.text: I absolutely love this place. My wife is a huge fan of crepes and we found this place about a year ago. Since then we have been there six more times together and she has went with her mom and daughter a few additional times. She loves the strawberry/banana crepe, but I have turned her more toward the savory. The Grand Prix is a definite winner with a great piece of pork belly. I also have ordered the Jamaican Jerk Pork multiple times. The latte is wonderful, and she loves the selection of tea. The restaurant used to be very crowded and it was difficult to find seating, but they have expanded and solved that as best as possible. There is also the option to sit outside. Two savory crepes, a latte, and tea will come in around $26, but it is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jamaican Jerk Pork

8SDUhPYDckFQXcoW7Cuhcg.text: A delicious update! I haven't been here since they expanded their space and changed up the menu a bit so we decided to try out Crepe Bar for breakfast today. We got here a few minutes after opening (9 AM on Sunday) and there was already a line 5-6 people deep to order! That gave us time to decide what to get at least. There is a good variety of savory and sweet crepes, various coffee and tea beverages, and a small selection of non crepe items. I had the octopus crepe, tried a bit of the tahini chicken crepe, and shared the dulce de leche crepe to finish our meal.   While we were waiting for our order the server brought out a small plate of chicharron with dipping sauce. It was a great way to pique our appetite and had a lovely presentation. Our entrees looked even more beautiful, with a well balanced presentation and mix of colors. My octopus crepe was served on 3 small crepes open faced. Because the crepes were thin, and the filling plentiful but crumbly it was hard to get a good bite of filling with crepe. I loved the presentation but I think having a more traditional folded up crepe would make it easier to eat the dish. In general the octopus was tender and flavorful but was slightly chewier than the amazing octopus dish at Virtu and Nico's Heirloom Kitchen. The chorizo in the dish was decent, but after a while I was wishing there were a slightly sweet element in the dish to balance out all the salty flavors. Perhaps a small squeeze of orange would help brighten up the dish.  I tried a bit of the tahini chicken crepe which had a lovely balance of flavors and textures. The chickpeas were a wonderful surprise as they were dehydrated so they tasted crispy and light.  Our dulce de leche crepe for dessert was amazing. The fresh slices of creamy banana went well with the soft crepe, lightly sweet sauce, and crunchy candied pepitas. I would definitely order this again (And again, and again)!  I ordered a Moroccan spiced almond milk latte, which had a subtle hint of exotic spice with a light flavor of honey. It was a well balanced drink. Note that the hot drinks (At least with my latte) are served in a cup that has no handle. My hands got a bit sticky since some of the coffee and milk spilled off the side and I had to grip the cup with both my hands to drink it (First world problems, right?).   Overall, it was an enjoyable experience. I will definitely come back again! Upgrade one star.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Granola amuse bouche
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. AZ honey crepe
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious chocolate samples

uOudglsorM9wwg7RR07ftw.text: Delicious! Super happy there is a place dedicated to crepes in my area. I look forward to the next Sunday I spend here. I highly recommend to any breakfast lovers.

mO-BWN0nIzw67nF9SYpU6g.text: This place gets quite busy on weekend making it hard to find a table. Nice atmosphere. Food was delicious. I love their sweet Crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Second time sweet crepe and burritos

d9xyd4NgETcZFJwVCHvnDg.text: Great food! Gourmet food in the shape of crepes. Friendly service. Baked goods are amazing.

Nl36NTQYtPdBmrULq3v0lw.text: Average and will not return.  I have been wanting to try the Crepe place for a long while and was seriously disappointed. I did not read too many reviews because I did not want to be influenced. The one review I did read mentioned the rude kitchen lead and I am guessing that was the same person I said under my breath was a terrible person.  I don't know but almost thinking he maybe the owner?  Seems to me when they remodeled they should have made the kitchen bigger and more feng shui. I also feel like there is a lot of wasted space. They were not busy when I went on Sunday at 9:30am but if they are as busy as it sounds there could be so much more seating. I was watching the kitchen staff and perhaps they need training and a sense of "team" to be more effective. Especially since they are visible to the public.  Overall vibe was not rewarding. Did not feel any different from when I walked in.   The food, eh not impressed. I ate it (3 stars) but pretty sure will never have a craving. Maybe they should visit La Creperie in Fort Collins, CO. That I enjoyed.   And no substitutions, you may delete but not add.   Good Luck

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Savory

heqStClInzImQ34V_YaTQQ.text: Beautiful place. Yummy food , customer service is great. Exploring different cafe places & this is one of my faves ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

kmyZpZqz5pAYyW9IhODpmA.text: What a great place for breakfast and coffee. The food is amazing!  I can't wait to go back

aZQIleZnfj1QwZgIFNwl3Q.text: I have been here quite a few times and, while the service has never been good, this last visit on the morning of Friday July 27th really showed how poorly the staff at Crepe Bar is trained. A group of friends and I came to this restaurant and grabbed the only open table that would seat all five of us. We all order food and are halfway through eating when an employee comes by and places two cards on our table without saying a word. After he walks away, we take a look at the cards and see that they say "Reserved". A few minutes later, he comes back and says that they have a group coming in and basically asks us to leave so that they could have our table. There was nothing that indicated that the table was reserved before we sat down and we had only been there for about 40 minutes before he asked us to leave. We decided not to get up as we were nowhere near finished, and about 10 minutes later, the large party came in. It appeared to be a bachelorette party or something similar and for some reason they had a clothesline with a bunch of pairs of underwear on the table, which was a bit off putting to see in a restaurant.   Overall, this was just a ridiculous experience. If a table is reserved, perhaps it would be wise to say so before a group of customers sits down and gets their food. Also, this same employee rather aggressively said to us "You didn't eat the granola that I brought you?" Which might have been a joke, but was said in a rather rude tone and made us all uncomfortable. Don't come to this restaurant if you care about good service. And the drinks are tiny and expensive and the iced tea does not have refills.

wbrnSC0gNSUgrGOEz8T_Sg.text: Haven't been here in a while but I love the fruit filled crepes. Perfect light treat for after work.

LXUPsZfshF4el_dMPeRhLA.text: Definitely check this place out. The Wifey and I love to go here on weekend mornings. Staff is awesome, food is better if you can believe it. Can get busy, and the line confusing. However, the staff are definitely invested in the food, experience, and ambiance and do their best to accommodate everyone.

SS3zP0bt58FeaUskMWhcoQ.text: The s'mores crepe is to die for!!! Saw this place on the news had to go check it out and it lived up to every bite. The gentleman who was working helped me pick out my flavor and was very sweet and taking to me the entire time he was making it. Highly recommend it. It is in front of the ASU building and parking in that parking lot is a bit risky without paying but worth the risk.

JRqmC2g13d8aCvveN5d24w.text: Wow,  great place for Brunch.  Very very outstanding service,  Yummy Crepes, highly recommend this place if you want a really delicious breakfast to start your day.

haXdheQBgL8cl9aPWoAydg.text: Went for the first time. The place is awesome. I love the industrial feel and relaxed environment. It gives me a downtown vibe. The staff was very helpful, they asked me if I had ever been here before and explained to me how the process works. You order at the front and pick any table that you want. They bring the food to you.  I ordered the "Say Cheese" Savory Crepe which is a savory crepe filled with scrabbled eggs and cheese. You have an option of choosing a cheese and it comes with a small side salad with a vinaigrette dressing. Overall the crepe was delicious, simple, cheese had a great flavor and combined with the salad it's great! The chocolate scone was amazing. Not too sweet, which I like. The chocolate drizzle on top made it even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Say cheese crepe

SXpjBpiNyssecKqHCUT0GQ.text: The menu is limited but they do it really well. Go here for the crepes savory or sweet. It's also nice to support a local venue. Great coffee. If it's busy it's worth the wait.

WZJr8BaACdYTb_zvObgo9A.text: Great place to chill and enjoy breakfast on a Sunday. We had the lemon drop with lemon curd. We will return on a Sunday.

tjGe7FoWfqTb_TQygO5DTg.text: In an effort to branch out & try some cool spots outside of downtown Phoenix, I found myself here for brunch. It was busy but we still got a table with no problem. It's an order at the front first type of place FYI. It's cute inside & surprisingly bigger than it appears. I ordered the Papa K crepe & it was pretty good. Not the best crepe I've ever had, but tasty & satisfying. The highlight was definitely the honey latte though! I have a thing for more uniquely flavored lattes. The service is very laid back & casual. If you need anything, expect to grab it yourself. Overall it was a good experience. I would be fine coming back, but it's probably not something I'd suggest myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Papa K Crepe

HSEVKk7GIW6RsqrbM-GcQw.text: This place had a delicious breakfast!!! Sometimes I crave sweet, sometimes savory, but I got both at this breakfast spot. I ordered the Sundae Crepe and it was soooo good. Custard, strawberries, sweet roasted peanuts and more. It was also nice that they brought out a small bowl of sweet cereal with dried fruit and nuts while we waited. Oh, and yes, they have mimosas! My favorite part of a weekend brunch.

uc1HcT-A4txKejhTIq2ZsA.text: Food is wonderful!!! It can get pretty busy during brunch. Their crepes was amazing. I ordered their savory vegetarian crepe, which did not disappoint! Next time I'll try their sweet crepes.

BQ2CamXY4yBXNR-GY_U1tw.text: Very good crepe place. Definitely a good morning breakfast after a long night. I went the sweet route and got the one like a sundae. I thought it was good, although it could used another fruit than strawberry. I got the business coffee which pretty much made the whole deal worth while. Real solid breakfast, would like to try a more savory crepe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

e5JuqxRrP3tIE0C1uOPNaw.text: I am used to homeamade crepes and am skeptical about venturing out. This place made me a believer though. Service is fast and friendly. I don't eat meat (fish and veggies only) and there are plenty of options for sweet and savory whether or not you eat meat. I enjoy the sweet crepes when I am there, especially the lemon one. Sweet is not too sweet, it's the perfect sweet.

j7YGL8y_EJZyfCGLQ_pYvg.text: I absolutely loved the coffee here. Very robust but smoooooth! I enjoyed the buckwheat crepe with veggies. Unfortunately, not gluten free, which I will pay for. Ugggh, though worth the itching and tummy ache. Lol They have a lovely menu and are in the process of expanding the dining area.  We got here early due to a long waiting line.  There is limited patio seating so plan accordingly.

_ZvRMd3kjBZUAe11RCI6bw.text: Crepes and mimosas.. best brunch in a darn long time here in az.  I'm a foodie and Yelp is a great source to find new spots to keep coming back to.

62emNl1tXSeFbHDYcEPuYQ.text: This place was great! Not exactly what I expected but nice. Kind of had a Lux Central vibe but much smaller and less of a food selection. However I loved it. I got the vanilla bean crepe and the Moroccan latte. Both were amazing. I was a little concerned about the pistachios but they are delicious. Definitely grab a few bites with the berry, crepe, pistachio and caramel! It is DIVINE!! The latte was great too; it had a very unique flavor that compliments the crepe very well. I'm looking forward to going back to trying more of the menu. Also the cereal you get to snack on while you're waiting is beyond AMAZING. I could eat it solo everyday.

ovmh4Jwt_ukdG9CZ6vTzbQ.text: Thats being generous. Over priced piss water coffee that you have to serve your self. I dont know how they think those potatoes on the side are edible. Long line, all the employees do is ask people who appear done if they need anything else over and over again pushing them out so the people in line have somewhere to sit. Rude employees. Terrible food. Disgusting coffee.

RbFJuvg6YIgsshtAiYUuxQ.text: What a quaint little spot!   Crepes everything.  I took my teenage daughter here and it stole her heart. She loved the vibe and so did I. We were both very pleased with our selection,  I got the papa k, the mushrooms were amazing.  She got the ode to sundae, sweet but not overly sweet.  She also got a chai tea and after tasting it I wish i had too, but the line was out the door. Very casual,  make yourself at home.  Water and coffee is self serve. Specialty drinks are made to order.  Definitely going to be a regular breakfast escape.

o3XNgOWAi_b183hn_PqSYw.text: Jeff and his team have created something very special. Crepe Bar is a must try if you are in the South Tempe Area. I have had the Papa K a few times and it's one of my favorite crepes. Also have had the Grand Prix and the burrito - both excellent.  Stop by, you'll be glad you did.

akP5kGcdHT0H_1R9DEoFbQ.text: This place is delicious! Love the many savory crepe options - very unique, tasty, and filling. The owners are really nice guys and there's interesting art on the walls - what more could you want?!

f3CqiaeZcb2Rl-TeJcLWaw.text: We love this place, simple but delicious!! We love all of the different varieties available. Great job & thanks for keeping your prices reasonable

L2qW4tWBaf_LA-W6d34VLQ.text: Not sure why it took me so long to write a review for this little cafe since I've been coming here for years and am always extremely satisfied.   You can't go wrong with anything you order here so give it a whirl. They have sweet and savory crepes as well as pastries. Everything dish, pastry, or coffee is carefully composed and you can tell that the people working here really care about what they put out. I'll keep the review short and simply say that that if you haven't stopped in yet, you're missing out!

NnPMBQlTrcUULCBHb3HSgQ.text: I've been a regular customer at crepe bar for quite some time now and I have to say its by far the best crepes I've had in Arizona. The atmosphere of the place is very cool and hip and all of the workers are very friendly. They always bring out a little appetizer while you are waiting for your meal as the waits here tend to be pretty long. Don't come here expecting a quick and fast meal as they are always busy and it usually take 15-20 minutes for your crepes to come out.   Never the less the crepes are delicious and they always come out fantastically presented. One thing that does bother me is that they don't do substitutions on the crepes, ex) I can't substitute strawberries for bananas on the Nutella crepe.  I highly recommend the breakfast burro crepe and then the vanilla bean and strawberry crepe for dessert. And of course don't forget to try their coffee, its always made fresh to order and they use super high quality coffee beans, the coffee always turns out fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Definitely recommend getting the Moroccan Iced coffee, its got a sweet cinnamon taste to it and its so rich and creamy. One of my favorites!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla Bean and Strawberries crepe

TeT5T7dLKXIXqPSU2FF1yQ.text: Look no further. I mean it. You want quality flavor busting crepes? They are here waiting for you.  The have the best savory crepes and their sweet crepes are only second to France.  Only downside is the wait... Expect 45 minutes for your food to be prepared but it is worth it.  They don't make substitutions so those who prefer little to no salt, be aware as the flavors are strong and yummy.  Highly recommend the andouille sausage crepe.

P_2KAUS5foWKvly8QZ21Eg.text: This place is absolutely awesome!  Deliciousness in every bite of the 3 crepes that I tried, totally unexpected tasty samplers while waiting, and super service!  While waiting for our orders, we received a sample of the CB cereal and farro pudding.  The cereal was more than just your typical cereal (some nuts and dried fruits - check out the pics).  The pudding was a cool refreshing treat that I'll have to try more of.  Then the crepes came out.  We tried the chicken pesto and the smokey crepe.  Both offer such great flavors of savoriness.  The dessert crepe was the Pick Me Up Crepe - if you love your share of coffee, this one is definitely for you (packed with espresso marscapone and hazelnut goodness).  I cannot wait to try the other items!

Toa0ONd9Rl1SJFaJiGscRQ.text: This place has self service to order but a very good table service and cool interiors. The crepes are prepared very nicely and all the ingredients are fresh. Coffee selection is also vast, we ordered pour over (awesome) and honey latte (a bit sweet). Will def gong back for breakfast.

1N5IZOElVRyIB4RUvLirbQ.text: From the coffee, to the food and the atmosphere. This place is where it is at!! I can't wait to try other things on the menu! I had "the first time": Nutella banana crepes, there iron cast toast and cappuccino! Amazing- it all just taste so fresh. You can tell the employees believe in the food and providing good service. I really enjoyed myself here and definitely will be coming back! Can't wait. Thank you!

XHDoAwEfwuRvDlpM54tt6w.text: Great, unique menu and exceptional service! I finally tried this place after being told many times by friends how good it is. My roommate and I went on a Saturday morning at about noon. You can expect a small line and few free tables, but that's just another sign its worth the wait. We were helped even when waiting in line by the friendly staff who gave us some awesome suggestions. We ordered the strawberry vanilla crepe and the toast with avocado spread egg, and sprouts. It was easy to tell the ingredients were of the highest, freshest quality. I also drank my coffee black, which I don't normally do, because it was just that good. While we were waiting, one of the employees brought us out a taste of their granola (easily the best I'd ever had and I'm really regretting not buying a bag!), a bowl of their perfectly crispy kale chips, and two sea-salt mint chocolates after our meal. The atmosphere was charming - a very local feel and truly a hidden gem. I was also able to bring my dog, although we had to wait a bit for one of the outside tables (I wish they had a few more).   Can't wait to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brioche with avocado spread, egg, and sprouts. So good!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vanilla strawberry crepe

JuENlgodwghgZlUnmTYFsg.text: I love the decor here! And major props for sourcing fresh and local ingredients! (So I don't mind paying the higher prices) I tried the breakfast burro crepe with chorizo, but the chorizo was dry and detracted from the rest of the crepe... But their sweet crepes (I tried the Pick me up and Vanilla bean) are definitely worth the hype! I especially like the coffee crepe - gives it great flavor without being overpowering. And while it gets pretty busy during the weekend brunch hours, the tables turn over relatively fast.

P_OLT85R7y-EJEXj3PH6Aw.text: Awesome. Delicious and unique. If you have a sweet tooth, try the Nutella toast. The crepes were amazing

oFcJBrIdAO5ySGFhAQDLIg.text: Outstanding! They know how to balance flavors perfectly. Such pride and love put into the food they serve. Great customer service. Great coffee. Such an enjoyable experience!

zCaK63GqFhTT3QWW2jbxOA.text: One of my very fav places ever!! The food is always fresh, bright and delicious. All these flavors bursting in your mouth! The chef has done a beautiful job of pairing things together and making the most wonderful dishes. I like to try something new every time. The staff is very knowledgeable about the menu and they will help you decide if you need assistance.  Go here once a month, love it!

-qdHksS--X7juCAr0nBKuw.text: I used to LOVE this place. Then they decided to expand their space which sounded awesome. After being closed basically all summer (with no real warning) they reopened. The new space is great but they completely changed their menu and got rid of a bunch of their amazing crepes. I am not a huge fan of the new menu and I very nicely asked if they could change out the cheese in my crepe to a less spicy option (not everyone likes spicy). Not only did the manager refuse to grant my request, she basically lectured me about how if they changed out my cheese they would run out by the end of the day. This was on a Wednesday and the place was less than half full. After asking again nicely she still refused. It soured my whole visit and I am not sure when I will be back. Really, really bummed about the changes here.

fNZsKL_605kpiuJtdDSjiQ.text: Yummy! We arrived shortly before close and still received stellar service. They had had a busy lunch and were out of quite a bit of the crepe fillings. But the Staff was super friendly and answered questions and offered  their suggestions when we couldn't decide in which dessert crepe we were gonna have.    I enjoyed the breakfast burrito with no bacon and a vanilla bean crepe w strawberries.  One of the friends I was with got the breakfast burrito with bacon. It had a white bacon powder on it that was a mystery fluff to us before we asked. Apparently is has a subtle bacon flavor. Either way; the idea was creative and original but may have fallen short of its potential.   Before entries came out they brought dehydrated kale chips and a gummy candy treat. It was perfect! After we finished those they brought out a granola mix; which was a little sweet for my palate, but still enjoyable.   The complimentary treats were much appreciated!   Overall vibe of the place is pretty chill with attractive art work.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kale chips and gummy treats

Ut97l9W7suU-lhnmn6CYAQ.text: Clean and modern restaurant but very overrated. Very expensive considering their portion size. Sweet crepe was very good but savory food was disappointing. Great service but bad coffee. Would never come again.

62T-3Bm1NesEtbooI2VPxQ.text: I've come here a countless number of times. The food is always superior quality, the flavor combinations are very unique! When I go here, I get a high quality meal for a very reasonable price, without the stuffy feeling of a fancy restaurant. They even take the time to change the presentation of their crepes (monthly, I believe). It does get crowded on weekends, but the wait is well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Their limited quantity special, the Grand Prix.

_M_fDddrvCv4FxdjQ2cl8g.text: This place was such a surprise! The menu was small, but thoughtful. The staff was attentive and gracious. The atmosphere was the only reason that I am only giving four out of five stars.   Ordering was a little chaotic. It's a walk up counter/ coffee bar. There are people waiting by the cash register for their to go coffee and it feels congested. But that's the only downside of this neat place.   When I sat down at the table to wait for my meal I was given a tiny bowl of homemade granola that was a salty and sweet  and the perfect tapas to nibble on before my mushroom Ragu crep was delivered. My crep came out quickly and it was delicious! There was a little serving of beautifully seasoned sea salt on the side of the plate which parred perfectly with the crep.   At the end of the meal I was served a dessert tapas of homemade rose scented marshmallows that are toasted at the table by the server and drizzled with dark chocolate. To die for.   I will definitely be going back! I can't wait to try everything on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rose scented marshmallow, table side toasted with dark chocolate drizzle.

zE7w-7b5TORDfM9Jw41N9Q.text: If you're looking for the perfect, cozy, quaint and totally delicious spot for breakfast - don't miss this place. The menu is filled with choices between unique savory options and a few sweet ones to satisfy your sweet tooth.  And the coffee is served in real cups with saucers and tastes amazing.  My sister and I shared the Chicken Pesto crepe and the Lemon Drop crepe to have a savory and sweet breakfast and we were not disappointed. The crepes are large and filling!   Only two things you should know: this place is small so sometimes finding a table can be a challenge. And the food takes a while from the kitchen but it's worth the wait. The service is incredible and the even bring out little "snacks" to try while you wait.   Do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. First round was a cappuccino and it was floavorful and tasty...and the latte art is pretty too!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. We had the chicken pesto and lemon drop crepe with mocha coffees and all of is was amazingly delicious!

zv6EGxdB_6lu4WhTxxNXaQ.text: Short version: Awesome food. Awesome services. Friendly and safe atmosphere.   Full version: My boyfriend and I stopped here once before and it was pure deliciousness. Today, we had the breakfast burro. The eggs were perfectly fluffy and there was just enough chorizo and bacon to satisfy my savory buds. The iced Carmel latte is so good! It was almost buttery. We finished off with a sweet crepe, vanilla cream with strawberries, chocolate pistachios, and espresso chocolate syrup. Amazing.  The staff really care about their customers. Not only are they friendly but they have also taken CPR courses to ensure the safety of their customers and employees. A customer needed attention of the EMTs and the staff assisted with keeping customers calm and comfortable while help was on its way.  Apparently another incident happened before and they were quick to certify their staff. I'm impressed with them for taking the initiative to have their staff trained.

jpQnfUuEUzP9MnmB6IUhww.text: The WORSE meal I've ever eaten.  Seriously, I can't believe they served me warmed up olives in a microwave as their "fried olives" and a doughy under cooked crepe.  The bananas were supposed to be caramelized with spiced pecans, etc.  Nope, just raw bananas with some raw pecans.  NO flavor whatsoever in the crepe and it was so raw it was inedible.  Unfortunately it was a to go order and I didn't open it until I got back to my office.  Way overpriced and terrible food.

neXLLcRxA6P3v_dxSFg_Sw.text: FANTASTIC lunch this afternoon with my husband!  The staff is awesome and the owner made us a delicious dessert afterwards. PERFECTION on a plate!  Thank you, Jeff!

1EdIh8W7ceo6U_cXY4zaUw.text: My new favorite breakfast spot.  The breakfast burrito crepe is a must, their iced coffee are really good and the hipsters are nice. no phone orders only down side as it's pretty busy every time I've gone.

CanI-tIPGdZovq-iF9wt8A.text: I was waiting for this place to open so I can check it out. Ordered the veggie crepe, and was momentarily concerned by how small the serving seemed to be--this did not actually end up being a problem, like at all. The combination of flavours was unexpected and delicious!! The coffee was awesome, service super friendly--really makes me want to support this local business. Only slight concern may be that $12 is a little steep to pay for lunch: just a crepe and latte.

8Msgm1GqZC1ra9rtMU0vnw.text: I was blown away when I went here. This is my first review, and I had to do it because these people are amazing.  I never felt like I ate somewhere where what I was eating was such art and had a lot of passion behind the making of it. They care about what they make. Of course the service is great and the hosts seem very humble about their great product.  I got the veggie stack. There was room for dessert, so I got the vanilla vean custard crepe. I am blown away by how great this place is. I hope they keep up their passion for producing a great product.

ZXVSG5E77G96XzkBJQjb6A.text: I've been here a couple of times now.  I'm definitely a fan of sweet crepes, and this place delivers.  The crepes are soft, delicate, and very thin, which I think is more "authentic".  They taste great - I've had bruleed sugar, nutella/bananas, and vanilla custard crepes, and was never disappointed.  The coffee is fantastic.  I love the latte art - always seems to make the drink taste even better.  Speaking of which, the food arrangements are always spectacular, which adds to the gourmet feel of the place.  It's definitely pricier than I would like.  A single bruleed sugar crepe (the cheapest on the menu) and a coffee drink ended up costing about $10.  Try not to get too addicted, but it's definitely great for a special occasion.

E-0MVl9OMwoJ56Lyy16P1w.text: Food is great and service is always amazing as well! We have been here multiple times and always great. If you like crepes then this is a MUST!!!

z3KEUu-rDSTKPXdvxSoz_A.text: Best breakfast burrito I have ever had. It was wrapped in a crepe instead of a burrito and it was fantastic. The dessert crepe we had after was really good too! It did take about 25 minutes to get our food but they told us that ahead of time so we got some banana bread (also great!) to tide us over.  Will definitely become a repeat customer!

Bm4zgALofNSGFVHMg4o0HQ.text: I just went in because I always hear great things. Definitely lived up to the hype, the crepe I had was amazing. I don't really eat crepes that often but it was the best one I have had, the espresso that I ordered along with it was smooth and well pulled. The staff seems really nice, and they play great music. Ill definitely recommend this place to everyone I know.

PVHpZNCrnpZ1bChVGt7VQQ.text: This place could be GREAT with just some minor changes, first to the atmosphere. Crepes were perfectly cooked, prices are fair, and the staff is very friendly and personable! My coffee was not made correctly but the staff was quick to offer a replacement. The atmosphere and design need a bit of attention, as I think that they are going for modern/artsy, but it comes across as a bit stark. While eating such a comfort food as crepes, I wanted more of a comfortable and welcoming surrounding, I think couches and books would be a nice touch. I would give a four star had the coffee been a bit better. I do recommend for an early morning sweet tooth!

ZOOijcjTjp1H70scMO_qGQ.text: Awesome Crepes, great atmosphere and wonderful service. The server kept bringing me little samples to try as well. A tiny cup of cereal and a small bite of coffee cake.

9qRuCqTXwnreluUh468oDw.text: A fantastic place for breakfast & lunch in south Tempe!  So glad you opened in my neighborhood!! Jeff, the owner, is so passionate with food, he uses high quality ingredients and make wonders with every single item on the menu! Refreshing!

XDS6dXFPpteyYARV71776A.text: The atmosphere is laid back, the service is amazing. I had the breakfast burro with chorizo and a drip coffee.  My wife had the smokey and a chai latte. The portion sizes are just enough, but not too much. The drinks were very good. We received multiple complimentary small bites from the chef, much to our surprise.  This may have been because we were there on Father's Day. The dishes were simple, yet delicious.  We will definitely be returning and bringing friends.

NPwhIbQkuIiBvF7Skx7Wpw.text: Delicious gourmet crepes. Friendly staff. Awesome environment. Price is right. Eat here, it's good.

3gUThLm5SzKdmCFcQYIl_g.text: I love love love this place.  The coffee is out of this world as is all of the menu!  I want to go sit with my laptop and hang out there soon- great ambiance.  How lucky are we in Tempe that they moved in?

OjdLfcWCRPBRzp4-sf1Uyw.text: This place was super charming. I don't always like the order first, then find seats method, but it wasn't too bad and we went on Saturday morning around 10 am. The lemon crepes were amazing though not very big. Order another dish and you're all set!

-RZrDKvIU-AgWYXths9YAw.text: Absolutely delicious and great service.   Jeff, the owner was very friendly and easygoing. We talked about his french-inspired recipes and his foodtruck background.  The menu is pretty simple, with about a dozen crepes and a standard coffe-bar drink menu. Jeff says the crepe selection is always changing - when we went he had some cool seasonal options. For crepes you have the choice of 'savory' or 'sweet.' My wife and I both ordered savory and loved our choices.  The menu is reasonably priced - about $4-$5 for sweet and $7 for savory. For two savory crepes and two drinks our bill was $20 and change.  We will definitely be back to eat our way through the menu!

fLLEUVxL3qm6gtyOSBHm3g.text: Phenomenal service and food. This place is my new favorite spot for food that is off the typical beaten path but worth the stray. Each plate is dressed like it just came out of a four star kitchen. Bravo!

4CWHGeleOuSZSClpT5UfyA.text: I met up with the brunch meet up group....OMG, my mouth was having a fabulous experience.  I have to admit, these were the best crepes I've ever had.  I had the Buckwheat crepe (piquante, mushroom ragout, horseradish havarti), this was so wonderful, even the small salad greens with an amazing dressing....I wanted my eating experience to last all day! What a 'savory' delicious experience.  I also wanted to try something light and sweet, so I had the sugar bruleed crepe.  The owner also was giving out some of their side treats, of toast and strawberry, as well as chocolate treats.  I highly recommend this fabulous place.  It is a small venue, so expect to share your space with others.

DFhxvPqbJmxml1unourIaQ.text: The Crepes here are quite fantastic, however the portions are small.   The prices are a bit on the high end, considering the atmosphere.  Nonetheless, the service was good and the food was tasty.

k-hpa_NCXpeC4iUlV6Kmvg.text: We go there every weekend morning because of its family style, friendly crew and quality food. We love it.

V8Qqt1nTTLSVAqe1cLFEuA.text: Crepe Bar is a great little restaurant! Their food was yummy and I LOVE their lattes :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. So yummy!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States

cxIQ3lhqsjnqhfLAKxKBvg.text: I like that everything here is fresh, although sometimes food takes too long to serve but I guaranteed it is worth the wait. I know that this place is a breakfast place but I think the hour should be extend a little because I like to hang out there but the place close too soon...overall this is my favorite crepe place by far

S6zX9jquPPJkaMZZaAytaQ.text: I was visiting Tempe with a friend and reading the good reviews for this place, decided to try it out. The sweet potato chips were weird. It was like shaved sweet potato that was deep fried and dosed with salt and pepper. It was pretty greasy and looked like they had been in the fryer for a few minutes too long. The breakfast burrito likewise looked saturated with oil like it had been deep fried. I ordered the honey crepe and it was burnt. The crepe itself was relatively thick and the nuts were also burnt. I don't know if they recently got a new chef but I think you can see a trend in the food we got. Their iced tea was really good though! As an added plus, you get free refills on the iced tea.

yhNgPCriN3nhdFX2cWWpvg.text: The food was amazing. I ordered the "winner's circle" crepe and it was really a culinary work of art. The wait for the food was way, way too long and our food came out like 5 minutes apart - a big no-no in my eyes when it comes to great service. I probably won't be back because I live pretty far. But a nice experience for a foodie nonetheless.

6vCL-aNWZw80Qf99imBmpw.text: A modern set up with emphasis on art the Crepe Bar is not one to overlook. The Grand Prix was absolutely delectable and the pork Belly was glazed yet melted in my mouth. The flavors of both the chili sauce and the egg were emphasized on the crepe that accompanied them. After eating the breakfast crepe, I indulged in the Second Time which consisted of Nutella, banana, and strawberries. It easily secured the needs of the meal with the sweet but detailed nuances of the caramelized banana and strawberry. The place was comforting and I would recommend anyone in the area to try the crepes for themselves.

uJZXpEvG7DGu9lbJq5WS2g.text: A Sunday morning favorite! Originality, flavors, service all get five stars. We are always impressed with the great food. It's popular and as soon as you eat here you will know why! Love it.  Have their cereal, papa k, duck, specials, all are fantastic and flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Never go wrong with Papa K
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s special - Spanish toast! Fantastic!
Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Love the extra tastes they give you! Awesome!

ldXhaonmBzDZnDpQFkzaQw.text: We enjoy this restaurant and the feeling we are supporting local business coupled with the good vibes this place has. The food is great although it can take a while especially if they are busy.

TGiAHezA2lgUz7WaB3d0zQ.text: So, working right down the street from this place I've been eyeballing it for weeks, waiting for a good time to strike...  Well, that time finally came and I stopped in here for a pre-holiday lunch just a few weeks ago.  I have to brag on them, the food is utterly delicious!  I ordered the Buffalo Chicken crepe for lunch, and a First Timer (Nutella with bananas) crepe for dessert.    (Yes, dessert with lunch.  It was almost Christmas and I was treating myself...  Don't judge!)    Firstly, let me say that the buffalo chicken crepe was light and airy while the chicken was spicy and savory.  It was complemented by julienned carrots and crumbled blue cheese, which perfected it.  The First Timer dessert crepe was like a warm hazelnut and chocolate banana party wrapped in a pillowy soft crepe; amazingly good.  Second, while it all tasted fabulous, the food *was* a bit on the high price for a lunch entree, especially considering that the crepes don't come with any kind of side so really all you get for your money is a delicious crepe.  Also it was a little bit slow in coming out, but still so yummy that I'll easily forgive the wait.  (Plus, as another reviewer perfectly stated, "It's not as though they are looking to dethrone McDonald's" so keep that in mind when you are waiting for your food...  Quality takes time, right?)  I edited this to add that as far as pricing goes a miniature, mixed green salad served as a side with the savory crepes (with a simple lemon and olive oil dressing) would easily make me feel the value for the price had been leveled out and would cost very little to provide.    I don't know if my waistline or my wallet can handle visiting the Crepe Bar too frequently, but I'll definitely make it a point to come by as often as the diet and the budget will allow it!

kxwwdNlYzq5pTHhM0j5QQg.text: Amazing Crepes, people are so friendly and the granola is amazing too!! Keep up the great work, and I will keep spreading the word

huola4qxHgi7MjA6l4Sd9Q.text: I've been hearing about Crepe Bar from my wife and we finally made the time to meet a friend there for lunch.  It's nice that they have a few tables indoors as well as outdoors (although, during the Summer months they probably won't get used much).  We approached the counter and the girl who helped us was very nice and made suggestions to help us decide on what to order.  We each ordered a savory crepe and a sweet crepe.  All of the crepes were really good; my lemon dessert crepe was especially satisfying.  My savory crepe was delicious too - it was a chicken crepe and the edge of it had crispy cheese all around which was a nice touch.  The crepes themselves are perfect.  My one complaint about Crepe Bar is the drink selection.  They have an espresso bar, but, beyond that, your choices are craft root beer (which I have no problem with) or water from a jug on the counter.  There is no soda fountain and no bottled water.  I understand if you don't want to pay licensing to have a soda fountain or, maybe you just don't want soda, that's fine too, but having bottled water in Arizona is a pretty standard option.  The luke warm, non-iced jug on the counter is just not what we were looking for.  Crepe bar was definitely a nice place and I will go back there for sure (my wife has already been back so I'm a little jealous).  But, when we go back, we will take our own bottles of water with us... and we'll buy a root beer too.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito.

ASJk_nxtu-nq5WR4LE8_2Q.text: This place is awesome!!! I had the breakfast burrito which was absolutely divine! Also, it doesn't usually seem like these types of places have anything special for coffee but this place has got it down. I had a single origin pourover with the Ethiopian la cholla which was good and also a quality cappuccino that had great art. The staff was very friendly. If you love crepes or quality coffee check this place out! Seating looked like it could be a problem as all the tables were taken when we walked in but by time we had ordered there was a spot. If it's full and your not in a hurry it's definitely worth a wait.

3zj1-veGESYDsUPET2tq0w.text: This place was recommended by a friend, so I had high expectations, because he's a bit of a foodie. After reading the yelp reviews, I decided to try the smoked turkey savory crepe and the buttered toast.  The toast was fine, and the highlight of the meal was the cultured cream and fruit compote that came with it. The fact that the crepes weren't the highlight is one of the reasons why this place only gets 3 stars. The crepes were ok, but nothing amazing. Mine had chorizo which was overcooked and salty, but the smoked gouda was a nice flavor with everything else. Overall, meh.  The other reason this place gets 3 stars is the service. The people were nice, but it took almost 30 minutes to get our food, and we were after the lunch rush. There was certainly enough staff, but they were terribly inefficient. And if I'm waiting that long for food, it should be amazing. Plus we both had water with lunch, and they brought a chilled bottle for us to split, nice gesture, but it was at the end of our meal. Another miss.   All in all, I was underwhelmed. I won't go out of my way to go back.

PWTpg8QXPOvnSM9MCyMrKA.text: My husband and I saw this place one day as we drove by. We looked it up, read the reviews and went back a few days later. All I can say is WOW! This food made me smile. I even told the staff how joyful it made me feel. Excellent ingredients, I had the pork belly and I can't stop thinking about it. We are going back tomorrow with our daughters. You. And tell the staff gels and actually enjoy what they are creating. So thankful to have such a great place so close to home.

-e3Dw3z_SrAbXB0CZmaYuw.text: Can't say enough good things about Crepe Bar.  Had some great crepes in France recently and this is right there.  Amazing quality and flavors with just the right ambiance - hip and cool but not pretentious.  Be prepared to wait but it's worth it.

WvHbrKQAoGltjGtTD5giMg.text: Why I'm done with Crepe Bar:  Coming here in general, I expect a wait.  A wait for tables, a wait to order, and at least an hour wait for my food.  Which should say, either how popular this place is, or how unprepared they are to handle demand.  Prior to today, I would have said the former (which is why we've waited outside for them to open before just to get faster service, etc.).  After today's experience, I am going with the latter.    I understand that a crepe is not a quick prepare meal.  And we were briefly warned that they were running "a bit behind today".  And finally, in their defense, we came in an hour before they close.  So, I shouldn't have been upset that they were out of basic items like mushrooms.  But, it was disappointing.  After waiting the standard hour for food, I did start becoming a bit antsy.  And the blood sugar started dropping as we watched table after table receive their food, including a couple that came in after us (this despite the fact that we had been assured our food was next).  So, finally, our crepes started seeping in, one to two at a time.  I had ordered a turkey with gouda and vegetables.  That's what the waiter said he had, so I took my crepe, announced to my friends that selfishly I would be eating because I did have somewhere to be afterwards and would need to take off shortly.  As I was eating, I noticed that it was actually a crepe of eggs and ham.  Nothing at all like I had ordered, but it was the order of one of the other girls.  I drew the server's attention to the mislabel and that I had already eaten 1/4 of it.  Ironically he was serving the table with a ham and egg crepe, which was her order again.  So, we received 2 of her orders, but none of my.  I told him that I was in a hurry and needed mine to go because of the EXCESSIVE wait.  And we were still missing one girl's food.    He told me that he was embarrassed and that the wait was excessive, mostly due to a lack of preparedness in the kitchen area and that they would get my meal to go. Finally, the last girl received her food, that was, SHOCKINGLY, missing some of the ingredients, especially guacamole, that it was supposed to have. Another mis-made crepe from our order, that would have to be a correction after she had was almost done with her meal.  As my To-Go crepe was arriving (which I have to give some credit for the speed that they showed crepes COULD come out, although apparently no one offered to refund anyone for slow speed, mis-orders, or general poor service, or to bring us a granola sample like we've had in the past) they were bringing little "brownie bites" that at this point, felt like a small bribe for the awful service, prolonged wait, and mis-made crepes.    I took my To-Go bag and as I was driving away, I noticed, that although all meals come with the standard salad, mine did not have this in the bag, just a crepe to go, so, once again, I was "jipped' on my meal.   And as I finish eating it while I type my complaints, it was a turkey with vegetable crepe, but without gouda, the third ingredient I asked for.  Once again, a mis-done crepe from a HORRIBLE experience.  Let's hope Crepe Bar remembers what made them this popular (from food truck to restaurant) and can channel this again.  But, I , for one, will be finding my crepes in a less stressful, more efficient environment (and one that actually makes the food I paid for).

tFD2YRQ8Bb6RR5izw32arg.text: Delicious and the customer service is amazing. I accidentally spilled my macchiato and a server noticed and cleaned the table and replaced it for me without any request. I will be coming back to try other great dishes in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Bar - Tempe, AZ, United States. Macchiato 3

yKBUTXIEpRfKhSDJa7igGA.text: Went with my husband, daughter, son-in-law and grandson.  Even with them being crazy busy we got seated easily, and our food came quickly.  The coffee was amazing.  I had the Moroccan Latte, ham and cheese crepe and banana desert crepe.  Everything was amazing!  The entire bill with everyone having designer coffees was only $60.00

u6OMDRm5kPggZtIA_j_qew.text: I came here for brunch a few months ago.  We ordered a banana Nutella crepe and some savory crepe. I was not impressed with the savory crepe. On the other hand, the Nutella crepe was good. However, it is difficult to have something with Nutella on it to taste bad.  Overall, not impressed especially considering the long wait and high price

QtvzEuPfrVgrGOT0c14mYA.text: Amazing!! We enjoyed a nice relaxing breakfast here. We started with the Cast Iron Toast, Olive Oil and Sea Salt which was so good. I had the Papa K and my husband enjoyed the Breakfast Burrito. Will be back!

_J2ihD4d7wAIcdpwNWMQIg.text: You ever fall in love? Like 'holy shit why the fuck am I  smiling all the time' kinda love?  Well, to my 1 to 2 crazy readers, this is a confession; I'm going to be with Crepe Bar, for-evs'.  (queue Psycho shower scene)  Seriously I think I've attained regular status here. The staff give me the 'heeeey...you're back...again' look when I walk in.  Not going to lie, kinda like it (and chiggity-check all them 'check ins'!).  You know what they say about creepy, unrequited love though...it's creepy.    Not sure if I stressed this in the original review (or even mentioned it) but get the breakfast burrito.  Damn it's fine n' tasty.  Also, after you've had their coffee, you may decide to cheat on/break up with your current coffee relationship (Seattle, I'm sorry...but it's over. I love Crepe Bar now.  shhhhhh).    And Jesus-H Christ they're serving fresh baked cookies now?; I'm fucked.  Should have engagement ring all set for next Thurs (fingers crossed!).    To the naysayers and ass-bags:  If you don't approve of their 'portion size', can't appreciate these peeps love for food or don't like the fucking rad art on their walls, then hit  up a different restaurant so I can have your table (their busy as crap lately).

-ImjZaA3o1NqwNvnSVmY4A.text: Soon fun! Went here with a toddler, and they didn't have highchairs but we made do. The kid loved his scone and it was dry like it should be. I LOVED the lemon crepe. And the sugar crepe I stole a few bites of. I can't wait to come back and bring the husband for a breakfast date. Only thing I didn't care for was the paint job. Not as hip as I would expect given everything else.

LOBmVfhL_38_ZM23oQXh7A.text: What a joy it is to have this fine establishment in my neighborhood! Get the duck confit crepe, it is out of this world delicious!  Love, love, love this place! Prices are so reasonable and the quality and commitment to local food is something I love to support!

SIsZoMIGiH93J5sZXK_Nkg.text: The food is great and the constant lines of people shows that it's at least somewhat of a trendy place to eat. The prices are very reasonable.  The downside is the wait. It took us 20 minutes to order and another 30 to get our food. If you have some time to burn, it's a great place to go.

SZSvJaGbD2Oe0fBEEMMo-Q.text: Reluctant to go. Friend kept inviting me. I am very pleased to have gone. Good was great. Make sure to get here early cuz it gets busy! Loved it, will be back.

i7B3QFb8P4e5VTHLAW0APg.text: This place is a must at least once a week for me. The crew is top notch, the food is awesome and the coffee is spot on. When you see the price point (cheap), portion (perfect side of full) and taste the quality I know that this will quickly become one of your regular places!  Jeff&Co do it right!

lER5fiL4DI75mOPWcdmZ6g.text: 30 minutes to get a seat, another 30 minutes  to get my food which arrived cold, another 20 minutes  to get my daughter's  food. This was my first time going there,  I  complained about the service, experience  they  did refund my money so that was nice. Not a wonderful  first impression.

FE-1gQP-I5sKyzeLbOJV7A.text: My first impression was not a good one. The line to order was about 15 people long, snaking through the dining area. The line to place my order moved incredibly slowly. One lady in front of me took 10 minutes to place her order! As I creeped towards the young lady taking orders, I found out why. She was pleasant, but unnecessarily talkative and  socialized with everyone in the line.  As I sat and waited for my food, I noted that all of the employees were pleasant and attentive. My fresh squeezed OJ was great, but very pricey. All of the food they brought out looked very good. We ordered 3 crepes, one with chorizo and egg, one with ham, mushrooms, egg and cheese, and a dessert crepe with bananas. All were very good, but not superior to other crepe places I've been to (Flip Happy in Austin, TX is better and they serve theirs faster out of an old Airstream trailer).  Would I go back? Maybe, if I just had to have crepes in Phoenix.

oRhdVTR7ApzLDH1h5KELhw.text: Small but still nice.  Feels like a hipster joint. But I live crepes and the crepes were actually good. Are here twice now most likely going to keep coming back.

7Jwo8E6q3AMaWnMAlGVGoA.text: Some of the best crepe's ever. We have been going here for a while now. The only reason why I would say it would be 4/5 is because of the wait. They keep serving people that where there way after us.

aE8wsv5RjMR887y4m2sH1w.text: We Usually always a great dining experience here But was unhappy with our last visit. I understand that the crepe bar takes pride in their prevention on their menu items but when a guest wants to alter, or would like something in addition to what they are ordering; crepe bar should be more accommodating to the customer ordering there food, especially if the customer is willing to pay to have it done.  I usually always ask for more chipotle salt... Really can't have any extra? Always an issue. I know it comes on the side but yes I still would like a little more. The big factor that was upsetting to me with crepe bar this last visit wasn't so much the salt but was trying to order an additional EGG UP on the side. They told me they can't do that. We'll if you don't want to ruin the presentation to the order, then have it come on the side on a separate plate. IM PAYING for what I want! But they still told me NO.  Just because crepe bar thinks their items on the menu are the best served how they come, not everyone is the same or has the same taste. If someone wants to make a slight change or wants to BUY a side of an egg or whatever it may be, they should be more accommodating. I am a loyal guest of the crepe bar I always have invited friends and family to come experience their food with me, but won't be back for a while and won't be talking it up either.    On top of not being able to order what I want, my toast was very burnt and the food didn't have quite the same flavor as it has in my past experiences.  Still enjoyed my food but that why I'm only giving this review a solid 3 stars.    Hopefully their customer service gets better! The gentleman with red hair and glasses is always very kind and attentive to the guest. But other then that hopefully they can start learning how to say YES

sX74ldKfAVjQBIVkJG57EA.text: I just found this place last week 12/31, 2014, the last day of 2014. I have to say, their crepe is the most delicious I have had. So so good!!! I also love their coffee! The service is good too. The waiter is friendly and cute! He gave me free small and cute desert and starter. ;-). You probably have to wait for a while to get your food. But I suggest you just laid back and enjoy the waiting and the atmosphere of the store.

U3OFF-RYPncu-tgL_Ny5OQ.text: Delicious! Incredible flavor, they let each component of their dishes shine and they come together beautifully. We will certainly be back.

kQIcjcbJBfen-zUWh_i0cA.text: This place is SO good!!! Savory & sweet options. Awesome Yelp checkin deal for free, yummy coffee. Can't wait to go back

c0sIJGd4JXLck8S0K5_opA.text: Second visit.  Had the crepes.  Very flavorful and tasty.  Mine had ham and mushrooms.  Will definitely be back.

SWbK26O-JO-GmvyKoUp6bg.text: I LOVED the food here! The chorizo breakfast crepe was so different, savory, with the right amount of heat. So perfect for a morning delight! Only thing that was hard to get by was the wait time. You can definitely tell that they are popular. There was always a long line! But the poor cooks were overworked and definitely got behind very quickly. Took almost 45 minutes to get our food. Luckily the coffee and the atmosphere were so nice that it helped to pass the time. Would definitely come back here but not doing Sunday brunch hour.

5fA2IUtu3DAKR0BRlORfVQ.text: I ordered the breakfast burro, and added an extra $1 for the "potatoes". I was very disappointed when I saw that the potatoes were indeed little flakes of squares that's sprinkled on top of the breakfast burro crepe, and that there wasn't any potatoes inside-definitely not worth the $1. Also, this place is way too small to cater to the large amount of people that wants to get breakfast. It was really awkward for our group (and others as well) to try to find a place to stand while waiting for our food.  While waiting, we noticed that another table ordered a bowl of cereal and a few droplets of milk for $4.25. That's outrageous and just doesn't make any sense. Overall, the food was decent, but the atmosphere and the overall experience of this place ruined it for me.

MKrbCi_tEIyV5toUNm27SA.text: This place needs no more good reviews-what more can be said? ;-)   If you haven't been--go! What are you waiting for?  Don't be afraid of the menu.  Order blindly. It's all good.  I didn't love, love the espresso one but my hubby did so order a couple and share.  Order a savory one and share a sweet one.  Just do it.  Take people.  Good stuff.  I crave it when we're not there....lol

FkkgEeme-8QyVTjQxOevkQ.text: Finally checked out this place today and I've lived in the neighborhood since June. Excellent food: Had the papa k savory crepe with eggs. WiFi that works. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the flimsy chairs and table. Very impressed with tableware! Little things matter. Very friendly staff. Will definitely go again.

Yu1cmQS59uPJRFnibbDUCg.text: Awesome food! Everything was great except for the seating. They have very limited spacing so it may be difficult to find seating for a medium to large party. They offer all sorts of sandwiches and coffee. Great service!

Ve-D7r_RV0GrlwfebuE04g.text: Crepe Bar is my absolute favorite breakfast spot. You can't go wrong with savory or sweet, both are magical. I'm obsessed with their vanilla bean custard crepe, so damn good. We've gone quite a few times and the longest we've had to wait was 45 minutes (Valentine's Day) and it's always been worth it. The service is always great and the bites are sweet!!
